5eeQhmQgwzqSAX7HE_A8Xw.text: My husband and I went out for a special dinner to celebrate our anniversary and we definitely picked the right place! We had a table outdoors and the ambience was beautiful. We had an excellent waiter and the food was phenomenal. I highly recommend the short rib entree and the mussels for an appetizer. We will definitely be back again!

IKv1XExnaN_boClWwDp45w.text: I've been coming here for the past 20 years and haven't been disappointed. The patio is my favorite place to eat or simply sit to enjoy a glass of wine or beer. Cheers!

DQ0bt1PtmcXqXYZiKix9tQ.text: Love coming here for special occasions and spending time with family and friends.  Outdoor patio is a must, amazing atmosphere along with friendly and attentive staff!

CkNn4Tb5eClRqUsFzO4_iA.text: Never a disappointment! Took my son and mom here last holiday when we picked him up from the airport; this year, the first place he wanted to go after landing - says it's the best French dip - EVER!!! Frankly, never had a bad dish! LOVE LOVE LOVE the patio seating! Who would sit outside!!

_wsMjMfpQ-f4vYql7DPTVA.text: We went to House of Tricks on Saturday night.  It was our first visit.  We had a reservation and arrived on time.  Our table was ready within 5 minutes.  We asked for a table outside; the dining area (both indoors and out) is lovely.  Very comfortable.  Very romantic.  We were quite impressed.  Our waitress was friendly and kind but the service was incredibly slow, whether or not this was her fault was hard to tell.  We got seated at our table around 7:50 PM and our salads were not delivered to the table until 9 PM.  They did bring us extra bread at our request.  But waiting an hour for salads is pretty ridiculous.  They were fresh, beautiful and delicious.  We also ordered the soup of the day as well... potato soup which can be pretty ordinary.  It was amazing!!  Our entrees were served about 15 minutes later and we weren't disappointed.  The plates were lovely and every element on the plate was wonderful.    The food was fantastic.  Regardless of the slow service we will go back.  In particular the lunch menu looks really great.

d5Y-DCzUvYUFpcfk5LLm2g.text: The food and service were exceptional. Server was attentive without being obtrusive. It was my girlfriend's birthday and they made it a special occasion

VYhsOBgD_L2a2OWpKQQrgA.text: I won a bid at silent auction for a $150 gift certificate to this place. Located in Tempe and buried on the ASU Campus, this was not a restaurant that we'd normally stumble upon. However, I am very happy that I bid on this even though I knew nothing about it...why? Because the food here is fantastic! Here's what we ordered: Korean Style Baby Back Ribs, $14 yelp.com/biz_photos/hous... Yukon Gold Potato Gnocchi, King Mushroom, $23 yelp.com/biz_photos/hous... Grilled Filet w/Smoked Cheddar Bits, Asparagus, Cabernet Sauce, Crispy Onions, $36 yelp.com/biz_photos/hous... Grand Marnier Creme Brulee, $6.50 yelp.com/biz_photos/hous... Double Chocolate Bacon Cake w/White Chocolate Butter Cream & Candied Bacon, $6.50 yelp.com/biz_photos/hous... The Korean Style Baby Back Ribs were simply amazing! The BBQ Sauce was sweet & tangy with just the right amount of Ginger. Yum! As everyone who knows me knows that I love Gnocchi....the Gnocchi here is delish. The Grilled Filet was very good as well. But the best part of dinner was the Dessert.... The Better Half had the Grand Marnier Creme Brulee, which I sampled and was very good. However, the best of the best was the Double Chocolate Bacon Cake w/White Chocolate Butter Cream & Candied Bacon....yes, that's right Bacon lovers! This Dessert delivers the goods on all levels.....it's Chocolatey, Sweet, and the Bacon adds a little salty/meaty goodness that causes your palette to jump for joy....my mouth is watering right now. There were 3 things that kept me from giving this place 5 Stars: 1 - Parking. It sucks. Jockeying for position against ASU student parking plus the customers for this place and area businesses is not fun. They should offer a valet service up front just for customers....I'd pay $5-$10 just to avoid the nonsense. 2 - Seating. We were seated outside....not our preference, but the size of the interior of the restaurant is tiny and we were told the wait was long to sit inside. They have a huge outdoor seating area with giant trees. We were sat at a table for 2, the table was very small and the servers had trouble with space when we had a bottle of Wine, Appetizers, and Bread. When then entrees came out, it was a circle jerk to rotate old plate off, etc. The furniture is patio furniture and the pads of the seats are left out overnight, dusty. There was a lot of bird shit on the wall next to where we were seated and fallen leaves all around us.....I was constantly worried about something dropping onto my food. It was our decision to accept sitting outside, so it's on me. If I come back, will definitely not sit outside, don't care how nice the weather is. 3 - Service. It was so/so. We had to flag our waiter down when we were ready to order Wine....a huge pet peeve of mine. Also, had to flag him down to order our food and refill Wine and Water glasses. I think the majority of the wait staff here are ASU students.....they look young and don't know how to provide proper service. When we walked up, we didn't know where to go because the hostess stand is outside and isn't obvious....2 hostesses looked at us and didn't say "Hi, how can we help you" or anything at all. It was only when we started to wander around the patio area that they said "are you looking for someone?"....LMAO, yes I'm trying to get seated in your restaurant! Too bad because the food is outstanding. I will give it another try and see how it goes now that I know about the things to avoid. Return Factor - 75%

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Double Chocolate Bacon Cake w/White Chocolate Butter Cream &amp; Candied Bacon, $6.50

w1HXckf6GkSyL1rTovICQQ.text: Great food and service was excellent!  Great patio and ambiance. I had the lamb shank with risotto which was ridiculous! The short rib appetizer was also phenomenal! Great experience overall. I will definitely be back.

yofy1CvcOrIcz5pIGo_oHQ.text: We had a wonderful lunch! Our server Nathan was great! Everything was delicious! Really good margaritas. Great atmosphere! I love The House of Tricks and will continue to go there when I can. This was the first time for my girlfriends and they loved it as well. I definitely recommend making a reservation. Yelp was great for that!

kxRs0Kk2GKl-icV1uukwEg.text: Fantastic menu options made this an evening to look forward to. Made reservations only to be told,"they were not a guarantee of a table." when I arrived. . Not sure why they asked me what occasion we were celebrating when I made the reservation?  No VIP amenities or accommodations. Waited 35 minutes to be seated. Duck was undercooked and poorly seasoned. Bison meatloaf was dry. Cornish hen was over seasoned and drowned in sauce. Best meal was a filet that was cooked perfectly. This is what earns them 2 stars. Service and our table location were inadequate.  Disappointing place to celebrate a special event. Too many great eateries around to waste time on this establishment.

Q12q9NDlE5hj6LE7u_OIKg.text: This is the 3rd time my fiancee and I have been here and the food is always amazing as well as the atmosphere. The 6oz tenderloin was cooked perfectly for medium and my fiancee's Cornish Hen was juicy. The brownie desert was especially fantastic. Her pecan pie creme brulee was great. Will continue to keep coming here. Definitely want to try out the winter menu.

d7clbzZuAKYDlQHuHT4cMg.text: Everyone that works there is fabulous. From the moment you walk on to the patio, you're already being taken care of. The food is delish and the ambiance is romantic. Totally recommend -- especially during cooler months when you can more so enjoy the outside dining experience!

5zye9HadKa_rmU1Y3mU2eg.text: We brought a friend to House of Tricks a few nights ago. The experience was somewhat disappointing for a few reasons. We were seated outside, at our request, and nearly immediately noticed the construction going on across  the street. The lights were intense and glaring in our friend's face-this, of course, was not the restaurant's fault and our server, Sarah, offered to position the table umbrellas to block the light which did help. The night we went was a Thursday and the restaurant was busy but not terribly. Nonetheless, the service was quite slow. The food was very good, once received. I think we will hold off on returning until the construction in the area is completed.

NaEgicgDMk3zPtT2WFvKkw.text: I am giving House of Tricks 5 stars and I've never even been there!  Let me explain... I arranged for a dozen attorneys to have dinner there as part of a dine-around for 200 attorneys during their annual members meeting.  We used a total of 16 local restaurants.  I dealt with Janis who responded to my emails quickly, and we set up a master bill for the evening.  Then, two days before the dine around, I called her to book another large group, this time the executive board, on the night before the dine-around.  Again, she was accommodating and understood my corporate billing needs.    Both groups gave their experience glowing reviews!  They not only commented on how delicious the food tasted and how well it was prepared, but they also had numerous compliments on the staff and the outstanding service.    Thank you to Janis and the the House of Tricks staff for taking good care of my clients.  I promise, if I get back to Phoenix, I will stop in for a meal and say thanks in person.

f6vXyeUHh8Lu1LzQr038Qg.text: My absolutely favorite lunch spot in Arizona. Beautiful patio that is just amazing on a nice day and the food is delicious. The chipotle pasta is AMAZING!!!! They have great wine specials at lunch and a pretty extensive list.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lunch meatloaf.  So many good options here, hard to pick!
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Chipotle Chicken Pasta...awesome.
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Definitely get the raspberry ice tea.  It&#39;s quite the treat compared to the syrup based stuff everywhere else!

xdMt0UvVAoWhMwjDx2yCzg.text: Fantastic meal.  Two of us had the tuna.  It was spectacular.   Thought I was not going to be able to eat the ample portion but the plate ended up totally clean.  Several in the party had the corn and blueberry salad, which they raved over.  The bison meatloaf also got rave reviews.   Only down note was the sour waitress.  All in all House of Tricks lived up to its reputation and our collective past experiences.

gmJeaTPZy9sp7dp-irhC4w.text: This pre- Mama Mia lunch exceeded our expectations on food quality, service and ambiance. Excellent, efficient service (and menu recommendations) were provided by Kate and the Salmon salad entree was 'life changing' as she said it would be. Super special patio made us forget we were in the heart of ASU/Tempe (and as U of A fans that's a good thing ;) ).

rqWtIvvK0XM7vqTQRE1lJA.text: One of the best outdoor dining experiences in Phoenix. Amazing service, drinks, and food.

cuFCWBSqYQ5u4GUsAiF5Wg.text: We had an amazing experience. Came from out of town. The name scared us yet we were feeling adventurous.  The food was delicious, we had the salmon and the filet. The atmosphere was calm and serene, great service. We sat outside by the fire pit. Warm and cozy.  If you're superstitious, beware, a black cat roams the area.  Good luck!!

K6fUomSbX94dKIO6K9miIg.text: Wow! Just Had a tuna poke and an arugula salad. This is some seriously good food. Like seriously. With a lot of creative flavor twists and impeccable finishing

kzjbsIR7IJyWwDpTYby6QQ.text: Wow, after reading good reviews and looking at the menus on line, what a bummer here.  All the interesting looking preps but food was bland, dull, typical of Valley.  For instance the beet salad with blue cheese.  How do you ruin that?  Boiling the beets into mush balls and putting a rock hard block of cheese next to it.  Some greens, no dressing but some sort of gelatinous goo on the side.  Fish with harissa?  There was a small dot of something hot on the side of the plate.  I had to put on my bifocals to see it.  Fish was taste-less.  Ditto for hsb duck dish. Not cheap either, $140 for dinner with 2 glasses of wine.  How this place is in business for 25 years would amaze me like an alien invasion if i didn't already have experience with this valley's dumbed down food.    Nice to sit outdooors but thanks I'll sit on my balcony and order something from Sal's or Marco's or someplace that puts some flavor in.

V9eg_RRlWRS3v_sTq2aJqA.text: Foodie heaven - I love this restaurant!!  (March 7, 2017 update: visited again a few nights ago - there simply aren't enough stars to rate this restaurant - six stars on a five star scale. Every time there is something new and inventive - this last time they had a special soup [sorry I can't recall the name] that was a creamy, shredded meat literal orgasm of flavor - stunning - everyone at the table loved it.One of my favorite - scratch that - this is my all time favorite restaurant!)  Previous review: My fourth or fifth visit, excellent every time. Weather happened to be perfect, which made it even better. Service excellent, with informed waiter which is always a pleasure - knew every detail of every item, really got the impression that he had savored every item himself.  Myself and two guests. We started with the mixed green salad, which was simple and small but very fresh and tasty, a nice start. One had the salmon, which he said was very good. The other had the chicken and dumplings - forget everything you know about that dish, this is different (as-is everything at this restaurant!). First of all, I love traditional chicken and dumplings. However, here the chef has apparently cooked the chicken in the sauce, then out it comes and the plate is prepared with unusual but excellent dumplings, topped with a chicken confit, sauce and small vegetables - delicious.  I had the Pork Belly starter - decadence on a plate. The tastes were overwhelming, and the item plated beautifully. The waiter brought out a small glass of a sweet wine (I think it was  Muskat) and said I just had to try it with the pork. Sounded unusual, but he was right. I then had the Macadamia Nut Roasted Duck. Another hit. The crunch and flavor of the macadamia nuts made the the dish fun, the flavors were terrific. Topped with gingered cranberry, the tartness of which perfectly offset the sweetness of the coconut yam puree. On the side was a crisp bok choy, another flavor profile that added to the sensations. If you like duck, this is the bomb.  I love how the chef really plays with the presentations and tastes here; every time we've gone it's been a great experience, with fantastic food surprises and great service, in addition to the very pleasant and relaxing garden setting of the large outdoor seating area including outdoor bar.  Highly, *highly* recommended.

Sf_sJeqd-YH8Lx2ouF4AVA.text: Pure chaos. No one is in charge. Management issues. Waited 45 minutes past our reservations. All they kept telling us was they were setting up the table. Then admitted it was a staffing issue. Clearly short staffed. Had great expectations and was disappointed. Service was incredibly slow. Both for food and bar. Food was "ok". I rarely spend my time doing reviews but I had to share this one.

TV-SWgvncEV3-832329cUQ.text: This place looked great and had wonderful ambiance, but the wait grew from 20 minutes to 45 and then our group of 6 was told they were unsure if they would be able to seat us because they "prioritize reservations"... Lesson learned go early and definitely secure a reservation!

0YmKYM1ldl8pB1IJRe7ccA.text: We always enjoy going to House of Tricks, we love the atmosphere and the food.  I had the seared ahi tuna and it was perfect.   We always go there for the PEI chorizo mussels this is a must have.

565VKHxLnlviCnZ_KhiLMw.text: Excellent choice for dinner.  Service and food was incredible,  Great atmosphere as well,

7aomCUhCfIT4KsKYANiPgw.text: We have eaten here a half a dozen times and it is always memorable.  It's not the fastest service in the world, but so worth the wait!  Unique pairings of flavors, interesting variety of selections.

auWK3jZimeBsvZpVopObww.text: Great place for date night or for a business meeting. Gorgeous setting with unique dishes. Love it.

fTTNvNkSvfzyNu-2qhDymw.text: The service was fantastic and I even tricked myself into eating the "meat" loaf.  I don't usually stray from my carnivorous ways but I was pleasantly surprised by all the different tastes I experienced in this vegetarian dish.  I had a salad to start and i had to have the bread pudding for dessert but I failed to finish it.  Me belly full.

LX0TFyn4YRiVh_3s97sVxw.text: I think there are enough reviews for everyone who has not been here to figure out what a great restaurant this really is. This was a recommendation from a fellow yelper, and I am eternally grateful.   I might suggest changing the name to House of Treats which is exactly what happened to my palette with each bite I took.   The flavors and combinations were unique and delicious. Everything that everyone in our party ordered was devoured and thoroughly enjoyed. A fine dining experience. I have never had the opportunity to try ricotta black peppercorn grits ~ YUMMY.   I would love to return on a night when outdoor seating might be more completely enjoyed.   The only negative is the REALLY small size of the available indoor seating area. It could not accommodate a group larger than 5 people.

vtTkWE7-Fqd1oN4_2qmJfw.text: I call this type of place "fancy schmancy." It might have been a little too sophisticated for our group on this particular night. It was packed even around 8pm (on Friday), but we got a table in the bar area. We wanted to start with shots of Jamison and were told they don't have shot glasses. So, yeah, it's that kind of place.  BUT...the food is DELICIOUS. I started with the kale salad and it was incredibly tasty. Very good flavors. They don't have many vegetarian options for entrees. In fact, I think they have just one, which I got: the gnocci. Thankfully, it was probably the best gnocci I've ever, ever had. I challenge you to try it and disagree.  The have a good list of cocktails (I enjoyed a Manhattan) and wines. They hide beers on their last page because, yeah, it's that kind of place ;)

tdVjlbyRJAJddiQbYWo-JA.text: Wow! We were recommended this restaurant for our one night stay in Tempe for my husbands birthday by a store clerk at Divaz Boutique (also fab!). We stayed at the Mission Palms and couldn't believe this restaurant was right across the street beyond a a shopping walkway tucked away in an intimate setting. First, we have to mention that our waiter Chris Coleman, was beyond phenomenal! Friendly,fun and highly professional, we wished we could always be served by him back in our hometown of Chicago. His menu recommendations were courteous and he really listened to us when we asked questions about certain dishes and his answers were genuine and helped us pick exactly what we needed. Now on to the setting and food!Since it was snowing back in Chicago we opted to sit in the beautiful outside terrace,duh. We were seated in a table for two next to the entrance facing the street  so intimate   that for a moment it felt like we were the only dinners that evening which was great. The food was literally phenomenal, from the drinks to the salad to the entrees. I opted for the scallops which is a starter for my entree, but a side of Brussels sprouts and arugula salad I ordered was plenty of food! My husband ordered the sirloin and even though he eats at the top steak restaurants in Chicago he was thoroughly impressed. Now back to Chris, since we expressed we were so satisfied with our food and couldn't eat anymore especially dessert at that moment,he brought out a single candle on a plate for my husband to make a wish on his birthday! It was perfect ending to a wonderful meal. He also recommended we see his friend Julia at a wine bar down street when we asked where we can go next,where again we were treated wonderful!See other review)And lastly,as animal lovers we loved how the resident cat Moma came out as soon as we finished our meal as to give us a farewell, if you are a cat lover def sit outside as she casually walks around and says hi to local patrons, nice touch!!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mama the cat that sends you off after an exceptional meal!:)
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Amazing scallops!!
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Us dinning

-m6nfAZiqFzI2YZDSGnG9Q.text: I will try and keep this short and sweet.  We had an AMAZING experience last night at HoT.  We ate indoors in a very sweet and ambient dining room.  We had EXCELLENT and ATTENTIVE service from Alex.  Everything we ordered from cocktails to our culinary journey to our espresso was DELISH.    We started with cocktails (and ended up doing another round) Fig Infused Bourbon (my friend ordered Manhattan sytle) and I did a Chopin in Nocturne (or something like that) which is a Vodka based drink -- both were fantastic (hence ordering another round).  We decided we wanted to taste a little of everything so we ordered 2 salads and 3 appetizers to split.  We had:  Ceasar Salad (standard, nothing really special here although sparse on dressing, some leaves were completely dry) and the Warm Seafood Salad which was absolutely delicious.  We also had:  Mongolian Barbeque Shrimp, Blue and Yellow Corn Beignets and the Korean Style Baby Back Ribs -- ALL were off the charts good.  Between the location and atmosphere, the excellent service and the outstanding food... we WILL be back!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Korean Style Babyback Ribs, Mongolian Barbeque Shrimp and Blue and Yellow Corn Beignets
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Warm Seafood Salad

k5U6369_0qibEdVsoO0C0g.text: Lovely atmosphere and amazing food. We had the Brussels sprout salad and it was awesome!

ErBSw0KXLMiygMGz7xTdvA.text: Fantastic experience at House of Tricks - the hype was warranted, and the food and service did not disappoint. Nice wine list, impressive entrees (probably the best scallops I've had in a non-coastal city) and truly great desserts. After our second visit (with my wife's parents) was just as good as the first, I feel comfortable giving 5 stars. The outdoor seating is lovely, although you may have to cover your beverages if the trees are blooming... flower petals may sprinkle onto your table. Might be romantic, or annoying, depending on your frame of mind.

TgI4EDm9AclErZtJMbhRhA.text: You tricked me!  Where have you been?  Twenty-five years...oh.  Even from the street, the patio looked warm and inviting...okay, it was 104 degrees that eve.  But still, it was enchanting.  A perfect place for a date night.  Christopher, our awesome server recommended the Pecan Smoked Salmon with Lemon Crema, Red Onion, Avocado and Capers.  The salmon had just the perfect smokey flavor and not too salty.  White wine spritzer over ice paired well, it even lowered the temperature around me by 10 degrees!  I had the Harissa Spiced PEI Mussels with Charred Yellow Tomato, Chorizo and Creamy Sweet Cilantro Vinaigrette.  That was surprisingly by far the best bowl of mussels I've ever had.  It came with three thick pieces of toasted bread to sop up the creamy, spicy sauce...heaven isn't too far away.    Hubby loved the perfectly executed Red Chili Braised Short Rib with Creamed Sweet Corn, Garlic Haricot Verts and Smoked Anaheim Chili Potatoes he paired with a cabernet.   Ugh.  No room in our tummies for coffee and dessert this time!   We get so giddy with excitement everytime we find a local gem.  There is bad news.  They're closed for the whole month of July.  The anticipation of trying the rest of their magnificently prepared cuisine is killing us!    Until we meet again...

88SWBCnZVih9XhgrSaQTbw.text: Great restaurant, great service and setting. Unfortunately  the only negative was the parking ticket I got out front for being seven minutes late on a Saturday night.

0_kQAMeoK03cu2LshAMwcA.text: Excellent food! Everything is paired well with its sides. Interesting there were more small plates/appetizers then entrees but, can't go wrong with what you order it's going to be delicious. That just tells me to come here for cocktails and try more small plates! Great service.  Sat inside and was a little to quiet. All in all Can't wait to return!

uZmhQWlPjXhRdw3H-M4-Nw.text: Fabulous dining experience!  Great menu offerings followed by great service (from Hilary) followed by great food!  I had the day's special sirloin burger and my wife had the meatloaf...both of which were mouth-watering fantastic.  For dessert we had the apple bread pudding and the blood orange sorbet and would have them again in a heart-beat.  We rank House of Tricks one of the best restaurants we've tried since moving to the east valley 3 years ago, so needless to say...we'll definitely be back.

d9P9Ip9cuUTsBwuCGug3Dg.text: This review is for happy hour only.  After attending an art show nearby, the Hubs and I popped over to House of Tricks to give it a try.  It's been on my "to-go" list for awhile, so I was looking forward to the experience.  Since it was early in the evening we opted for happy hour at the bar.  The atmosphere is very inviting and casual, but nice.  I really liked the way it felt to sit outside and enjoy the evening... though I am sure in the middle of the summer it wouldn't be quite as nice.  For drinks we each had a couple beers and they were served nice and cold (lol).  As far as food is concerned, we shared a few appetizers.  The brushetta was just ok... I've had better and it wasn't traditional, so maybe that's why we didn't love it.  The Harissa mussels were the highlight.  That sauce is awesome and the mussels were cooked perfectly.  The duck 3 ways was also good, but not amazing.  Overall, we had a pleasant experience and the service was great.  The bartender that serviced us was friendly/helpful and directed us to some good selections.  We will be back to try dinner or lunch soon!

E8ncQfL92vir6cLMnKEuRw.text: My boyfriend and I spontaneously decided to check this place out this past weekend and geez, I am SO glad that we did.  I was totally blown away by House of Tricks!  I didn't take any pictures because this place is pretty intimate.  And although the dress code says casual, I personally thought that it was more on the dressy side BUT definitely not formal.   Parking: street parking.  The service: Terrific.  At 7:00PM, I made a reservation for two for 7:15PM via Yelp.  The place was CROWDED, but we showed up around 7:14PM and the waitresses were already waiting to seat us.  Now that's efficient seating! As for the service itself, Axell was very friendly and took the time to go over the menu and made a lot of recommendations tailored to my interests, which I really appreciated.  He also made sure our wine glasses were always full.  The interior: Cute and (really) cozy.  My boyfriend and I got lucky because we were seated immediately.  Unfortunately, the interior of House of Tricks is quite small (after all, it did use to be an actual house -- most of the seating is outdoors). This meant that we could hear every conversation going on at each of the tables.  We came to House of Tricks to celebrate my birthday and some other huge life milestones.  I didn't mind this so much, but I think the two of us would've appreciated a more intimate setting.  However, we did stay at the restaurant pretty late and as it began to clear out, it certainly felt like we got the best seats in the house!  If we ever go back, I definitely want to check out the outdoor seating.  From what I saw, there was a lot of outdoor space heaters and lights.  Definitely much more intimate.  The food: 10/10.  I'm not 100% sure, but I think their menu is seasonal... For our appetizer, we ordered some scallop dish (but not the seared scallop BLT).  I'm not a huge fan of seafood, but those freaking scallops were so tasty! They were HUGE, they were light, and they were packed with an explosion of different flavors.  As for our entrees, I ordered the salmon (but not the same one as the one listed on the online menu) and my boyfriend ordered the veal osso bucco.  Neither of us got the chance to try the other one's dish because we were both too busy devouring our own dishes.  We. Ate. Everything.  The salmon was the perfect portion and had the perfect balance between sweet and savory.  I don't know which exact cab my boyfriend ordered, but we thoroughly enjoyed it as indicated by the empty wine bottle.  It seemed to pair perfectly with the salmon. Everything was perfect.  So if you're looking for a new place to take your loved one(s), I'd definitely recommend House of Tricks!  This is a great place for a romantic date or for a small, private gathering.  This just might be my new goto restaurant for special occasions.

Y0j2o312u3LfCwgEFqwwfw.text: My reply to the business owners posted comment of my review...  The day after the reservation was booked I called around 10am to Inquire about gluten free and vegetarian options and shared that we were treating our out of town guests to dinner to celebrate their union that took place 6 months prior.  When the four of us stepped up to be seated the hostess never asked for a name just looked at her seating chart and sat us.  I personally did not feel warmly welcomed. And there were no other tables.   So you suggest I shouldn't taken care of it then instead of via social media.   Maybe the hostess should've acknowledge the reservation when we walked up and warmly suggest a drink at the bar until a more inviting table became available but instead treated us like walk ins and sat us in the far dark corner.  And yes we were having a good time at the table visiting our friends but had little to do with House of Tricks.

Dk5w5F4pt3RetI4dIHmBuQ.text: Comfortable atmosphere outside on the patio with heaters keeping the evening chill away.  The mussels and sauce were the highlight of the meal. The sauce was awesome. It comes with big pieces of bread that can be used to sop it up. I could have that every day.  For the main course, I had the duck which was good but not memorable. Dessert was the ginger bread special and that was just right, not very heavy but with an excellent flavor.

hETd-iT5n7_i4yEHnG4brA.text: One of my favorite restaurants.  I live the outdoor bar with the gorgeous tree and giant fireplace and the food is amazing. This was the first place I ever had ceviche and I am officially addicted!

e41eZiisPi9uR64xoWctdQ.text: Both of my kids goes to ASU and always walk by HofT and I have too. We just really didn't have a chance to visit. Well during the Memorial Day weekend we finally got our chance.   Parking can be pretty difficult cause it's all street parking but the good thing is after 6pm it's free street parking. Woo hoo.   As we walk in, you basically walk into a garden with many outdoor tables. They do have some indoor but they were all full inside. So outdoors it is. Outside has lots of bushes and trees to make the dining experience a little more private with water misters keeping you cool. It was really nice and comfortable once the sunset.   We were greeted at our table right away and they brought us water and bread. The bread was really soft and chewy. Very fresh.   Me and my wife started out by splitting a baby kale & romaine salad. It was really really good. Really loved it.  It came with fresh black berries, walnuts, candied bacon, and apple slices over a creamy salad dressing. Really fresh. All the ingredients really came together. Outstanding salad.   I had the sumac crusted lamb rack with sweet potatoes and figs. The sweet potatoes and figs were cooked perfectly. Really good and moist. Melt in your mouth. Only problem was the lamb rack. It was good but not great. Didn't really stand out to me. They give you four bones and a fairly good portion. So it was okay.   My wife got the brick roasted Cornish game hen and this was really good. Juicy tender. Fresh. I got to sample and it was very good. Both my kids got the beef tenderloin and they loved it. I got a bite and this was so tender. Melt in your mouth good. They were both raving about it. My mom got the smoked Korean style baby back ribs but it was a little spicy for her cause it has spicy red chile paste. I tried it and it was fall off the bone goodness but pretty spicy. Not that spicy but gave a decent kick. It was very good.   So our server was really good. He greeted us and took care of us. Checking on us. Our water cups were filled on a regular basis. So service was really good. The food was quite good. Very fresh. All the dishes were really good but just wasn't impressed with the lamb rack (- 1 star). Loved the ambiance and everything about the House of Tricks. I would definitely come back again. Enjoy.

Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sumac Crusted Lamb Rack
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Brick Roasted One-Half Cornish Game Hen

LKLbsUBIcOmnTn9U5oNFZw.text: Great food and great atmosphere. My employees always ask to have our holiday party here. We do a lunch and gift exchange on the patio. Everyone loves it and looks forward to it all year long.

8GWbFlqt4Bx9BVYUg8aLOQ.text: If you're looking for a unique one of a kind place this is the place. Beautiful old house and huge property with lots of patio seating. Great for all occasions and even a quiet meal for a date. Delicious unique menu and the staff is very nice!

RoZkUrCFWKnsKPDY02ktVg.text: Rude hostess. Even though we had a reservation (birthday celebration). she said it'd be a minimum 2 hour wait for outside seating even though we saw empty tables. She put us back in a cramped inside dark corner by kitchen noise. We politely complained and ended up sitting outside by the bar. We heard other parties complaining. Food was nothing special. Misters were dripping huge drops onto our table and heads

W59VrJX13xvMQNHMhCer9g.text: I don't often give out five stars, but this time, it is well deserved.  It was a quiet birthday dinner for a long-time friend and we had reservations for early afternoon.  It was a warm day, but the extensive outdoor area is misted and well-shaded.  We were guests, however, and our hosts preferred inside dining.  The House of Tricks is an old home that has been remodeled into a quaint restaurant with exceptional food.  We started with a drink from the bar called "Weeds".  A hemp-infused Vodka with some other stuff, garnished with Bee Pollen.  This drink was quite refreshing, not too sweet and not too alcohol-Ly tasting.  A perfect starter on a warm day.  Passing on the appetizers, we started with a crisp, light dressed Caesar salad that was cool and refreshing.  The salad maybe could have used a bit more dressing, and one of our companions did ask for more, which was quickly delivered.  Following our salads, I had the Orange-Blackberry seared Duck Breast.  My wife enjoyed her Blackened Ahi Tuna.  Both dishes were cooked perfectly and the presentation was beautiful.    The duck was tender and juicy, with a nice crusty sear, cooked a perfect medium.  The garnish only enhanced the flavor of this delicious dish and my plate was quickly cleaned of all evidence.  The wife hardly spoke during dinner, mostly because she couldn't stop eating - clearly she enjoyed the beautifully presented Ahi dish.  After dinner, the dessert people among us opted for the Salted Caramel Apple Bread pudding.  Once again, a beautiful presentation, a tall column of bread pudding, topped with a flavored whipped cream and drizzled with fresh butter and salted caramel sauce.  Service was impeccable, as was expected and we were not disappointed.  The dining room is a bit loud, and for a hearing-impaired person, this is a bit much to take on, so I would recommend the outside dining.  The bathrooms open right on to the dining room and there is a table right there, so that could be a bit disconcerting, but when I used it, I just avoided eye contact with other diners :-)  There is metered parking on the street out front, but we opted to park in the rear, where we found a nice, shaded spot.  This is a small parking lot in the back, so good luck.  Prices are on the high side, but for the experience and the food, I say well worth the expense.  I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Seared duck breast, blackberry jam, fennel, pickled onions, couscous and carrot puree
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salted caramel apple bread pudding

VpdxmcgejszO_cnh1ygIYg.text: First time at House of Tricks and it was amazing! We celebrated our 10th anniversary there and probably had some of the best service we've ever had.   Ambiance was nice, casual outdoors meets white linen!   We tried the bread (a must), Caesar salad, Ahi and Beef Tenderloin. Everything was cooked to presentation and displayed for the senses.   We did not try dessert! Next time.   If you go, make reservations. We were seated promptly and they read that it was our anniversary and greeted us as such.  Thank you HOT!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Ambiance
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Caesar
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bread...yum

FHt7O7OtWyLFi5KYOy5hnw.text: It had been a few years since we'd eaten here and we were really, really looking forward to returning.  (It used to be fairly regularly for us with friends, but we changed our Gammage seats to Sunday a while back and they're closed on Sunday) I wish that I could say we had a good experience like we always used to but it was pretty awful unfortunately.    We eat out at least every other week at busy restaurants, we understand slow service happens, especially on busy nights, (and we arrived 2 hours and 20 minutes ahead of the show to allow for that).  What we didnt understand is a server (I won't mention his name) who from the beginning seemed disconnected, uninterested, and seemed to act as though he didnt want to be there.  Even when things fell apart, he made very little attempt at making things right.  We have always had *exceptional* service every time prior at House of Tricks, so this was just so unexpected.    Our food arrived quite a while after the tables' next to us, even though we arrived before them.  (They ordered almost exactly what we did, so it wasn't the type of food that was the delay) Our table was rarely checked on, (except by the bus-boy with water) and no attempt at an apology was given until I complained about the long delay.  Our server finally checked on us after the food arrived, and ask how everything tasted.  We didnt know, as the bus-boy had taken our silverware and didnt return with any until several minutes after the food arrived.  Overall the food was very good, (Ahi Tuna, Salmon, Portobello Etouffee, and the SeaBass), as good as we remembered.  The service unfortunately was pretty awful, and the $15 credit and free (single) dessert on a tab of over $210 was a sad attempt at trying to make things right.  No sight of the manager either which to me says the service issues extend far beyond the server in question.  House of Tricks was a favorite of ours for many years, it had been a toss-up for us between this and Monarch Cafe for a delicious meal in a beautiful, romantic setting.  After last nights experience I feel as though we have no reason to return.  Such a shame.

DhBiyadbgbWVCbjlL8veLw.text: I made a reservation for a birthday dinner and requested a patio table. I called to confirm both the reservation and my request and was informed by a rather bitchy host that they never guarantee patio tables, even for reservations. So, I cancelled and won't plan to go again. I don't mind so much that they won't honor a request, what I minded was the attitude that came with it. A very poor way to make guests feel welcome. Don't you realize that the person who answers your phone is, many times, the first impression of your restaurant? You need to offer him some training as to how to speak with your guests in a way that expresses your policy but doesn't make you not want to dine in your restaurant. No thank you. We'll take our business  and our money to restaurants that are warm, kind, welcoming and act like they appreciate our business. I wonder if the owners know this person is turning customers off on the phone? Perhaps they need to hire a mystery shopper to hear what your customers are hearing.

na5i04ZixS6pkPoUuZAc9A.text: All I can say is wow. What a beautiful place. Food is outstanding in the service is first class.  It's a wonderful place to sit outside among the trees and bushes. The grand old home that has been converted into a first-class work restaurant.  We brought one of our Hollywood producer friends in from California and Matt there for a business meeting. They just went above and beyond in service making us feel especially well.  I will definitely go back.

s45-qyu7brvVmS8lExhLng.text: House of Tricks is a restaurant that gets a 10+ in ambiance and charm.  Located right near the ASU Tempe campus, we have enjoyed many celebratory dinners here while our kids were in college.  The outdoor garden setting is absolutely gorgeous and whether you are just enjoying wine and appetizers or an entire dinner it is a great choice. What I love about House of Tricks is the unique (never boring) appetizers, soups, salads and entrees with a southwestern influences.  The menu changes and offers seasonal choices.  The wine list is great and offers many wines by the glass.  I am not a huge dessert person, but the bread pudding at house of tricks is so good, you won't regret it.   They do close during the summer months, so be sure you call before going.

bmjg8vpmAUzTeueuAd4GVQ.text: Our server, Sean, was funny and endearing. He was able to give us a background of the restaurant which was enjoyable. The Etouffee was divine--excellent flavor and texture. I ordered the sea bass which was sweet and mild in flavor but overwhelmed by the black beans accompanying it. The artisan cheese plate and smoked salmon as starters were the highlight of the meal. Phenomenal cheese choices and delicately-flavored salmon. The prices were steep, around $250 for five of us, but if you're looking for high-quality food and a relaxed environment this is your spot.

xv7fkeEen25NmOLdj9N9JQ.text: I wouldn't waste the money.  My daughter and I went a few weeks ago.  The old fashioned I ordered rivaled the equivalency of a neighborhood watering hole.  They did deduct that from the bill on their own accord.  The scallop appetizer didn't have a proper sear and was a tad over cooked.  The asparagus salad was average - very little flavor. My pork shank was too sweet and again slightly over cooked.  They accidentally dumped my daughter's beef entree on her lap for which they apologized but made no real other amends except preparing a new one. Ironically enough, that was the best item we ate. The creme brulee was burnt leaving a terrible aftertaste and the inside and had the consistency of cooked eggs. Overall, overrated and nowhere near worth the prices. We won't be back.

0x6n0p8x_1CGNQFWSCjHDw.text: Great design of the patio. Good menu selection and great food  good service and staff

h4I7tXmpklLeOD6DY3PT8A.text: First came here back in 2009 and it has been solid ever since. Saturdays are always a good day, but be prepared for crowds. The food is to die for and worth the wait, I would say give it a try and see if you think the same. Most decent spots with a great menu like House Of Tricks are going to have lines on the weekend. At least the weather is turning! Time for some nice Arizona patio lovin'!

VCpFBTMo8UM8XFIHMNeg9w.text: This place looks great from the outside - outdoor seating, bar, lights, etc. Sets expectations for a lovely evening. But this is how our night went to begin with:  7:30: "I'm checking in for my 7:30pm reservation under Samantha."  Hostess: "Ok. We're just clearing out some tables."  *Another party with 7:30 pm reservation gets seated. A walk-in party gets seated. A couple other reservations get seated*  7:50pm: Boyfriend goes to host stand to check on status. "What's the eta on our reservation?"  Same hostess: "What reservation?"  "Samantha at 7:30"  "I marked you as a no show."  "... but we've been waiting since 7:30. We checked in with you."  "With me...?"   We finally get seated. They seat us at a table next to a heater and say "we'll turn it right on." They never do. Rest of service was meh. Food was okay, nothing worth bad service (we had pork chop, bison meat loaf, foie gras poutine, salted caramel bread pudding).

OdtilPpBAbjQ7hS_7FntGg.text: If you're looking for somewhere to go on a nice date this place is killer. The happy hour is excellent I really love sitting at the bar there's a tree going through the middle of it. Service is excellent probably my favorite fine dining in Tempe

f6QXSy3Czk34lwQdMBR62A.text: Be sure to sit on the patio!!  It's one of the best in  patioa I. PHX with amazing service and !

zQGBfs-rff6rx3nc8H5CoQ.text: Excellent food and accommodating seating for indoor/ outdoor. Great drinks and staff is friendly. Parking can be challenging so get there early

LyarWHWYGYpPMYaY8m9Tug.text: After our eventful emergency landing at PHX (landing gear failure), we got stuck in Phoenix for a night.  A colleague of mine who lives in Phoenix recommended this place over any other place in town.  My wife and I had a lovely dinner at the House of Tricks.  Great service all around and our server "Josh" made our night by making great recommendations and treating us really well.  Thank you "Josh" for turning our travel nightmare into a great evening in Phoenix.  Their mussels (must try), double-cut pork chop, ribs were just great and nicely arranged outdoor seatings made it all work well for us.  Good wine selections and they were NOT overly expensive at all.  I would visit them again next time we are in PHX.  Again, thanks for the great experience!

UcXbucKBfOAzF3Bn7GOOGQ.text: Was there the evening of April 24. Don't know if it was an off-night, but long long wait times. Long wait for drinks. Long wait for appetizers. Long wait for entrees.  Desert came fast.  Weird part was our server seemed oblivious even when we pointed out the long waits to her.  Said something about a "big party", then shrugged her shoulders. Eh.  Not the response we were looking for. Food was good, generally, but not outstanding given the high pricing. I think HoT is a bit over-rated.  But it's ambience is unique.

2LO-qtf4kfP7u63ZSRTw2w.text: From start to finish a great experience.  Started with the duck liver ( can't spell the French version) and mussels.  The waitress recommended getting the duck liver first since the mussels would have over powered the liver.   Turned to be an excellent suggestion.  For dinner we had the Ahi which was perfectly cooked and really delicious.  I've even to this place about 5 times now and have never been disappointed.  Sit outside, it's really nice anytime of the year.

QBs-Q1qZ9KQC5nsTHt6OcQ.text: I have walked past it quite a few times and was curious about them. I found them to be not very vegan friendly. Hardly a couple items on the menu which are vegetarian.

3sQ9f7A3tRNoF0yx8rSspA.text: Server was very nice but kitchen was terribly slow and the bison meatloaf was dry and tasted like liver. (I like liver but..,). The General m gave us a free dessert but waiting over an hour for entrees was not worth it! We were the only people in the room.

adDuDgwl5FOhBcJhmGPdBg.text: It was a very cute place with good food - unfortunately the service was very sub-par.  We had a reservation for six.  We checked in and probably waited 10 minutes to be seated although we walked past the empty table when we walked in.  Then we sat another 10 minutes with not one employee acknowledging us.  We had to go back to the hostess to ask for a waiter!  Then it was still poor service - had to ask two different servers for a black napkin, waited again for straws, the food took quite a while, and ultimately we were there for 2 hours.  That is unacceptable.  We will not return.

Dw3FiTw1AEM0nUxkLRJ1zw.text: I've been going to Trick for many years off & on. While I love the cute house & outdoor seating area, I've decided to no longer visit House of Tricks. Each time I visit Foie Grois is on the menu - which is cruelly obtained from ducks (practice of shoving a metal pipe down their throats three times a day and pumping several pounds of mush into their stomachs -horrible) It was even in Creme Brulee once (WTH -disgusting). I don't really like see lamb on the menu either (IDK if they serve veal, also very cruel).  It's just not a place I will choose to take guests or myself until they create a more compassionate menu.

GQ3KTCSiHiWWv3LBquHYnw.text: This place is the best. The patio food and service are all spot on. Check out the pecan smoked salmon appetizer for sure! Also had the daily lunch special that was eggplant lasagna... Holy moly yes!!

63cYyqBVaAmNW_bPsNnuYg.text: House of Tricks is a small business located in a Tempe historical landmark. It has great food, but not a huge selection. It's pretty classy and is a great place for a nice date or classy occasion. Not very vegetarian friendly and is a little pricy, but the dining experience is well worth the price. Totally cute.

5eNuKl_h_eoy36SUP2yPfg.text: I have been to this place couple of times and with the recent experience I will NEVER go to this place. Went during the lunch and the hostess said the wait is 20 mins. After 30 minutes we were getting agitated and went and asked she very rudely answered that the wait will be 30 more minutes. She is not even apologizing and even didn't say sorry and asked us to go to another lunch place. What a crazy rude place this has become. Completely lost respect. Guys if you are in a restaurnt business please at least first learn to respect customers and say sorry!! Such a mean staff!!

5aDJ7tjqOnguNZm1B0Unyw.text: I know that this place gets rave reviews from ASU faculty, so I took some out-of-town guests for lunch.  I had made reservations online and specifically requested indoor seating.  When we arrived, our table had been prepared outdoors--and, even worse, out in the open, so it was covered in fallout from the trees and speckled with bird poo.  We requested in indoor table and were quickly accommodated.  I'm guessing that some people find bird poo to be 'quaint' or authentic, but I don't.  To summarize: Some of the food is delicious, while some of the food is disappointing.  Club sandwich was delicious, grilled chicken sandwich was dry and flavorless.  The menu reads much more impressively than the food that arrives.  I was also disappointing that it took over an hour to receive our lunch entrees on a Monday afternoon.  One of our five dishes had also been incorrectly prepared (ordered without hot peppers, but they were included), but we didn't have time to get the food corrected, since we had an engagement.  Service seems adequate, at best, but the servers seem fairly apathetic.  Not rude or incompetent, just not attentive.

2OgUejv2_P5IIa6yqvDP5A.text: This is a very pretty and cozy romantic place to bring a date.  We came during lunch and the clientele seems almost upscale with well dressed businessmen.  I was impressed upon entry as the place looks classy.  My date wanted a glass of wine but the waiter thought she was under 21.  She forgot to bring her ID so no wine for her.  Bummer.  She looks way older than 21.  I had ordered a the french dip roast beef sandwich.  It came out so-so.  Way overcooked roast beef and it was very dry.  I had much better roast beef sandwiches for $8 at nice sandwich shops.  The waiter was really nice and offered to take it back which I did.  I then ordered the ruby red trout.  When it came out, it looked like cooked salmon.  I was expecting trout but as the waiter explained it was ruby red trout.  It tasted exactly like salmon and bad salmon at that.  My date took a bite too and agreed it was bad fish.  I told the waiter and he took it back.  I finally go the mashed potatoes which were heavenly.    My date really liked her salad.  She thought it was great.  The place had a lot of orange fruit trees and outside seating during nice weather is good.  Overall I am disappointed in the food quality here as I was expecting some good food based on all the reviews.  Service was good.  Ambiance was great.

lTOkuNj5RxKCeI9kEE8EkA.text: I had an exceptional lunch experience at House of Tricks yesterday.  While there were a few things they could improve it was clear that this was a 5 star deal/establishment.  I started my meal off with a cup of exotic Asian beef soup.  The flavors included corn and cilantro.  The soup was incredible, possible one of the best soups I have ever had.  The broth was clear and light.  Temperature and spice was precise.  Clearly hit the spot.  I then had a lovely ahi tuna salad.  Portion was huge, tuna perfect and lightly dressed.  The pasta and veggies underneath were tasty and refreshing, perfect for a hot summer day.  The problems here are a few.  Acoustics are really bad.  The floor is wood as are all the furnishings.  It was very noisy and hard to hear others at my table.  The outside is a tad rundown.  Looks like they need some paint and repairs.  Does not have the best curb appeal for a high end establishment.  Service was wonderful.  I will definitely be coming back.

S86d1GJS4oMFyVab7vq1Sw.text: I'm a total foodie... see my reviews.  This place is pretty good IF you know how to deal with their HUGE PROBLEMS...  1) Prices are crazy for the quantity you get - make sure someone else pays 2) The Over Sauce EVERYTHING! Pear Salad was swimming in an ocean of dressing  Lamb Shank was good but the side dish was under the shank (Sweet potatoes in this case) and it was swimming in another ocean of sauce - you coul not taste anything bt the sauce.   ASK for ALL sauces on the side!

OlNOt-ujUEG3zbaXL8_rdA.text: House of Tricks was a unique dining experience.  I like the charm and character of the restaurant being located inside a former home.  They have a nice patio dining area where the front lawn is.  I ordered a grilled salmon over a chive risotto cake resting on a bed of spring lettuce with sweet roasted peppers, cherry tomatoes, avocado and garnished with tortilla strips.  There was a chipotle grapefruit vinaigrette used.  All of the flavors blended well together and it was delicious, delightful and satisfying.  I had good table service and I had an enjoyable meal and time at House of Tricks.  I am looking forward to visiting again.  It is challenging to find parking around the area.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salmon Salad

uyDCnb7588szXE3a8TqNFA.text: The House of Tricks has done a wonderful job creating a beautiful environment you're sick tree covered garden space surrounding their beautiful venue nested in historical Tempe Downtown. The food is delicious yet I don't find them taking very many risks in pursuing a more persuasive or passionate types of food. I would love to come back and always tell people great things about this place.  I recommend your friends and family or after work functions even for events :)

wjidDduzrGusWlgIiTFnUQ.text: House of Tricks has an extensive wine list that is very reasonably priced.  Both the lunch menu and dinner menu are great, probably the best food you will find in Tempe.  The outside patio is very cute, great for dates.  I suggest the wild boar appetizer.  The carrots are drizzled with a carmalized bourbon sauce, so good!!!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Great wine list!!

aN7iNojOn31mQkuqNsNDRA.text: Made a reservation because of the name. Thought it had magic. Well it was magical. Took a group of NDs for dinner and the meal was superb. The Korean short ribs were succulent. The drinks were fantastic and the service superb too. Highly recommend House of Tricks

Cwh37AjyWVeUJg7Qq7FWtg.text: Hands down my favorite place in the valley to eat! I've eaten here a dozen times and never been disappointed.  I work in the industry and cannot say enought about the food at this place.  I also consider this to be a secret weapon with the dating scene.  I tell every one of my guy friends that this is the place for a first date.  The patio atmosphere is a shoe-in with the ladies.  Don't doubt me, try it.  You'll thank me later.  If you don't try the house of tricks than you suck!

2CZGKMwlzkwtFPzr6VRcNQ.text: One of the best kept secrets in Tempe I am told.  Had a wonderful time.  I only sat at the outdoor bar for drinks and appetizers, but I was quite pleased with the menu selection and service.  Perhaps one of the best caesar salads I have ever had as it is generous with the garlic.  Recommended for dates and romantic diners.

3zBe_G_qzFlgbWfs6OOGFg.text: This is the perfect date restaurant.  Make a reservation, sit outside under the misters and take in the great atmosphere.  I was lucky enough to indulge in the restaurant week menu.  Arugula salad, squash soup, asian meatballs on risotto with long beans and finished with lemon meringue and tasted my date's creme brulee.  Exquisite food.

OLPinJWDr261owfzIzmUiA.text: Hidden gem in Downtown Tempe. When I first heard the name I thought I was being taken to a dive. Wow was I surprised! The location seems to be in a former residence with a casual garden surrounding diners eating al fresco. There is air conditioned dining available.The food is well prepared and reasonably priced. It is the favored location for entertaining visiting faculty and VIP's from ASU. It is a very popular spot for graduation celebrations so make your reservations well in advance. Parking behind the restaurant will spare you the unpleasant surprise of a parking ticket for those who linger beyond the parking meters 1 hour limit. The serving portions are generous. The deserts are equally delicious! Been visiting about 10 times a year for the past 12 years and always a great meal at the House of Tricks.

TPC738Dd6ej_yxnSl6xt3g.text: I went here last night with a friend of mine after a long break of simply forgetting how close House of Tricks was located to me. The ambiance and table setup strike a nice mix of casual and refinement. you're going to be comfortable there whoever you are. The server Jessica was a pleasure and seemed to guess right that I was on a date, so she acted accordingly which was a nice touch...you know, adding a little more formality and checking in frequently with suggestions to the wine and drink list. She suggested the green thing and freaky squirrel for cocktails and they were both very good. We had the pork belly appetizer which was very tender and complimented the large bread basket well. We skipped getting a salad which was good idea because the entrees were surprisingly large cuts of meat. I had the Grilled Beef Tenderloin which was exceptional. I suggest when the server asks you how you want it cooked, to just let the chef decide at a place like this. It was perfect. The other entree was the double pork chops still on the bone and it was beyond tender and flavorful. Easily the best pork chop I've tasted and my date couldn't finish it all if that gives you an idea on the portion. Both were served with mashed potatoes and asparagus. The asparagus was cooked properly but the mashed potatoes could probably have used some cream in them, not bad but i'm picky on simple sides like that. The biggest thumbs up I can give is that the steak arrived hot. If you get steaks/cuts of meat at restaurants, you know this to be one of the most anticipated moments and i'm usually very disappointed, but not this time. The food was promptly brought and it makes a difference. The biggest let down of the meal was the dessert, We ordered the doughnuts and they were more like flavorless hush puppies. A bit too dense and overcooked, these doughnuts just didn't do it for me but my date seemed to enjoy them. The desserts at other people's tables looked really good and the remorse of not getting the peanut butter infused treat also probably played a part in my not loving the doughnuts. The price is pretty much on par with any upscale steak place, while some people might not understand that given the location is an older house setting, you have to embrace that you're paying for the peace of mind that you're not in a cheesy setting and you're still getting 4-5 star service and food. That's a big deal if you're a foodie or appreciate what matters in my opinion. That being said, If you're showing up for dinner and you plan on having a few drinks, you should probably be prepared to spend around $130 or so. Pretty reasonable considering your only other option in the area is cafe boa for something similar. Again, props to the server, Jessica- she was really helpful and fun. I considered a 5 star review, but decided to hold off until another visit to confirm how much i enjoyed dinner.

xY6hzjzmUrVGVfEl1Ka4Nw.text: Bad service and food was just okay, not great by any means.  Our waiter couldn't have been more disinterested in showing any signs of friendliness!  I ordered chicken and specifically asked if it were all white meat and was told it was.  When I got my order, there was a leg and thigh.  When I brought it to our waiter's attention, he said it was half a chicken and had to have the dark meat.  Wish he had told me that in the beginning.  I only ate the white meat part.  The risotto was not cooked properly, was borderline mushy.  We were so disappointed, we did not even have dessert there and we always have dessert!  After an unsatisfying meal, we had to wait for a really long time for our waiter to bring the check and even longer to get it back after we pointed out an error on the check.  No apologies from the waiter were offered! I would not recommend House of Tricks and will not go back there again.

zG166AxFxzrv6xrXB6mgbg.text: Although quaint with some items tasty, we've decided not to go here anymore based on them serving foie gras.  Many of the better restaurants are straying from serving this plate as it entails forcefeeding ducks by shoving a feeding tube down their throat and esophagus. Much more gruesome details I won't mention because most people don't care anyway.  There are some of us meat eaters that do not wish to eat flesh from tortured animals and thank goodness there are enough other great restaurants around who will no longer serve this.

Z4Ldb5FmTdRB0P411T_U7A.text: Went for a business lunch and had the banh mi which was very good. The waiter wasn't very attentive, but overall, I would recommend.

yEuT9PEhAN6yeZGwKXTpzw.text: Great place for drinks and/or dinner. Seating inside and outside - great for date night or with a group. Lots of great healthy menu options. The bartender we had wasn't very friendly and kept grabbing our drinks before we were done - our waiter was great though. Definitely a neat place. Parking in front is metered.

OLgvOMJbSjV42dqM-gWSew.text: For some reason, I prefer dining here for lunch more than dinner.  I love their salads and the daily specials are typically creative and delicious.  I typically get the beef tenderloin salad, and my husband opts for anything seafood.  I really enjoy sitting outside and find their indoor area rather stuffy.   Be sure to try the raspberry ice tea and save room for dessert.  This place never disappoints!

fgjFG8jsj3La7BGrYK1U8Q.text: Location - Totally unassuming!  Located on a quiet, semi dark street with other hidden restaurants.  Looks like some of those other restaurants aren't in business anymore or don't open for dinner.  You see an occassional couple strolling through. Parking - Metered street parking till 6 pm, so bring coins!  Busy so come early to find parking. Reservations - Sometimes required and always recommended.  Very busy place. Service- Superb.  Price - Great for the experience. Ambiance - Cottage feel.  Request outside seating in the garden area.  Candles and string lights provide soft glow along with heat lamps.  Very romantic. Menu - Changes often.  Therefore, some of the items I wanted to try from my Yelp research was not on the menu.    Food - 1. Mixed Baby Lettuce Salad with Balsamic Vinaigrette and Goat Cheese Croutons - Didn't try.  My friend seemed to like it. 2. Green Chile Salmon & Shrimp Cakes with Citrus Jicama Slaw and Smoked Yellow Pepper Remoulade - Not fishy at all.  Great flavor with a bit of a kick from the green chile.  Lots of salmon and shrimp, little breading.  Loved the jicama slaw.  Really refreshing contrast to the remoulade. 3. 13 oz NY Strip with an Heirloom Tomato Salad of Shaft Blue Cheese, Garlic Chips, Arugula, Radish Sprouts and Anna Potatoes - Meat was real tender and flavorful.  Salad was a bit oversalted.  Potatoes were sliced thin, layered and baked.  A bit dry and salty though.  Overall a good dish. 4. Pumpkin Seed Crusted Filet Mignon with Potato Masa Cake, Guajillo Chile Glaze, Haricot Verts And Roasted Poblano Aioli -  A bit disappointing.  Meat was incredibly tender.  You could probably cut it with the fork.  However, the meat wasn't seared/seasoned properly.  Although cooked medium rare as requested, it had that grayish hue color instead of a dark burnt color on the outside and medium cool inside.  Pumpkin seeds provided little flavor and the meat need more flavor/salt.  Potato cakes were good, similar to a breaded and pan fried mash potato. Chili glaze provided a small kick and flavor.  Haricot verts (green beans) were really over salted. 5. Everything Spiced Ahi Tuna on Toasted Couscous with Avocado Tangerine Fennel Slaw In Ginger Chile Vinaigrette and White Miso Sabayon - AMAZING.  Three of us went and the two that didn't order this dish, wished we had.  We were skeptical to order fish, especially raw fish in a land locked state.  By far, the best ahi tuna any of us have ever had.  Thick cuts of tuna that you can cut with a fork.  No bits of tendons or chewy bites.  The tuna had coarse ground seasoning on it of salt, pepper and something else.  Reminded me of a Montreal seasoning for steak.  No five spices or heavy aromatic seasoning on it.  Definitely definitely try this. 6. Volver Tempranillo- Good top note, nice finish. 7. Cranberry Apple Bake - Cranberries were very tart.  Decent but the clumps of cranberry made my mouth pucker. 8. Cranberry Bread Pudding -  Very good.  Huge bits of bread baked with sweet cranberry, topped with ice cream.  Highly recommended.  Although some of the veggies were overly salty, I would love to come back.  The ambiance, service and fushion of ingredients were great.  I'd give this place 4.5 stars, but since I can't, I'll round up to 5 stars for flavor, presentation and uniqueness factor.

9Oalq8ZotO-p_NarQfvy9g.text: great food, great atmosphere. been here a few times and usually for special occasions or a nice date night. can't go wrong with lunch on the patio...dinners can get pricey but worth it.

kAoAv8UD0GVFIBWqFTFjsQ.text: I absolutely love this place! It's like fine dining without such a stuffy feeling.  I can go here dressed up in heels for a date or in flip flops and jeans for a lunch with friends. I've gotten something different every time and I have yet to be disappointed. I recommend trying whatever the special might be at the time because I've had fantastic luck with them. I've never sat inside but I'm not sure why you would want to because the patio is beautiful! A big tree, fireplace, flowers, and even a little koi pond really make a lovely dining setting. I've heard there are sometimes stray cats around? I haven't ever encountered them yet but I wouldn't mind. Kitties are cute! One of my favorite restaurants ever. If you haven't tried it you really must!

etZajCEs-uHA0c26vgv4hw.text: Great spot for outdoor business meal.  Limited vegetarian options.

3kyCCUeBZjuF-8w9Oo-bSg.text: With so many amazing restaurants in the area (that charge the same high prices), I can't understand why this place gets good reviews. I can only assume people don't know any better and are so charmed by the historic bungalows that they can't see they are getting ripped off. I have been here twice with family, and the first time I thought the food was mediocre, and the second time confirmed it. The ceasar salad tasted like something you would get at Denny's, and the salmon came with what I can only describe as "airport quality" potato cubes that tasted like leftover morning hash browns. At least there were only a tiny amount of potatoes, next to a tiny amount of brussel sprouts - and all that for the same price of an amazing entree at a real 4 star restaurant. Please save your money and go someplace great. The service and drinks were fine, but the food is really sub par for the price.

4K5jNk2cFrmTZZeIWdpeFw.text: Excellent!!! Food was delicious. I had the salmon dinner with the mixed green salad. Yum... My friends all had the Flounder special. That was wonderful as well. We sat outside, perfect weather for it - February. We enjoyed the atmosphere.

XylkdCZo1xWeTZtTnppl-g.text: House of Tricks is my favorite place to spend my birthday.  Beautiful patio. Seared tuna was awesome.  Loved the Arizona wine. Good service.

-7Mnm-6pw0yYMBNecQn7Kg.text: Trusted YELP patrons once again..... and they proved themselves!  Talented, artistic chefs....Korean beef soup with a bit of kimchee and brown rice...just enough heat.  Who would have thought a soup could be so filled with flavor!  Fresh Fish of the day was Barramundi....perfectly prepared...moist, with a sauce that hinted at mustard grain.  Don'miss the mussels...the broth and fresh crusted bread is the perfect compliment.  Great for a date....sit on the outdoor patio.

j_foU3l1CnOC8ephDkD5MA.text: This place is amazing, how have I not been in the entire 6+ years I have lived in the valley? This place is very warm and inviting, a sharp contrast to the nearby Mill District. I went there earlier this week to have dinner with a friend. House of Tricks has a great ambiance. It's definitely a "date-night" sort of place.   We sat outside on the patio. I ordered a Manhatten Iced Tea, which ended up not being my cup of tea (no pun intended), but it was a well made drink. For an appetizer, we ordered the Artisan Cheese & Fruit plate. Delicious! Fruit and cheese plates always make me feel fancy. The presentation was great..it was like a work of art. For the main entree, I had the Sugar-Spiced Salmon with Chinese Long Beans, Mustard Sauce, Sweet Soy-Ponzu, Sticky Rice and Nori. The salmon was probably the best salmon I've ever had. It was perfectly seasoned and cooked impeccably. The rest of the dish was just as good..oh that sauce! It was sweet with just the right amount of spice.  One drawback I have noticed-Thankfully I am now a pescitarian because the vegetarian options are quite limited. I'd suggest checking out the website before going. :)  From the looks of the other reviews, I see that the menu is seasonal, so I look forward to coming back and trying what else this place has to offer.

3zD6qVSQjlvDz0nHY2wOPQ.text: Had a great birthday dinner here! Satan finally decided to stop savaging The Valley of the Sun in the ass since it's now fall, and it was only 80 F outside at night - so I sat outside with my wife under the trees. Nice romantic setting. The tables were spaced out nicely so we didn't have to smell any other people or hear the stupid things they were saying, which was good. Got the salmon and it was delicious. Service was really good but I am 99% sure our waiter was on coke. He was sweating profusely and kept fumbling with both his words and physical items. Not that we cared, it added to the fun. Odell IPA on tap and only $4.50! We decided to get creme brulee for dessert, and finished the experience off right with a 16 year Lagavulin, served in the correct snifter glass. $120 with tax and tip for two people. Pretty much every entree was about $30, which I felt was about $10 overpriced - it was great but not $30 outstanding.

vnO3K64-AluoGMXlCKnN1Q.text: Such a great place with great ambiance... the food was amazing. My boyfriend and I came here for our Valentine's brunch and everything was perfect. The service was a tad slow, but everything else knocked it out of the park! Be warned, the Bloody Mary is spiccccyyy! But good spicy :) Will be here again very soon, definitely waiting for it to be a little warmer at night to try and dinner menu, which looks awesome!

8W04Cw-raECPbH5tl21csg.text: This place is amazing.  Great food, good service, and a lovely space.  Outside is like eating in the middle of a garden.  Inside is a renovated house but we didn't feel cramped at all.  Highly recommend their PB&J.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. House made Snickers bar at House of Tricks.
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lox, cream cheese tapenade, arugula, cucumbers, and mango chutney at House of Tricks.
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. PB&amp;J (pistachio butter, balsamic strawberries, mascarpone, arugula, and shaved fennel) at House of Tricks.

mdDDj-6h7LfWkGas2nPG2g.text: Very tasty burger wit potato chips and a pickle. Not worth waiting an hour for though

DyKQUOPvSEqAOeeA1ksuZQ.text: I was visiting from out of town and we used yelp to find this establishment and they must have got a new chef.  The waiter told us that he has tables on the other side of the restaurant and that we should just holler at anyone if he is not around.  I'm sorry but I expect better service.  Secondly, I ordered rack of lamb medium rare.  The meat by the rib bone was not even cooked.  The fat by the rib bone was still gummy and white.  My friends orders a seafood dish with various small chunks of dried out seafood.

diN28Rm_Erqr0wm3kIv7NQ.text: The only good part is the Korean BBQ and the pistachio gelato...for an upscale restaurant the service was terrible! They didn't put our outdoor heater within good range so we could barely feel it and we had to move our own table over closer to the heater. To top it off service was extremely slow and they acted very snobby towards us even though we were part of a fairly large party. The worst part was we were still enjoying our evening and between 4 of us we had ordered one bottle of wine but they took the bottle away when it still had at least one glass of wine in it. Hello!!! We paid for that and it was just gone. Terrible terrible service.

SmcZqqmsTdrorZXMOWqiog.text: This is a nice place to spend an afternoon on the patio. Great food wine selection and beer. Quite dining good place for a date.

6oPtmCBB1hDw1Lwr_B3jmQ.text: Had an amazing dinner here on a Wednesday night and the place was really busy. We had foie gras starter to share and it was amazing, glad we shared though as we got 4oz of it. For main we had the salmon and the lamb both were beautifully presented and came out quickly and cooked to perfection. To finish we had the expresso creme brulee to share, again a big dessert but a delicious alternative to after dinner coffee. The service was excellent and it was a really pretty setting on the patio. And fun the house of tricks has a resident cat.

MRSEAgApWdV-p3dY1H5RWg.text: I took my daughter to House of Tricks to celebrate her birthday with a nice lunch. I'd been there many times before in the past, but it has been a couple of years. We had a wonderful time, the atmosphere is lovely, and we treated ourselves to a full experience; the spinach dip appetizer was incredibly creamy and yummy; we split a red-wine marinated tenderloin salad which had some absolutely scrumptious chunks of quality rare beef; my daughter had the homemade pork pastrami sandwich, which was delicious - except, they forgot to add the Irish porterhouse cheddar cheese, which we didn't notice until after we left - my daughter took the majority of her sandwich to go. So sad, that cheese would have been marvelous on that sandwich! My lunch special, the shrimp fried rice with two types of shrimp, had lots of flavor. For dessert, we splurged on the salted caramel apple bread pudding, along with the special, a peanut butter/peach tort. Oh, my. Excellent service, excellent food, would have been five stars if the cheese was on the sandwich. Our bad for not noticing until later, but still...We will be back.

3Vo8aAVFvmCCrCoUP8GI3Q.text: I personally think this is as good as Tempe's culinary scene gets. Tucked away from the chaos of Tempe's student population but close enough to walk to neighboring bars and entertainment venues. House of Tricks is a must for anyone seeking an upscale experience, that's worth the price in Tempe Arizona. Very professional and knowledgeable staff, and an extensive menu and wine list, it is obvious the owners poured their hearts and souls into this place. Have never personally sat inside, even though it looks great, but you will know why once you experience the patio. A historic piece of Tempe, you must try House of Tricks if your in the area.

G2t8UqA521aSKV5k1UGyhw.text: Lamb rack was simply amazing, I've had a lot of lamb but this is tied with lamb I've had in Greece...it was so tender and juicy and cooked just right...  and everything complimented so well on the plate. I had the duck, which was delicious but on the rare side so for those of you who don't like a little red, order accordingly. The cocktail I had, the spring chicken, was great...husband and I shared 2 salads both we're very good. Last but not least we had the bread pudding dessert with a scoop of vanilla gelato, very very delicious. It is an expensive place , our dinner plates were in the 30's and I highly recommend making a reservation. We were there on a Wednesday night and it was packed!

NeHrqy1JRy4QcHCPD3X8JQ.text: Went there for a business lunch and loved the ambience, food, and wine. We sat on the patio and it was very nice. I will definitely visit there again.

zII6q5btGK9IvwHEdT9rwg.text: Always great food and atmosphere. With misters evening temperature in August perfect on the patio. Orata (sea bream/dorade) excellent!

bIiQ8VfEw6y5uK8cMni47A.text: For the valley Tempe area, this place is a gem, especially amongst the bustle of the college district.  The food was elegant and tasty.  I never knew a mixed green salad could taste fresher and more flavorful then what I make at home from garden choices.  Worth a try for a finer dining experience and a tasty treat and drink in downtown Tempe.

AjiowJI7Q0yL52nP_qOeag.text: Server was in attentive.Salmon portion was about 3 oz for $27, basic flavor. Wine list is awesome but server wasn't very well in touch with list or the wines, let us know that a white wine from Bourgogne region of France was aged in all steel, questioned her then looked at the bottle that said aged 15 months in french oak. Asked about a Pride Viognier and she let us know that it was sweet but had a lot of body. We just smiled. The cocktails we had made by Matt were awesome as always. We will go back to sitting in the bar area where, Jamie and Matt do such a great job!
