Lunch, happy hour and dinner are served Monday through Saturday from 11am - 10am, and they are closed on Sunday. Examples of the menu include these current appetizers: ~Artisan Cheese Plate with Seasonal Fruit (see pic) ~House Smoked Salmon with Lemon Crema, Red Onion, Avocado and Capers ~Green Chili Chorizo Oysters with Sweet Corn Buerre Blanc and Tart Honey Glaze ~Seared Diver Scallops with Cauliflower Puree, Sauteed Baby Carrots, and Root Beer Gastrique ~House Made Squid Ink Pasta with Whole Tiger Shrimp, Calamari, Grilled Mexican Sweet Corn and Jalapeno Tomato Fish Fumet ~Smoked Texas Wild Boar with Lime Whole Grain Mustard Barbecue Sauce, Bourbon Glazed Sweet Potatoes, Flour Tortillas and Anaheim Chili Slaw ~Seared Free Range Pork Belly Confit with Black Bean Chilequile, Roasted Jalapeno Emulsion, and Corn Honey ~Harissa Spiced Mussels with Charred Tomato, Chorizo, and Creamy Sweet Cilantro Vinagrette ~Seared Jalapeno Goat Cheese Grits with Mixed Mushroom Confit, Fresh Seasonal Vegetables and Watercress Pistou ~Foie Gras and Anise Cinnamon Sopapilla with Vanilla Mango Broth, Pomegranate and Lime Crema ~Smoked Korean Style Baby Back Ribs with Spicy Red Chili Paste and Barley Pickled Cucumber Salad ~Ahi Tuna Tartare with Balsamic Glazed Asian Pears, Toasted Almonds, Horse Radish and Grilled Baguette The entrees are equally spectacular, most with amazing sauces and all equally creative and delicious. There are also soups, salads, sandwiches, and desserts. Needless to say, they are all equally impressive. Please check their website: houseoftricks.com to see the full menu. HOUSE OF TRICKS: THE WINE Drinks include a bar and extensive wine list. House of Tricks has been named "One of the Top 5 Wine Bars in the Valley" and Wine Spectator "Award of Excellence" for the past 2 years, so you can be confident you will be pleased with any selection. House of Tricks has won Trip Advisor's Certificate of Excellence Hall of Fame, is Arizona Republic food critic Howard Seftel's Top 5 Restaurants in East Valley, have won countless other awards and are featured in numerous publications. CONCLUSION 5/5 RECOMMEND OF NOTE *Over the years, the Tricks have acquired an impressive art collection that is displayed for guests to view throughout the compound. *Parking is metered out front or in the nearby underground parking. *For more information: houseoftricks.com

q88EKmAUZmfsRTHzlNjh0g.text: I can't imagine why this isn't a solid 5-Star... I guess most reviewers are stingy. This is a treasure of a restaurant with an innovative menu. I've never had a dish that was less than 5 Stars. The staff is professional. The dozen or more times I've been here, I've never found anything to complain about and I'm always looking lol

a5k3b2NHSqU85aEkNfQsFg.text: I love this restaurant. Such a peaceful environment, good service, and delicious food! The food is fresh, and there are many healthy options. I usually get the salmon and risotto, it's quite spectacular. There are also plenty of unhealthy options, like the green chili cornbread BLT (omg, so yum). My boyfriend's family and my family both came here (on separate occasions) to celebrate our graduations. I've actually never been for dinner because I'm a broke college student, but the lunch prices are fair! It's my go-to spot for a nice lunch, especially when the weather is good out.

asWQgVCf8vaIFKpa_uT-GA.text: Karen, out waitress, offered excellent advice regarding our drink and food suggestions.  Dinner on the patio provided unparalled ambiance...  Seafood was fresh and well prepared...  We will certainly return with friends...  Looking forward to many more years of spectacular dining experiences...

qJ5Vl9uMgyGrI-8FlhSoYw.text: I recently met several friends for lunch here. I had forgotten how wonderful the food was. Just sitting outside under the shade trees was a great experience. The menu keeps getting better and better. Definately going back soon. It is nice to be able to park right next to your table as well.

CIqiN9eae08FLlXY4eDdyQ.text: One of our favorites... Great service, delicious food  , and nice ambience.. Perfect for date night

9Q_ChHVKAyVjG9ICNUMtVw.text: I've never been disappointed here. Beautiful lush foliage and quaint patio. Delicious food with a great ambiance. I had the ahi tuna today which was very good. Also had the crab croquettes and the goat cheese grits appetizers which were great. The desserts just didn't do it for me. The lavender cheesecake was a little too overbearing with a heavy lavender taste. The blueberry crumble was ok but the ice cream was delicious.  Overall a very good experience

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lavender cheesecake
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Blueberry crumble
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lavender cheesecake

wsyEboBKj9_Zq7N6GMQ3aA.text: Deeee-licious!    Came here for a work dinner and it certainly did not disappoint. Great and friendly service and the food was awesome!  For starters, we shared a few items. The mussels are a MUST have!!  It's to die for- ask for extra bread to sop up the amazing broth. Also had the Korean ribs and tuna tartare. I was a bit apprehensive about having tuna tartare in AZ but it was super yum!  The ribs were perfectly seasoned and was fall off the bone.   I can't believe I had the nerve to order a salad- okay I split it with someone but still... and entree. I had the blueberry and corn with kale salad. Very good!  And had the duck breast as an entree. The duck breast was very good although, not my favorite compared to others.   To top off the night, we had two desserts- bread pudding and strawberry balsamic ice cream with shortbread. The latter was my favorite!    This is definitely a must go to place!

x40jW14mitD6i8-vYebp0Q.text: Phenomenal atmosphere, the outdoor bar was great as well as the service. The Indian spiced grilled salmon was top notch

dczau0bnc0R8yYRUketa8w.text: If you want microwaved food and wait two hours for your  "food" to come out. This is a place for you. Overrated. Not coming back. Wine is good. So disappointed.

z4ffjnwlUEPXdUdZHzxUVw.text: The server was excellent!! Great food and wine!!sad the big building across the street took sun away!! Great place!!

Xnl5BU1N7RhpIIK8RL6tbw.text: I was visiting from TX and made a reservation through yelp, and it worked well! We were seated right away, but it probably took around 15 minutes to be waited on--just to order some waters. Our waitress continued to take an extremely long time to come back with our bread, take our order, bring our food out, refill our drinks, and then bring us the bill. We wound up using whoever we could grab. The food was pretty good (had the meatloaf, pork chop, and the salmon), but the service was terrible. I will not return.  Also, they have koi fish in a fountain that is way too small for them! They were trying to jump out the whole time we sat there. Sad!

VEczENqKBmIHOboCp-6-8w.text: This was a beautiful experience! The patio is so clean and fresh feeling. The portions were perfect and the food was delicious!! I would recommend this place to anyone wanting a fabulous outdoor dinning experience.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

hUZZLgy4tqAYgGHkFBfY7g.text: I can say that Tricks is my favorite restaurant in the valley. Set like a jewel amidst the greenery, the restaurant is in one of the old charming houses that used to line this street when I went to ASU, in the seventies, though the house itself looks from the 1930's. Other than a charming location and atmosphere, the food is wonderful and reasonably priced for a fine dining experience. The servers are professional and personable, and seem like they actually like their jobs--not always the case in restaurants and a surly server can ruin a wonderful meal. I've been to wine tasting events, and celebrated my birthday at Tricks numerous times. It's perfect for special celebrations and a casual happy hour. It is my "go to" place for any occasion.

QJAGRrgKggyTbXee038LwA.text: Omg I'm the 1000th review! This place is awesome. Great patio! Ordered the artisan cheese plate to start with. And the chicken was juicy! Reasonably priced wine too! We will be back soon! Thanks for a lovely time! I didn't catch the servers name, but she was excellent as well

zT8RyA8D4QPqtHsq14ufaA.text: This is an upscale restaurant near the ASU campus. The ambience is wonderful, especially when seated outside. We got a large table on a very pleasant Arizona evening and although we were in a large group we never seemed cramped for spaced.   I ordered the mango chili margarita which I usually don't because I find such drinks too heavy. Contrary to expectations, it was actually very light and flavorful. The chili pepper on the rim was an excellent complement.   For starters I got the fois gras. This was quite disappointing. The sauce accompanying it just did not work well and some of the pieces were too fried and chewy.    For dinner I got the lamb chops. These were excellent --- juicy and well herbed --- simply delicious. The only issue was that I had ordered them medium rare and they were closer to rare so a bit cold, but still delicious.   Overall a great restaurant for a business meal or a night out.

MPtPUS9uDT1w8NIZmOOLcQ.text: Always amazing . The food is espectacular, the attention to detail is what I like the most . If you never been there is a must try .

JhmzswEi-qj5ndYeKBo9iA.text: I just didn't like this place very much.  However the service was good.  It had a smell that I just couldn't get use too.

_PEVFC9JgeN4bQOLzebSYw.text: My boyfriend and I came here for Valentine's weekend. Service was good and our orders were taken in a timely fashion. The ambiance was great and romantic. It felt private and secluded despite being very close to Mill and University. There was even a cute tuxedo colored cat on site, named Shrimp! The two of us ordered off of the Valentine's menu, but everything sounded delicious. The reason why I am giving three stars is because all of our dishes came out lukewarm from appetizers to dessert. The flavors were alright, but didn't live up to their full potential due to the temperature at which the food was served. However, kudos to our server - she was friendly and attentive! Although we maybe could have told her about the temperature of our dishes, we knew how busy they were this weekend and decided not to bring it up...so partly our fault. Overall, it wasn't a bad dinner, but it certainly didn't feel memorable.

dWPYdfluJiiaDimxPrefZw.text: Love this place! Came in for dinner 6ish and got seated right outside. You want to sit outside!  The ambience is incredible and really beautiful and romantic for date night.  Service is very attentive and can discuss anything on the menu: food, cocktails and the wine list! We started with the cheese plate. The different types of cheese and the lightly toasted baguettes were perfect! Salad was next. We both got the specialty salads before our entree. Yum.  I got the risotto and felt it was a bit over cooked and a little salty...but I've eaten here before and will chalk it up to a bad night.   This place has great food,  beautiful surroundings and great service.  You can't go wrong!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Risotto
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salad!

ENGazqX85RxRSnRzzpzvWw.text: Decided to try the House of Tricks for a birthday celebration. I'm so glad we did!! We decided to sit outside, and although the temperature was about 110, it was comfortable and lovely dining outside. You feel like you're on vacation somewhere tropical, although you're in urban Tempe.  But what you really want to know about is the food. We started with the mussels. Probably the best dish I've eaten in a long time. The mussels were tasty, but the sauce is what made it spectacular. I couldn't stop sopping the bread in the chorizo, onion, tomato sauce. It could have been a soup!!  We had the ahi tuna for dinner and who doesn't want something served on a potato pancake! Delicious!  And for dessert (it was a birthday celebration after all) we had the apple bread pudding. What a wonderful combination of flavors.  So here's the bottom line...one of my new favorite restaurants in the area. Their food preparation is spot on for me. The flavors are sophisticated yet comforting. Not upitty at all.  We will be back, thank you for a wonderful evening!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mussels

Lw-UBjiyv5CfELYT4NrXAg.text: Great, somewhat quirky, venue right in the middle of Tempe. It's built in recently but still feels open thanks to all the plants around the perimeter. Doesn't feel like you're in the middle of the city. Food is excellent, and service great. Depending on which room you're in, it can get a bit noisy but the food quality is worth it. Definitely recommended.

NzppXgW33wE1cg1z9xlybg.text: This place never fails to impress me. I've been here 3 times now and have always had the best experience. The atmosphere, service and food are amazing.

nIkwRwSOTWIdPff8Y-2m9w.text: O.M.Yum!    We went for dinner after work one day and it was too hot to sit outside however I am definitely going to come back to enjoy the patio when it cools down.  When I arrived I felt like I had gone back home to the South, there are fountains, greenery, and the fact that the restaurant is in old houses lends to it feeling cozy and comfortable.    The menu was even better.  We ordered the Korean Short Ribs and the Scallops as appetizers and were not disappointed in either.  I liked the scallops so much I would have ordered them again for dinner.  For dinner we ordered the pork and sea bass.  I had the pork and the mustard sauce was amazing! I wanted to take a bottle of the sauce home with me to have later on!    Cannot wait to come back for their "hours of tranquility" aka happy hour.  Love it!

benUMX1gXyh5pkqDBzGtEQ.text: We had a team dinner here and had our own room but had to put a deposit down to guarantee inside seating. The food was great but it did take along time to get our drinks so I only ended up having one. There was a group of about 12 of us and everyone really liked their food and the choices are great!!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

QEEkKGV7AJkvEaOiX0k_Iw.text: Been twice and always had great service, food and Atmosphere. A little on the spends side so good for special occasions or lunch.

N0BesZMjOoAHOAqK65s4Xw.text: Went to celebrate my birthday. It was prom night so that was disappointing. The service was extremely slow. In fact, so slow we should have ordered take out to be delivered to our table from another restaurant! I think we flagged our server down 2-3 times and had to beg for the dessert menu. The food was just okay. It came out cold. We drove from North Scottsdale, so no need to go back. There are plenty of good restaurants nearby.

GTSzRWGnlbDOk8Z7QWMhxg.text: Very tasty food, super cool staff and the ambiance was unique. The highlight for me was the mushroom appetizer. I think it was on polenta or grits.

pz2QjpvG4VNJj7rpFs3ruQ.text: I've been to House of Tricks a few times in the four years I've lived in Tempe - it's always an amazing experience! One of those rare restaurants that really makes an effort to deliver an excellent dining experience, from the ambiance and seating to the incredible service to the original and always-changing plates they serve.   Most recently, my boyfriend and I went for an anniversary. We had the Rabbit Terrine to start off - it was delicious and definitely enough for two people to share (and get full from!). Our waitress recommended some great wines to go with our entrees (Jidori chicken and the fish of the day), and we ended our meal with coffee and cheesecake - I do have to say one thing about the cheesecake: the lavender-infused graham cracker crust was AMAZING!   We'll continue to make House of Tricks our spot for celebrations and special occasions - always a great experience!

Hu3RGIFPLMh-IUC-ZEG19g.text: Went here after realizing Culinary Dropout was way too crazy, and we were all so much happier with this place. Good location, fantastic food and great service made this a very enjoyable experience. The cocktails at the bar were pretty special. Only bad thing is that the outdoor lighting was minimal and it was hard to see my food after it got dark. I recommend checking this place out.

lI0xANIALRACecibAhZ-RA.text: The service was good and their mussels were amazing!!  My friends and I had a nice time and enjoyed the food. It was also less expensive than I expected--always a win. Their outdoor seating is beautiful!

dtxRqxJoIfOD27H9ToBExw.text: My boyfriend and I dined here on Valentine's Day. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was romantic and serene. The mussels were our favorite part of the whole meal. 10/10 recommend the mussels as an appetizer for sharing or even as a meal. The perfect amount of spice and served with bread to dip in the amazing broth (we ordered seconds of the bread).

uvXBMGpbZsGfoX9v2fUZhQ.text: House of Tricks has a beautiful shaded outdoor patio area that would be great on warm days.  We opted for an indoor table when we stopped here for lunch.   The indoor space is not very big but it has a lot of character (restaurant is in an old house).    I had the Hoisin Glazed Salmon Sandwich.  It was a large piece of fish and crunchy slaw on a toasty grilled soft bun - very good.   My husband tried the Pork Banh Mi sandwich which he really enjoyed.     We will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Hoisin Glazed Salmon Sandwich

HCTwvAdnAhmrfgTjSpf-uQ.text: Amazed at how cute this place is!  There is inside seating but the outdoors is ideal.  Greenery surrounded by new builds.  Cozy. The lamb appetizer and mussels were so delicious and had unique flavors. Husband liked it so much that he went back the next day for lunch!!!!

0UBywJsuuw5LNNHLnRuKNA.text: I had not been here in years and took my Son for a nice lunch yesterday.  The grilled cheese special was amazing and the raspberry iced tea is a must!

SWB6UIigRP80ju_gzaGeCQ.text: We found this place based on yelp reviews. And we were not disappointed. I made a reservation for a Friday night but the inside part of the restaurant seemed a little empty. We ordered a salad and a bunch of small plates. Everything we had was delicious. The service was spot on. We even had the dessert special of the evening which was a pumpkin cheesecake tart. So yummy. The only negative thing is the table we sat at was very close to another table which made me feel a little uncomfortable. When in town we would come back . I'm interested in learning the reason for the name of the restaurant.

Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Seared Foie Gras
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Seared Diver Scallops

-DEL7fCW2X5rl5zStmBTmA.text: Celebrated mother in laws birthday and everything was fabulous, from the friendly staff to the drinks and entrees.  We Sat on the patio in October and loved the atmosphere.

2JpLHwd2GTGmBel70bYDMA.text: Best romantic date spot. We come here every year for our anniversary. Great food and nice wine selection. The patio can't be beat.

cOQnRSA5wc0-hR5UJZZ3AA.text: This is one of my favorite date night or lunch spots. Beautiful garden and friendly staff, and I have never had a bad meal there. Please bring back the adult PB and J!!

Cp4wE7TuqWHeljy8bq1b6A.text: Valentine's night. Service was good.  Food Was Mediocre. Sorry. Wife's fish was a little over cooked. My sirloin just not that great. The sauces w the beef weren't very complimenting. Three stars at best.

sfIjSNvm0hMmHBwvxKREmQ.text: 8/6/13    The setting is very nice, and the menu sounds wonderful.  I had:  The Bison tartar for an appetizer and  Halibut with roasted carrot, roasted orzo and wilted chard  The last time I had steak tartar it was at Maison Robert-  it was traditional with eggs and caper and was out of this world.  I realized this appetizer was going to be completely different, and it was.  The bison was sort of dry and the main flavor was salt.  Honestly, the whole grain mostado with pickled onions on the toast was better than the tartar, and it was about a teaspoon in size.  For a $50 meal with tax I don't mind small portions, but I expect to be dazzled with flavor.  Likewise the halibut was lacking in flavor.  It was cooked well, and tasted fresh, but I enjoyed the orzo and chard more.  I think I noticed a hint of fennel in the orzo, which I will try at home, so at least I learned an alternative preparation.  The service was about what you can expect these days as the waitstaff talked to one another (it was later in the evening about 40 minutes before they closed when I checked out), and they were attentive.    In the days when 20-25% tips are expected, and the majority of reviews rave about the food, I want to be objective.  I'm rating House of Tricks based on their prices reflect fine dining.  Maybe I ordered poorly, but I chose items that I typically wouldn't cook myself and sounded different than I could get elsewhere. The food was by no means awful it just lacked pizazz.

O1c4XErP8pL4mOxioVgHTg.text: I love the atmosphere at House of Tricks. If you didn't already know where the location was, you would not be able to find it just driving down the street! The big trees make for a hidden, romantic patio, and almost makes you feel like you are not in Arizona anymore!! I ordered a White Spanish wine, it was very good. Although it did not go with the Filet I ordered! I believe I ordered it Medium Rare and it was more along the lines of Rare, but I refused to bring it back! It melted in my mouth! The fish was perfect though! I love how the menu is always different!!! I recommend House of Tricks for a Romantic Dinner, anniversary Dinner, or birthday!

0tmiyOcGixPOWasa4FacHg.text: Awesome place for lunch.. Atmosphere fantastic... Customer service outstanding... Must go... Outside bar and patio beautiful... Food is great.... Specials daily; Smoked salmon app; cheese tray; sharma salad; Cesar salad with grilled salmon; tuna melt; French dip; chipotle pasta grilled chicken; meat loaf!!!! Just to name a few FAVS!! So much more tasty selections!!!

On_D4X-MhrLjGPuMy-z-WA.text: For the longest time, I wondered what trick this place must have been using to be so successful in such an odd location.  When I was a student at ASU I walked past House of Tricks on my way from Campus to Mill Ave countless times, and I always thought it was out of place.  While even as a student I could appreciate the beauty of a house converted into a restaurant with an amazing garden patio as its setting, it just seemed odd that a such a fancy restaurant was hidden on small street, just feet from a college campus, surrounded by parking meters and pay lots.  Now that I have eaten at House of Ticks, I understand its charm.  A while back, my girlfriend mentioned that she had a great happy hour at at this place  with friends some years ago.  She couldn't remember the name, but based on her description I instantly knew she was talking about House of Tricks.  So, when we went to see "Wicked" at Gammage (great show, by the way) for her birthday, I decided it would be the perfect place to dine before seeing the show.  Turns out that's what a lot of people do.  The server even asked if we were heading to the show, so he knew to get us out with time to spear.  We also happened to overhear another server mentioned that about 90% of their customers on a given night were heading over to Gammage.  The food is quite pricy, but very tasty.  I had the Ancho Chili Seared Ahi.  The orange-chipotle honey aioli had a good kick.  The white bean chili had a unique taste.  The tuna it self was perfectly seared, but no too flavorful.  My girlfriend had a salmon dish which was amazing.  The salmon was very flavorful and cooked perfectly.  For dessert (we were celebrating a birthday, after all) we tried a brioche bread pudding.  One word: Wonderful.  If you are looking for a pleasurable meal with a pleasurable ambiance, House of Tricks will do the trick.  I highly recommend it before a show at Gammage or if you are just looking a romantic night out.

dCYDIZHI-GXvpFQLlemxtw.text: This is one of my all time favorite restaurants in the area. I love sitting at the outdoor bar and enjoying the view from what feels like a secret garden. I have so many favorites here, I don't know where to start. First of all, sit at the bar and get amazing service and the best mojitos that I've ever had from Renee. Try the kale Caesar, mussels with chorizo, Asian pork sandwich, any of the soups or the most decent pb&j of your life! This is a one of a kind place for food and ambiance.

QhObOg1Ao2oAFzZt2cy5jQ.text: Went for Mother's day, $48 per plate. Extremely limited vegetarian options. The waiter was either baked out of his skull or just didn't care at all. I understand holidays can be stressful on people working in restaurants but if you don't like it; get a more serious job.  The patio was beautiful, the area sucks (ASU area of Tempe, I mean c'mon seriously). The main thing this restaurant has going for it is it's ambience, I would pass on the food and the service.

tRC0XSdbak-pxZ67om5MaA.text: All I can say is Frittata heaven! Darling inside. Great place for a lunch date. Good service and great salads too.

4NU7nJyP9NQGDpG9qOUA_g.text: We decided to check out House of Tricks for my husbands birthday. We had dinner with two other couples. The atmosphere was perfect! We sat outside and throughly enjoyed it. Our group shared several appetizers and all of them were outstanding. I had the salmon for dinner and couldn't have been more happy. Every single person in our group was very happy with their dinner. Dessert was spectacular and our service was very good. So glad we celebrated at House of Tricks. We will for sure be back!

Q54aWkZYHdIElt8PcJ6pRA.text: The setting is quite enjoyable and oozes romance but the food is unremarkable, in my opinion.

M50zfaJ3GhJHdd5F94qWfQ.text: This was my first visit to the Tempe institution and overall it was superb.  Great wine list, amazing food with fresh ingredients in mouthwatering combinations and a beautiful shaded patio are the highlights.  Inside seemed a little cramped and poorly vented so try to eat outside if you can.    The wait staff is attentive and very well educated re menu and wine and restaurant.  Sl slow bar service was only mild negative we had.  Busy Saturday night kinda expected.

xEqQw59_Xx4VAu0qVSnBrA.text: I just had happy hour here with Ada G. and our friend P before Jesus Christ Superstar and happy hour is great!  The bruschetta is the best thing on the menu!  Rustic bread toasted and covered in goat cheese and heirloom tomatoes.  Yummy!  We also ordered onion dip and homemade potato chips and an artichoke dip-both were also good.  I think there might have even been a fourth dish.  I think wine was $2 off a glass for happy hour.  I was here for dinner a few years ago and unlike Ada G, everything was perfect.  I had the loup de mer that night.  I don't remember what my husband or his coworker had but everything was perfect.  I do remember that for the appetizer we had ahi three way and that was really good too.    The best part about House of Tricks is their beautiful outdoor dining.  There aren't many places around with such a nice garden area.  It's a nice treat to be able to eat outside under the trees with the little white lights overhead.

u67S5FbJrrJQVyF8JyveXA.text: Another very good place to eat in Tempe if you are looking for fine dinning. Great food, good wine, and a romantic atmosphere. I love sitting outdoors on a warm spring or fall evening!

RQcAUmh-Jj4zAd-pF7mmSg.text: One word - yummy! It has been years since I have been to House of Tricks. A girlfriend and I had an impromptu happy hour date and met in Tempe without knowing where we would end up. Postino is always a great option but I live in Arcadia and wanted something different. House of Tricks it was! Great patio, great wine list, great service, and great snacks! We had the happy hour bruschetta and artichoke dip. Perfect snack with a glass of wine girl time! I will be back sooner than later.

i14UzybF6IbuUAHBF2JWFg.text: There's no point in me writing anything.  This place is ALWAYS on point, food is excellent, service is professional. Don't even think about another restaurant in Tempe.  Drive here from 50 miles if you have to.  You're wasting your time reading - just go here.

bNA4ttFsj_HTif0gXCnJPA.text: Came to celebrate a special occasion with our family. The Bourbon with Vanilla Beans and Figs was incredible and highly recommended. I had two of those along with the lamb. The food is very expensive as are the drinks but the service is excellent. For a high end expensive restaurant, I give it 4 stars. Not quite 5 stars comparing it to other high end restaurants. I'd definitely come back again.

hjRc3IUFIhk0WMNvtXUn7Q.text: This is one of my favorite restaurants. The outside patio is lovely with big trees overhanging the area. Servers are all very professional and pleasant. The menu changes so each time we go there are new choices. Most recently, I had the fish special which was grouper. It was delicious with a light, stone ground mustard sauce and colorful heirloom spinach. My husband's pork dish was also very good. All in all it was a great restaurant experience.

Lk_Lq8co7HW5Tj8HQUJ3tA.text: Great food, atmosphere and staff.  Scallops appetizer was really good.  I had the salmon with brussels sprouts.   Delicious

DxpMeyAA8ka03H5G8iH2Ug.text: The food options on the restaurant week menu were great.  We Always have an amazing meal, receive great service and enjoy sitting outside on the patio.

CI0R4dDLY9mJRV5bj75tZw.text: The food was pure excellence. I had the oysters as an appetizer, and a salmon entree. Those were the best oysters I have ever eaten.

1kmHYa7VrX5ZURw9n7iPtw.text: My husband and I came in for phoenix restaurant week and it was delicious. The ambience, quality of the food, and service justify the prices and we were very happy.  My husband enjoyed the cocktails and they brought me a really ginger beer which I appreciated (I'm pregnant no cocktails for me).  I really enjoyed eating here and we will be back!!

E6EO8z_RY3cFElrcTRxKtg.text: Horrible service. Waiter passed by our table and would serve others but never came to check on us after he got our order. We waved him down for check, once my food was cold and I was trying to get something different because it was the driest chicken sandwich I had ever had, no cheese on it despite cheese being on the description. Meatloaf wasn't so good. Only thing I could eat was the fries and the server did nothing about it but ask if I wanted to take the dry sandwich home because they are usually dry according to him.   Would not recommend this place.  Maybe trying something different could change my mind but for now, for a slow afternoon, it was poor service.

SwI97Hqd2zPzYw5-QfYZUg.text: Great place!  May have some 'splaining to do on my expense report.  The name could depict a different kind of place.  Service was superior from the host stand and to the service.  We chose to sit on the patio right by the misters.  The trees and misters made the temperature nearly perfect.  Our table started with tenderloin spring rolls and 3/4 people got the short-ribs with grits.  So glad I did.  The depth of flavor in the sauce and meat was perfect.

YpyBHKarL986Rr6Gmu-o6g.text: Our server was great The food tasted great  Now for the harsh part: I got the worst food poisoning of my entire life. Had the beef short rib, and had staphylococcal food poisoning. This was the only meat I had in days, and as someone who studies biology, I know the only way this can happen is when food is not stored at the proper temperature.  After spending the entire night vomiting everything in my system, the ambiance and service were moot points.   They had mentioned at the start of our meal (which was in January of this year) that they had a party of 300 people and "stretched very thin" Seems as if quality of food storage flew out of the window.  Will not be returning even if they laid out a red carpet, showed me the back room meat thermometers, and comped everything.

wW9jZYPro1cXqI9fxD82GA.text: My family and I came here to celebrate my wedding. For as many years as I've lived in Tempe, I can't believe I've never been to House of Tricks. We started off with the mediterranean tapas. The hummus was delicious and the pita bread was so soft. My grandfather and I each ordered the turkey club. The pasta salad was so flavorful! My brother and mother in law ordered the pastrami sandwiches and they loved them. My mom ordered the french dip sandwich. And my husband got a noodle dish which was flavored amazingly well. He is gluten-free so he was excited to have something more than just a salad. It was a delicious meal and I can't wait to return!

ZnNP2yw7HfeC35ll1zCNuw.text: Brilliant service and stellar food. We had our wedding dinner here and everything was super-- thanks, Janis!

OQxTPY3-k2UrEq2S1J55BA.text: I dont know what the fuss is all about.. I thought the place  needed to be cleaned (the Windows were gross) Spend some money on the floors , they were all chipping off ,half Red half brown.. I thought the food was over priced .. Not for me!

Cc2_P-BVf36UBePrew3NQA.text: Nice place with outdoor seating Area. The wine list is good and wine by glass is really affordable for the wine quality. I tried smoked salmon that was too dry for me. My entree was the ahi tuna with sticky rice. Tuna was nicely seared but the sauce was bland and the rice not cooked properly.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Ahi tuna

G-2H2VRpg-aYmMKSHaX7ow.text: Dinner was absolutely EXCELLENT. Our server Jaymie recommended the soup and fish of the day. Both were excellent choices.  My husband ordered a salad as well. I can't remember the name of the fish but it was a flakey white fish on crispy potatoes.  We paired it with a local red wine. The service was excellent as well. Our server explained to us the order of tasting and pouring wine after my husband asked how do you determine who tastes and who gets the 1st glass poured. Didn't expect to learn something at dinner! We will definitely return!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

q0LiiM_-qOb_-HcMNZ25dw.text: Went here on a recommendation but we were disappointed, particularly in the service.  We were seated and then waited a very long time to even get drinks ordered.  Since we just got off a plane, we were starved and had to ask 4 times for a plate of bread, which they promptly charged for. Not a big deal but considering the entrees were wildly overpriced, you would think you would get some bread for free. Our server was completely awol most of the night. Our appetizer came out in a decent amount of time but then the entree's were crazy late.   A couple next to us who ordered the same things, arrived one half hour after us, yet were served 40 minutes before us.  They put us at a table that in a location that should not even have a table.  Right in front of the kitchen where they bring the food out with a wet floor, restrooms right there, and pots and pans banging, drops, etc.  Then they had another door to the front that was opened and closed probably a thousand times that creaked annoyingly all nite.  A couple squirts of wd40 would have fixed easily this irritation.  Chicken was dry but the other 2 entrees were ok, but by this time we were pretty much done with this place.  Finally, another waiter who could tell we were distressed tried to help us out by offering to fill our drinks, offer desserts, etc.  We just told him we wanted the bill.  He then went to our original waiter, who was processing  the bill and talked to him.  We thought there would be some sort of discount after all this, but NO!!  Full price!  Way overpriced, $30 for half a chicken and $30 for meat loaf.  Sorry, but no amount of magic will make us return to House of Tricks.

LIryqgVWeVmOaHCdp2MytA.text: I was in town from Seattle for ASU Homecoming. My girlfriend and I started with a really tasty salad with dates and goat cheese. I had the ahi tuna which was prepared perfectly, that had like a tasty potato pancake underneath. The slaw on top was good but very spicy, seemed to have wasabi in it. My girlfriend got the steak which she enjoyed as well. The creme brulee was also a great way to end the meal.  While the food was very good, it was the exceptional service and setting that made this meal so memorable. Our waiter was one of the best I have ever had- happy to explain some menu options to us, attentive but not overbearing, and was happy to take multiple pictures of us after the meal.   The setting (request outdoor) is incredible and romantic. I was very glad to choose this place as the special dinner of the weekend on my vacation.

mGixbSxoGfezJP49tVp7xw.text: What a treat! When visiting Tempe in recent years, I always seem to  bemoan the loss of its charm in the midst of its over-the-top success. Then I go to  House of Tricks. Yesterday's lunch was no exception to the great food, service, and ambience I've experienced at Trick's over the years.  The fresh smoked salmon Caesar salad recommended by our lovely server  was mouthwatering, to say the least. My dining partner and I shared an espresso gelato for dessert which was the perfect finish. This culinary experience is enough to entice me back to downtown Tempe again and again.

tIVOYudquYNo_i9182n2sg.text: I've been to Tricks many times and it the food is ALWAYS fantastic.  Lunch service yesterday was not perfect, but the food was amazing.  Cornbread BLT was better than expected, and the Bahn Mi is a powerhouse.  The outside garden setting is stellar.  Tricks is definitely the nicest restaurant in Tempe.

gzeUYVadkVSNIMEBb9-srQ.text: We tried House of Tricks before going to a concert at the Desert Botanical Garden. Outdoor seating was lovely and lush. I had their version of a Manhattan from the specialty drinks list - strong and flavorful. My companion and I took a chance and ordered the pork chop and the salmon - two dishes which can be ruined if cooked a moment too long. Both came out perfectly.

wTU5bAd3t8CligJ7NMYuwQ.text: I really wanted to love this place! We spent the weekend in Tempe sans kids and decided to check it out for our anniversary dinner. I made reservations and we got there early and they were able to seat us outside where it was quite lovely! Our server was very attentive (at first) and helped us finally decide on the Scottish salmon and seared ahi plates. Unfortunately, after we placed our order we didn't see her again until our plates were empty!   I've had many types of salmon, but I believe this was the first time I tried Scottish salmon -- which from what I had must mean slightly dry and salty salmon cooked well. The ahi plate was descent, not as good as Kona grill... We both could've used double the amount of sides but that's how it goes sometimes.   Again, great atmosphere and ambiance, the food was just so-so.

vV19pqJBePOsGrywonoOeQ.text: If you're looking for a date night to impress, this place delivers. The indoor seating can get loud, but it's worth it in the Summer. The outdoor dining is my preference when the weather cooperates. Excellent craft cocktail menu, and you'll regret not saving room for the lavender crusted cheesecake

EM2eClkOH2BCVcoJcdsmXw.text: The ambiance is incredible. Totally takes me out of the Phoenix hustle & bustle & reminds me of a tucked-in, lush setting in southern California. There's a great spot in the guest house for large parties, although I definitely recommend sitting outside if possible. They don't typically have very many vegetarian options, but the menu changes & the fancy PB&J is a phenomenal upgrade of the classic childhood go-to.  They also offer some fun beer/wine paring events in collaboration with other local spots like FourPeaks.

20nc_1swC6uVuBSTSYNvuA.text: Love this place; however to me it seems like the service is slipping. We've been there a couple of times lately and the wait staff takes forever to greet you, drink orders take too long to arrive and overall just lackluster performance on all service. Nice place, but staff needs to step it up being attentive to their guests.

CtHpJ7qysw573TV1JIjdTA.text: The place was really nice, service was good, but the food was really bad, and also it took almost 3 hours to get to our main course....AND IT TASTES BAD!

PhwpQ7bl4FX12VRyp08WwA.text: Great spot for dinner with some ladies from work. Very quaint house setting with lots of character. Food was creative and delicious, very impressive. This would be a special night out with the hubby in the future for me, as it is a little pricey, but would stop by the outdoor bar anytime for a drink and snack.

wQsiGegr5gAJKxS88Ot5Hw.text: I had the salmon with a citrus lemon sauce. It was amazing. I was also there with a large party and they were very accommodating and we never had to wait too long for our drinks, food, or the bill.

92cV5x--PXKK0DupYPwLrg.text: I wish I had done my homework better, because most of the seating at this restaurant is outdoors. We made reservations, so it was not last minute seating. It was in the 50s and pouring down rain, so the patio seating was not as pleasant because of this. Mea culpa! The staff was very attentive and made sure all the heaters were turned on. The food was excellent...grouper was tasty in a wonderful sauce, salmon glaze amazing, bison meatloaf excellent.

ghSg47PZoq04zTa7GQO4CA.text: Fun selection of food and good drinks.   The outdoor setting of the restaurant was pleasant in the Arizona summer and was not too hot.   Food was great and the customer service was pleasant and perfect evening.

UbDhgYSxm8zuaIT8VSl6oQ.text: Started with the muscles, cheese board and Volcano shank for main entree. Everything was Devine. Sat outside on a cool evening in Tempe, but the fire pit kept us nice and toasty. Food and overall experience were excellent.

CBLnfAGI2JyMqPe_mqup0g.text: This year for our wedding anniversary, with some reluctance, I let my husband choose where we would go out to eat. He's usually one to choose price and convenience over atmostphere and quality, so I was a bit nervous. I literally had no idea where we were going up until the moment we pulled up to the restaurant. Upon first glance, I was pleasantly surprised. It looked cozy, romantic, inviting and trendy. We sat outside on the patio so we could enjoy the nice weather and people watch. I ordered the Tandori Salmon and my husband ordered the Pork Volcano Shank. He would not stop raving about his meal. Mine was delicious as well, but if I ever return, I want to try the gnocci. Prices were a little high, bill came to just around $100 (2 glasses of wine, a cheese plate appetizer, and 2 entrees). However, still affordable and a great place to celebrate a special occasion. Service was excellent as well. At the end of the meal, our waitress surprised us with 2 glasses of champaign to celebrate our anniversary. It was a great way to end the night.

if12mUlIuOGyzV8EkLXwCQ.text: h.o.t. meatloaf.... yum! All the food looks amazing and I cannot to try more! New favorite restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

q-4Okfgl-fDIfeiwRd9PrQ.text: What a fantastic dining experience!  I was fortunate enough to be in Tempe while the temperature was low-80s and perfect.    Even more fortunate was the outdoor seating at the bar that I took advantage of.  Looking for an appetizer, get the tuna!  Looking for a cocktail, get the Three Piece Suit!  I think 4 is a good rating, but would do 4.5 if that was an option.  The bartender flopped on making me an old fashioned, but was apologetic and took it off my tab right away.  Problem solved.  Quite honestly, I make OFs at home all the time and probably shouldn't order them out anyway.    I would go back again and recommend this place to anyone!

NvBCQLXR2lhP-0bJhuNPQQ.text: Came here on Valentine's Day! Was busy but still a perfect setting! Food was amazing! Staff friendly!

vg-wU7Bg0xYKj0Fw1iX_OQ.text: This was a fantastic experience! Highly recommend House of Tricks for a special occasion...our server was attentive, friendly and informative and the food was excellent

4yyv5gtLLtT47YtlgILswA.text: Atmosphere was that of dreams. (On a nice AZ evening.) Garden tables with tea party feel. Menu was interesting, everything was absolutely delicious. Get the mussels! The upside down mushroom focaccia appetizer - still dreaming about it.   Love, love, loved it. I will definitely recommend to friends in Phoenix, if they don't know about this gem already!

cIiBt9whOZZ0yuFpqIhejQ.text: Really nice environment and delicious food. Our server was very helpful in suggesting wines, drinks, and food.

UNXKhx6HLt_gJv5DNNqrgQ.text: Just went there recently to enjoy the delicious food. Just tried the mussels as an appetizer. This dish was different as it was in a red sauce with chorizo. It was hearty and different. The main meal was grouper. Our group loved their dishes. The waiter was knowledgeable and very helpful in explaining the new menu. Since it was cold ; we ate inside; lovely as always.

IYBrBYyhBTyGyIe_28866g.text: Not a fan. I was in town for a conference and they recommended this place.   All the dining is outdoors. The bathroom are through the kitchen insides and the sink is outside the bathroom.   The waitstaff was attentive. The food was good. The prices were high and the menu was not for picky eaters. There was nothing on the menu for me to eat but a salad. The good thing is that i was not hungry but I was underwhelmed by the salad.   At soon as dusk hit the bugs were i full force and starting eating on me. I walked out with a dozen bites on my legs.

nzFfqg6ZkBVOjgpiLDcxWg.text: After reading several reviews, we decided to visit this place for our Anniversary dinner. First thought, its a beautiful house converted into a restaurant. The outdoor seating is beautiful, we were shown a center seating, we weren't happy so moved inside. Outdoor is definitely not recommended during summer or if you want to have a nice time. The ambiance is lovely and one star goes for it.   They have very interesting cocktail selections and a whole list of wine. We decided to go with Kiwi Sangria and a jim beam based cocktail. It was delicious, perfect drink and price was spot on. We ordered smoked salmon and vegetarian jalapeno peas mushroom starter. Salmon was cooked to perfection and the smoked flavor was amazingly good. The vegetarian dish had a very good flavor, mushroom was spongy and juicy like the way we like. Highlight of the evening was the Lamb rack. Phew!! Thats one hell of a dish. We prefer well done and it was the best lamb we have had in a long time. We have tried at The Ivy in chandler, Red at Santa Monica Pier but this one beat them all. The meat was juicy had absorbed the salt, the crunch flavor on top of the ribs impressed me.   We love this place, I removed one star for not having any option in the poultry section. There was no chicken or turkey. That was a little disappointing. Apart from that everything was good. Yes, price is definitely on the higher side, but they are running a offer all this August 20% off your bill. That just made our evening.   Would highly recommend it and will definitely go back again.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lamb Loin - Mouth watering.

tpjEnU6ynFvrf_Zv5gjyCA.text: Amazing pork dish! You definitely do not want to miss this place if you are in Tempe.

78G9x7IL-W7FjgI3I9XcVA.text: A culinary experience! This is an excellent restaurant for a date or intimate dinner. The atmosphere allows for conversation and you can see your food (somehow I find this rare in fine dining lately).   Our table started with the Cheese plate appetizer which had a delicious assortment. Perfect for 3-4 people! We ordered the Ono, Rack of Lamb, and Bison Meatloaf. The Bison was a new experience for me and it was incredibly flavorful and well balanced. Would definitely order it again!   I can't wait to be back. After this experience, I'll trust any dish on the menu. Thank you!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. My husband ordered the Bison meatloaf and it was ridiculously flavorful. Despite being lean, the Bison was juicy and flavorful. 10/10
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Three entrees from our dinner: Ono in the back, Bison meatloaf to the right (my favorite!), and rack of lamb in front!

KlurELNo8wpyOTvPrUA9Qw.text: Paradise in Tempe!  We enjoyed our dinner in the main dining room and came outside to have our dessert in the garden patio. The mist coming from the overhead trees kept us cool as can be. And it was 102 outside. We did not feel the heat until we actually left the property.  I can not wait to go back and experience this tranquil dining pleasure in paradise again.

XVAzB9NpnSUX6snnFCzsPw.text: What a delightful spot nestled in and around an older home in the heart of downtown Tempe.  Very fun outside bar and assorted patio tables in addition to traditional seating in a variety of inside rooms.  Almost always get their mussels and call it a meal.  Will return again and again and.......

5JIgsS-TvI1emM-uaQ-i9g.text: Went here with my wife on date night! It was a excellent place to eat. It was quite and the staff was great. I could not ask for a better experience. We will be going back!!

dZ0YEFHzjlur0Wzr_UyQtg.text: This place never disappoints.  I frequently go here before heading down to Gammage for a show.  I always let the server know that that's our plan and I have never been late.  The food is always excellent and the staff is always pleasant.

iEyfEvSZbp-Ce1kLOPwTXw.text: Fabulous meal. Michael our waiter was great. Very personable, upbeat and friendly took care of us perfectly and always seemed to be there at exactly the right moment. This is a must stop if your in the area. Everything on the menu is worth a try.

bauiuVb-2TA2S8XV3oM7Ow.text: I have been here about four times and only for lunch. All four times I have sat on the patio, had no important deadlines to be after, and had outstanding food and service. I had no problems with parking but the times we went could be considered odd or off hours. Other reviewers have documented that they had parking issues. We just parked right across the street. If we were not suppose to park there, "could have fooled me." I never saw a sign that said, "ASU Parking Only, Subject To Towing." One time we just walked in from Mill. I guess we got lucky.    The outside patio is so, so quaint, and the food is delish! The prices are not cheap and I heard even more for dinner, and the service is slower. It reminds me of a "Ladies Who Lunch" or,  "Do Tea" place. I actually like the slower service pace. I go there only when that is okay for me. It can be very busy here since it is a smaller restaurant so be prepared.     The last time I went I had a fruit tea, they throw in real fruit, love it! I ordered the Grilled Chicken Sandwich with Capricho de Cabra Goat Cheese, Fig Jam, Bacon and Arugulaon Toasted Ciabatta. Served with Fresh Fruit &Greens with Rosemary -Balsamic Vinaigrette. The sandwich was good and the salad that came with it was wonderful, as well. My lunch friend said the food was spectacular! I think she got the Ahi Tuna or maybe the Salmon.

ZP9Dxq3YRFDY14dNy8R6tQ.text: OVER-RATED, OVER-PRICED, OVER-IT!  Best part about this restaurant are the friendly stray cats that hang out around the patio begging for scraps of food.    The food was decent but not worth the price.  Any foody could come up with the dishes and anyone overly impressed obviously isn't adventurous enough with their foods.  It's pretty but so is my backyard.  All in all, meh.

7RKV3d0i7LzYn-U1AG4ZQg.text: Bad Service: Had to ask the hostess three times for a high chair for my baby  Bad Service: I asked do you guys do anything for birthdays, got different answers: hostess says we can do a birthday cake, then waitress said no complimentary slice of cake, but we can put candles in it and then in the end they didn't even do that! shame as we went there specifically to celebrate a birthday and they dropped the ball... it's the little things.  Good: Food was very good.

z-oZN3A5-PqQW9b9dg9pYw.text: I went for dinner last night and it was my first time. The employees were nice and helpful. It is just the cutest little place and the cats were adorable wandering the grounds.   Delicious food, very unique in flavors. The dessert drinks were enjoyable as well!

kJ4fkwJ1J-fLadcgxPljPA.text: It's been a while since we were at House of Tricks and we feel they've lost a step. They were out of the beer we wanted. They were out of the Turtle Brownie dessert we wanted and the entrees were just average. The presentation was very nice but things were lacking in taste.

uYsuug4ldzrB9--BJ02Hrg.text: Haven't I reviewed this place before?!  I LOVE HOT!  Reason I came on this day is because a friend from Napa, CA was in town for shows and I brought her here last time she was in town and it was her request that we come again.  Like I said, I LOVE this place and you'll have a hard time getting me to decline.  However, on this particular visit I have to say my meal was just okay.  Generally it's fantastic but what I ordered just wasn't up to par.  I had the chicken and dumplings as my entree.  Again, everything else was very nice.  It was a very cold evening but we kept shuffling closer to the heat lamps and sharing our jackets, doing whatever was necessary to keep warm. So the meal I wasn't so satisfied with -the chicken was dry.  I prefer dark meat because it's moist, white meat is always risky because it gets dry and I can't choke that stuff down so easily unless you make it into a chicken salad.  Dry white meat = not great.  The dumplings were DEVINE and I want the recipe.  Mmm mmm MMMM!  Our server, Greg, was wonderful and was on top of the recommendations and descriptions. Suprisingly it was very busy on that chilly eve and that kept him busy too.  My guests from Napa, Oakland, and Paso Robles enjoyed their meal and the experience.  Hopefully they'll have an opportunity to come again when it's a bit warmer and we have more daylight hours to enjoy the views that surround.

UO9_y_P5jU0HPtyxy-PYZg.text: We arrived and the hostess allowed us to go to the bar for a drink before sitting down for dinner. The bartender was very nice but extremely busy and the service was slow, she was the only bartender for the bar and the entire restaurant. After a drink we were taken to our table and given our menus. We order the mussels to start and then the yellowtail for our main dish. The mussels took a long time to come and then the sauce they were in was only slightly warm. We notice also the price of the mussels had increased to $16. We asked for more bread to go with the mussels and they stated they charged for more bread but we agreed to the fee (most restaurants that I have been to never charge for extra bread). The extra bread came out about 10 minutes later when we were pretty much done eating the mussels. The yellowtail came out about 5-10 minutes later and was extremely good. I have gone to this restaurant for close to 30 years and this just seemed like a lackluster performance.

eAz1vFLrKLaDZ6LonrDGmA.text: Quaint Tempe spot- great outdoor dining patio and bar area. Food was perfect - try the mussels!! Espressotini is perfection in a glass

jaoDfZJnDYFMC9-xG6GKtg.text: Let me start by saying that I love YELP. I have found some of the best Restaurants and things to do all over the country by using this web site.... With that said I have found that restaurants that have a lot of reviews and still managing to get 4 and 5 stars despite a few negative ones says a lot.   I have lived in the Phoenix metro for 15 years now and have been frequenting this AMAZING restaurant the entire time. The atmosphere is as good as you will find in the Valley, and the food on both the lunch and dinner menu's is delicious. One of my favorite aspects of the restaurant is that at least twice yearly the menu completely changes. I really find this important because the menu is smaller and while I always find something interesting and delicious, because of the change, I'm never bored.   There have been times that I have stopped in for a drink and an appetizer wearing jeans and was seated next to a small group dining in tuxedo's, and there have been times that I was the one in the suit. Never once did I feel uncomfortable or out of place and NEVER have I regretted spending my hard earned money here.  Not to lie... I did have one bad meal... but I have been here at least 45 times over the years so dont be distracted by a negative review or two. You wont be dissapointed.  OHHH AND IF THEY EVER HAVE KEY LIME PIE ON THE MENU.... PLEASE DON'T GET IT, I'D HATE FOR THEM TO BE OUT WHEN I NEED A SLICE.

TDymklNtZ5nIce-Tqhv2cQ.text: Food and atmosphere were great. Sarah our sever was very helpful and patient with suggestions and tips on the menu. Only annoyance was waiting an additional 30-35 after our reservation time to be seated but it was a very busy night and I understand these things can happen. It's a nice restaurant so I expected a $130 bill for 2 with 2 drinks each and an appetizer. We will be back for happy hour and another special occasion I'm sure. Added bonus, black and white cat named Mickey likes to roam around the patio and is very friendly.

tRRMLIpsobnyPsCeb39K4A.text: Took the girl out for a date night last October.  It's not a cheap date, but it was a very nice atmosphere for a date.  The nights were still reasonably warm, so sitting on the patio was lovely.  The salmon appetizer is to die for.  Yes, I'm using that phrase, to die for.  The seared ahi tuna was like butter . . . amazing.  I went back again in February for happy hour, sat at the outdoor bar.  Bartender was impeccable, drinks were great, service fantastic.

aGHJvZOBsseRY0Jgt7L-Vg.text: We are periodic guests here, and never have been disappointed. The food is consistently very good to excellent. Service is pleasant, knowledgable, and efficient. The wine list has many reasonably priced great options from around the world. And this is one of the best patios in the valley. Certainly, this is the place to eat if you are in the Tempe area.

HFcWJIP2UWrqFLHdgFR46A.text: Great food and atmosphere. The mussels our cooked in an excellent sauce you may want to take home.  That was our waiter's idea and now we are having it with pasta tonight! They were busy but took care of us well. The bread pudding dessert is also amazing!

DnTKO_oXFKjx9-nc3Ra9Vw.text: Very cute place! Went for dinner with a friend of mine. Our meal started out with a couple of appetizers. We shared the scallops and the mussels. Both were very good. I ordered the salmon and she ordered the duck. Although both were very good, I honestly preferred the duck. The service was good although there were a few times when I thought that our waiter had forgotten us. For dessert we shared the espresso creme brulee and it was okay although I think I prefer just regular creme brulee.

b42XL2W_IUN43u-x_G8QiA.text: Been twice in two days; once for lunch, once for dinner. Good food and service both times. And, enjoyed the outdoor seating both times. I will definitely dine here again on another visit to Tempe.

Zpd1epX_UrjCQHZLJgdJBg.text: I love house of tricks. The atmosphere is beautiful. Perfect for a day when the weather is nice. The service was great. Our server Chris was very attentive and friendly. I had the black peppercorn salmon and it was phenomenal. Not outrageously overpriced either. House of Tricks is a must in Tempe. Perfect if you are going to gammage to see a show.

alDxoP3oKnRGviZEX4zZaA.text: House of Tricks has been a fixture at Arizona State for a while now.  Lots of open air dining, great food and drink.  The concept works well when the weather is nice...not so well when things get warm but H.O.T. has been around for 20+ years so I think they have figured things out.  This is one of the few decent restaurants that is within walking distance to the Sun Devil Stadium and Wells Fargo arena.  I hope the remodel of Sun Devil Stadium doesn't end up killing all the businesses around ASU while the Devils play their 2014 reg season in Glendale (yuck, #notgoingtothewestsieeeed).

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

37XjgqW7BgYU-GNnxMOSXg.text: After reading the high rating in the online information it seemed like a place to try - I had high expectations but a bad feeling when I walked in.  I am very intuitive about restaurants and hoped for the best.  The bread was old and the butter strange.  Not a good start  The setting is an old residence and garden and that is nice.  The menu is eclectic and has a variety of choices for dinner, heavy on the meat side.  Each of the four people at my table ordered something difference, Osso Buco, the vegetarian bean dish, steak and chicken.   No one enjoyed their meal - there was no flavor at all in the vegetarian dish.  My guests didn't like anything.  The salad was lacking is variety with a little arugla on the place.  Not going back, and expensive

SyEunyIvOpgT2YRUX4In9A.text: Best veggie burger in town. Even my meat-eating friends love it. Great outdoor setting too, love the roaming kitties.

Mjj_sw4qdXaXox7P693s3A.text: We love "HOT" for the ambience and this visit with out of town guests did not disappoint.  Gorgeous evening with cool temps prompted patio heaters to be fired up.   Our group of 6 ordered cocktails, 2 bottles of vino, starters, an array of main dishes, dessert, and after dinner drinks.  We all felt well fed and taste buds were satisfied.   I was a little disappointed with my mahi mahi which was in need of some seasoning.  All other meals were tasty (we're the kind of group to share tastes).  Our server, Piper was an excellent example of good customer service.  She tended to the pace of our meal with non-intrusive attention.  The timing of the second bottle of wine to the table was spot on!

scpadDu4YhI80Tvv3kouQQ.text: Used to be my favorite Tempe restaurant. No more. Food is for the most part delicious. But the service is awful. So sloooooow. One hour and 20 minutes - and we had no time to even see a dessert menu. And we had to bring our bill up to have it run because our server who said she would be right back never came back. We had a reservation and yet we were sat at the smallest table in the restaurant - no room for starters or drinks.  All in all a very disappointing experience. They should be ashamed of their performance. My advice - eat somewhere else.

M-Bx23WnAcrG7V7hbAnYww.text: Pros: Unique and cool atmosphere, professional (yet snotty) service and interesting menu.  Cons: A bit on the pricey side and whatever you do -- do NOT order the bison.  Nice selection of drinks and my Caesars Salad was excellent, as was the gelato after dinner.  However, the bison strip steak was inedible and I should have sent it back.  I ordered it medium rare and it had the consistency of shoe leather.  The single worst $30+ dollar entree I have ever suffered through.  If there is a next time, I will stick to the tuna or fillet.  One last thing: our server, Kate, while a pro, was either suffering through a bad day or had zero personality.  Robotic would be a good word to describe her demeanor.

nhA1whzR5idJVlYXzzw5kw.text: great 'hide-a-way' place. First time there. Will be going back.

inRfMuQExkTpGBEbbMQmcA.text: My fiance and I enjoyed a beautiful birthday dinner together here. The food was delicious. However, we did sit inside and it was a little too small and loud for us to have a romantic dinner together. We are interested in sitting outside next time. We had a hard time hearing our female waitress because of the noise level. However, it is the beautiful lighted and decorated place. We will be back!

EKG0vP4ZYWPaNnlecGyq8Q.text: House of Tricks is such a great place to go! Our service was impeccable (Naomi) and the food was awesome. We had a great time and the atmosphere is second to none:)

3jP359Z9-9BuRe0EOTy1Ig.text: This is a nice enough place. Best seating is outside.  The food was spot on. Portion sizes however, were very small. The a la cart menu definitely overpriced.  $26- $30 average with no side dish was just stingy. Too many other choices to repeat this restaurant.

-QmVT6XJ_WCfcn9hqnrYYA.text: Very nice for Valentine's Day dinner, perfect weather, wine selection and ambience. The food was excellent.

8I_Cd5XtIjDIu4LoPS_aIQ.text: This is absolutely one of my favorite restaurants! The food is amazing and the service is always top notch! Naomi was such a pleasure! We couldn't of asked for a better evening. Also an added plus are the wonderful well behaved cats! I will admit it's a crazy cat lady's dream, good food, great service and cute cats . But seriously If you are looking for a wonderful romantic night to take a significant other look no further, this is your place.

K21PY67uuGlFubSH7CD0pg.text: Very nice spot. Patio was perfect. All my food was very good ... I tried halibut with squash and coconut, salad, and brownie dessert. My husband shared an Asian type soup that was outstanding and his apple bread pudding looked really good & I'm typically a chocolate person. We didn't have any parking issues - just parked on the street right around the corner. Just make sure you pay the meter because they do go around and check.

Ux2iB3V5fqXtSg3Dy1kqHQ.text: A lovely oasis for lunch.  Enjoyed sitting under the shade trees watching a hummingbird sip from the little fountain while we savored our creamy pasta & pork pastrami sandwich. The pasta was great with spinach & blistered tomatoes in a creamy pepper (chipotle??) sauce.  Nicely spiced creamy  sauce with tasty  pieces of roasted tomatoes and spinach. Really delicious and satisfying.  The pork pastrami sandwich was pretty to look at & delicious too.  Our reservations about ordering pork pastrami  were unfounded- sandwich was delicious- moist & stacked high with thinly sliced pork that held all the pastrami punch! The creamy white sauce drizzled over meat was incredible.  Service was efficient &  elegant without being stuffy.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pasta with spinach, blistered tomatoes &amp; grilled chicken- very tasty.
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pork pastrami- very good &amp; hearty.
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

t7SI_GRXFV_ATxo7-IAgkA.text: One of the last few great dining experiences in Tempe, and their historic stand is indicative of their brilliance. I had originally come here about ten years ago (this place has been around for nearly 30 years), so I couldn't tell you what my experience was then, but we finally decided to revisit it, and we're glad we did! Friendly staff, prompt service, great environment and setting (we even came to learn that they have three cats who basically live there! One of whom was hanging out with us, it seems, named Kinko). In any case, we had a few apps of course, my favorite being the Artisan Cheese Plate, but also Harissa Spiced Mussels , Smoked Texas Wild Boar and Seared Free Range Pork Belly Confit, all absolutely delicious! For entree, I had their Almond Crusted Rack of Lamb, and oh goodness was it amazing! I don't know that there are any other restaurants in Tempe  left to match the quality of House of Tricks, it brings fine dining to the heart of a busy college area without compromising their integrity. We'll certainly be back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Almond Crusted Rack of Lamb, delicious!!

5GbnhQ7DrToaDoPUa-0_kg.text: I'm sorry. The food? Delicious. The service? Exceptional. The ambiance? Perfect outdoor meets romantic novel. But we came here for dinner and the price was kinda outrageous..  We had the scallops for an appetizer, and there were only 2 pieces on the plate. The  fish I had was pretty much smaller than the size of my palm, and the ribs he had, well, was pretty underwhelming in portion as well. The flavors worked very well together, especially with the curry spices with my fish. It came to $110 and both of us were still hungry, yes, like starving still after dinner and hit up a fast food joint right after. I just can't see myself justifying in coming back just for the cost even though everything tastes great.  Definitely come here if you have money to burn and don't really have an appetite.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

d9Y6sugJAytE3Nj6WgDXAw.text: We had the smoked salmon and poke apps. We could have had several servings of these two dishes and been satisfied. Being from the northwest , the salmon was delicious and our other Hawaiian fave is a must. For dinner I had the Cornish game hen , and the rest of the family the ahi tuna and deck. All plates were polished clean by the end . Would definite go back ...

fQ4gknxkzco-T9kspXnzUQ.text: Always wanted to try this place. Was disappointed with our server. Was slightly rude. Didn't seem like he wanted to answer any questions about the menu. Seemed a little frustrated with any question we asked. Lemonade was sour and not sweet at all. Food came out quickly, however. Food also tasted great. Good size portion. Server never really checked up on us. Overall, food was really good. Service was not so good. With such high standards for this place I expected even just a slightly nicer waiter. Deal breaker for me as I can get good food somewhere else with better service.

flJJtRDhqT3DENLDk1Eocw.text: Legit - mostly due to the atmosphere and excellent food.  I've been meaning to check this place out for quite a while - just needed a good excuse to celebrate.  The only time I cannot fathom loving this place is when it's too warm to enjoy the patio.  There's even a mascot!  We were visited by the official cat of the House Of Tricks and even though I'm not a big cat guy, this one was really sweet.  The cocktails were delicious and everything we ordered was really tasty.  The service was superiors and I only hesitate to give five stars due to price - this was not a cheap meal.  I think between the four of us it came to about $350.  Granted, we didn't hold back, and we were celebrating, but that's still rather steep.    It's tough to say whether or not I'll be back, but I won't say no if the group decides to do so.

4DqJGoCOUk3TEWO6pfEmEQ.text: It seems like the reviews on here about House of Tricks bounce between meh and mind blowing.   This place is a solid 4 stars.  You're not going to find anything in Tempe that really competes on this level, as even the nicest places in Tempe are corporate balloon knots and do not offer a True fine dining experience like Trick's.  I went here with my lovely lady on a Friday night and posted up at the bar.  The bar is tits and it's outside with trees growing out of it.  It has this Swiss Family Robinson type of vibe that's really cool. The entire property is a couple of buildings and the patio/bar, and it's a cool setup.  The food selection is legit, with a hefty portion devoted to seafood.  We dove into the seafood and got an order of the scallops and an order of the mussels. The scallops were legit.  Cooked perfectly, presented beautifully and garnished thoughtfully.  The Mussels dish was also a winner: Mussels were fresh and cooked well, and the sauce was just awesome with the sausage in it.  I devoured it.  Overall, I couldn't see why anyone would give this place any less than 4 stars.  Go now and eat some scallops.

yFrHu6RB-38S9xXj2psG-w.text: Very good! Lovely setting, excellent service, and great food.  Hope to return to try the rest of the menu.  An excellent place to dine for a special event or an evening when you want to sit outside and feel special.

zWqIyflUjaG9XoG3UvbSxg.text: Been here a handful of times over the past 15 years when visiting and it's always incredible. Always new, delicious, and fun meals to try. Great service.

irVkVDmgu3DlXzndx_BZaA.text: Great food and atmosphere. We were able to sit outside even on a chilly night with the heaters. It felt like sitting outside at a friends house! So glad we found it. We were going to a show and our server was great about keeping our meal service timely without rushing.

wVeiQfP74uRdFDkqIy7Y7w.text: I have been here before, but will pass on a next visit. The lamb chops were very tough and my date's steak came out way to rare, as did the lamb. We sent back the steak but it took so long for it to come back out, i had finished my meal. The waiter comped the steak, which was very nice, but the quality of the lamb really turned me off. Service was really slow and the room that we were in was super loud.

GAKESeYe3VzF3rGK-Bqosw.text: Our annual Christmas gift ornament was held  at the House of Tricks.  I loved the outside patio.  6 of us sat near a heat lamp and it was perfect.  The service was a little slow and she refilled one of our drinks wrong, but that is OK.  She fixed it right away.  I ordered the Oven Roasted Turkey Club (Brown Sugar Bacon, Tomato, Avocado, Havarti, and Honey-Dijonaise) on Sourdough served with Tri-Color Pasta Salad.  The sandwich was great, especially the crunch of the brown sugar bacon.  YUM!  The Tri-Color Pasta Salad was ok, because it had onions.  Not too fond of onions.    Overall it is 3-1/2 stars, but the patio seating bumped it up to 4 stars.

aYVa699c7vN5Hv496eETqQ.text: Here's a tip: check the ASU game schedule if you're making reservations during football season!  Something I neglected to do, and we ended up being stuck in game traffic, re-routed around a bunch closed streets, and arriving 30 minutes late for our reservation only to have nowhere to park.  Luckily, there was an empty spot in the lot behind the restaurant, and they were still able to accommodate our reservation, so it all worked out in the end.  We chose this place because we wanted a fancy restaurant that wasn't a steakhouse or seafood place.  House of Tricks delivered.  Food was amazing.  Atmosphere is intimate and just what the husband and I were hoping for on our date night.    Although we'd been here to eat before, it was 6 or 7 years ago so I wasn't sure what to expect.  I will say that I enjoyed the outside ambiance of this visit much more than I did the inside ambiance I remember from the first visit.  It's just so pretty on the outdoor patio, especially in the evening when the weather is nice.  And despite the tree we sat under that kept dropping its giant flowers on me!  Just as we were finishing our meal, a large party was seated on the patio next to us, and I was immensely grateful that we were almost done, because they were very loud, drunk, and obnoxious.  One of the other hazards of eating there on game night!  We'll definitely be back.  Just not on game night!

pJNPM-yf2rgGdoV-rXaNEw.text: Awesome atmosphere! Great food! Fabulous service. Has one of the better cocktail menus around and really unique menu. Awesome vegetarian dishes as well!

2YoFBP0wBAoTznAtVV5rgw.text: Yum!  We visited here from Portland, OR and this place does not disappoint.  To start I had the broccolini potato bisque and it was creamy and smooth.  My husband had the Cesear salad was oridinary.    Then for the entree I got the beef tenderloin with potato puree and bacon jus.  This was very tasty.  It had a nice smoky flavor.  It was paired well with the puree and garlic spinach.  My husband got the short ribs and he said it was a little fatty.  His was "Ok."  My brother-in-law got the vegetarian pasta and he said it was salty.  My sister-in-law got the butter fish, which she really enjoyed.  Dessert was a wonderful chocolate pots de creme.  Wow!  A must try!  Had a nice kick of cayenne.  This place a great ambiance.  I really like the indoor/outdoor options.  I would recommend this to visitors to Tempe.

obwbuqgV71YUwfaAPQtTWg.text: Not one of the better choices at this price point. I had been wanting to try this place for a while due to the hype, but was a little disappointed. Nothing was bad, but nothing stood out either and if I'm paying $25 - $30 for an entree I expect the food to be pretty spectacular. I came here with a group of friends before a show at Gammage. My husband and I shared the soup special which was a white bean pork soup, the PEI mussels and the osso buco. To drink, my husband had the Franziskaner and I had the Green Thing and a margarita. The soup and mussels came out first. The mussels were good, but I've also cooked mussels as good as these. The soup was lukewarm, we should have sent it back but were with a group and didn't want to be bothersome and it was not as robust or flavorful as expected. They split the osso buco for us which was nice, but it wasn't one of the better osso bucos that I've had. The pork was cooked perfectly, but I felt that the sauce on it was too sweet and a little overpowering. It came with toasted white beans and sugar snap peas which I found to be a strange combo, a potato or other starch would have been better. The dish included gruyere, but the amount was so little that it didn't really add to the dish. My husband chose the flourless brownie for dessert and it was a bit on the dry side. I took one bite and it was good but not great, and not enough for me to want to waste the calories on. My favorite thing that I had was the Green Thing cocktail which had fresh cucumber and gin, it was delicious and very refreshing. The service was great and the ambiance was very nice, but I just didn't think the food was a great value for the price. I've had much better meals at this price point, so I could only see myself coming back here to enjoy the cocktails.

YxIxZmncdD-ShO81qZFkRg.text: I took my daughter here for her 16th birthday and it will be a night that both of us will never forget! First of all I have to say that the woman emerging from my little baby girl looked amazing and makes me want to buy more guns. From the very moment we arrived until our departure....everything was perfect!! You simply cannot go to places like this and eat off the dollar menu. Two appetizers, two of their perfectly cooked ribeyes and two desserts later and I would have paid $1,000 for this splendid meal. Service:great. Atmosphere:perfect.  Food: outstanding. Sharing this special moment of my daughters life....priceless.

UIN4CNhAsHMp0C2Ht-BmrQ.text: All the 5 star reviews are correct. This place is amazing. The ambience, location and staff start your experience off right and the food delivers a home run.   We went with a group of 10 people and everyone got a different plate and only rave reviews.   Wine list was great and they also had all the drinks for the ladies.

mM-B1PVT5oMch2Pyh0YiBw.text: (insert joke about how this is really a house of "Treats") *cricket sounds* Now that we've all had a good laugh...  Get the grilled chicken sandwich. It's quality meat, and goat cheese, bacon, and fig jam pretty universally take every sandwich from "um, sure" to "oh, yes."
