The pistachio butter and jelly on a croissant is interesting, but is more of a novelty than a substantial lunch choice. The turkey club was least popular, but this shouldn't be an issue because you're ordering the grilled chicken sandwich, anyway [see beginning of paragraph.]  In terms of ambiance, I'd bring my grandma here before I brought a date, because the environment and the lunch plates are all detail-oriented and dainty, plus the feel is cute and cozy, even in 100+ degree heat. However, if you're dating a grandma, please ignore this section.

tcL-UdJg0MT3fv-tVo0C2A.text: Great venue, great service, great food .... go .. have wine and enjoy the outdoor dining

0F9Xt9UBbTy2N3exJdOpVw.text: The food was delicious.  The patio is lovely and there are heaters if it is chilly. The service was great.

r73B8pLG4C6iZbKymf0WNA.text: Very cute place. Went on a Monday evening with reservations and was sat immediately. Didnt see a server for about 10min even though it wasn't busy at all. Bread was good. Beer was good (pretty hard to mess up beer). Tortilla soup was really good, too salty, but still good. Ordered the Cornish game hen.  OILY DOES NOT MEAN MOIST.  Spinach was also soggy and oily. Overall disappointed.  100$ and wasn't feeling well when we got home. Mostly because I usually eat fresh and healthy on a regular basis.

EIsbmCsc_g6q5NaiwKeY-g.text: Wow! What a beautiful, romantic restaurant! Out dishes were outstanding and so was the service! We will definitely be back!

vS1yGfVPCmFtfbHIN7w2Rg.text: This is one of our favorite restaurants.  We hadn't been here for about 4 or 5 months, but I'm happy to say it is still wonderful.  The lamb curry spring rolls (on special) were superb; the rack of lamb was delicious, and the squid ink pasta dish was delightful.  We also had a mixed green salad and a soup - both great.  We don't usually go for dessert, but this time we split a cappuccino (perfect!) and a peach/peanut butter tart, which was pretty unique.  Our waitress was wonderful - sweet, informative, and the right amount of attentive (she recommended the spring rolls & we were glad!).  I especially liked how each dish was served separately with time in between the courses.  I was also happy to find a truly nice and affordable red wine blend on the menu.  This time we sat indoors (so hot out there right now), and that was perfectly lovely, too.  Great experience!

8in9abWdwKrpK4KPyaTJsA.text: House of Tricks is a favorite of ours and our family's as well.  Drinks are inventive and tasty, the mussels with chorizo were brought back by popular demand and worth every piece of bread used to soak up the broth. Yesterday I had the red trout special, but have had their short ribs, salads, meatloaf and more.  My five star rating spans years of excellent dining.

DqdgItScozzfNa8OMPzipw.text: My husband and I decided to try House of Tricks based upon other patrons' reviews. We were surely glad we did! First of all the restaurant itself is a nice little gem in amongst the ASU campus in Tempe. The outdoor garden patio area is very inviting with fans and misters for those brave enough to dine in the AZ August heat. We chose to dine indoors. The interior decor is quaint and very period-oriented (Victorian). There is a really nice cozy, non-pretentious feel to the restaurant. Our server, Naomi, was awesome: super sweet, very personable, helpful with suggestions on the wine list and the menu, and her service was timely and not rushed. My husband and I started our dining experience with a shared wild arugula salad...it was so delicious! The dressing was very light and didn't overpower the combination of arugula, oranges, dates, carrots and goat cheese...a refreshing start to our meal. We then shared the seared scallop BLT appetizer (the bacon jam was SO rich and yummy I could've eaten just this on toasted bread and have been satisfied...hint, hint)--very delicious. My husband chose the Grilled Salmon and I chose the Grilled Yellowtail as our entrees. Both looked and tasted scrumptious!!!  I don't care for salmon, but I took a taste of my husband's and liked it. I loved the combination of roasted squash and caramelized leeks with my yellowtail...perfection. After a short 'intermission' from all this delightful food, we chose the Salted Caramel apple bread pudding for our dessert (hint-do add the scoop of vanilla bean gelato for a more sinful treat!). It was a decadent delight to share!! (Couldn't finish this so we took it home for a treat later in the evening .) All of the dishes from beginning to end were presented so beautifully...kudos to the chef, who not only prepared tasty food but very tasteful as well! Perfect portions too. Our experience was an A++ all across the board. House of Tricks is now tops in our repertoire of restaurants for special occasions and date nights.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salted Caramel Apple Bread Pudding
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grilled Salmon Entree
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grilled Yellowtail entree

7IDIh21q1EFS1PXQZLad0A.text: Very good food with reasonable lunch menu prices.  The dinner menu is a little more expensive.  I love having lunch on their out door patio because it makes you feel like you aren't in AZ or even close to a college campus.  The atmosphere is relaxing and very quaint.  Last time I was there, I had their quiche and soup.  It was very good.  I don't think I've been there and had something I didn't like.  The service is quick and the waiters have always been helpful and polite.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Quiche and soup

ApN7yVubW9XnXxXlLf0-IA.text: The food was excellent:  I had scallops as a starter, and duck breast as a main dish.  Both dishes were complex without being overly so.  For dessert, their classic bread pudding; a bit large for a dessert, after the rich duck, but still tasty.  Diet begins tomorrow.  Service was attentive.  The only reason I did not give 5 stars is that the room was incredibly loud.  There was a large, very noisy party of 10 or 12 next to us, and the room was small and had no sound buffering.

XX6hEsaQaXoWu6L5T_Ea3Q.text: This place is just trying to hard to be "upscale". The food was good, just not as good as expected. Definitely not worth the price. The staff was great. The place is quaint and cozy. I was just disappointed with the food. I also had a drink refill served in a dirty glass. Not going back. You're not missing anything by not going.

UiyU9B2z8h5s93hf0gFMzg.text: I used to come here when I lived in Phoenix and the weather was nice. I've been for happy hours, baby showers, lunches and dinners and there's a reason my friends and co-workers always came back.  Coming back for the holidays, I wanted to take my boyfriend (who hadn't been to Phoenix recently and had previously not been beyond Scottsdale) to a cute, romantic, quiet place so he could experience everything I had loved about living in Phoenix.  House of Tricks definitely delivered. We had a great time and the food was perfect. Our meals were cooked to perfection and the service was impeccable. My boyfriend is gluten-free (not by choice) and they were able to cater to his dietary needs.

9OPp3Ho4DcmxM-BY85ZxLw.text: I have been here twice and both times have been a wonderful experience. I took clients to this place and each time they were pleasantly surprised by the cuisine as well as the ambiance. I would say that this is my favorite restaurant in Tempe for its great food, great wine/drink selection, and the friendly staff. Both times we have sat outside and I would definitely recommend there as well. It is not loud and during the evening, its quite nice. Definitely recommend this place if you are looking for a nice restaurant in Tempe for yourself, clients, or a romantic dinner.

z3-m20rsmEjKXhuwL1zi0A.text: (Late review- came here in February)Came here before a show. We were seated outside - they had some heaters going but they wouldn't stay on, couldn't get them started etc. eventually the waitress asked if I would like a blanket. They keep some stocked at the hostess stand for people. Ordered some wine, appetizer & 2 entrees (salmon & meatloaf). Food was pretty good, service was a little slow. Great for date night - intimate.

C2vjlESdFAxJspoE0XYATg.text: Honestly, the food wasn't that great...(maybe cause it was a weekday) but the atmosphere is AMAZING! Will definitely be back:-)

ZVakIG0iUmB5RCsN56iNYA.text: Always love going to this restaurant! Food is awesome and staff does a great job. Has an excellent patio to meet and enjoy time with friends

wzPhx46LWIuj0wpKSWXCKg.text: Great environment and a great selection on novel combination.  Enjoyed truffled short rib special.  We were inside during an active outside night and service was a little slower than expected

HMyY4Dr2fsSPbodXdYXylg.text: I came here on a Friday night and was totally impressed with the appeal of the patio. Trees, flowers, and vines abound. The cheffiness of the menu also surprised me because as a downtown Tempe restaurant it doesn't seem like a place that would appeal to students' palate or budget.  But once we sat down and actually had to order from the cheffy menu, the impressed feeling died because no one could really find anything we really wanted to order. Once we finally ordered and tasted our food, we were all unimpressed with what we picked. Service also left a lot to be desired. Refills were hard to come by. Dirty plates sat on the table and we had to physically find our waitress to get a bill.    So overall I would say I am not interested in returning BUT the patio is beautiful and I would go back for drinks at the bar.

_icinzQIDIL1yZfFLSRSVQ.text: Nice ambiance. I like sweet cocktails so the waiter suggested The Purgatory and they made it extra sweet and it was delicious. I ordered the soup of the day which was a green curry chicken and veggie soup. It had just the right amount of kick. I also ordered the Grilled Chicken Greek Salad.  I highly recommend this place especially for a date night!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

n6YLM3LSbJmlRsjvR2gt6Q.text: Fantastic food, I took my mom here for Mother's Day, the food was phenomenal and the place is beautiful

NX5RsczSrx3kRc4iUmsg_Q.text: I am giving three stars because the food is truly amazing!  The presentation is beautiful and all of our meals were delicious.  The food and the beautiful garden setting make this a nice choice for dinner before a show at Gammage.    Our experience was not great.  We had a party of 6 and a reservation at 5:15.  We were seated promptly in a beautiful outdoor area.  Our water was delivered about 10 minutes later, but we did not have any contact with a server until we had been there about 25 minutes.  We were busy looking at the menu so it was not the end of the world.  We ordered drinks and those took another 15 minutes, we did not order anything special, wine and beer.  It was painfully slow!  Others around us seemed to be taken care of quickly, so not sure what the issue was. Our food finally arrived just after 6:30!  We had to get to our show, we had planned to walk so we really could not enjoy the meal, we had to eat fast. We had to request the check right when we got the food.  No time to even look at a dessert menu, which was really disappointing.  Great food, but lacking a bit in the service area.

brX6_Uqrwr75C2RKK-FTDg.text: The ambiance is pretty good, but the food is too pricey for the quality and the amount of food given.

oRN_H7ck-ABkutyJ-LnFkA.text: Pricey, but worth it!  We went for dinner, and it was so delicious! This was the first time I finished everything on my plate! We had the Jerk Spiced Agi Tuna and the Grouper. Absolutely phenomenal!  Definitely recommend this place and it's quite romantic too! Perfect for date night

BeqsSenYDfck_bryeNXWUg.text: I took my Mom here before we went to Wicked at Gammage. We split the shredded Kale and mushroom salad.  Very nice portions and amazing dressing.  My Mom had the Spiced Duck and she loved it.  (Ok I had a bite or two and it was amazing).  I had the beef tenderloin and it was good but not great.  Service was fantastic- our waters were always full and the timing between salad and entree was perfect.  Our waitress was very friendly and helpful with the menu.  Last thought - should have had the salmon.  Saw it come out a few times.  Next time

yFkvi3JBB9U1mIONU1XT8Q.text: My fiance's birthday and I chose this restaurant to celebrate.  It was a first for the both of us and we couldn't have been more pleased.  The restaurant has a great ambiance, the food is incredible, and the service was awesome.  Chevan (sp?) assisted us for the night, and she was fantastic and gave us great recommendations.  The manager came by and chatted with us for a bit, and was really wonderful.    We will certainly be back again and can't wait until then!  You won't be disappointed.

_7tuTEIZv4j2CCBBnR0Fvw.text: The food is a little off point and the service is always disappointing. For Tempe, it's a cool spot but don't expect Scottsdale quality.

-MYxx3t8maC-LpoX0fxwqA.text: Was very excited to try this place and it met my expectations. First, I love the restuarant and how it is a house with a beautiful patio. It makes you feel like your anywhere but Arizona. The service was a little slow at first, but the waitress was very kind. We ordered the mussels as an appetizer. I strongly recommend you to order the mussels if you like shellfish. The waitress gave us some time in between the appetizer and main course, which was long but nice. It was nice that they did not bring all the food at once or shortly after we got our appetizer. We ordered duck and swordfish as our main entree. The swordfish was delicious, but lacked a little bit of flavor. The duck had so much flavor. They paired it with potatoes and beets. I almost licked my plate clean. We then ordered the flourless chocolate cake. Wow, delicious. The cake was rich, but paired with a cream, chocolate syrup and strawberries. The service was excellent, the restuarant was beautiful and the food was delicious. Overall, I would recommend this spot for a fancy date night.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Swordfish
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Duck--delicious must try
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Mussels

lhUjAS-ADQQTt3VnM0vfFA.text: Excellent dinner! Where to begin? Atmosphere on the patio was wonderful and cozy.  Service? Impeccable! Our server was a serious professional, I think they were all male servers?  Idk but it was refreshing to have a server who really knew how to provide everything but not be interrupting.  The food! Crazy good.  We had prime rib and it was a huge portion. Our appetizer was this cheese thing, just delicious! Cocktails, they obviously have a mixologist, because our drinks were the bomb!  My was similar to a lemon drop, my husband had a pims cup, also tasty.  It was not a cheap meal, but it was worth it!

HD95UWr8vbfyLnEMG0A_pA.text: Dinner here was awesome. I went to celebrate my birthday. We enjoyed their duck breast and it was cooked to perfection. Fat was rendered well off the duck. I do wish the skin was more crispy but the meat was a perfect temperature. You didn't need to chew the duck it was soft and delicious!  The other highlight of our meal was dessert. The apple bread pudding was delicious it offered many different layers of flavor and it was soft and had different notes of flavor: tartness of the apple and sweetness from the caramel. You must do this with ice cream!  The menu I would say offers a cohesive mix of interesting entrees and small plates it has something for everyone.  This house exceeded my expectations and was a great place to dine. Would recommend others to come here.

MM6fcWRFfr9jnqFIlk930A.text: I've been to House of Tricks many times, each time is better than the last.  House of Tricks is unlike any restaurant in Tempe, the tree coverage and the patio provides an awesome natural ambiance.  My father was in town and really wanted to come back here, the last time I took him here was three years ago. We sat on the patio, it was still 110 degrees outside but it was still cool somehow.   We started with the mussels and the poke. Both were phenomenal, the mussels with the chorizo may be one of my favorite dishes from any restaurant I've ever been to. I definitely recommend this dish to anyone.   For our entree we both got the sea bass, which was perfect. The sea bass was light and soft and cooked perfectly. The black beans, squash, tomatoes and avocado were a great compliment to the fish. This is one of my favorite sea bass dishes ever. Add the bottle of Malbec we were sipping on and it was a great meal.  I truly believe House of Tricks is the best restaurant in Tempe, by a mile.

mJYEL6WJVR2mfsYFF8qNUg.text: I love house of tricks great wine selection a killer patio. I always love coming here for a glass of rose or a nice cocktail and a cheese plate. So it's about time I wrote a review. Staff is amazing and always make every experience flawless. I can't wait to come back and enjoy and nice afternoon on their patio.

9sPXEEAO7N1oOHeQQZVzGw.text: The best meal we've had in a LONG time. Top-notch lamb appetizer. So good and enough to share with one other. If you're hungry get two. The pork shank was outstanding. The tenderloin was good, just not a large enough portion. Try it out.

3qgji8m4_-CHngL8nfeWSg.text: Amazing happy hour and service. Must have spinach dip and mussels and the small bite caprese is delightful. Chris is an amazing server and knows the perfect wine pairing!!!

h25_Prp0StcH5SWfhE3GxQ.text: Nice place to come enjoy some great food! First time in, and I will be back! My friend and I started off with an ahi tuna poke, which was delicious.  For the entree she had a pan seared seabass which was good, but the accompanying black beans were a little strong for the flavor (I thought they were great but together it was interesting) while I had the buttermilk pork chop which was fantastic.  My hefe beer was excellent as was her drink - something with jalapenos is all I remember.  Definitely worth a visit!

QR44a1I2l07BzEb78BQF7A.text: Top quality food and ambiance.  Highly recommend eating on the patio when the weather is nice or just stopping by the outdoor bar for a drink.

QVjZzBgoZFmTz8RgwBKLsw.text: Went for lunch today. Very disappointed. It opened at 11:00 and I arrived at 11:15. No hostess to be found. The heaters were not on (a cold day for AZ). One waiter for our area (he was very nice, but they were obviously understaffed). It took FOREVER (I am not exaggerating) after we ordered to get our food. I was Ok with all that but my lunch portion which I paid 14.00 for was minuscule. I had to order a bowl of soup to sort of fill up. I seriously think there are better places for the money and the portions. Won't be going back there again.

dxkBaRCXReH9ItWPXQe-HA.text: Visiting friends and family from Portland, OR we have pretty high expectations for food and ambiance. I am continually disappointed when visiting the Phoenix area, but this place was excellent. The patio was lush and grown in with beautiful plants,  and service was timely and polite. The staff made several recommendations and all of which were lovely. We stuck mostly to salads and desserts, but they were fresh and used good ingredients as flavors.

PAM4Kzp4ylzyuv6ZluAFbg.text: We went to the house of tricks before a show at asu gammage. We sat inside, as it was still a little too warm to sit outside. The service was slow and you are not allowed to order anything from the happy hour menu when dining inside. We had the scallop appetizer to start it was pretty good but was not very warm. I got the steak and the husband got the tuna.  The food was good, not life changing by any means. However, all the food that came out again was not very hot. The table next to us had to find their server because the service was too slow for them. I liked the patio vibe of this location but I will not be back, as there is better dining choices in Phoenix. This restaurant is over hyped, I was disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Scallop starter

MqOa3q8duMemJMKNa0A-Zg.text: This restaurant was a very special date night favorite for my hubby and me when we were dating after we met at ASU in 1990.   Now the eldest daughter is at ASU and we went down to visit on Sat afternoon for lunch and to senior girl. Hubby suggested House of Tricks and I wasn't even sure it was open for lunch. Checked Yelp and it was! AND there was a 20% off if you checked in. AND you could make reservations via Yelp. Decision made.   We arrived and were given a choice of a table inside or outside. Even though it was going to be well over 100 all of the shade from the beautiful trees and umbrellas and great misting system made us decide outside was the way to go.   The menu has so many things that sounded wonderful - it was hard for all of us to decide. AND they had both a white and a red wine by the glass for $6.   I got the salmon which was delicious. Cooked perfectly. Moist and flavorful. Served over a chive risotto cake, bed of mixed greens with cherry tomatoes, avocados and sweet red peppers. Yum!  Daughter opted for the daily special frittata with turkey, feta and tomatoes served with a side salad and a pile of fresh fruit. Another win. Hubby had the club sandwich which was wonderful. He opted for potato salad instead of pasta salad and it has bacon in it. He was very happy with his selection.   This place did not disappoint. It's $$$ on Yelp but I think that was more for dinner. Our lunch was very reasonable. Especially for finer dining - improved more with the 20% off. We will have to go have a special date night there again soon!  Nicely done house of Tricks - we will be back soon!

5WP0EdAl8zOBT9GQqGDI_g.text: I would normally give this restaurant a 5 star but not now.  I would go there in the evening but never for lunch for the next two years while a Multi story apartment building is being built across the street. The noise is Beyond belief.  My advice is stay away during lunch and only go at night.

YmoW6NlccMSRJwbPfDwuCg.text: We sat very comfortably at a table outdoor.  The food was delicious.  We tried the Foie Gras on a piece of toast with red pepper and green onion that was very good. So was grilled tandoori salmon and the tenderloin with crispy toasted Brussel sprouts.  The service was attentive.

1qqht-SI199R9CnWTqf2KA.text: I gave it two starts because there was a stray cat that was roaming around the grounds and the waitress mentioned there are actually several cats that "hang out" all the time. I mentioned that not only am I allergic to cats, but it's unsanitary to have stray cats jumping up on people and the table (which it did, jump up on an empty table)....she made no attempt to remove it and didn't seem to care...it eventually left our table.   However, the food was really good and the atmosphere was enjoyable!

oB_SsGrKAro2fgOR0N11vA.text: The food was amazing... the beef tenderloin and sides were fantastic.  Service was perfect.  I highly recommend.

qXlV8EeI2WreEZ5J8kxqqw.text: Giving it 4 stars for the atmosphere. Didn't eat here, just came for a drink.  Food looked good though.  Loved the atmosphere.  Really cute place and romantic.  You wouldn't know your in the middle of the city when your inside the restaurant.  Sat at the outdoor bar; hightops.  Very nice patio dining, and pretty trees and plantings.  They do have an indoor area.  Didn't seem like they had an extensive menu but different.  They have a happy hour and it looked like a lot of people were ordering things off that.  Next time will try the food.

Tm1udZ93sNRi1eKygRkJ1Q.text: I was here recently for Mother's Day brunch. They had a price fixe menu for the occasion with plenty of options. Everything I ordered was delicious. The cocktails were excellent as was service. The restaurant is set in downtown Tempe, but you can absolutely not tell as you are shaded by so many trees. Super romantic setting. I haven't seen the inside, but I highly recommend outdoor seating. Planning to go back for a dinner reservation sometime soon.

9Hx-VDolNF5Abz75snznpg.text: #AZ Restaurant Week# House of Tricks was our first choice for the AZ Restaurant Week 2017 Fall. The menu was a little bit different from other restaurants (especially the churros with Miso Caramel), so it stood out. I chose smoked pork belly+Branzino en Papillote+pineapple upside down cake,and my husband chose Fried Oyster+short rib+churros. The smoked pork belly was tasty and well-seasoned and I liked the sause with it. And I have to say, I am now a big fan of the Branzino en Papillote with corn and quinoa. What a perfect match!!! The pity was that the pineapple upside down cake was tooo sweet for me. But the churros were a big surprise!! The churros I had before were sweet and they were served with hot chocolate, but now I found wow Miso actually worked as well! Finally, the portion was huge, and I think the price was reasonable!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Churros with Miso Caramel (dessert)
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pineapple upside down cake (dessert)
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Branzino en Papillote (entree)

AG1H6LnbO2oO6zCQZuHzfw.text: Happy Hour review:   The bartender was very nice. My problem is they offer "Happy Hour" with a separate menu printed out, but the appetizers available are the exact same price as regular appetizers. The drinks on happy hour were not even anything worthwhile. We were very disappointed so we only ordered one beer each and then left. Perhaps regular dinner is good; this review is happy hour only.

HzaEg-HsfNEnNCdLvHpt5g.text: I was visiting Tempe on a work trip and this place was hyped up.  It did not deliver.  Service was OK, but our food too almost an hour to arrive (kids Chen backed up).  I ordered the sea bass, and it was quite salty.  The Caesar salad was also just ordinary.  It was not terrible, but doesn't deserve four stars based on my experience.

B4Xb8FWZPF6D0jU-kf6XvA.text: House of Tricks has a nice setting.  It also has a cute name.  I would like to know where it came from.   It is located close to ASU.  The parking is all street parking.   It is best if you make a reservation.  I did not, but was able to be seated on later side at 8:30.  It was a little frantic near the bar with servers rushing around.  I waited for my table at the bar enjoying  couple of cocktails.  Unfortunately, me and my chair were bumped into frequently by a few of the wait staff carrying the stand for their trays.   There is a lot of outdoor seating which we took advantage of on a pleasant night.  The menu at House of Tricks was pretty interesting.  My entree entree was good, a B+.  I had the beef tenderloin.  My dessert was even better.  I had the salted caramel bread pudding.  I would give that an A grade.  Our waitress was professional and very efficient.  She was one of the highlights.  I forget her name, but she was originally from Knoxville.  I would be happy to go back. However, its unlikely as I am not is Phoenix often.  Thumbs up.

Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Exterior 2
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Exterior

vraIwnGeS41ZwDqOT3-yBg.text: Rally great food, terrific atmosphere, we sat outside and loved everything about this place

LIvrEQezoO6YV2nbStAuSw.text: (Disclaimer: just my experience) the food was absolutely amazing. I'm just upset that I booked a reservation weeks in advance for Valentine's Day. My girlfriend let me know she would be late so I called in the morning to let them know. They said no problem and at no time told me about the 20 minute policy. So when I showed up 25 minutes late after they told me it wasn't a problem they didn't even want to seat me. I had to bitch about it and then we lost our seat outside. It was just extremely disappointing because we were so excited to come here. Then of course when we left there were tons of open tables outside so we could have very easily been sat.

O5X2als5NeahfXnyDimG-w.text: Got there for a work lunch at 11:15. We were the second set of tables there. Ordered about 11:30 and didn't get our food for an hour. Seems excessively long to wait. Sure we had a group of 10 but nobody else was in the restaurant yet.. even after other parties showed up they got their food first. That was disappointing, but we didn't cause a fuss or complain.   Once we got our food, the server didn't even recognize that it was so late.. but at least the food was good. Everyone was happy with that part and said they liked what they got.   I had the Salmon Salad, just can't remember what it was called right now. Don't know if it was extra good because I was so hungry after the wait or if it truly is that good.. I'd be willing to go back and give it another chance

vXblY9_Ovp-dADwIqoUVtA.text: Have been there twice in last 2 weeks. Fisrt time wasThursday 11/6 to welcome a friend to town. Was seat in vineyard section - not nearly as nice as seating in front. Food was great ,but very loud  and intoxicatedload  guests sat next to us. Service was poor.We the first seated in that overflow section and the last to be served. On Saturday the 15th we sat in front. Food was good, but service was poor .Surprised that when buser cleared our appetizer plates he put used silverware back on the table. Their prices warrant better service. Also waited inline for the men's room. Apparently a patron locked the door on the way out. Four guys were waiting to get in  (one holer). Manager finally came and opened the locked door.  Although I like the ambiance of this restaurant, the poor service and prices for what we got would make me very hesitant to go back there anytime soon even though the food was great. It isn't worth the hassle. Also called to see whether the restaurant could do something special like flowers or birthday cake for my twin sisters birthday. They couldn't -- referred me to a local bakery inTempe for a birthday cake,

vwdQ5ay-fNvlbvwP1ZTI8w.text: We had a delightful dinner with a great atmosphere, service and food.  We definitely recommend this place!

fyCaqXjwWb0-UAZ7YwLROg.text: LOVE this place!  Beautiful backdrop, eclectic decorations and you definitely feel like you're at grandma's house.  Food is absolutely delicious!!!  Waitstaff is very well trained and pleasant.  Decent wine list.  This is a must visit every time I am in town.

VLYimga-8GC9wHIg3KGGdQ.text: This little gem off of Mill Avenue in Tempe is such a delight. The two houses merge together with a lovely tree-shaded patio. It's perfect for groups or couples. Our party of three sat outside watching the revelers attend the ASU/Stanford game as there was a private party going on inside the houses. No matter, the weather was perfect and the heaters were warm enough. Our service was fair, to be honest and I would have preferred a little more attention and information regarding the menu. The food was amazing though. The filet actually melted in our mouths and was perfectly seasoned. It sat atop a delicious mixture of cheddar grits and veggies. The halibut was also nicely done and very flavorful. The best part of this meal was the amazing bread pudding dessert. You cannot skip this one filled with apples and the flavors of fall. The red velvet chocolate mousse cake was also good, but the bread pudding was better. Very nice wine list accompanies and the cocktails are quite good - try the salted old fashioned for a unique twist on the old favorite.

Z3H0VneO-AZVAfORl9i6_w.text: Very disappointing, especially as it was to be a birthday treat for a friend.  Shuffled us off to a side building where we were the only ones and rarely checked on us.  Food was ordinary.  No offers of a birthday treat which most places now do.  And to top it off, we had to pay to park.  Not worth it.

lcJ1eqRvr8LGpa2fmRgbnw.text: I liked House of Tricks from the get go when the hostess let us be choosy with where we sat on the patio. They have a great selection of signature drinks. I went along with our servers recommendation the Green Thing and my date got the Frisky Squirrel. We were both happy with our choices. I loooooove pork belly, and their appetizer was delicious. It was a smaller portion which made it hard to share because I wanted it all! I followed with the pork chop and he got the beef tenderloin. Again, we were not disappointed. For dessert we ordered the donuts which were probably my least favorite part of the meal. Not bad, but not great.  Our server was attentive and helpful and I really liked the atmosphere. I will definitely be back.

TAiCJW1yUNZ1J0ZnVRXEjA.text: Food was good but the service was the worst ive ever had. To top it all off, my server charged my card a different amount than was on the receipt. $17 more to be exact! Will never go back.

u9GVNJ5Wuxb3bTgY5Y5Low.text: Loved the location at atmosphere of this place!  Had a very nice business dinner here last night.  We were able to sit outside thanks to the gorgeous weather, and I'd recommend this to anyone.  The houses inside have their charm, but al fresco dining is great!    We had a few drinks at the bar before we started dinner - they have a fairly nice wine by the glass list, as well as a nice stocked bar.  Something for everyone!  The menu contained lots of delicious choices, and it was hard to choose.  Ended up going with Hapuku, which was a new-to-me fish from New Zealand, similar to grouper.  It was delicious - tender, flaky, and the earthy vegetables with it were a nice complement.  We had very polite service, though not well-timed.  I like when plates are cleared all at once for people, instead of taking plates at the table away when others are eating.  OR, bringing the bill before we've finished dessert.  Both of these happened here.

7V_obHcR9V15hjdtqEvkNg.text: I love their PB&J (pistachio butter, balsamic, and strawberry). Parking can be a little rough.

_5kbkv1PXaxaMTOU-HN_Bg.text: I've eaten at HOT for a holiday party as well as for dinner. Filet mignon was perfectly cooked on both occasions. The warm bread with "special" butter is a great starter.  Patio setting is great. Pretty garden with overgrown trees.  Excellent service.

2q1DRgdROF89hma5YkAHLw.text: We went here earlier today and had a great experience. It has a beautiful patio with tons of shade. The staff were friendly and helpful. The food was very delicious and came out quickly.  They also have fantastic, spicy bloody Mary's.  We plan on returning here again and would most definitely recommend it.

Dq8zlmNkMzwrBgg4pEaofA.text: I'm a big fan of this place. The food is excellent, the patio is beautiful. However,I consistently get really bad service. Today we were there around 11am, maybe 3 other tables already there....it took our server about 7-9 minutes to acknowledge us, took our spinach artichoke dip about 20 minutes to arrive. The only reason I go back is that is such a nice spot, the food is delicious....and I continue to hope the service gets better or that a manager reads this.

Y01ehC0gOlUN23CIYD5NrQ.text: They get upgraded from my last review. Went here again on New Years and because I was so impressed went back again. That says a lot. And yes, the food is delicious. Wait staff still not awesome...that's what is holding them back, and some of the crowded seating (sit outside if you can).

44qNNHKUKYUZ36xcTsbMLg.text: We had an wonderful evening with old friends at House of Tricks.  The patio seating was perfect, the food amazing and the service excellent.  The wine selection was good and I enjoyed a great glass of wine recommended by our server.  It is nice to find a restaurant with a wonderful atmosphere, amazing food and amazing service from our waiter Sean.  I first visited House of Tricks in 1990 when I moved to Tempe and this continues to be one of the best restaurants around!

ns4QTaJc84WZCLYiSTL4Xg.text: Excellent food, excellent service.  A perfect place to celebrate my mother's 68th birthday.  We will definitely be back to try the dinner menu and the awesome bar/patio when the weather is cooler.

BBuUmY0HUKqkjfRFHHgfyQ.text: HOW have I not been here before???  This place is amazing.  The cozy little location makes you feel like you're out in the middle of the countryside, even though in reality you're steps from Mill Ave. Everyone - from the bartender to the host to the server - went way out of their way to make sure our meal went well.  I had the quiche special (chorizo & goat cheese) with a side of the soup of the day (califlower with basil) and both were out of this world.  Add in some stellar $6 by-the-glass wine specials and you've got a happy, happy camper.  I will definitely be back! One tip - I didn't realize they had a private parking lot behind the restaurant; so initially I parked on the street at a pay meter.  Save yourself the $0.50 and park back in the alley!  :)

_w281WH4ZCDQ68VOPTttwg.text: This was our 5th visit over the pat few years. Love the food and ambience overall. Our server was just very slow this visit, and it took away a bit from our experience. No bread was offered - we had to ask, which has never happened before, and she was slow to bring our wine. We had finished the first bottle between the 4 of us, and ordered a second, which didn't arrive until our entrees were on the table and being eaten before they got cold. Water glasses weren't refilled often enough. She did not mention the dessert special, I happened to overhear another server telling her table about it - she had just dropped off the dessert menus and run off. Food was fabulous as always, but at this fine restaurant, we've learned to expect better service. We'll be back, though, as we know how wonderful this gem really is.

mQV5Y-ziHBBBjGdbiI23fQ.text: 1. Awesome job in ambiance and location 2. excellent service 3. Menu variety  This place is a diamond in rough. It's got class and appeals to a variety of appetites, tucked away in the heart of downtown Tempe (party central), yet it's got a private feel or rural-ness. It's a little expensive, however, I've been known to turn the other cheek with price/value issues, when bribed with good hospitality, a memorable experience, and good coffee :)  The fire place is a nice touch.

sCKV7IzvfgEVbuTJGr1ypQ.text: Elegance to the guilds.  Great food and awesome wine list.  This place is awesome for lunch, dinner, or just happy hour.

-jNbcx2UX5dTEx_UWuztqQ.text: Fantastic food and a massive wine selection. We also had a great waiter. Very upscale and a place that only the locals know about.

H8Ga_1GbGtA_ZU6_nDC_7w.text: I hate to be unoriginal, but what I've read before was True yesterday. Ambiance is wonderful, the place couldn't be better for a date (I was, however, there with my dissertation chair - not so romantic - lol). The lunch special was wonderful, a variation on a steak sandwich second to none I've had. The servers were all pleasant and mellow, which is a nice change of pace from the hustle and bustle of usual lunch rushes. Highly recommend!

cus-z3FuEpqDGsiv1HEhJw.text: I went here for my 5 year wedding anniversary and was very disappointed. My husband chose it because be had gone before and liked it. Some food was good and some was just ok. Seems like it should all be amazing for the price. I ordered my steak medium and it came out rare so I sent it back and it came back only slightly better but I ate it anyway. My husband and I both left there feeling sick. Later that night, I awoke to my husband violently vomiting. The food gave him food poisioning! I called the restaurant the next morning to make them aware of the situation and they took down my name and number and said the manager would call me back in a few days to make the situation right. We spent well over $100 on our food and I would have rather spent half that on a meal that didn't make my husband sick. We never heard back from them. No manager ever called. I really like to support local restaurants and really tried to give them a chance to make it right, but they just never did. I will not be returning to this restaurant.

zvO4W7UPrW9FsSkGowhL5A.text: Love this place! Always come here with my parents when I am home. Oh and had a fantastic 21st birthday dinner here years ago.   Every time I come here, my meal is always amazing. They also have a really incredible wine selection that is constantly updated and improved upon.   Their outside patio is gorgeous and complete with heaters and a fire pit when the weather is a bit on the chilly side. But the indoors is just as great-cozy little house with a fire place.    Just yesterday, we had the Mediterranean Platter as a starter (delicious!) and I had the fruit and chicken shwarma salad (so good!) with a lovely glass of pinot noir.  I highly recommend this place...I have never been disappointed. Plus the waitstaff is always incredibly friendly. Yesterday, we sat at our table for over three hours-not only did our waiter sit and joke with us, we never felt rushed to leave.   Check it out!

wTLT3e_YjTLQk34HL6ZDdg.text: Food was excellent but service in the bar area was awful! My group of 5 girls that spent $225 there and we had to flag someone down every time to get silverware, drinks, menus, order and then our tab! The 2 bartenders sat at talked while we were sitting with empty drinks! Will not be back!

FqwQtLOAhzjtC_atW6Lu0g.text: I went here this past weekend for lunch with a large group of girls. We were very pleased with the service, food, and sangria! They were able to accommodate our party of 10 with no issues. The really friendly waitress even separated our bill for us even though they don't normally do that. The food was fantastic! Everyone loved everything that they ordered. Only thing that was a downer was their cat that ran around. I'm allergic and the cat running around was bothersome. Also, no parking, metered parking all the way.

QFompAN7-0RpurqE0_bwcQ.text: Location is great and food is fresh and good. Pasta salad side dish is amazing!  Raspberry lemonade has real fruit. Great

HUGuMjsRvcG6uRrvNXYDiw.text: Pricey but worth it.  I've never had a bad plate at Tricks, and they make a very good martini. I wouldn't say the food is world class, but it's never been disappointing.  Extremely pleasant to sit outside under the trees. With some good conversation and a couple of good selections from the menu it's hard not to have a good time here.

TFH9OCLWr-7glW6wseh5hw.text: We wanted to love this place but couldn't. We were so looking forward to lunch here on a recent visit to Tempe. Although we didn't have reservations, we were seated very quickly on the back patio (or we could have chosen to sit inside).  The problem is that it took what felt like forever to get our food.  We were hungry when we arrived, and were never even given a bread basket.  We waited at our table for our meals while four other tables near us received their food, finished their meal, and paid and left the restaurant. And I have to be honest, our food when it did arrive wasn't spectacular.  I ordered the Sugar Cane Shrimp Salad - about 5 medium pieces of shrimp, tasty but overcooked, on a bed of mixed greens with a fairly flavorless dressing.  That's it.  My daughter ordered a Salmon Salad that came with a hefty fried risotto cake, so I ate half of that.

dsai4SHPWEoGbbuyTcwi-Q.text: Have been more than once. Taken friends there too. Always a good experience. Like the people, the layout and the food. Not often in Phoenix but when we do visit, we always make a point of dining here at least once. Our experience has always been for lunch so cannot comment on dinner.  We agree with the other positive reviews.

bdt29lFmQNfkmVFr-joHVg.text: The food was over-priced, the portions were small and really the food was nothing special. The service was just so-so as the server brought our appetizer after our entree was served. My wife ordered a salad without bacon and they goofed that. After they took it back they returned her a salad that was half of what she was previously served and it appeared they just removed a bunch of food from her plate rather than bringing her a new portion. Very disappointing experience as I paid a lot of money only to go home hungry and dissatisfied. I am certainly not going to go back to this restaurant.

CSN351mLacSBkikTTVUw5w.text: Server was really nice but the food wasn't that good. Scallops were under cooked and fish of the day was over cooked. Also the gnocchi is fried. Menu wasn't clear and they weren't very good.

_NKGzwojaRPcNrr3QTD6Yg.text: We had lunch here yesterday. It's been a while since we have been here but we were not disappointed. I had the chicken breast pasta dish and Susan had a Reuben. The patio is always nice and the waitress was kind enough to make sure we stayed warm by moving another heater next to us, too bad she didn't smile much. The service and food were very good. The house wine was also very good for $6 a glass but the pour seemed a little on the skimpy side. I'm sure we will go back again.

GC77KWNsd_wIj6YWHmpW8Q.text: Pork belly with nice crust was very good, as was the duck breast in a very tasty sauce that had thai influences, using coconut milk and peppers. It's mouthwatering when i think back of it now even though it has been a few weeks since i was there. One minor point of critisism was the texture of the duck meat, which i found to be too soft. I recommend getting a seat in the yard, i was late and had a less optimal seat inside.

zj0FzsFVZ4V3vljn1_AtjQ.text: Since I moved to the Valley in August I have been on a journey to find the greatest locations with nice, quiet, laid-back atmospheres and House of Tricks quickly became one of my favorites. As a singer, I need places that are quiet and chill to go get a drink so naturally I quickly latched onto House of Tricks as a favorite for an evening drink. The bar itself is a very unique treat: outdoors in the round with trees built-in as part of the bar rather than torn down! When dining, a majority of the seating appears to be outdoors (which is fine because it has a fantastic patio) but I have sat inside and it is a wonderfully intimate atmosphere; built out of what appears to be a very old house-turned-restaurant. Very cool! I had a fantastic glass of wine and a Scottish Salmon that was served to perfection. Bravi to the staff of House of Tricks for creating a truly unique establishment that is sure to create regulars out of wanderers!  Keep singing,  -Jerron

tzN21UjKyKl-Q5dhcmvnpQ.text: Absolutely great each and every time. That's pretty much how I sum up Tricks.  Living nearby has given me good opportunities to visit Tricks for lunch and dinner, I've never been disappointed. Lunch is nice for something a bit classier that won't break the bank, their salads are fresh and crisp, the sandwiches are just enough to fill but not weigh you down (at least for me).  For those considering taking their family out for a nice quiet lunch, Tricks is a no worry choice. I've taken my family here on two separate occasions and even the picky Grandfather of the family had something he liked. (He's super hard to please) I would only steer clear on the hottest AZ summer days as the misters can only do so much. Or you could sit inside for some A/C action.  I'll agree that Tricks is a great date destination. It's the first mention when someone asks me where to go in Tempe for a nice date (with Caffe Boa just behind it). The wine list is comprehensive without being daunting and the dinner selections are borderline amazing. I've had several and again, not been disappointed. My favorite has been the Ahi Tuna Wellington, prepared perfectly and with served with nice presentation.  All in all, one of the best restaurants in Tempe and probably the Phoenix area. A few Tricks lunches in the Fall and Summer should be planned accordingly.

cvENFBjPneMqA1KYzT4Agg.text: Went there for lunch on Saturday. Beautiful patio with lots of shade; food was great and service is nice.

RGzYqESDkSXkeSuKfWwl7Q.text: Have had lunch here on several occasions & it's been great but the recent experience was not quite so pleasant. A group of us decided to go there for dinner before a show at Gammage. It was restaurant week so we made reservations well in advance allowing plenty of time. We were never asked if we were going to a show. Service was incredibly slow and when we had not yet received appetizers 40 min after placing our order, we were starting to panic. When we finally caught our server we told her that we were attending a 7:30 performance and she seemed so surprised. Food came pretty fast after that but unfortunately, 5 out of 7 dinners were cold. I think the cold meals were all from the restaurant week menu. Too bad as the food was good. We barely finished and rushed out the door, just making it in time for the show. I am sure I will go back again but I think I will stick to lunch from now on. I found it surprising that they just didn't seem to be prepared for a Sat night with both restaurant week and a show at Gammage. Was this a surprise to them???

c-A5Ye2nZclL3EJ5_zwG2w.text: Stop what you are doing right now and GO! Greatest place to eat in Tempe and Scottsdale combined. All around amazing place. You just have to go to fully understand what I am yelping. Expect to spend about $25-$50 a person.

f36n_QSxhkPSxUcjTQdimQ.text: We have chosen to eat here on numerous occasions over the past 5 years or so.  We are never disappointed.  Food and service always superior.

NA9Vfp5iNxc3U6dxbe00_g.text: Good food, pleasant garden setting.  Turned off by waitress' saying they couldn't substitute cole slaw in their Reuben and couldn't serve just a bowl of chocolate malt ice cream because they were pre-portioned.

atDO2-xj7iAnqeNhBvA6MA.text: Great patio with several locations that qualify for great date seating.  It's located near ASU/Mill.  Service is decent during busy times.   Put aside the hard bread and frozen butter they start you with (its free so you can set it there) and the rest is a pleasure.  The Artisan Cheese Plate - this is such a winner!  It is a perfect appetizer to accommodate any of the entrees.  If you haven't gotten it yet, do.  They cook their fillet perfectly!  I definitely recommend the Artisan/Filet combo to anyone.  They cook their seasonal fish perfectly as well.  I have not dined inside the historic bungalows - however they do look very cozy!  Note: There is only a single bathroom for the property, now that's really keeping it historic lol.   Adding some white "holiday" lights to the patio trees for the evening crowd would be a great addition.   Jabbing aside this is a good place to have dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

6x74BUaC941Xd-w4egzV-A.text: First visit to House of Tricks, lovely atmosphere on the lit patio.  30th wedding anniversary celebrated and our waitress knew it and brought complimentary champagne for us.  Our waitress Kate was a delight! The food was wonderful, prices not outrageous.   We will most certainly be back!

V644gqo2Jm1adgeBlZe4jw.text: The House of Tricks is up there with my all-time favorite restaurants. First of all, there is the food, a fresh and imaginative kale/lettuce salad with pears and crisped prosciutto; then a perfectly done and tender lamb shank on a bed of creamy risotto for me. My partner was less daring and had glazed salmon with baby boo choi. I had a lovely Zinfandel which went perfectly with the lamb. We eschewed any starters and ended the evening with coffee.  We felt the cost was reasonable and I have to say the wait staff was hip and efficient... great service!

_hStfy0TX6tiuKcIJrYU5Q.text: I come back here again and again.   It is my favorite place in Tempe. Period.  Food is perfect. Service is unsurpassed. Decor/Atmosphere is the best around.  Yes, you'll easily drop $100 for two people, but if you're in the mood for fancy pants food then this is the place to go!  It's so nice to have a place like this near Mill that isn't filled with the college/frat crowd. Us adults need love too.

Fj7nV4ftJzn6mfMvomtiNA.text: This place is hands down a must go to in the downtown Tempe area. Service is always spot on and the food is a little pricy but for good reason. Cocktail list is A+ and the patio is awesome.

FR6XIrHxLAGdVSiLOat6fw.text: The food, location, and ambiance are all great. This really is a top-notch place to sit and enjoy a meal when the weather is nice. It is expensive, yes, but worth coming to for special occasions. I wouldn't eat here regularly, so if you're looking for something like that, this probably isn't the place.  All that being said, the service was quite bad, and if you're gonna charge that much for dinner, it seems like you should provide good service. This was my first time here, so maybe it was just a fluke, but both the bartenders and our waiter were really inattentive. We stood at the bar for quite awhile waiting for someone to even glance in our direction, and there were several people working. Then our waiter was nice enough when we were seated and he took our orders, but then he completely disappeared. He never once refilled our waters or asked if we wanted more drinks. We finally got a busser to refill our waters after everyone had finished eating, and only then did our waiter reappear to give us the check. By that point no one wanted dessert or coffee, which probably would've been delicious, but we didn't feel encouraged to stay. I would come back, so hopefully the service is better next time.

YLU9hdx9lR1SaPF-5KvovA.text: Consistency is the name of the game here. House of Tricks always delights in so many ways. From the quaint and beautiful patio to the the presentation of the food,, this place always delivers. Albeit, the service may sometimes be slow but its definitely worth the wait. Some go to items are the salmon salad and the meatloaf..  Btw if you are afraid of this classic, think again, take the leftovers home and make a sammie on rye, if you have it. Love this place. Obsessed!!!

4Bc8_QvLSnYPE697LkeN0g.text: HOT hosts out Christmas party every year.  Usually for 25-35 people.  They just nail it every year.  The food is fantastic and the service is great.  They are willing to do whatever it takes to make our experience a great one.   You will not be disappointed!

-p8tWYi17MO2kDzrkLi6MQ.text: This lively restaurant with plenty of outdoor seating is located within close proximity to ASU. My friend and I arrived at 6 o'clock and free parking wasn't hard to find and were able to get one of their outdoor tables without reservation. After consulting with our waittress (who literally guaranteed that everything on the menu was really good, particularly for the carrot cheese cake)...we ordered:  appetizers: pork belly and scallops main dishes: rag pasta + veal (weird looking pasta but veal meant was very tender) and pork belly dessert: carrot cheesecake and salted caramel bread pudding wine + soda Total for these dishes above came to $106 without tax.  The notable dishes were scallops (looked and tasted curry like but with relatively small portions, it wasn't too much or too little to have!)...and salted caramel bread pudding (my friend and I have been having bread pudding from different restaurants in the past 3 days, and we agreed this one tasted among the best). Rag pasta also had very interesting texture (probably due to its interesting shape) when chewed in my mouth (in a good way). However, I was sort of disappointed that the carrot cheesecake was WAYYYYYYYY too sweet...even without the frosting....  One of the things we had with this restaurant was more on plating issues. The way this restaurant plates their dishes seem a bit random. The dessert plate (that came with our cheesecake was too long (the plate was the long one that should have been used for 3 items plating rather than 1 cheesecake) also, the plates they brought for us to share looked completely all 3 different occasions times waitresses bring them. They definitely need to work on details such as plating consistency and appropriateness (wow...don't I sound like a food snob now?!!?)... :)

xDiIIDcEMxk9aLSvjFshjg.text: I've only been to House of Tricks once, so you can take my review with a grain of salt if you want!   We came to eat with a party of 6, and I was really impressed with the atmosphere and wait staff. Being a non-AZ visitor, obviously I was in love with sitting outside by the firepit in December. The waiters always made sure we had full water glasses and drinks, but they were careful not to be in the way or too obtrusive - clearly well trained. Everyone was super happy with their waiter-guided wine choices and cocktails.  I ordered the scallops appetizer, and the salmon entree. My husband had the mussels appetizer and the lamb entree (I assume this rotates regularly). Everything was absolutely *to die* for. I will say that the mussels were enough to be an entree in themselves! The scallops were some of the best cooked I've ever had.  definitely a little pricey, but worth it for a date night (or when you're parents visit!)

D7DOAyiTsWo1SLpk-NAL-w.text: We had my best friend's bridal shower here. The patio is gorgeous and the food is delicious. Staff is great. Ask for Lee or Kayla. They were so helpful, polite and professional.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. The staff helped us decorate for a bridal shower.

5HJifSLdmCojaBtLUUTf7Q.text: New Zealand lamb and the salted caramel bread pudding.   I was left grunting with happiness.   Twice.   Nothing more to say, except come here.   More than once.   Life becomes that much better when you do.

Cekvly0OZXpYNsZWfXzUMQ.text: My observations: Great date/couples/celebration pick.   Tips: Make reservations. You'd think on a Tue night on a week with no major sporting events or otherwise going on, you'd be able to grab a table without waiting, wrong. It was a 20 min wait, which is fine if i was in NYC or SF, or even Seattle, but in Tempe?!? Luckily there was space at the bar for us to wait until our table was ready.  Staff was a bit slow (but is not reflected in my 4-star, because company was good, so I'm not as irritated as I would have been).   Their charcuterie is worth checking out - it was a great start to our meal.

5H6OaztvQvbSg_Ii2VPFRw.text: Great ahi tuna ap and that is coming from a coastal dweller! Great outdoor seating area and outdoor bar. It is large and rambling but still manages to feel intimate. The wine list is extensive and pretty good and the waitress was very friendly and accommodating. The bison meat loaf was really neat, and the rainbow carrots really made it feel special. I had the tenderloin which was perfectly cooked to medium rare. We had a great time. Would definitely go here again!

0hr1WqyhftPKzTfVpy9gPw.text: Food is amazing, specials were killer, beef short ribs, blue cheese mash, poke appetizer. Service was awesome, all good. #amazingfood

LA5LlWxDQB4_FmMBqVlcpQ.text: This was my second visit to House of Tricks. As usual the food and service were outstanding. The House of Tricks is halfway between Sedona and Tucson. This is my friend and my "Command Central" for getting together. We love the outdoor patio ambiance and masterful, artisan cuisine that is a stylish departure from a traditional restaurant. Generous portions and excellent prices. We love this restaurant and will be returning.

BAPRgysm5pnMFRgBK-7edA.text: First time there on Friday November 3. Food was good, not great. Had bison meatloaf which was good but the tomato chutney on it was so over salty it was uneditable.  Wife had the chicken which she enjoyed. Took a long time for initial service. Will probably give it another try but not too many more.

QzEPhQiKW1oYNdG4lbAb4g.text: Great food, great ambiance, and knowledgeable staff. Love this place. Probably been here a half dozen times over the years for lunch and dinner and it's always new and innovative and delish!

B14_7GnBXG9F40SMMtn0EA.text: Just went here for a department lunch. Good on so many levels! I loved the charming atmosphere, loved the decor; heck, I even loved the way the place smelled (like a wood-burning stove)! The food was superb. I had the pork pastrami sandwich. It was delicious! I also had two scoops of gelato, which was also quite tasty! My coworkers also really liked their food. We definitely plan to come back here again!!

2v1IFURLCNmUdIITnVB4Qw.text: At first, my boyfriend and I were a little intimidated by the menu, but the food was delicious! Service was great too. I recommend the crispy chickpea salad! We also had the fish of the day, which was flaky and perfectly cooked.  Don't be afraid to try something out of your comfort zone. Everything we tried was great.

Shipxl0q8GGuUj0hbBhlOA.text: I am visiting from out of town and a colleague from Phoenix recommended this spot. The place was bustling at lunch. Four of us sat at a bar table, which had no wait. A friend and I shared the BLT, which is made on CORNBREAD - amazing - and split the beef tenderloin salad. The atmosphere is fantastic. I'll return on my next trip.

JJbxdbVN3Z4-Nl_4Qws02g.text: My husband and I love to try new restaurants, and this one had great reviews and piqued my interest.  Started out by using the SeatMe option on Yelp.   That worked great, our table was ready and waiting for us, AND I had mentioned it was our anniversary on the reservation, so our very capable server brought us complimentary sparkling wine for us to toast each other with.  We started with the wild boar appetizer for my husband and scallops for me.   Both delicious and plated beautifully.  My scallops were perfectly seared and the boar was very tasty.   We had been provided with a bread basket beforehand, which was FULL of bread.   Others have reviewed the bread negatively, but we thought It was tasty, as was the butter.   That being said, I would prefer the bread be warm rather than cold which would also make the butter easier to spread.  We both ordered wine, mine was white and was one of the local AZ choices, Provisioner, I believe, and it was crisp and lovely.  My husband asked for a suggestion from the server for a red, I can't remember which one he went with, but he was very happy with the suggestion.   Next came our entrees.  My husband ordered lamb, which he loved.  He said it melted in his mouth.  I had  the 14 ounce pork chop which came with red potatoes and an apple mustard something or other glaze that was out of this world.   So HUGE, though, I had a  box prepared to go.     Now on to dessert, since it was our anniversary of COURSE we had to get one to share.  We went with the apple bread pudding with caramel sauce and cinnamon whip cream which was HUGE and wonderfully creamy and delicious.   It was an amazing dessert and an anniversary to remember.  Would definitely go back!

i83mQGpAXia5Axxe0zmOag.text: I've had lunch here several times and was always good. For our anniversary I decided to take my wife for dinner...The bread was rubbery and cold, I guess that was a warning. We ordered the smoked wild boar to share, very nicely plated, unfortunately the flour tortillas were sticking to each other and soggy with the juices from the meat. I ordered the pork Osso Buco and the meat was good but expected it to be exceptional for the price and place, in addition the shaved gruyere was missing and the snap peas were very tough and stringy. My wife ordered the fish of the day, opah, with potato gratin, was very good but portion was tiny. Finally we finished with the apple and bread pudding, was tasty but dry, lacking the moist creamy texture. Overall this place is overpriced for its not so exceptional quality and taste.

n3k53pPsjMfmzDLD9m87-g.text: Made reservations using the Yelp Seatme feature and it worked perfectly. Ate outside on the patio and it had wonderful ambiance. The service was very attentive throughout the evening. Our server, Siobhon, made excellent menu suggestions and guided us to some wonderful choices. The trout was moist and delicious. The lamb was flavorful. My husband had the soup of the day and practically licked the bowl.   The only negative was the flourless turtle cake was a little dry. But when we mentioned that they took it off the check (keeping that 5 star rating)!

akbN8Jqpx7n09UVXD3bERA.text: Ok, so I discussed it with my dad, and decided to give this place four stars ( I was going to give it five stars, but he convinced me that it wasn't 'special' enough to get five stars and then I decided that I would need to go again before making that decision.   Anyway, I met my dad here for lunch yesterday at around 11:30 and the place had some customers, but wasn't crazy busy. We sat outside, and that was very nice. We decided to split the caesar salad with chicken and the chicken sandwich with the goat cheese and fig jam. The caesar was really good, the dressing tasted excellent and was tossed perfectly, and the chicken was also very flavorful, but the whole thing still had a light quality to it. It was tasty. The sandwich was also very good. I could taste each ingredient, which I like, the bread was good, crispy but soft at the same time, and the combo of flavors was really great. Also, the service was excellent, my water was never empty.   So I would most definitely come back here. I just think I need to try dinner here and some more complex dishes than what I got before I can give it five stars, but honestly, as far as sandwich places go, I liked this very much, better than pane bianco.

ZIrX2Qs-3UGlraqks_S_8w.text: The best thing about this place is the atmosphere. What a wonderful dining experience especially for a special occasion. I was sending a friend off so it was a perfect place for a goodbye. The service was excellent.

diuh1kXi729T9_taVRvPoA.text: This is my favorite place to eat in the city. I love this place. The food is fantastic. The service is perfect. And the atmosphere is wonderful. I like to eat here when the weather is warm but not too hot and you can sit outside. I have eaten here several times and have always enjoyed it immensely

fuDoWSlN4hH6VQ7UxAdJww.text: Eat at this place during my trip to Tempe, because it was recommended by a friend as being cutting edge and unique.  If by unique she meant eating a steak as tough as shoe leather, than she was right.  Not worth the time or cost

XhrrzVURquYRo9RI5sLGjA.text: Great atmosphere and food.  We love food and the Lamb shank and the mussels were great. We would definitely go back the next time we are in Phoenix!

lurVAoxYxpDCzgEesZcSlA.text: House of Tricks never disappoints! We went before a show at Gammage. We decided to eat indoors, which we had never done! Started with a wonderful mushroom ,chicken and rice soup. Enjoyed a Caesar salad, one of the best I've ever had. I ordered the Tenderloin (Med. rare and cooked to perfection) and my husband had the Salmon. Both were fabulous. Enjoyed Flourless Chocolate cake with vanilla gelato. It was to die for!! Highly recommend House of Tricks. I also recommend reservations

y-N39uQ6WioPbjQUoPtppg.text: Very cool outside seating.. Server was very knowledgeable and efficient. There were four of us dining, each having something different. Filet was cooked perfectly. My friends reported that the salmon, Maui mahi and meatloaf was very good. Overall a very nice experience!

nCul-E8uCEOIfj369bDACQ.text: I've never had a bad experience - this place is fabulous especially during the cooler months. The patio seating is like you're in another world, everything is done with so much care...  The salmon on risotto cake is my favorite - but again, everything I've had has been out of this world in regards to taste and texture....can't say enough - you have to try it!

hTbhgmjF_tcSce56zJFAIw.text: What a superb experience we had at House of Tricks. We went there based on yelp reviews and were so thrilled with the outdoor ambiance, service, and unbelievable food and wine. This is a must-do if around the Tempe area!

T1yXipw9qxqpr0_0CveFcQ.text: The best restaurant in Tempe. Never disappoints! Beautiful setting, delicious food. The outdoor patio seating is our favorite. Had the salmon this trip, it was perfect.

kOtjhPXjA99HfMG5Q7MJiw.text: My husband and I have been eating at House of Tricks for years on our annual Spring Training trip.   The menu is creative and the food is tasty.  I love the wine list too!  We took some of our clients there for dinner last week and it was perfect - beautiful setting, great service, lovely wine and food everyone loved.  I highly recommend it!

eZSl975iRk04UIgT-KvNog.text: This was a return visit after a few years --we don't live in the neighborhood.  We were celebrating my wife's birthday. First, the patio is fantastic...and the weather was perfect. Reservation at 8, arrived early and were seated by 8:10 (restaurant was full and bussers were behind, but hustling). We ordered a salad to split as an appetizer and it arrived promptly,  but our server dissappeared for quite a while. The salad plates had been cleared away before she returned to get our entree order. Then, we waited. And waited. And waited. My son's root beer was forgotten, along with my beer, both required follow-up with the server. After 40 minutes i asked if there was any sign of our food...server went in search. Another 5-10 minutes before we were served by our apologetic (she was consistently sweet) server. It was good, but, as my wife said, not "to die for." I haf the duck, my wife had the mahi mahi, and our 13 year old tried the cornish game hen. He was asking to stop for a burger on the way home. The manager came over after we ate and apologized, even adjusted our bill to make it up to us. We still had room for dessert, which were all very tasty - flourless torte, lavender cheesecake, and scoops of gelato. Luckily we didn't get towed...as we returned to the pay lot well after our 2 hours had expired.

gyv5TxL4kbM9zG2xiZudFQ.text: If you're looking for a nice dinner in Tempe, this is your location.  We had heard of it on various occasions but finally went with friends when they recommended it.  Everything was fantastic.  The service, the food, the drinks, the dessert.  It was one of the best meals I've had in the valley.  I am now obsessed with their house infused vanilla bourbon.  I want to keep it in my house and keep on seeking an excuse to go back to HoT for that very drink.  They have a beautiful outdoor dining area which is perfect if the weather is ideal.  We went on a humid and hot night and preferred to be in a/c.  Luckily with reservations that wasn't difficult to accommodate.

X7MyuvYjLw5_qYmjzCXncw.text: Not aging well.  I've been going to HoT on and off for years and it used to be ok but this last time the service was horrible, drinks tasteless, and food cold. I went last night with 3 friends and the place was a ghost town. Our waiters and waitresses were slow and seemed to have no training.  They reached across each of us every time they brought food or drink. We overpaid for a dismal and very mundane experience.

HU7HD5DTLmbFjuFcpt4mRw.text: My friends and I have been coming here for years. We save it for special occasions  only because its such a unique place and its so savory,both in food and service, we dont want it ever to become ordinary in our lives. Thank you for another wonderful memory!

cd1Yzwl7sPtTnsU9arS6OQ.text: We had a wonderful dining experience!  We were promptly seated at a great table outside.  We had an attentive, professional waiter (Thank you Ben for your wonderful service). And the food was excellent (selections chosen from the AZ Restaurant Week Menu).  We were a party of four, and had an absolutely wonderful evening.   Thank you House of Tricks!

PVepxxAqogF3ay7ng9Ql3w.text: a 'must dine' in Tempe!!  quaint historic property in Tempe tucked behind the hustle and bustle of Mill Ave.  The menu is a work of art.  The plate presentations are unique and appealing.  Their play on ingredients is masterful...the overgrown shade trees and string lights sets the atmosphere for the indulgent menu. Absolutely charming...one of the few historic original 'homes' in that area....look forward to dining again.  Not just a 'meal'.  but a culinary experience.  The only area I feel lacks slightly is the service.

AuVMgbrgcRT3ySHQH9kn4A.text: My boyfriend took me to House of Tricks the weekend after Valentine's day for lunch.  We had heard there was a wait so we got there early which was really nice because there was no wait and barely anyone there. Their menu is full of delicious food.  The two of us both had trouble deciding what to order.  My boyfriend got the grilled chicken southwest pasta and I got the fruit chicken salad.  We ordered the artichoke dip as an appetizer.  All of the food was magnificent!  The portions were large and the taste was amazing!   The atmosphere is what really makes it.  The patio is quiet and full of flowers.  It wasn't super pretentious or over-priced.  It was tucked away and private. Overall, I really enjoyed it!

Y6LaFmR_RdtiSLtv6GslNA.text: Awesome food, great presentation, and wonderful outdoor dining expirence.

bDA_KDgO1Jpp4Rm1Gjs6Rw.text: Went to House of Tricks last night for the first time. Sat outside in the courtyard and the ambiance was fantastic. Based on a previous review I tried the Thai Mojito and it did not disappoint..... it was delicious.   Good, but not great, waitstaff and service. However, the food was the star of the evening --- it was excellent. Generous portions for the entrees and a unique selection of desserts. I had a great pumpkin cheesecake with cinnamon whipped cream.   I would definitely recommend this restaurant for a group or a nice romantic dinner.

UJVlqqKvbBCcVTNBmFADpw.text: I've been here several times and the food is always top notch.  Fine dining size portions and creativity are what you get here.  The patio is fantastic.  The service has never been what I consider to be exceptional, just average.  On this occasion we waited for about 8 minutes before anyone came and took our drink order.  We went there for restaurant week menu and the menu that was on the table was the wrong one.  Not a big deal just not something I expect.  Now, my pet peeve is when a restaurant that has such a nice menu and atmosphere serves me bread with cold hard butter.  How are you supposed to spread cold hard butter on your bread.  The server said they keep it in the cooler because if they didn't they couldn't scoop it to serve it. This tells me one thing.  They use crappy butter.  Good butter can be stored and should be served at room temp.  No real fine dining establishments will serve you hard butter that is not spreadable.  Other than that irritating me, the pork belly, flat iron, and carrot cake were great.

oSkDRIksJkqRbrV6oVK3IQ.text: My husband and I went to the House of Tricks last night for our 37th anniversary. I was really excited. The reviews were impressive. But,alas, I was disappointed. The hostess sat us in a quite room (which was really nice)., gave us the menus and wine list.  Our waiter came, he introduced himself, ... didn't ask if this was our first time at House of Tricks, have any questions about the menu, just  asked for our drink order and left. When he brought our drinks asked if we were ready to order, when we hesitated he said "I'll give you more time and LEFT'. A basket of cold bread was brought to us. Waiter returns and we ask him some questions about the menu, ordered soup and salad. Soup was lukewarm when it came, Salad was good. Waiter doesn't show up till we are done with this portion. He takes my salad plate, reaches across me takes the spoon that I had placed to my left and realigns the spoon on the left side of the table, takes the other fork and plops it into the plate (like I really committed a faux pas), let him know soup was only luke warm "Hmm.. sorry about that). We had several questions about items on the menu.  I don't like spicy/hot food. Those questions were answered with "You don't have to have that but no substitutions were forthcoming." Finally settled on the filet. Which was very good, the potatoes and spinach was just  ok.. nothing special. But the food was lukewarm when it was brought to us. After our meal he asked if there was anything else. We asked to see the dessert menu, I didn't have one in my little burgandy book... but they didn't sound appealing at all. THen as we were leaving I spotted a dessert tray, that actually had some good looking stuff on it. Over all I would not  recommend House of Tricks to anyone. It was mediocre at best. This will go down in the anniversary dining book as should have gone elsewhere.

rErvlfL0ScXHJSLAzYXltA.text: To die for food and the atmosphere is adorable. Great date night.

o9ZP-PQhXOufjaSlkbV9kg.text: I was really excited to come here since I have heard such great things. I will admit my expectations were pretty high. I started out with the beet salad. It was okay. Nothing special to talk about here. Then I had some fish, which I can't find on the menu presently. It may have been halibut, but it definitely was delicious. The dessert was also just blah. The portions were small, but since I had all three courses I was full. Would I go back? Nah. Our waiter was also pretty out of it.

hZRkCVKxB0GNjbQRErLmsA.text: We've been many times, mostly for special occasions over the years. The food is inventive and supremely well executed. Service is consistent. Wine list is terrific. So many places are "pay for where your sitting" as opposed to for "what your getting". It might not be cheap here, but you'll be satisfied every step of the way. Can't give them enough praise at this place.

Xibu-dtdXK2Vm1GgiEWy5Q.text: I was always interested in trying this restaurant because my husband had raved about it in the past but my experience was barely memorable.  I think the atmosphere is fantastic.  Great place to be outside for either lunch or dinner, however, the food was average and the service was terrible.  We were a party of 5 dining at lunch.  We were sat promptly but took at least 10 minutes for a server to greet us and take our drink order.  We ordered the Mediterranean Tapas Platter and that was really good and I'm not usually a big fan.  The presentation was great and the flavor combinations were also very good.  For my entree I ordered Toasted Green Chile Corn Bread BLT because it sounded amazing.  All the robust flavors and ingredients that were listed on the menu sounded like it would have been out of this world. Chili-Rubbed Bacon, Melted Havarti, Roasted Green Chiles,Bibb Lettuce Tomato and Mayo between a green chile corn bread bun. The bun was a little overwhelming, too rich and overtook the other flavors.  I felt it was lacking on the green chiles because they were few and far between.  I started to pick through my sandwich because it was too much and my lettuce wasn't fresh and there was very little on there.  I don't tend to complain on my reviews but I was disappointed.  Our server got my order incorrect and brought me the chive bacon potato salad and I wasn't impressed by that either.  I didn't bring it to her attention that I had ordered the pasta salad as a substitute because my daughter got that and it was saturated in dressing.
