Although we didn't want to get too full and sit for the play, we did indulge in a sorbet and a couple of gelato scoops. Everything was fresh, tasty and well-prepared. Our server was attentive and efficient aware that we were scooting off. Great go-to when we're in the area!

qx0pR5NbbgD7MvWssTmnng.text: We went to this restaurant to celebrate a birthday. It was the perfect place for that or any other special occasion. We all thought our food was delicious and the service was also top notch. Parking can be a problem but they have a parking lot behind the restaurant which truly helps. There's indoor seating as well as seating on their beautiful patio. And the sunset was amazing to watch. It was a little expensive but will definitely go here again when we're in town.  Cathy from Portland.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Tempe , AZ sunset.

l8YMqxbGq_-C-TFhGKoGvA.text: We had a reservation but still had to wait a while  to get seated even if the place was half full. Then they try to seat us by the stored heat lamps outside while plenty of tables were available. So we decided to go inside instead where we were seated in a room with only another couple. Not a very nice ambiance. Waitress was below average and busy serving a bigger party (that's what she told us). As for the food the Tuna was unusually cold (beside waiting forever for it) and we did mention it to our waitress. She said that she would tell the manager about it but never said anything about it when she came back. You just expect more when you spend over $150 for two on a couple of meals and a half bottle of wine. Too bad I had high expectations but this is one place that will never see me again.

648xLnZqW1XH19dsaiMC7A.text: One of my most favorite restaurants! I've been going for over 20 years. The outside patio is quaint & covered with greenery, from vines to flowers, white linen with simple lighting in the evening. Such a quaint vibe. The food is always exciting! Fresh & delightful! The servers are attentive and not interruptive. I always look forward to my next visit. The best restaurant in Tempe hands down!

wx8-4QAqSZGeMCnm2MWyNA.text: I don't know why i didnt write the review til now. This is my favorite restaurant at ASU. I probably went there more than 15times. The of them were during lunch time and their pasta and salmon salad are superb. I dont remember the name of the pasta but there is only one pasta on lunch menu. We alaways sat outside which has a jungle feel to it and has a good vibe. It is usually packed with people and u might want to make reservation ahead of time even though we never did and was just fine. The service has been usually good. BE ADVISED: it might not be good time to visit there for lunch, since there r some construction going on right across the restaurant.

mdaST_cWIpB_WyyURKK_yg.text: Great food and atmosphere. Especially, if you have your meal outside on the patio.  This patio is all shaded with beautiful old trees and different plants. Highly recommend.

RLes9wFYRmme5V9PVyVNzQ.text: I usually go here with a friend or two and we get a bottle of wine, and the seared salmon. If it's summer just go inside and enjoy the interior design and paints

18f4THDAokKZrYoRrBs_sA.text: One of my favorite dining experiences in Phoenix. Everything from the service, the food, and the ambiance was spot on. I was a little cautious when I saw the college town, but don't let that throw you off. It was a little cold out and I sat outside at the bar, I was promptly offered a blanket. What a nice touch!!  I ended up sitting next to two guests that were pretty familiar with the place. We ended up sharing food so I got to taste a lot and EVERYTHING was amazing. My favorite though was the mussels. I am a sucker for mussels but these were so unique. A creamy sauce with chorizo served with plenty of bread, YUM!!!!  I also ordered the bulgogi grilled cheese from happy hour. I tried from my new friends the special and the pork rilette which was also tasty. There were so many things I wanted to order.   For dessert I got something lighter. I went with the gelato/sorbet assortment. It was perfect. The bartender also gave me good hiking tips and was super personable.

Omxx7c6BTn4KcdnXPl8bPQ.text: Recently came here for dinner and love this place. The patio is absolutely beautiful and I love eating by the heating lamps to keep you warm on a cold night.   I had the house of trick cesar salad and their soup special of the day which was a chili.  Now you may thinking that very basic choices however they were both packed with flavor. The salad had amazing dressing that was made in house which gave a lot of flavor to this salad.  For drinks - I had the lawn chair which was fabulous. Highly recommend this restaurant if you are in town.

kU-m2Xop1jVGjZlaiiQw3g.text: Had the volcano shank and dear Lord was it absolutely amazing!  One of the top 5 dishes I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

hykXiDtPFviQbjyYHooq3w.text: Had an anniversary dinner. We started with the delicious, creamy, salty cheese dip. Will come back for this alone.  Had some drinks and for dinner we had the potato gnocchi and the bison meatloaf. Ended with ice cream.

UxWffG1mlJgv3bWTF9A-EA.text: We came here before before attending a live performance at ASU Gammage.  Great atmosphere and the food was phenomenal.  I felt like I was dining in my own backyard, right down to the tiny petals falling into my drink.  No flies and lots of shade.  Its a short walk to Mill Ave where you can continue to enjoy the rest of your evening.

AItXM2b9i1x6sPGs4sweFA.text: I have always loved this restaurant but the portions seem smaller, coffee was weak, and "special" lemon desert tasteless and dry. For $240 for 4 people  it should have been fantastic! Entrees at $29-$35 we should of at least had some free bread..or a salad. Bread was on the menu for $8. Overpriced for small portions drives me away. Plus we were jammed in the corner when there were tons of tables open and we had a reservation. Disappointed this time around.

zmX9y8leMw4-X8TSPLgUYw.text: This is my favorite restaurant, hands down. It has a really quaint atmosphere, located in the heart of downtown Tempe so you can walk around afterwards. Eat here.

QS3XLCubp87kjPkzcv1_LA.text: Went here for valentines dinner last year, and gotta say, it did not disappoint. Phenomenal meal, all prepared well, with tasteful presentation. If you're looking for an upscale date in Tempe, this place is the spot.  Pros: Menu options are broad and unique. Service is spot on. Ambiance is unique (it is in an old home) and has many outdoor options as well. Right on ASU's campus.  Cons: expensive, can be a wait, and many times you must reserve.  Overall, come here for an upscale meal in the Tempe area, and you won't regret it.

Cxh-I3pfJYb0vWIwFmDMLg.text: We love this please! I took my girlfriend here to celebrate her birthday. Our waitress was really sweet and helped make the birthday celebration special with a candle and champagne. The food was delicious, I had the bison meatloaf and she had the jerk seared ahi. Thank you House of Tricks for the delicious food and truly incredible service!

HE_tmuJMZO57Bt5UDztfzA.text: The food was good but pricy.  We went there (had reservations for 515p) before a show at Gammage and assume most fellow diners were doing the same.  Our waitress was obviously overworked.  We ordered drinks, and didn't see her or the drinks for at least 15 minutes.  We were one of the first parties there and one of the last to leave before the show.   Our waitress even said, "I guess you don't have time for dessert because you need to get to the show."  The food is good but the service is very uneven.

ED1CfSLJM06dEBsBNEdjwA.text: Whenever we see a show at ASU Gammage we always have dinner here before hand. You can always count on delicious food, wonderful staff and creative cocktails. Highly recommend this restaurant. When the weather permits the outdoor seating is the best!

gsle5vXQ0kN30RHXMgvSIg.text: Went here a few weeks ago and was pleasantly surprised! I didn't think it would be so nice. A cute patio, perfect for an October evening. Service was good, and lots of vegetarian options I could have! The entrees were a little pricey, but the appetizers weren't bad, so we got appetizers as our meal! I got a cheese plate and omg so good. It came with noble bread, 5 different cheeses, honey, and grapes. I couldn't even finish it haha but I loved the variety and you could tell all of the cheeses were great quality. I'd love to come back and try a drink sometime. Really awesome place!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Artisan Cheese Plate

dGwVRX6DGPwZfDohHCLXBA.text: House of Tricks has always been a staple... tonight they broke my heart a little. Tiny table too squeezed into a corner... loud... hot. Mussels were good..tuna was average at best. Not even worth finishing... average service... desert was an inedible brick. They did the right thing by taking it off the bill. There is so much amazing food in Phoenix. We won't go back.

1zC6uc7VCcxhrvx9f7W12w.text: Love this spot.  Nice go to restaurant for a date night.  When it's not so hot outside, I love sitting on the patio.  Definitely check this place out.

2bSlKGzVUNQ88JJO97pC9g.text: Best pork is have ever had. Honestly. The meat was cooked to tender perfection and had a sweet sauce that made it incredible.  Took my wife here for a romantic anniversary dinner and we both were very happy with the venue. Got to sit out on the patio with space heaters and watch the sun set.  I would highly recommend this place for a nice evening out!

ItIBG8-cuA2xOWKyubtx9Q.text: This was a fantastic experience! Highly recommend House of Tricks for a special occasion...our server was attentive, friendly and informative and the food was excellent. Our group of 7 shared the charcuterie plate and a cheese plate which were both great. I had the duck breast for dinner which was perfectly cooked, and also got to try a bite of the meatloaf (so flavorful!).  As a bonus, the restaurants have a couple outdoor cats that are super cute and will sit by your feet during dinner! They'll stay a little longer if you feed them a bite of something tasty (our server said it's okay to do).

JMFFnlA8gLoaKM7RSP0oSw.text: Great place to come for a graduation celebration! The bartender is fantastic and the service here is top notch. The food is delicious and unique. Love this charming little place; it's full of delight and character. Stop by the bar and say hi to Clay, the bartender, he will be sure to make you a fine drink and take a great shot. Ben, also a bartender, is full of wit and great suggestions- be sure to ask him for his favorite item of the menu. Axel is the wine specialist so if you need pairings or suggestions in love he is your main connect. Come visit this charming place.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

U6JqLg5oGOWHPaNPUX91xA.text: I came here because I was in town from LA and trying to find quality food in Tempe, and this place more or less hit the spot! It's an "upscale" vibe in that the waiters announce every dish and wear white button-ups, but everyone dresses pretty casually. Kind of a Kanye-wears-sweats-to-Nobu kinda vibe.   My favorite part of the meal was my waitress, Siobhon! She was so friendly and personable it made me want to like the food. None of the entrees stood out to me so I got a bunch of starters:  Scallops - really delicious, light and had depth of flavor. Scallops were cooked perfectly and it made me really glad I was eating alone because there were only two of them. The hollandaise sauce it came with was really good, and the blue corn on the bottom of the scallops was a great touch!   Duck confit - for whatever reason they made it into an okonomiyaki (Japanese savory pancake). It was too salty and I got sick of the flavor quite quickly.   Mussels - it comes in a "creamy sauce" that's reminiscent of a butter chicken sauce and there's chorizo at the bottom. I didn't think the chorizo worked in the dish at all, and I would've liked more tomatoes, mussels, and maybe some lime to lighten up the dish. Comes with 3 enormous bread pieces.   Dessert special - a cream puff with chocolate spread and fresh strawberries with whipped cream on top. The chocolate was heavy for me so I skipped it, but otherwise I thought it was decent!  Overall I like that they try to be innovative with their menu, even if it doesn't always pan out. The staff are amazing and they clearly stick around because of the owners, who are also the restaurant's namesake.   This is not a bad dining choice considering this is an upscale restaurant in Tempe, Arizona. (Did I mention enough times that this is Arizona we are talking about?) I would recommend it because the service is so excellent and the owners seem open to feedback based on how they responded to other Yelp reviews.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. As of 5/2/2018

ToGST-8vsJPlrEPEXiayyA.text: Disappointed they didnt have our table set and ready when we made a reservation over 24 hours in advance.  The table and chairs were full of debris from the trees.  We ordered fish and my mahi mahi had to be sent back to the chef as it was raw inside on one end.  Thought it was unusual the server never asked how we wanted it prepared in the first place.  Management was not visible on my visit.  There are better options in Tempe especially for the money.  Prefer Kings Fish House, they ask how you want your fish grilled and they have two covered patio options.

chX3RrCCD2AEmbM4gvU-KA.text: My review is on Valentines Day night with my girl.  Arrived early so we could a cocktail at the bar. Great outdoor atmosphere for dinner, a perfect night. At 8pm sharp we were seated at out table, we ordered drinks and the Artisan Cheese plate which was amazing. I will simply come back to House of Tricks just for that!! I went out of my comfort zone and had the lamb shank which was incredible and filling!! My girl ordered the salmon which seemed a little on the small side for $30, it was like 6 bites of fish really. Now I have never been a fan of salmon, but she insisted I try it and Im glad I did, I don't know what they did to it, but it was finally a piece of salmon I enjoyed. Thanks for an incredible V-day dinner!!

zKiARAlKUsB61wcbEFuEPg.text: The only reason to go here is for the atmosphere of being in an Italian or French outdoor cafe among trees and shrubbery!  I've been at 5 Star restaurants around the world and with these prices I expected the best!  The bread was uneatable, tiny slices of what seemed like bread that hadn't been baked long enough and was cold, plus, the real sign in my book that the management isn't concerned with details, the butter spread was hard, not spreadable.  What!?! If you can't get the basics right, what's the rest of the meal gonna be like.  Well, the House salad was fresh and tasty, however I ordered the scallops and the way it was described with carrots and another garnish, and that the waitress said they were quite large, was NOT the way it came; two teeny-weeny scallops.  When I made the reservation they asked if it was a special occasion and I thought, oh good, it was my friend's birthday, they probably do something special for that.  When it came time for dessert, the waitress brought the menu for us to choose and my friend oh how nice, we get to choose the complementary item.  Oh no, she said you'd have to pay for it.  What?  I said, you do nothing for a birthday?  Well, she said we put a candle on whatever you choose.   Oh and if you sit outside, the chairs are so unbearably uncomfortable, I had to go to my car to get some pillows! How this restaurant ever got 4 stars is beyond me.  Some of my local non-descript favorite restaurants in the area are soooooooooooo much better and much less expensive.  Never going back.

SLwRAII7fTeULp8BO7yKpA.text: The environment of this restaurant is so charming and the food is delicious. Staff was very friendly and there was a nice crowd. I had the tuna melt, it was a gourmet spin on an old favorite, and it was delicious! Will def be back to keep sampling the menu.

BUhLBLc9UfRJiD9LknPjbg.text: Great food great service. Love the building as well. Seared tuna was fantastic as was the spicy short ribs!

kpuqrMz0ANPAzhqAu9riKg.text: What happened? I hadn't been to House of Tricks in years when four of us decided to go there for lunch. The service was still friendly but it started out badly. Despite our reservations we were seated in the middle of traffic near the kitchen. Not the worst thing but more of an omen of things to come. The Bloody Mary I ordered was too spicy for me but there was no offer to adjust the heat. Instead our waitress said "I can bring you tomato juice."  The cheese and fruit plate was a bad joke. There was barely any cheese or nuts or fruit. The dishes we ordered were all disappointingly mediocre at best. I don't think any of us took home leftovers though there was plenty left on our plates. House of Tricks used to be wonderful. I won't go back.

kftuYLuUqblwNB8heqLLyg.text: First of all.. this is a beautiful little cottage with an outstanding patio that is just beautiful. Love the little tea lights,,white table clothes. Plants and trees. Very romantic with perfect ambience. Our server was great, very pleasant , and knowledgeable about the wines. I had an exceptional Chardonnay. Ok now for the downfall, it was my sisters birthday and she ordered the Cornish game hen. Very salty and skin was burnt. Our server did offer another dish but my sister declined. The cheese platter which we ordered as an appetizer was very uneventful and sparse! Only offered 4 to 5 cheeses some nuts and 5 grapes! No other fruit that they show in pictures that other patrons have taken. All of our main entrees for the price, which is extremely expensive, just didn't make the grade, with the exception of the beef tenderloin, which my daughter ordered. She enjoyed that very much. All in all this was very disappointing. I was looking forward to coming to this quaint little gem in Tempe, but I'm not sure that I'll be back.

m0EA2stCwyQ3eMx6XWHXoQ.text: As a highly recommended place, we decided to have our first visit. They assigned us a very nice table and a great server, very attentive and always smiling. My wife had Kale salad and portobello entree. I had clam chowder and pork chop. Food was really delicious and portions  were generous enough so no space for dessert. Next time in Phoenix, will certainly try to dine here.

48EhCOWh8AEEtmKCuZKwfw.text: We had an 11:00 am reservation and we arrived a few minutes early, along with a number of folks including an elderly woman.   The Hostess working Saturday morning had a rotten disposition and although it was 10:57 refused to seat anyone until exactly 11:00 while she stood behind her podium doing nothing. That was strike one.   The restaurant has a fountain with two koi fish floating in barely 6 inches of water. Strike two.   Although our waitress was great, the food, while decent, wasn't fantastic. It was ok.   We won't be returning, mainly because of the scowling hostess.

U25_FH8UBM1KVC1xqTE_xQ.text: Fantastic food, minus 1 star for hair in food and no apology from any staff member and a very MIA waitress

kmlTPvVHzhvV4ASz_c9abg.text: The reservation was for 7:45. The meal order was taken at 8:30 for drinks. Our meal was delivered at 9:10 pm, cold. I feel horrible for the servers. Lack of kitchen inefficiently.  The black cat on the patio was the best part of the evening. Not returning.

GbOwWUxvHYOi80bBApp2vA.text: Pretty generic kind of dining place. It's not like the food was any bad but this could have been any other American food place. Standard fare of appetizers, salads soups and main course. The stuff on the main course was the standard fish white meat and red meat. No vegetarian fare. Really can't give this very standard places any higher score.

CoJ9VT2E4EOnfLZnC3Ag_A.text: What a find! I was so impressed with the variety of options with soups/salads, appetizers, and entrees. I had the kale salad and blackened ahi. The presentation was beautiful, the flavors were delicious, and the service was on point.

VCNUTkYIpbmkjRzSYacRlg.text: The food was great!  I loved the ambience.  I will sit outside next time.  I had the meatloaf and the flavors were very nice.

BnQ8SiRPoV0SVhr9LCiqmg.text: The staff was wonderfully accommodating and attentive. We came to House of Tricks for Restaurant Week.   For starters we had Scallops with squid ink caviar and the Apple frisee salad. The entrees were, Sauteed Shrimp, Bacon and Sweet Peppers on a Lacy Corn Cakes with Bourbon Creme Fraiche and Confit Mango and Sierra Nevada Mustard Braised Rabbit Leg and Golden Beet Gnocchi with Aged Balsamic Vinegar Reduction and Crispy Kale. For Dessert, Salame di Cioccolato and Espresso Gelato with Hazelnut Brittle and Sugar Crusted Moist Butter Cake with Blackberry Compote and Granola Crumble  The scallop was well prepared and the ink caviar was interesting. It was a little fishy smelling, but that is squid ink afterall.  The Apple Frisee salad was very very good. Of particular note were the toasted hazelnuts which provided a nice textural contrast and that wonderful crunch.  The sweet and tart contrast in the salad was expertly constructed.  The entrees ordered were on the whole, very disappointing. We ordered the Rabbit leg and the sauteed shrimp.  The sauteed shrimp were inconsistently cooked. More that half of the shrimp were undercooked. The chef would do well to season the shrimp before cooking them. My God, a little salt even. This dish relied exclusively upon the Bourbon Creme Fraiche for flavor. But the fraiche was too oily and left a slickness on the palate.  I didn't even notice any bacon or sweet peppers flavors in this dish. The dish needs some heat to bring it home.  The other dish,  Sierra Nevada Mustard Braised Rabbit Leg and Golden Beet Gnocchi with Aged Balsamic Vinegar Reduction and Crispy Kale. The only redeeming part of this dish were the Golden Beet Gnocchi. The Gnocchi was expertly seasoned and prepared. The Rabbit was unfortunately terribly under seasoned and dry.  The Salame di Cioccolato was nice.  The Salame was more akin to fudge. It incorporated some great flavors. A subtle taste of amaretto, though it wasn't listed. The Espresso Gelato was smooth and flavorful. The brittle was the star. Brillant.  The Sugar Crusted Moist Butter Cake with Blackberry Compote and Granola Crumble was something my aunt Mable would bring to a potluck. The "Moist Butter Cake" was neither moist  nor buttery. The cake could have been from Sara Lee, but I'm not sure The blackberry compote was uncomplicated and could have come out of a can. The coup de gras was the lack of any granola crumble.  Again, the wait staff was exceptional. The chef needs to watch the Food Channel.

OASP8KgCXVZTzBNCB8htyQ.text: Pretty much every aspect of the dining experience here was exceptional, but what stood out the most was the outdoor seating area. Sitting outside on a warm night in late March with blooming flowers and greenery all around made for a sweet smelling, calming, and relaxing atmosphere.   Our waitress was incredibly patient (but maybe I say that because my standards have been skewed from living in New York), the food was delicious (I ordered the pesto pasta and there must have been 100 basil leaves in the sauce, it was so flavorful), and the beer list was diverse.   I would come back here for a special occasion dinner.

BOGFp-CokUDID0jvvaF2mg.text: Savored the Ono "Fish of the Day" menu.  Served with goat cheese scalloped potatoes. Malt vinegar syrup with fish was perfect.  service is awesome as always. Finished our meal with Pistachio Date Apple crisp, another dessert special.  I'd provide pix but we were in the outdoor patio and it was too dim.  We had to use our phones to read the menu. the place was buzzing for dinner service, luckily we didn't have to wait for a table.  I recommend making reservations ahead of time. Make this place to take your special guests for dinner.  In the heart of ASU campus, minus the students. Pricey according to Yelp, but worth every penny!

P20NTXCen941EkM_fNDNZQ.text: Great place! Chef Scott come out to visit as he saw the KU hat and as a Kansas boy he had to stop by. Our server Josh was such a pro, to bad he will be gone until September as he holds a "real job" and takes Summer's off from serving. Food was exceptional, dare I say the best I have had since moving to Phoenix from KC. The ambiance was great and was super charming with the mis matched plates. We let Josh pick our wine as he is from Sonoma and it was spectacular. If I just find a fault I will say I have had better deserts but they were not bad just not as good as the food!

0YHNpHIroPkPCrDpb6B74g.text: After reading some very good reviews we decided to come here for dinner and we made a reservation. Our impression on arrival however was not a good one. The hostess was opposite of friendly. She seemed stressed and in a bad mood and I have no idea why because they weren't busy at all.  We were seated and at first I was thrilled with our table. It was private and placed between two trees. I soon realized it was not so peachy when the wait staff kept using it as a walkway. It was a tight space and each time they slid through I thought they were going to bump my arm. It was so annoying!    FOOD- just alright. I had the tagliatelle pasta and it was so saucy with way too much pesto. Disappointing.  SERVICE- she started off well and then towards the end was very slow and not attentive.    All in all the experience was not that great and I would say try somewhere else as this restaurant seems hit or miss. Also,it is pricey so you would think they would have excellent staff to give their customers a nice experience from start to finish, part of what you are paying for correct?

v0RWhkujARbrBfHV7amxuQ.text: While in Tempe for some spring training games, my husband and I came here for our anniversary dinner.  We arrived a bit early for our reserved time so we found a nice spot at the bar for a cocktail.  I ordered a house specialty called a "Crunchy Squirrel."  Weird name, strange taste.  Shoulda known better.  The atmosphere is pretty nice on the candle-lit patio, but they have to provide flashlights so you can read the menu. Good thing we showered and changed after the game because it wasn't what I would classify as "casual" attire. Most people were dressed in nice date-night attire like us.  By the time I finished my squirrelly drink, the sweet little hostess had tracked us down to seat us. (She was the friendliest staff person we encountered all  evening.) She gave us what seemed to be a pretty nice, intimate little table, but as the evening grew cooler and a little breezy, it became clear that we were too far from the heaters.   Our server was very professional but not overly friendly. He had to read the specials from a cheat sheet which didn't seem very knowledgeable or enthusiastic. Our food came out relatively quick but to my disappointment, it was only luke warm and I am a stickler about eating my food HOT. Nevertheless, we both enjoyed our small, expensive portions of grilled salmon and lobster.  Presentation was very nice, but as for taste, the entrees were "okay." Not bad, but not mouth-wateringly yummy, either.  Especially for the prices. Since we were still hungry, we ordered some delish decadent desserts. They were much tastier than the dinner.  Overall, I'd say this is a nice place to come for drinks and/or dessert, but the dinner was a bit disappointing.

MXvENbZ2FS-9YcRIWdim5Q.text: The food comes out looking like a picture and is as delicious as it looks. Service was wonderful!

l7fw0iRxHuJ6u1a620WiUg.text: Romantic, outdoor eatery, complete with the christmas lights and all the ambiance associated with high dollar ticket entrees found on Sunset Blvd..  This one gets 1 star bcause of the food having some decent flavor. The other four stars were dropped because of the gigantic cockroach that was hiding beneath my plate.   What!!??? I know you are wondering what happened, well here is the story. Eating dinner nice and peacefully, nearly finishing up and the waiter comes over to snag my plate to wrap up my leftovers. As he picks up the plate the GIGANTIC cockroach makes an appearance running across the table cloth towards my lap. I jump from the table and my seat, the waiter swept the cockroach onto the ground. ......okay now wait for the ultimate response from the waiter!!!  "That's what happens when you eat outside"  Nothing was offered in compensation for the "gigantic cockroaching."  Beware of the unprofessional service and the unlikely bedfellows!

K0k4lWX_VBFikQS7V2sPjw.text: Love the space and have many fantastic baby and wedding showers here. Lunch is high end at a reasonable price. Dinner is a bit pricey.  Such a hidden gem

TpxkvfBd8-0qlsTKkniVag.text: Scrumptious!  How to dine at HOT:  +The food is delicious and fantastic so order everything on the menu once and then repeat  +The service is lackluster and leaves much to be desired.  Make sure you have some leisurely time or let the staff know from the beginning you are on a time crunch  +Go to lunch to sample a few things for a great deal  +Go to dinner to splurge for a special occasion  +Bring quarters for the meters in the daytime  +Order the Chicken Schwarma Salad - you won't regret it and you'll think about it often  +Check out the daily quiche offering - it's all the rave  +Enjoy

ANUCNkDsYH_8Fjl7Ku4SZA.text: Came here on while on business in Arizona.  Located right near ASU stadium, we stopped in before taking in a basketball game.  It was a rare cold night so we ate inside.  Good bottled beers on the menu, some fantastic wines as well.  Very cozy and dimly lit.  Great place for a date, too bad I was with my boss.  I had the gnocchi and it was tasty.  Not sure I would recommend this place, but we had a nice, quiet evening with good food, so I can't complain.

gRcf7tuSJy9nQwo88KAjYg.text: Understaffed...but they nailed it! Perfect food and atmosphere right off Mill. I will definitely frequent this place.

IKT3O-FfUGkhwZhBTbEJ7A.text: Went here for lunch ordered the Pecan Smoked Salmon with Avocado Puree, Red Onion, Lemon-Caper Crema, and Olive Tapenade. It was only $10. I would have paid $20. It was spectacular! I also got the Chili Rubbed Hanger Steak and Asadero Cheese Stuffed Tortillas with Roasted Ancho Guajillo Sauce, Avocado Puree and Cilantro Rice   It was $13. It was tremendous. My friend got Grilled Salmon and Baby Lettuce with Sweet Roasted Peppers, Cherry Tomatoes, Fresh Avocado,  Chive Risotto Cake, Tortilla Strips and Chipotle-Grapefruit Vinaigrette.    It was only $12. I think this restaurant is the best in Scottsdale. This comes from a real foodie. The service was 5 star! Off course the outdoor patio was stunning but mesquite leaves kept falling in the food. It was super windy that day. Make sure you are seated under an umbrella!

0KGq-QBoTY5b_RH4_3HBIg.text: Just go.  Unbelievable duck tacos, sublime filet (really how does one make onion rings so good you want more? same for the grits, good grits-WTF?).  Fiance said lamb was so good she didn't know that lamb was supposed to taste like that.  Service great, attentive without being a pain.  Sit outside if you can, inside is noisy and small but smells really good as the kitchen is pretty open (no doors between it and dining).  This was top 3 in my memorable dining experience. ( Everyone has a bad day I guess, hence some of the bad reviews, but go. )

LmqLtO7YQfrFDEFZW69d0Q.text: For my inlaws last evening here in the Valley, we went to House of Tricks in Tempe because they wanted to try it based on a recommendation of one of their friends back in Ohio.  The patio area is really pretty and we were lucky to get a table toward the back of the patio because it was a tad more secluded and we had better views of the beautiful flowers in the garden. The only bad thing about the location was there was not a light overhead like other tables on the patio so you had to hold your menu up to the candlelight to read it.  The wine list is quite extensive, but we decided to go simple and had the Columbia Valley Riesling which was crisp and smooth. For appetizers we had the cheese plate and the mushroom flan.  My inlaws loved the flan and said it had good flavor. The cheese plate was delicious...their was blue cheese, brie, and two other cheeses.  All were very nice and there was a nice amount of apples, grapes, and strawberries as well.  For dinner, I had a caesar salad and the scallop appetizer. The salad was a perfect size and the dressing was really nice and had a good garlic kick without being overpowering.  The scallops were fine...not to die for or worth ordering again, but not bad. There was a little broth on the plate that was very tasty. I could have done without the lima beans that accompanied it.  My husband had the sea bass (it comes de-boned for you) which he enjoyed; my father in law had the salmon based on their friend's recommendation which he liked a lot; and my mother in law had the duck which she liked, but she did not enjoy the blackberry vinagrette that came with it.  We tried two desserts, the apple crisp and the triple mousse tower, and both were excellent.  For two appetizers, four meals, two desserts, and 2 bottles of wine, our bill came to $195 before tip.  Our waitress was very nice but service was very slow and not up to par with what you would expect at a place with the level of prices that House of Tricks has.  My other negative about HOT is that it is loud when you sit outside. Between the mosque music, the traffic on the streets around HOT, and some other random noises from the immediate area, it is very distracting and takes away from the atmosphere and sereneness of the restaurant.

-KwR9xoWrgkwCrjY2xdLiA.text: We are not from Arizona but wanted some good fresh food which didn't have to thawed before cooking. We weren't disappointed at all!  The food was excellent and the server Danny was very efficient.  We are discussing coming back again before we leave Phoenix as we would like to try some of the other entrees.  We recommend this location without reservation!

2Ctfb43QDyi7TnwQ5ozLCw.text: The name is so misleading, because this is the most charming dining spot I've ever eaten!   I dined here for lunch with a friend and was blown away by everything about it. First, it's location is tucked away near ASU campus in a quiet little neighborhood. It appears to be a converted home built in the early 1900's and lots of beautiful mature trees and plants growing in their huge, and I mean huge outdoor patio area. I only dined outside, but honestly with such beautiful weather 9 months out of the year here, why would you dine any other way!   The service was excellent! The staff was extremely attentive and always checked up on me while I drank water and waited a while for my friend. The menu was amazing. I never once read a menu that I wanted to try everything on here. They had a huge variety of dishes at what I can only describe as American/French fusion. It all looked so divine. And from what I've been told, their menu changes frequently to new seasonal dishes. So I can't wait to see what they offer when I return. I went simple with my meal having this delicious quiche, fresh fruit and a cup of their corn chowder soup. The soup was so rich and creamy, I could have ordered and ate a whole trough! It was that good. The fruit was clean, well portioned and fresh. I'm very particular with fruit, and hate when the fruit looks soggy and overly ripened. And the quiche was heavenly as well. Just the right amount of ham and tomatoes with alot of flavor.  Since I was here for lunch only, the prices were reasonable. I've heard at dinner it can get expensive.  This was an unforgettable dining experience and recommend this to everyone to try at least once.

QsWCnCTSExRMIYPIc-f_EQ.text: What the....? I've never yelped house of tricks? For shame! Some of the best meals I've ever had in tempe were at this mill ave. legend. Don't be thrown by the "mill ave." portion of my previous statement - it's far enough back from the p.f. chang's, cue clubs and fat tuesdays to keep the college crowd from interrupting your $34 filet with shouts of "jaegerbombers!" plus, the price point isn't exactly student-friendly (which is why I rarely get to eat here).  That usually means I come here for special occasion meals like birthdays and promotions, which typically entails a bottle of wine, two entrees, an app and a dessert ($100 for two people, easy). But I have, on occasion, come for happy hour drinks at the outdoor, four-sided bar. The restaurant is made up of two early 20th century homes connected by a large wooden deck and spacious patio. Most of the seating is outside, so in the hot or cold months take that into consideration. They have two fireplaces and plenty of heat lamps, but in January I still ate with my coat on. Not sure what sort of relief they have in the summer - though it is shaded by a canopy of trees and has plenty of flowers and greenery to keep you cool...ish.  I've never been disappointed in the food. My sister swears their ahi tuna is the best she's ever tasted (she orders it in any restaurant that offers it). and she must not be the only one because they always have it on the menu, which they otherwise change seasonally. I'm a steak girl myself, but the cold weather of my last visit prompted a short rib bourguignonne order, which was fantastic. Two people in our party did opt for the filet mignon served with coconut milk mashed potatoes (wha...??? Yummers!) and lovey-love-loved it.  The service can be spotty... the bar, host and wait staff was a little green for a Saturday night. bartenders were not rude, but... a tad sophomoric for a place that has $80 bottles of wine on the menu. Our hostess was nice enough to move our table closer to the firepit, but never brought the heat lamp she promised. The server seemed to be on his third night of serving ever - forgot an appetizer and was easily confused and in a hurry - probably waiting to get cut so he could head to a kegger. No one on the staff we interacted with was over the age of 20....seems odd for a fancier place like HoT.   But, for being the only place of this caliber I can think of in all of tempe, I'll take it.

VsQBXfTwXzab1Pcshx1JlA.text: Pretty good. Not spectacular enough to come back. Maybe for HH. The service was meh! Waiter did not know the food nor the wine list. He was not upscale waiter material by any means, more like Keanu Reeves trying to serve. "Whoa, need some wine dude?" I Had to send him back to the chef to ask about food Ingredients . Had no idea. Thats no good when average prices for plates are around $25. Small portions for the price. I know it is upscale cuisine but I was starving after my $29 meal. The herbed butter with bread was too powerful. Should be a subtle flavor. It was good but not worth going back to IMO.

uYX44Q_exiU0ZR4dmZcEyw.text: *edit* i just returned tonight to celebrate my grad school acceptance with my bf. i was pretty saddened. not by the food (although the braised short ribs is more like pot roast than short ribs... and a little too saucy). ok, the dessert did suck and is worth skipping. and our waitress was terrrrrible! she was surly and not helpful. we were at the restaurant for TWO hours. and it was not even busy.! she didn't even end up bringing us the bill - we had to ask for the bill, and a different waitress (who was really nice) brought it to us. bad service is a huuuuge turnoff to me. fortunately, the seared ahi tuna is still amazing. and so is the cheese plate appetizer. yeah, HOT lost a star from me tonight. it was allll that waitress' (and nasty dessert's) fault.  the food that dreams are made of.... this small hidden restaurant just down the block from Mill Ave is a True gem. i actually chose to eat here for my birthday after reading some reviews on Yelp, and have now come back to return the favor! in all honesty, i think this is my fave restaurant in ALL of the Phoenix area!   we started off with the cheese plate... oh baby! they had a fantastic selection of delectable cheeses that i would probably never choose for myself - i just wish i knew the names of the cheeses as i was eating them. and i wish there was more cheese to go around!   i ordered the pork chop with coconut mashed potatoes (yeah everything had super pretty gourmet names, but i can't remember that many words....) deeeee-lish! perfect complement.  although my dinner was awesome, i kinda wanted to steal my bf's dinner more... he ordered the seared ahi tuna over masa pancake. it was incredible. i think i'm always amazed by good seafood in Arizona. and HOT (haha, nice acronym) does an amazing job.  super cute date place. (two thumbs up to my man for taking me here!) perfect romantic atmosphere for l-o-v-e, and sitting outside is refreshing in the fall/spring. when it's crowded, though, it's not as intimate, but still cozy. i'd recommend dining here in the middle of the week for a nice intimate dinner. or lunch. just eat here. you won't be disappointed!!!!

HF5amm1HZeNigKrRCcWS9A.text: Legend, legend, legend, legendary.  My personal history has been intertwined with House of Tricks since I was roughly 16.  It was at this age I realized how to be a man and by man I mean how to treat a woman.  And quite frankly, Tricks has played something of an advisory role for many major manformative years thereafter.   Obvious hyperbole alert:  This place is so romantic that even if a clown juggling three chihuahuas rode through the patio in on a unicycle every 20 minutes you'd still get laid.  There is in no fathomable way I could dissect dishes or service or ambiance as I have been there literally over a hundred times.  Therefore, you'll just have to look elsewhere for a play-by-play of the dishes (as they also seasonally change menu items it renders this task improbable if not impossible).  What I can say about some food related items is this: First, the lavender crusted tuna from 2002 haunts me like a lost love to this day; and second, the grilled lemon caper salmon salad quite possibly changed my life.  Capers...who knew right?  What Tricks has to offer the patron is the quintessential personal dining experience.  The service is good but laid back...they will leave your party be for the most part.  This is not supposed to be a 5 star restaurant so it doesn't try to be.  What they do is provide a platform for their guests to enjoy their friends, family, lovers or liaisons to the fullest.  At the same time they are treated with impeccable food, great presentation, and a wonderful setting all very effortlessly.  Go here on a date.  Go here for after work/school drinks (bar area is amazing).  Go here for lunch with parents.  Just go here.

iIgFT-pTZpCW_qz-VG7sFg.text: My son and I were in Tempe to visit ASU, and stumbled upon this place around 8pm on a Thursday night.  We didn't have reservations, but they were able to seat us right away on the beautiful outdoor patio.  This is an upscale restaurant that caters more to romantic dates and special celebrations, but we were more than comfortable dining in our comfy travel attire.  We had a hard time deciding on what to eat, but I think we would've been satisfied no matter what we chose.  My son had the Caesar Salad to start and the Beef Tenderloin entree, while I had the Spicy Clam Chowder followed by The Scallops.  Both our entrees were delicious.  We ended our meal by splitting the Flourless Chocolate Cake...mmmmmmm.   Our waiter was professional but a little slow to respond due to the fact that he was juggling a few large parties.  If you are looking for a place to celebrate an anniversary, birthday, promotion, etc., I'd give this place a try.

Q0wG_rkvRa8FqWTh7uggRA.text: This has always been a favorite of ours for dinner before an event at Gammage, so this isn't the first time we have been here, but it will be the last. Seriously. While I have never been overly impressed with House of Tricks, my girlfriend has, and the atmosphere is pretty nice. For me, the food has always been just ok, not bad, but not anything special in this city of really good restaurants. The service in the past has always been pretty good, but Saturday night was a whole different story from the bottom to the top.   We had reservations for 5:15 for a 7:30 show at Gammage. Plenty of time, right? Well, it wasn't. We showed up 5:15 and were seated about 5:30. Crowded? Not really. We spied about a half dozen empty tables. There was a line at the hostess station, and it was obvious it was a first night of work for someone, or maybe a couple of their first nights. It took almost 5 minutes for them to seat parties even though there were a lot of empty tables.   So, about 10 minutes later, a young woman approached us and said she was not our server, but that she would bring us some water. She asked if we were going to Gammage, and we said yes. The server would be told this, we were assured. About 5:45 we ordered a bottle of wine when our water arrived. It showed up about 5:55. Upon opening the wine, a server knocked my glass of water into my lap. Really, not that big of a deal at the time, as I was wearing black pants, and accidents happen. Our actual server finally showed up, and we told her we were now in a bit of a hurry, since it was now about 6:00. No problem. We ordered three Caesar salads and a bowl of soup, and our entrees.   By the time the salads arrived at 6:20, we knew we might be in trouble on time, but the server told us that the kitchen knew that we needed to leave soon for the play. 5:50 soon rolled around, and we knew there was no way for us to stay and eat. When we informed the server, she said our meals still weren't ready anyway. She kept blaming the kitchen. The manager (?) apologized, and said he would comp the salads and cup of soup. Big of him. The wine was a $42 bottle of wine they paid $20 for. He should have comped it, too. Really, we weren't looking for anything free here, but he made sure that we weren't ever coming back, and he could have prevented that by making a gesture for the water in my lap and the overall bad service. Not only have they lost our patronage, but we brought friends along from out of town who come into town for events at Gammage, and their feelings were the same.   To be honest, there are just way too many good restaurants in town to be treated this way and just to be told they were sorry. This place has a great atmosphere and decent food. That's not enough anymore in this day and age. Someone mentioned in another review that House of Tricks seems to be having some issues with service around this time-frame. It is unfortunate that it happens to anyone, but for us its unacceptable.

umJ9gJwXWCdIG4tig0G7ew.text: I had a terrible dining experience at House of Tricks.   I had just given up on a ruben that tasted like it was made of soggy band aids just in time to have the jerk off who either runs or own the place take time out of his day not to apologize for the free lipstick that came with my  glass of ice tea but to tell me that, while sitting on an empty patio, playing This American Life from my iPod was driving the no other diners to distraction.  Maybe the trick here is they charge 10 bucks for a drowned sandwich but throw in the dirty dishes for free.

tZWWHx9DsWONVn1xaZ3x8Q.text: I live in San Diego, but was in Arizona for Valentine's weekend. Through local recommendations, I chose House of Tricks to take a friend for Valentine's lunch...and before I go any further, let me just say that I am SO happy we came here!   Location--kinda random. Next to the university, and directly next to a mosque and Muslim market. (Turns out market has the world's best hazelnut baklava--go get some!) Once you get closer you can see the cute outdoor tables in the little garden area that conjure up thoughts of a Parisian outdoor cafe. Nice!   I'll admit, one of the reasons I chose this place was for it's wine menu (glug glug.) They had a special wine of the day, which was great, and pretty reasonable at $6 per glass.   The food is where this place really shines though...the menu is so interesting, and everything sounds amazing and incredibly fresh. We decided on a goat cheese cake appetizer, served with tapenade, basil, roasted red peppers, and crispy slices of bread--YUM! For an entree I had the grilled slightly spicy calamari, shrimp, and tuna with Israeli cous cous and spinach, and my friend had the phyllo dough wrapped orange roughy with coconut milk and veggies. Both of our dishes were delicious, and we loved the uniqueness of the flavor combinations. For dessert we ordered a bread pudding dish and a tirimisu, with two cappucinos. Our bill was about $80 but we each had 2 glasses of wine, shared an appetizer, each got an entree, and followed it with two desserts and two cappucinos. Not bad for all of that food, if we had just gotten lunch entrees I would consider it a great deal at around $12 per entree.  Service was great, and it was the perfect location for a romantic, lazy lunch on a beautiful day.  My friend was only half-joking when he suggested going back on Sunday....

T0UZ7ZNoXP3vJ-1qC28vPw.text: I'm never disappointed at this Tempe favorite. When the weather is nice, you can't find a nicer outdoor dining experience.

q6QY7whX5PwbY4i3kVfbYw.text: Meh.  Had the filet and it was a little bland.  My salmon was very fishy.

T3PlPXTnly2fmelc7pqV4A.text: My husband and I went there last night for our anniversary dinner. We were seated outside in the courtyard section and we thoroughly enjoyed it, especially with the weather being so goo this time of the year! It was a cozy and romantic setting.The ambiance is nice and their service was very good too. Between the both of us, we ordered the lamb shank and the tenderloin steak. The lamb shank was served on a bed of cheese risotto, which was a very interesting combination. The lamb was cooked real well and the meat just fell off the bone. The only flip side to the dish I would say was, there was too much cheese flavor going on, so sometimes I felt the flavor of lamb was getting lost (it could just be me too!). The steak was juicy and moist and husband enjoyed the dish a lot. Both the dishes were plated n served really well. And to finish the day on sweet note, we ordered their dessert special for the night, which was creme brulee with pumpkin filling and I must say, it was a total winner! Though their pricing is slightly on the higher side, the place is worth a visit. Overall, we enjoyed our dinner and a great time there!

vkvw7bxmslfyfmEL5ZHTRw.text: Amazing food! The menu was chock full of so many delicious combinations, it was almost impossible to decide! We started with the spinach, green chili and artichoke dip, super flavorful! Next came the green chili cornbread BLT. Cornbread and bacon??!! How can you go wrong, it was phenomenal! We finished up with the espresso creme brulee and I was seriously in foodie heaven. The weather was perfect for dining outside, the space is surrounded by trees which kept it cool and comfy. Our server was friendly and attentive and I can not wait to come back again!

kS1Wcpuh4KBYX7tzHSjqYw.text: Incredible! Everything is great there! The ambiance, the food, the service. It is all first class. Just sad that they aren't open year round as its a place I could every week! I highly recommend this as a first date spot, anniversary spot, or just taking business colleagues out.

L4YA_y1BE_O5Y6medrwzhQ.text: Last night was the first time that I ever ate at House of Tricks.  Well, one time I had a piece of a leftover while I was drunk out of my gourd, but that just wasn't the same as actually being there and experiencing the beautiful ambience, having the plate brought to you and getting to pet the fat kitty that lives on the premises.  Right now they're got restaurant week going on and for $30 bucks you can get a gnarly three course meal.  I got:  Coconut curry shrimp, Asian meatballs served over a bed of goat cheese and a dulce de leche cheesecake brownie for dessert with a cup of decaf coffee.  Unfuckingbelievable.  Sometimes when you eat food that is that good, something that soars into that level of greatness, it makes every dish you made that you were oh, so proud of look like a piece of shit.  Did you ever bust your ass and cook something that took all day?  Did you ever make your own turkey stock for gumbo you made and the whole affair took all Sunday and you never even went outside?  I'm sorry, but you're going to be a little depressed after you eat here because it was incredible to an absurd degree.    Dude.  Amazing.

ujvVPSQByz9qQd418Tandg.text: I had the pecan smoked salmon, and it was fantastic! Portion size was perfect for a light lunch. Nice atmosphere outside at a table by the bar.

7XedXYEHXxY-crjvxF-u0g.text: Lunch is pretty cheap. Boogers on the men's room walls. Order the French dip.

GfhHpwHHKPihTG21vFDuaw.text: I recently had the pleasure of being treated to a meal here. I have to say the caeser salad and the beef tenderloin was excellent. My dining companions all seemed to enjoy their meals as well. The only thing keeping this from being a 5 star review was that the service was a little spotty. (Our server only as other tables seemed to be attended to properly.)  I will definetly return!

aQD2LrSYSxJ0KsWc45OjFQ.text: We had two kinds of salad, both amazing. one was chicken something- bad with remembering names- and the other was probably the Ahi tuna. I love going there when the weather is nice, at lunch time when I wanna get away from ASU junk food.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

kUFYKv4Ysi5BqGfHuQVozw.text: Love this place.  Great food, great staff...  The chocolate peanut butter dessert put it over the top!

vZoH3aCXWYPv3JhKayIT6Q.text: I am not sure how I have missed this little GEM. Seriously good food, ambiance and service. I had a Thai Mojito that was both delicious and potent.   For appetizers we shared Baby Spinach Salad (Incredible), Cesar Salad, Filet Mignon Beef Carpaccio (I had never tried Carpaccio before as I couldn't imagine liking it, but it was yummy), Fried Fromage d'Affinois with Homemade Strawberry Preserves (Fried Cheese and it was truly amazing and the Preserves were also amazing).  For Dinner I had Grilled Beef Tenderloin. It was incredibly delicious and cooked to taste (I prefer Med. Well and was spot on without butterflying). My only regret is that I tried someone's Pecan Crusted Smoked Pork Tenderloin. That was the best Pork I have eaten in some time. The sauce was heavenly.  This is now one of my top ten restaurants in the Phoenix area.

wFeCw_5Ff-RCrrMqOUwYGg.text: The setting is quite beautiful. We were there on a cool evening but quite comfortable sitting next to the large fire pit on the expansive patio.   My husband and I chose the mussels with harissa and chorizo for a starter.  Probably the most delicious mussels I have ever eaten. The grilled bread was great for dipping into the creamy sauce.  I ordered the mustard glazed salmon with toasted brown rice and baby bok choy. The salmon was well cooked but just a tad overdone for me. I felt that the mustard glaze was just spooned on and not actually part of the cooking process. There was too much of the glaze and it completely overpowered the salmon. The "toasted " rice tasted like plain old brown rice and the overcooked bok choy didn't go well with the other flavors.   My husband ordered the bison meat loaf. A small portion and nothing special. He loves purple potatoes but did not enjoy them as they were pureed to the consistency of baby food.   Disappointing food for that price point.  I'm giving it 3 stars because the mussels were so good (although they could have been bigger). We were there on a Monday night so perhaps the "A" kitchen team was not there but I would hope that food would be consistent no matter when you dine. Probably would not return unless a friend recommended a particular item on the menu

hYNO0gKFdWWlZ3TUOT3Xdw.text: Great creative menu that changes often. Great wine list that is diverse and shows a lot of thought put into it. Great for outdoor dining. No wonder its been there so long.

J46vLninmIwrKCiaCR-5bg.text: Great atmosphere, even better food. Mussels were terrific as was the seafood salad. I have no idea what the sauce they put on the mussels was but I want a jar of it. Waiter was pleasant and competent. It was just a very good experience. Would go again.

tOx3d6mYuddwQ5lblZq3lA.text: We have been wanting to try this place out for a few years, so we went for my husband's birthday with several relatives. I suppose of minor concern was the fact that several staff members (including our waiter) knew it was my husband's birthday, but nothing at all special was done about it, nor was it acknowledged in any way. Okay, so apparently recognizing special occasions is not their thing... Not a super big deal, but I thought I'd mention in case this happens to be why you are going.  The outdoor patio dining area is GORGEOUS. However, it was a little cold and quite windy, so we opted to sit inside. What a contrast! Big, plain, drab, empty, boxy, boring room, with poor aesthetics. We had to yell at each other in order to hear one another (sort of), and there weren't even that many other people seated in this room to excuse it from feeling like we were eating in a school cafeteria. Our waiter was friendly enough. He forgot a few minor things and took away every single one of my (4!) forks for eating my actual dinner, but nothing unforgivable. Nothing outstanding though, either.  I realize this isn't "fast food", and we don't expect that at all, but, the food really did take forever. I don't know how long it was from the time of order until we got our salads, but at that time we were told it would be another 15-20 minutes, when, in fact, it took 30 minutes to receive our dinners after the salads. There were two children in our party, who had to be taken outside and walked around and entertained TWICE for 20 minutes while waiting for our food.  None of these things individually would I consider deal-breakers, except for the fact that we spent a total of $280+ for 7 people (2 of them children under the age of 7), so I do think we should be able to expect more. So far, a place like Applebee's is doing better than this (and at about 1/3 of the price.) And then the food comes. (The deal-breaker for my relatives.) My husband said his meal was good, and the food we ordered for the kids was okay. (Although, we ordered them an "adult" meal of gnocchi to share, and I couldn't believe how small the serving was! In any other restaurant I've been in, the serving would have been 2-3 times more.)  The side salad that I ordered (a la carte - $7!), was TINY!!! Seriously?!?! They think it's worth a DOLLAR for each little salad leaf?! (I'm really NOT exaggerating.) The lamb that I ordered (which my waiter claimed was a "meal and a half", was only that by comparison to the other meals.) I did expect it to be fatty, because lamb is... but I didn't find hardly any meat, and was in no way full when I left. Certainly no "and-a-half" meal leftover.  The lamb was fairly salty, but, managed to stay on the high end of "still acceptable/edible" to me. However, the mashed potatoes that my aunt and I had? The description left by a previous reviewer, "it was eye squinting salty", is perfectly accurate. My aunt could only choke down two bites before she gave up. My other aunt said her meal was quite salty too and was surprised that her squash, which would usually been on the sweeter side, obviously had added salt.  To me, over-salting is an attempt to make up for a lack of culinary skill. "When in doubt, salt the hell out of it!" Either the chef doesn't have much talent at using other ingredients and seasonings to bring out delicious flavors, or he doesn't THINK he does...or he enjoys snacking on salt licks.  In any event, my relatives definitely won't be back. There is a small chance I would be willing to give it another try - but only on a nice day so that we could sit out on the lovely patio and order from the (significantly less expensive, therefore less financially risky) lunch menu and I'll ask if there are any low-salt options.

wA7Lg-bmNYl0UUV614N-Nw.text: I've been to House of Tricks a few times now and am finally reviewing it. My first two visits here were great but I had only ordered appetizers so I'll give it three stars in fairness of my other visits being great. Sad to say my most recent visit was just okay. I had the Filet Mignon and was so disappointed. While the meat was a good cut and it was cooked to my specifications it was incredibly salty. So salty I couldn't even finish it. We came with a large group of people so I really didn't want to send it back. Even my mashed potatoes were laced with salt. :(  After dinner I asked my friends how their meals were and across the table we agreed they had been a bit overly friendly with the salt shaker in the kitchen.  The atmosphere and service on the other hand are always great. Unfortunately, I need some space and time to think House of Tricks. It's not you, it's me and I guess I just don't love salt as much as you.

hYOhFm8R1auoMQLVgFkdhw.text: Had a great meal on my first visit! Loved being on patio. My friend had been there before so he suggested artisan cheese plate for starter. It was awesome! He had pork belly tenderloin and I had macadamia nut crusted duck breast. Mine was good and his tasted even better! Naomi was the perfect server because she paid attention to what was happening at table. She never interrupted our conversation. Very much appreciate great service like that!! Only reason it's 4 star is because they serve Coca-Cola products. Our pictures of meal turned out too dark so you'll just have to go and order food to see how great it looks.

qwLk-DtBdqtzIt_-67L2yQ.text: I like the unique atmosphere of this place. but I don't like the space inside, quite cramped to accommodate their guests who like to be there..  outside seems nicer than inside, but the day I visited there was very cold.  The big amount of food is good to share with your friends. and quite "OKAY" wine list.   It will be GREAT if you could go with your friends or family in the nice weather.

g15QZ6XHDzdCNiXz_vEWSg.text: Had the pleasure of enjoying House of Tricks last night, for the second time in the past twelve months.  With a party of six, I was excited to get to see a range of dishes and try out most of the menu via my dining companions choices.  The restaurant, found in Tempe near ASU, is not hard to find and houses both indoor and outdoor seating.  The outdoor seating is where we ended up last night and between the fire pit in the middle of the grounds and the abundance of trees/greenery, the setting works quite well.    Our party was seated immediately and without problem, the night was off to a solid start.  Our waitress, Jamie, was both friendly and courteous.  Jamie had a great understanding of the menu, the specials and especially the wine.  Her recommendations for multiple members of the party worked out perfectly.  Each person in our party ordered an appetizer and off we went.  I had the pork belly, on Jamie's suggestion. Other choices within our party included the salmon cake, sweetbreads two ways, and the scallops.  I thought the pork belly was great. It had a pea puree as a base sauce and some baby carrots that just killed.  The scallops were tasty and cooked perfectly.  The sweetbreads two ways were a bit of a letdown.  As a lover of sweetbreads, I have had the pleasure of tasting some of the best variations of there preparation. These were just not that great.  They weren't cooked properly and the seasoning was lacking.  This would be the only lacking dish of the evening.  For the entree, I had the pork osso bucco.  This was a real treat, cooked evenly, tender and tasty.  Other entree selections around the table included the ahi tuna, the salmon, and the duck.  The tuna was the standard seared variety on a bed of mashed potatoes.  Both diners who chose this selection were quite satisfied.  My companion had the duck and while she certainly enjoyed the dish, she found the duck slightly fatty.  All around, the entrees were solid and plates were cleaned.    With little room left for dessert, we ordered three selections for the table to share.  All were good and once again our plates were cleaned off.  The dessert best was agreed upon to be the homemade smore the restaurant produces.    All in all, this is a solid restaurant with a good atmosphere and good service.  I would eat here again and recommend you to do the same.

_0_a3tOQj0y3yz9rHObxcg.text: What I really liked the most? Those cute old plates they leave in every table. Made me feel like grandma was around hehehe.  Food was tasty and in good portions, just the salad that I had with my quiche was a bit dead. I wonder if it was 'cos they were busy for the AZ dine out week.   If you are a young lady...this place has really good looking waiters!! Enjoy!

Kz6ruCn0zl5ixg8bSJiUIg.text: Beautiful setting walking distance from Gammage.  Great service. Food was good. We found on Yelp!  Good work !

-_8j7XVzLZb__FVMze4XIg.text: The service was way.... too.... slow...... dinner reservation was at 7:45 took almost an hour to get appetizer. Very long wait from salad to entree at least 35 minutes. Food did not disappoint but service certainly did. Not sure I would recommend or return.

6je47iV7j4l6SWhtrKRYhg.text: We had a wonderful lunch at HOT a few weeks ago. I ordered the tuna encrusted with nuts which was cooked to perfection with a delicious sauce. Service was excellent.

zB2-q1uFh5W-1Wwank3Pww.text: Our pre Hamilton lunch was delicious. The daily wine selection was a dry French wine and the price, and pour, were generous. My salad with pecan smoked salmon was very tasty and my companions truly enjoyed the quiche of the day. We will return!

Bj2Xz-YU73hUZVXpNappWg.text: Excellent food, great ambiance and beautiful setting. We always eat here before going to The Gammage. Would definitely recommend.

0OjCYzTaVbv1Doa5ooHsRQ.text: I think the food is a little expensive for what you get.  The food is good and the service was good. All in all if you want a good dinner I would go there . When it's cooler outside the patio is the best

M-Zfv5hs0G0KM50rZzdfcw.text: This does remain a good solid establishment for a dining experience. I had ordered the Blackberry-Orange Duck Breast and it was so very good. I have and always will return.

R2VvM7gLMqB6D3ZwiXKERw.text: I loved the food here and it was genuinely an adorable atmosphere! Our server was very nice and I only have good things to say about this place!

E0gjvlidfjCBBZuV6NJD8w.text: Came into town for a long weekend and stopped here for some food and had amazing service and great food! Definitely recommend stopping.

o9gS2qx1jDiXyOdvrf2HWA.text: TL;DR - good not great. Not worth the price, and especially not worth the time I spent. The waitstaff was helpful and the atmosphere is lovely, but overall I came away underwhelmed, even with a comped entree.  You're better off going somewhere like Ocotillo or Barrio Cafe or the Henry at this price point.   I was excited to try this place out. Came here for a birthday dinner, somewhat large party of 12 or so, so take that into consideration. However. It was still very slow service, and nothing we got was overly complicated. About 4 hours from table to bill (with dessert albeit). Of course as you probably know, it's a pricy establishment. But that sets the expectations higher.   I started with a cocktail. Some variation on the gin and tonic. It was good but not great. I've certainly had better, it doesn't take much: Hendricks, tonic and cucumber.  I was hoping to order the Seabass, but as our waiter came to take our entree orders (about 45 minutes into the experience), he alerted us they were out. That's okay, a lot of us ended up ordering either the salmon or the seared ahi. The waiter came back about 10 minutes later to alert us that the ahi was also gone, so I switched to salmon.   My beet and arugula salad came out and presentation was great, as was the flavor. However at that size and at that price there wasn't anything that especially stood out. Oh well. The candied walnuts were super tasty.   Finally after a long time. The entrees were brought. The portions at least seemed appropriate. The chef came by to let us know that those of us who ordered the ahi would have our entrees comped. Hooray!   As for the meal. Salmon was cooked to a good consistency (though I would prefer a bit rarer). The bed of black grains was striking and added a great texture. The ricotta complimented both quite well. In fact, it may have been the most flavorful thing on the plate. The salmon unfortunately was not very flavorful, and the grain lacked seasoning. Perhaps my tastes are unrefined.   As it was a birthday occasion, a few of us ordered dessert. Since the entree was comped and I was at this point underwhelmed, I ordered the special. A butter cake with vanilla gelato. It was also good, not great. I expected more richness from something called butter cake.

TgfBre21sIZbifSmNqhgDQ.text: From the awesome Piper (our server) to the food and vibe, this place rocks the rocks!  Piper was attentive, lively, bubbly, and worked with the bar staff to customize a cocktail for my husband.  We had the arugula salad, with roasted beets, which was simply delicious, as were the diver scallops.  However, the stars of our night were the harissa mussels . . . I think we would have bathed in the broth, had it been deemed socially acceptable.  Don't miss this place . . . and ask for Piper.

N4TqjAcKd_-b9mWbmIN_uw.text: We were pleasantly surprised with House if Tricks! Food was delicious, ambiance great and the service and friendliness of the staff was great!

PnpfpCXL1FfWXLRoY4vNNg.text: Right when I got to House of Tricks, we were seated right away and ordered delicious Raspberry Iced Teas! These were perfect for the warm day and SO refreshing!   We then ordered the artichoke dip to start which was amazing and came with chips and little pieces of bread. This was an awesome starter before our salads arrived!   I had the Fresh Garden Salad of Spring Greens which was beautiful and tasted like a dream! There was a perfect amount of each topping placed on the salad and it hit the spot.   The patio was super cute that we sat on and service was excellent! I loved it!

uKqhyGaGY0eYNhEKe5YBNQ.text: I love this place. It's probably the most pricey place in downtown Tempe but the bar alone is worth it. This is my go-to dinner place in Tempe when I don't want to leave the downtown area. The food is very good and they have a reasonably good selection of wine. You can't go wrong by sitting outside at the bar and enjoying the scenery.

7GGUKVoxGZzQHXntl1gxBg.text: This is my all time favorite place to take my wife on a date. Everytime we go the service is excellent. The perfect combination of making sure all your needs are meant and allowing you to enjoy your company. On our first date here my wife and I were just starting to date and (I hate to admit this) we were there 35 minutes past closing time and didn't even notice! We finally noticed all the tables were empty and apologized, but our sever never said a thing and said it was his pleasure to serve. The food is also always fantastic and moderately priced for the quality you get.  The Ambiance is incredible, I love the candle lit patio and you feel like your truly in a secluded romantic spot without even notifying you are in downtown tempe! I can't recommend this place.

E8AwlvjAve34NlFXkX2lUQ.text: Made a reservation and we were seated immediately. Hostess was new and a little confused on the table numbers, but it wasn't a big issue. Fantastic and interesting food. It the whole place has a romantic atmosphere. Great service on a busy Valentine's days

EUngKSMoLJ0C64cuivEgBg.text: Multiple times returning guest. We love House of Tricks. Cozy and very comfortable atmosphere with EXCELLENT food. Front of house (hostess station) needs some attitude adjustment. We arrived on a Friday for lunch at 12:30 and requested to sit outside on patio. Hostess asked if we had a reservation, which we didn't, but didn't seem willing to seat or accommodate us. Here's the issue, they have maybe 30 to 40 tables out on patios and we counted FOUR of them occupied with the remainder set and available.  Get the feeling?

3GlsABS2_wmP_4FC797nZQ.text: We went here for our 5 year anniversary. We had reservations at 7 pm and we went a little early to have a glass of wine at the bar. We ordered a bottle of wine and a appetizer. There was 2 bartenders and they were very very busy. People were waiting for drinks all around us. We decided to eat at the bar instead of waiting for our table so we got menus. I called earlier in the day to ask if they had the lamb they said yes and that they had a bunch of specials as well. Turns out they didn't have lamb and had NO specials. Took about 20 minutes to order our dinner. We sat for about an hour and 40 minutes later and still only had our app and wine. We politely asked for our Check and left hungry. Bartender was super nice and apologetic but after sitting for an hour and 40 minutes we order a steak med rare and grouper and it still didn't come it was time .  Well now in regards to your post maybe you should talk to your Bartender because we bought a bottle of wine when we sat down at 6:03 at the bar I took a picture of it on my phone and that's the time stamp so sorry 1 hour and 45 minutes for a med rare steak and a fish. The wine was the best part of this experience. Yes he did buy us an appetizer which was very nice of him. Yes we also missed the happy hour app by technically 5 minutes from when we sat, but by the time it got put it was longer so yes thank you to the kitchen for making my delish appetizer. What a joke. Maybe you should hire more people to help because everyone around us was waiting and saying the same thing. But thank you for your remarkable response. We also tried to pay for our meal he said no problem I'll take care of it i understand it's my fault. We did get a $5 bill and still tipped him $40. Still stick with my 2 stars. Thanks again

CveeGzctXwk1TU9dDE2oKQ.text: I'm particularly leaving this review to acknowledge our waitress Piper, who made our visit last night wonderful. We were on a time crunch to see Hamilton, and despite the volume they were experiencing, we were able to have cocktails at the bar, then apps/dinner/dessert at our table  all in 1 1/2 hours. The food and atmosphere were nice, but seriously impressed with good service. (Also, bartender made a great cosmo!)

z7ZQaD1FHnSKRDThlaat3A.text: 5 starrrrs!!   One of my favorite higher end restaurants in Tempe!  My company did a holiday dinner here and I thanked God they did! We tried to book it again for the next year but they were already booked!  Their chicken is to die for and so are their potatoes! Fresh salads that I also highly suggest! Great drinks and over all good vibes! The patio is super cute and great to sit outside at night! Please go here! You won't regret it !  P.s. Did I mention the service is amazing ?

2EUZF0PyVxoich02y4QiOA.text: I have been coming to house of Tricks for years. I positively LOVE Renee, who is the bartender. I sit at the bar as much as possible. I'm always sad when she's not there, as our office is close to House of Tricks.  The food is the best in Tempe. Hands down, it's also one of the best patio's in the Phoenix, Arizona. Ambience is always lively.  Menu's change regularly, and HOT is also a favorite before Gammage plays.

9hfi-xzk3eHnVvgFtSslhw.text: I've been coming here for years but only get around to having dinner here maybe once every three or four months and that is not enough because this is a hidden gem in Tempe. I've never had bad service and I've never had a bad meal. Everyone has been friendly and whenever I come here it's always with friends and we always have a great time. I'm a vegetarian and I have never had a problem getting a great vegetarian meal from the menu.   Five stars all the way for the house of tricks.

CjDYShOYxcCIkBXpaC0oyA.text: Converted house into restaurant in the heart of Tempe with a beautiful outdoor patio with plenty of seating and misters.  We had really friendly service and a good deal on a house glass of wine. Seared tuna salad was fresh and light, French dip was juicy and piled with meat.  Soup of the day was fantastic- light but still savory and flavorful.  Ambiance: outside 5/inside 4 Service: 5 Food: 4  Would definitely come back in cooler weather!

ibxure8HF0I9iQ_wVOnfqA.text: We really liked our meal here and the service was great. Instead of an entree, I opted for a couple of smaller plates for my meal and I loved them. I highly recommend the lamb barbacoa arepa and the ahi tuna poke. Great portion sizes and delicious fresh flavors. My husband also loved his game hen entree. We sat inside but the large outside patio looked lovely - it was just too hot for us northerners!   I couldn't leave a bite on my plate so we were too stuffed for dessert.
