ABKhn6eWdT5rmEQTMRVr_Q.text: I've heard rave reviews about this place so my rating might be skewed by expectations vs. experience. Everyone I told I was eating here had nothing but amazing things to say so the bar was set pretty high.   Had reservations before a show at Gammage and showed up a few minutes early on a Friday night. The hostess/es were very scattered. It took about 5 minutes to get acknowledged. They kept whispering back and forth and would help  coworkers but wouldn't even look at us. When they finally did acknowledge us, there was a line of people of waiting. They told us it would be a few minutes to get seated because they didn't have menus. There were a lot of tables open so it seemed odd. We moved to the side so others could check in but they didn't acknowledge them. They then forgot our names... overall just not what I was expecting from a place that's supposed to be a nicer restaurant.   Seated outside as requested. Just a warning, it's beautiful but the tree leaves fall everywhere. We had leaves in our drinks, food, hair, you name it!   Our server was EXCELLENT. He was on top of our orders and very friendly. The wait staff/bussers were very efficient and cleared items quickly.   Scallops were probably the highlight of the meal. They lacked the sear you typically get but they were cooked perfectly, tender and sweet.   My husband ordered the volcanic pork (not pictured in this review). He had heard it was a must order but didn't love it. It was tender but a little on the sweet side and semi-difficult to eat. There wasn't much heat to it, I think the "volcanic" part references how it looks when it is served (like a volcano).   I ordered the halibut that was on special. It is cooked in parchment and you unwrap it. The interactive part was fun. The fish was perfectly cooked and moist. The dish as a whole lacked flavor. The umami gave it an earthy flavor profile and the black garlic didn't taste present. There also wasn't much texture, it was a very one note dish. I'd not order this again.   I wasn't incredibly impressed with the menu options. I ordered the Halibut because it was the only thing that stood out to me. All the appetizers looked amazing, a table near us ordered just 3 appetizers (the Korean ribs and mussels looked delicious, third one was scallops) and I felt like they did it right.   Wine and cocktail selection was great, enjoyed what we indulged in. We were given a small taste of champagne as a celebration of our anniversary. It was excellent and a thoughtful touch.   We didn't order dessert, we were too full. People around us ordered the bread pudding which seemed popular.   I don't have a desire to go back, if I did it would maybe be for lunch or just drinks/appetizers IF we were with people who wanted to try this place. For this price range there are a lot of other places we'd prefer to go.

c_6Tl8MPAmyrl7X1GHQvTQ.text: I went here a few months ago with my fiancee and totally Forgot to leave a review. I'm not going to go into crazy explanations because it's been so long but I'll post what I can remember. I will definitely go back, it's a little more money than I typically spend eating out which is the only reason I haven't been back. The food was simply divine.  The service was exceptional, great atmosphere. Love the patio and the lights! Easy 5 star

tctE9EwSwsZ5WP8Um7javQ.text: I hesitate to call this a hidden gem just cause it's not exactly hidden but it is a gem of a find. Honestly, I can't take all the credit of finding this place, I had come here based on a recommendation of a friend and also hearing from another friend that he proposed to his now wife here. You know it can't be bad at that rate. And it wasn't.  The patio is amazing. Hands down, get a seat outside, if you get the choice. When the weather is beautiful, and even when it's not. The hubby and I stopped by for lunch for his early birthday celebration and was not disappointed. We got the toasted green chile cornbread BLT and the green curry crispty tofu bowl with the sauteed veggie medley as our appetizer. Presentation was gorgeous - I never thought sauteed vegetables could look so good and paired with goat cheese, the sweetness of the vegetables balanced the dish out perfectly.  I was drawn to the BLT not just because it was a BLT, but the cornbread and green chile twist on the BLT really caught my eye. I wish there was a little more green chile, honestly, but I'm a green chile freak and love me some cornbread so this was a definite winner in my book. And if you're a fan of green curry, the fact that it was tofu instead of chicken or whatever else green curry usually comes with - it didn't bother me one bit, and I usually can't do without my meats. The curry was also rich, but not sickeningly so, and also super flavorful, so that's a thumbs up from me.  All in all, this makes the list for special occasions, or a brunch/lunch date, for sure.

Place: we ate outside and all of their seats were under trees, which is actually have nice view but the problem is the leafs fall on our food ( happened to me). KgKlsHHXKnA0N_ppOqrSrQ.text: A truly fantastic experience and meal!  I had mentioned House of Tricks in passing and my extremely perceptive girlfriend surprised me and took me here!!  It was a cold evening (by Phoenix standards, at least), so we opted to dine inside.  We were seated by the door where it was still a bit chilly... and when we asked to move to another table, the staff was more than accommodating and allowed us to sit at any open table!  After getting settled, we ordered some drinks.  The bourbon apricot sour and l'avventura were our drinks of choice.  Both are highly recommended!  For a starter, we ordered the Korean style BBQ rib appetizer.  Delish!  My entree was the pork shank.  If you are a fan of pork shank, then you have no need to look at the menu any further... just get the pork shank!  Amazing!  *****FIVE STARS*****

gdW4h-2yY1U6dlg-LLsWqg.text: Gnocchi in vegan cream sauce with roasted veggies and vegan ricotta was the best thing I've ever eaten - or at least close. Every bite was bliss.   This place is wonderful. We went here for our 18th wedding anniversary. There are a couple of tables inside but most of the seating is outside under the canopy of gorgeous trees. There are plants everywhere - you're literally eating in a beautiful garden. We went at 5 and snagged the last table at the bar - lucky us. The bar is elevated so you can look down into the seating in the garden. It's just so beautiful. This time of year is gorgeous! The food is creative and delicious, drinks are good, and the bartender that was serving us was fabulous.   TIP: GET RESERVATIONS!! We got so lucky to get a table in the bar area - it was the only one left.

UY9w1WICHSzyUrGO_Ju2Xg.text: I have gone to House of Tricks three times and I loved it every time. It has great ambiance and amazing food. I like to request to be outside so I can sit under the trees that covers the patio. Sitting there just takes you away.  My favorite item to get from the menu is Grilled Chicken Breast Chipotle Pasta. I recommend going for lunch. It's much cheaper than dinner.

B-5tV-NYlcQHd_UPF9cWfw.text: This was my third time here and certainly not my last! The food here is fresh and delicious. But for me it's the patio seating that I find attractive. It's located near the university but there's plenty of parking nearby. The patio has mature trees, a peaceful garden feel, and an amazing circular bar outside!   The inside of the restaurant is an older house. It's a maze of books and crannies; it has its own little romantic charm. The staff is friendly and laid back, but once again for me -- it's the veggie variety on the menu and the ambiance outside that has sold me. I'll definitely be back for more.

BE6N4P9KFDwssR0QROlW-g.text: It's been a few months but, I meant to review this place. Fun place! Eclectic setting beautiful outdoor dining that feels very homey. We got the Pork Carnitas Rillette and the Spiced Duck Breast to eat and the Lawnchair and Thyme is Relative to drink.  It was all very good. The duck was a little dry but very flavorful! The Pork Carnitas Rillette was interesting and also very flavorful. I will definitely return once it cools off.

mb7yIDy47zHCYjqFw9nsEg.text: It may be mostly outside, but this place is great!  Ask for Renee, so personable, professional, and nice.  Always great to feel like you know people when you go into places.

_0X4v6t22avOhp18wMYk3w.text: This place is fantastic, why on earth did I wait so long to go back? House of Tricks has always been a special restaurant. It is adorable and on a side street off of Mill Avenue. They have a ton of seating outside, in addition to a couple rooms inside the house. The food is spectacular. I had the salmon salad with risotto cake and it is definitely the best salad I have had in the state. The servers are nice and there is such a relaxing atmosphere. I would suggest making a reservation as the place can get pretty busy.

I had stomach pain right after having their trout. It tasted good but as soon as I finished my food I had a horrible stomach pain and was not feeling good all day feeling like throwing up. X364DcLr3ijGlXHhQS05kA.text: I've been here several times with friends and with family and just to get some really great food and I have to tell you that every time I come to the house of tricks it's just a tremendous experience.  Of course the food is out of this world but the service is what makes this place unique. The wait staff is always extremely attentive and professional and they just do an amazing job.  If you are somebody like me who appreciates customer service and the effort that goes into providing great customer service then you are going to love the house of tricks.   Five stars for one of the best restaurants in the Phoenix area and definitely one of the top three in Tempe.

iGzg2ayaDeoTRgIfQ6nupg.text: The food was delicious and service was decent as the server was very accommodating. The raspberry tea with fresh raspberries was amazing. Our table ordered the trout and Greek burgers--everyone loved their meal.

TUoeoIdF4tgpYFyxwnXEGw.text: Love this place- great atmosphere, amazing food! Shared the smoked salmon appetizer and mussels- that sauce!! I had the beef tenderloin, cooked to perfection. We all shared desserts- berry cobbler, caramel apple bread pudding and lemon cake- couldn't pick a favorite they were all so good :)

kVrm-R2KSy8MnsqRpkvySg.text: The food was absolutely fabulous, but our waitress (Jen) forgot several things (she forgot our drinks twice and even forgot our entrees). Interestingly enough, the other waitstaff stepped in and covered for her absences, which was impressive. I will absolutely return for the food, but hope that the next waitstaff has better focus.

G6g0B-sKJpj-iLoobbhr4A.text: I love this place!  Atmosphere is a cozy cottage with a charming, open front yard with trees hanging over it. For as nice as the food is, the waiter was very warm and unpretentious.  The food is top notch. I had duck and it was cooked and seasoned perfectly. You can't go wrong ordering anything on this menu.  Drinks are nice a strong, but refreshing! I'm interested in trying the "Faux-waiian Punch" next time.  Perfect place for a date!

Q0lPt9G7cRWkgRto1YmwfQ.text: Amazing service, fantastic ambience, and wonderful food!  I am a vegetarian and my companion LOVES meat. We both had plenty of delicious options to choose from. I will definitely be going back!

zspN7X2ur4HEYSa3l9ukXg.text: Beautiful patio, great service, very, very good food. Hidden gem in Tempe. Can't wait to go back.

2KaFC1Nv0pTUZAsBySjRGA.text: We arrived at 5:30 for dinner before the show at Gammage. Service was quick, food was excellent, drinks were superb and the outdoor vibe sitting in the front garden was amazing!

hwLepcnRE7lPnKt8bj7XBQ.text: Once again the perfect alfresco dining experience.  This is my go to spot when I have clients in Tempe.  We sat in the front yard.  It was warm enough that the heaters didn't need to be on.  Karen did an amazing job.  She helped pick a bottle of wine and gave my client an 'upgraded' bottle when the original choice was unavailable.  We shared the oysters and pork belly apps and then each person covered the main menu.  All dishes were outstanding.  Prepared perfectly and garnished to highlight visual as well as taste.  The tenderloin came with a watermelon radish garnish that wowed our diner.  We finished with espresso and tea and were warmly thanked as we left the house.

B8Ve4hLIYgEmOek8uTy7qg.text: One fantastic place. We go there maybe 6 times a year. Usually we just sit at the bar. They have an awesome rotating menu with fantastic 'in season' items; such as scallops that would melt in your mouth.    Great knowledgable and friendly staff. My GF is a total wine snob who almost always can get a well matched glass of vino (or three) that is/are not totally overpriced.    Funky atmosphere but fun.

RqP0S11UmiA_MnJREFG0tg.text: Ambiance was great! Food was amazing. However ordered the charred corn and kale salad and corn was just raw. Beef tenderloin was great-

BvXopXsvCOViO1O2dPD4Gw.text: Had a horrible experience.... Went before going to the Gammage, to see Wicked! We made a reservation 2 hours before the show started which should have been enough time to eat to get to the play in time.  The waitress took forever to get to our table, about 10-15 minutes. We ordered right away to make sure we would get to the play in time. Our appetizers arrived about 15 minutes later and then our entrees arrived about an hour after we ordered them. We had to eat our $30 entrees in 10 minutes to get to the play on time. On top of that, my steak was not prepared right.  The same people sitting next to us had the same exact issue & couldn't even eat the dessert they ordered.  Never going back & don't recommend to anyone going there even when you aren't in a rush.

bn6-S_cwhrc0NRLXp_FymA.text: A group of us took our artist friend for his birthday last night.   It was the third time I'd been there with the first two times being pretty decent experiences, but this time I was very disappointed, as were the majority of our table mates.  First off, plan on spending a small fortune for substandard meals.  I don't know if the chef that night was having a bad day, but here's the rundown.....we ordered 4-appetizers, the wild boar, pork belly, tuna and artisian cheese plate....I'd say they were "meh."  For the entree, I ordered today's fish which was a light whitefish.  It was bland, not cooked properly and very underwhelming.  My boyfriend got the sirloin and it was dry and almost inedible.  He said "the worst steak he's ever had was better than that one."  The cut was bad and the sides were a joke.  Our birthday guest ordered the lamb, he requested it be prepared "medium" it was "very rare" - they did take the lamb off the bill as it was THAT bad.  Friend of ours ordered the black bean "meatloaf" I had a bite it was dry and not that flavorful.  Service slid off after the main course as the server was hit or miss.  Most of the time if we needed something, we were telling our bus boy as he was more attentive than the server.  Our table for 8 was crammed in a room with a table for 4 and table for 2, it was so loud in there you couldn't even carry on a conversation.  Not to mention we were so tightly packed in, you had to do the "walk sideways and suck in your gut manoeuvre" to squeeze between the tables if you had to get up from the table for any reason.  I chose this place because I thought it would be a nice special occasion place in Tempe for our dear friend.  He didn't enjoy it, we spent way too much money for disappointing food, service and table setup and we will likely never go there again.  I would not recommend House of Tricks in fact, I'll likely be telling people about our experience to steer them away from here.  I knew we should've went to Caffe Boa instead.

n1vCfoN2pmoXRKA5ycHhRA.text: Atmosphere was good, food was good, however...... Relative to the price, I'd not go back as the food did not justify the price.  Don't get me wrong, I liked it and would go back if the price was in line with the main course dishes were better or if the price dropped about 20% (or so).  But the place was packed, so maybe it's just me?  But I've had wonderful dishes for the same price and less at places like the Vig and Fuego Bistro.... And others.  2 stars for the food relative to cost, an extra star just for the atmosphere!

Cd5-MOK0hjP1EC02xE_jfg.text: House of Tricks is located near ASU, surrounded by the hustle and bustle of the college town and the famous Mill Ave. You'd never expect to find a quaint and classy restaurant in the midst of crazy college life.  It has a garden-like patio space which also houses a fire place to keep its guests warm during some of the chilly Arizona nights.  The restaurant serves a mixture of Euro and Asian cuisine with obvious French preparation techniques.  With all the influence, I guess that's why it's labeled "American", because it's a melting pot.   The menu changes every season based on availability of fresh ingredients.  Supplement your meal with a wide selection of wine.   During our visit in the summer, they had an Ahi-Tuna, its wrapped in bacon and dressed in a miso based glazed. This probability will raise some eyebrows at first, until that first bite. The combination works really well.  The tender texture of the Ahi-Tuna complimented the smoky and salty flavor of the bacon.  The miso horseradish glazes is just what the dished needed to bring the flavors together.   Also on the summer menu was the tenderloin, cooked medium rare with a bacon-fig gastrique. The steak was cooked spot on. The bacon-fig gastrique was just a perfect balance of sweet and sour taste, complementing the meat.   All of the ingredient was fresh; the servers are friendly and for the most part knowledgeable of the food.  The price is on the higher side with an average entre costing over $30. However they do serve an amazing lunch menu at a very reasonable price, a perfect spot to enjoy lunch and the AZ sun under the garden patio.  Come out the quaint French influence restaurant and try all their seasonal dishes, you won't be disappointed.  I went back a few times afterwards and was able to get great results.

BhweVoE9GIHkzM2LfvwYbQ.text: Delicious sandwiches, salads, and burgers for lunch.  In addition to the standard sodas you would find as non-alcoholic refreshments, they have a great iced tea that is made with muddled fresh raspberries.  I had the special for the day which was the salmon burger.  It was quite possibly the best salmon burger I've had.  It was clearly made with fresh salmon, made from scratch, rather than a mass-produced patty found in the freezer section.  The salmon itself was tender, and flavorful.  I also tried some of the fruit and chicken salad, which was equally good, and very refreshing.  The only thing I wasn't too thrilled about was that it seemed like there was no A/C in the restaurant, and that the only cooling system they had were ceiling fans, which makes for a very warn environment, especially in the heat of summer!

BWYyQbYydigNsI1xSsZKQw.text: of course our anniversary beckoned us back to House of Tricks. the weather was perfect for our outdoor dining experience. the service was wonderful again, with nary a complaint.  we started with a kale salad and it was tender and sweet, plenty of young kale. my entree included the halibut dish. i'm normally not a big fan of halibut, but this fish was prepared so delicately and deliciously, i couldn't stop myself from eating the entire dish, knowing i had to indulge in one of their rich deserts.  again, this restaurant is in our upper bracket price range for our budget, but it's always worth it for great food and to be with the lovely wife.

xxUpEJqaofXnPFRx9bnUzA.text: Lovely outdoor seating complete with heaters.  Romantic and relaxed.  The lamb is amazing.

kQoHFHA4TDihTFXWVOPyWA.text: Enjoyed a nice dinner with friends and colleagues.  Unexpectedly nice setting under the trees on the charming patio.  Menu was very interesting and food was great.  Service was also quite good.  Will come again next time when in town.

1-nIsMA5anzqV3YELPawKw.text: One of my favorite intimate restaurants in town. Located in an old house near ASU one would not think of this as a great place for great eats. Good! Don't spread the word because this is the best kept "secret" in town. If you decide to go I suggest a spot on the patio, in the winter they have a huge fire pit going and it makes for a very romantic evening. Just be aware that you may find a small cat curled up in chair upon arrival as House of Tricks has a couple resident patio cats. This suits me just fine as I am a cat lover but if you are not amused by meows prompting you to share the butter or bits of your meal and accept head bumps and curls around your ankles as thanks I would suggest sitting inside because the little black fellow I have run into on several occasions thinks its his job is to taste your meal to ensure it is up to standards. If you are like me and think this sounds adorable then enjoy the patio with the gorgeous old trees and carefully tended garden, it is utterly magical and the company is cute and furry. The ambiance is enough reason for me to go back over and over, but the food is to die for!   The menu is very seasonal with many of the specials coming from what is found in the local markets that day so there is always something new to discover! A staple that never disappoints for me is the lamb. Always cooked spot on, tender and delicious, and a generous enough portion for me that the cat got a whole chop! If the foie gras appetizer is on the menu I would implore you to try it, absolutely divine! Rich, creamy and utterly luxurious! Don't know what to try? The friendly servers are never shy to offer up an opinion and they rarely miss the mark on suggestions. Overall this is a wonderful restaurant that has a quirky, sweet charm about it. It serves 5 star cuisine without the 5 star snottiness that is often found in many valley restaurants. If you are looking for an alternative to the stuffy, chic new restaurants that seem to abound in Phoenix and want an intimate dining experience that is top notch this is your place.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. One of the resident patio cats at House of Tricks. This little fellow is happy to make menu recommendations and eat any left overs

s9WV2z32lcd72_k7QLpazw.text: The best medicine for a long week.  The setting was perfect for a quick bite and cocktail after work before my trek home.

ZiI2GMZEod1NCLLvkqqAyQ.text: Wow. No. Words. This place is incredible. My favorites are the mussels and the Foie Gras. The pork belly is very good also. Dessert was outstanding; I highly recommend the buttery bread pudding. Service provided by Karen was outstanding.  We will definitely be back.

BAbt8I6Hml8ckPRwAZyXCw.text: Have been here a few times and always have been totally satisfied with the quality of food and the service of staff.  Decided to try their Mothers' Day brunch and was equally impressed!  Can't say enough good about this place and the ambiance they provide!

C5Tle37GSAQqeB7119irCw.text: Everything was great! Old fashion was refreshing, short ribs distinct and the cheddar grits superb. Dinner was so good decided i had to give desert a try and I was not disappointed. Flourless brownie and gelato was worth the calories!

tkSs_s8Y8kL4TOPiygXt8Q.text: 3 of 5 got food poisoning !  Never going again or recommending.   It truly is all about FRESH food and great sanitation practices!!

-IMXV_f7AMrh6PC7KUrZ5w.text: Watch your bill! Great atmosphere sat outside, food was pretty good. ordered salad and appetizer. The waitress talked me into ordering the scallop appetizer as an entree, instead of two you can add an extra scallop to the appetizer so I ordered it. She charged me for two full appetizers at $40 instead of $19+ one scallop! then charged $7 for three asparagus. They definitely like to over charge when you're not paying attention!

G9eoYddzc_0_M0k-OVKJlQ.text: My biggest concern with this restaurant, and one which everyone should be aware regards the last time I was there. I'd inadvertently left without signing my receipt or taking my credit card. When I went back the next day to sign and leave a tip, I was told that gratuity had already been included. This is CREDIT CARD FRAUD according to what my credit card company said regarding the incident. I asked to speak to the management on several occasions and was unable to reach anyone or receive a reply.  I've been coming to House of Tricks since they first opened, and had always enjoyed the experience. Sure, they had some rough patches when their head chef left, and after a year or so, things gradually appeared to settle back into a groove. While the food doesn't compare to what it was, it's now pretty decent.  This current staff however, is rough and untrained. But the old staff, including bartenders, aren't what they used to be either. When this happens, I look to management.    Everything trickles down from the top, and Robin, if you expect your team to be top notch, maybe it's time to look at the top. I'm not happy with how I was treated and many of my friends, including myself, haven't been back to your restaurant since.

ukHcODl7j26YXGj0TIkFtQ.text: I rarely write a review, but have to this time.  We have found the atmosphere and food to be excellent and this is one of our preferred restaurants.  This time we did not know there was an ASU game until we got close and could see there were no reasonable parking options anywhere - they neglected to mention the ASU game when I called for reservations.   Knowing they have a small lot in back we tried there, but it was, of course, full.  I double parked, went in and told the hostess our problem.  She apologized and found the Manager, Ryan Brown, who spent the next fifteen minutes or so looking for a spot for us and finally moving his own personal vehicle so we could use his.  He also provided us with a complimentary appetizer for our trouble.  This is the kind of response that went above and beyond what I had hoped for and is why we will continue to return.

Cg2u0q_ZcyLEzhUBmbVSpQ.text: 4.5 stars  Made reservations for dinner, and we were promptly seated outdoors (our request). The atmosphere and general was more sophisticated. They did a lovely job of the outdoor dining area - simple, but nice. I ordered a dirty martini which was made well and my sister in law had ordered the Green Thing which was good (and I usually don't like gin).   We ordered the mussels and shaved Brussels sprouts for our appetizers - both were amazing! We could not stop dipping our bread in the mussels' sauce!  My sister in law ordered the lamb and I ordered the salmon - wow! Loved the kale that came with my salmon and her lamb was well cooked!   Our server was very attentive and engaging. We did not have to look for her once. One of the best restaurants that I have been to in AZ so far.

1A__nd0TVgfMAtA8732Rhg.text: Had the sweet chili flank steak stir fry and was very impressed. The dish was seasoned impeccably. It had a mix of spices all working in harmony, everything came through without anything being overpowering. The flank steak was incredibly tender, which was very surprising as most times it's tough and chewy. Fantastic dish I highly recommend. I'm eager to go back but it's going to be hard to try something else.

pqLzkXe2LSsGtubs3lD_9w.text: Tricks has become my latest culinary obsession. I'm not even sure if the former sentence even make sense but that's because the food here drives me crazy. Yes. Its that good. And with such a nice cozy patio it makes this place one of the best places to go for brunch on the weekends. I look forward to trying more of their dishes but these are some of their must haves when you go:  Salmon Burger. It's a burger special they are currently running. Get as much of it while you can. It's amazing!  Pb&J - The best rendition of pb&j I have ever had in my entire life. This is not an exaggeration, trust me. When you first read that its pistacio butter with cheese, fennel and strawberries, you kind of wonder if that would even taste good together. But when you finally man up and order it, it will change your whole life!  Salman salad with risoto cake - If you are looking for a lighter fare dish, this is a great choice. Perfectly cooked Salmon tossed in a chipotle/grapefruit vinnegrette...Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. The ginormous salmon burger. To die for!

vmP2gkktS-wrhOjcTCW_Fw.text: One of my favorite restaurants. Not only is the food always amazing, but it changes seasonally. In heart of Tempe, but with the foliage you would think you're in Italy on the country side. Staff is always more than accommodating and friendly. I've been going here for years and I've never once had a negative thing to say. It's always my go to for special events, celebrations, and random whims!

oZ9Yuy_rDCxQm3XuIhuuOA.text: Another fabulous meal at one of my favorite restaurants!  And the service there is some of the best in the greater Phoenix area!

8n6W2ambBTZxxLijiL9jQw.text: Love love, you must try the green Chile corn bread BLT and the appetizer hummus falafel platter.

TCvmC1Znme3kumksZQXTQw.text: I was so happy with my experience here.  After spending a few days in AZ and having a bit of culture shock, it was nice to find this quaint little renovated house with a gorgeous outdoor patio area.  There were lush trees and plants everywhere, and even a few kitties that might live there?  My boyfriend and I even decided to brave the 100 degrees to sit out on the patio (we later agreed that it was just a few degrees to warm for that, but it was ALMOST bearable).  We thought about ordering from the happy hour menu, but that is only available at the bar, and we weren't super tempted by anything on the HH menu so decided to delay that for another day and just order off the dinner menu.  We started off with a smoked salmon bruschetta - it was delicious.  I decided to order the lamp chops with lavender potatoes (How could I resist lavender potatoes?).  My boyfriend ordered the filet mignon.  Oh my GOD.  So good.  I also had an Oregon pinot gris that made me very happy.  This was amazing food in an awesome atmosphere!  My only complaints about this experience were:  there were LOTS of flies buzzing around.  I don't really know what could be done about this - we were sitting outside, after all.  Maybe the restaurant could have some discreetly placed fly-catchers ( is that a thing?) around?  I don't know if that is even possible.  I understand that flies are a hazard of sitting outside, so I don't really fault the restaurant for them.  But there were seriously lots of them.  The other slight issue I had was that my boyfriend and I arrived very early in the evening - and we had a reservation.  There was maybe one table seated on the patio, with all the other tables open.  They sat us right away, but it was at a table RIGHT next to the service door.  Meanwhile there are all of these other tables just sitting empty all over the place, and we are trying to have a romantic dinner with people constantly walking in and out of the door right next to my chair.  I just thought it was a weird place to seat us since the place was virtually empty.  These two slight issues were not enough to take away from the overall experience, particularly the amazing food.  I would suggest House of Tricks for a special occasion dinner, and I will also definitely be back to try the happy hour.  This place is a gem!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Honey crusted lamb chops with fig demi-glace and lavender potatoes! Wow.
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grilled filet mignon

F3Kp77yeJx5xih-Hdk7yMw.text: Great food and great service for reasonable prices. I love the play on American traditional dishes, and the flavor in every dish! We will be returning when we come back to Arizona to visit!

-M64lkZh-6gFIhVk9RdERA.text: Ok. Hadn't been for awhile food & service ok & ambiance much better. Prices very high for value rec'd.

eY00B3nTIOHHcDBwmSJSMg.text: This place was surprisingly nice.  We came during the Superbowl and found this place while searching for good places to eat. When we arrived at the restaurant, they told us that they were booked out for their inside seating. That was a bummer because it was raining and cold that day, but we figured we'd try outdoor seating anyway. That turned out to be alright because they had heat lamps above each table. We could barely tell we were outside except for the occasional breeze.  One of the biggest things I enjoyed about the place was that it cared for several stray cats. They were super friendly, cute, well maintained, and would adorably beg for food right beside your table. It's impossible not to feed them. They were a welcome distraction.  The food itself was very high end, high quality fare. We started with the wild boar, which was as good as good as the best boar I've had in Seattle. Great flavor, great texture. As for an entree, I had the lamb, which I was skeptical to order. I haven't been to a place that's served good lamb in many years, which is a shame because I love lamb. This place NAILED it. It was tender, flavorful, and on a long bone so I could eat it without having to use utensils (which was probably improper, but whatever haha).  I wanted to try dessert, but was too full. I didn't feel like the meals were all that large, but still managed to fill me up, so that was great. I'd definitely go here again for a special occasion. It's a little pricey for day to day visits.

B3rrXxBdXR-EYxOrdT9PAA.text: I have been to house of tricks now a few times and I have to say the food here is absolutely delicious!  It's fresh and made to perfection!  The atmosphere is hard to replicate anywhere with the large patio, trees and you're in the heart of downtown Tempe.  The word to describe this place is charming!   I would recommend trying the mussels as an appetizer.  The sauce has some chorizo in it and it adds the just the right amount of "spice" to the dish.  I would recommend trying the fish of the day or the short ribs.    This place is perfect for a date, celebration, or happy hour!  Say "hi" to Kirk, the manager, my dear friend when you're there! :)

yxpMdHNrRf5np63B95Suhg.text: Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink): 1 star:  Never again. 2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back. 3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad. 4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return. 5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.  Props to the owners of this establishment for putting and keeping casual fine dining so close to Mill.  Huge patio, perfect when the weather is nice or on a warm (not hot) summer night.  Quaint atmosphere holds up well to the old home that houses the restaurant.  Soft spot in my heart for this place since it was the first fine dining meal I had in Arizona and it was free since my friends paid for me.  The only real complaints I've had about this place have been uneven service on a couple occasions, and unfortunate seating.  Neither of which overcomes the quality of the food, has been very good.  The service, I've yet to see steady improvement.  The seating, sometimes hard to fix when the place is crowded.  Case in point - came here with my and my family for lunch.  It was packed, had to wait even with a reservation, then was seated on the patio under a tree.  It was nice, it was shaded, but every stiff breeze blew leaves and little flowers into our food and drink.  Couldn't move because the place was so busy.  Lesson learned I guess.  The food is international contemporary.  I appreciate that they use ingredients and techniques form different world cuisines to change things up a bit.  On this last trip we ordered:  Garlicky Caesar salad with chicken breast French dip Asian pork tenderloin "Banh Mi" Trout with roasted mushroom brown rice  The Caesar was indeed garlicky and quite good, though the chicken breast (which was pretty big), was sliced into three large pieces and just placed on top.  A little cumbersome to work through, and a little overcooked, but the salad as a whole was good.  The French dip was perhaps the weakest dish.  Nothing wrong with any of it, just that nothing stood out about it - the au jus was a little bland as was the meat, but it was cooked fine.  The "Banh Mi" should be reviewed for what it is -  a banh mi in quotation marks.  It had most of the constituent parts of a banh mi with some exceptions (light on cilantro, no pickled daikon), but it tasted decidedly Western.  The Asian-style sauce they put into it didn't help.  But the meat was tender, with lots of it, and the bread was crispy enough to stand up to the filling.  The trout was the best dish of the lot.  Trout, perfectly cooked and seasoned, served almondine-style, with a great mushroom brown rice pilaf.  Some squash on the side too.  Everything was well-cooked and well-seasoned.  It was light with some heft from the umami-rich rice - we would all get this again.  So, to sum up.  House of Tricks, Tempe institution.  Quite good food, reasonably priced, great atmosphere.

Q_tLxoo-UPBvqJ9ros_PSQ.text: I wish I could give a higher rating, but our waitress almost never checked in on us and left us waiting forever for the bill, long after the buser had cleared our plates.  The food was excellent, so a solid 3 stars and hopefully next time the service is better.The outdoor patio is also lovely.

eUvERJssDKjgv5i1P8UT6w.text: This is a interesting place. I was brought here for a work lunch with a client of mine. It was very charming and quiet.   I had the Lemon aid and Chili Rubbed Hanger Steak and Asadero Cheese Stuffed Tortillas with Roasted Ancho Guajillo Sauce, Avocado Puree and Cilantro Rice.  Two things to note: I eat fast (I have a 2 year old, you learn to eat on the go) and I will be honest I eat a lot.   The portions are not huge but I was satisfied, not overly full. The flavor was out of this world. Very bold, spicy flavors, the Avocado Puree was an excellent touch.  The patio looked very comfortable and romantic, however it is Phoenix, Arizona and summer, you will not see me anywhere that does not have AC. Thankfully the inside was nicely decorated with AC.   The service was very attentive, I did not have to ask for any refills of my drink.   All in all I would certainly bring clients here, or have a nice romantic evening with the husband if I was in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Hanger Steak with Chili Sauce. Delish!!!

mTeQUmviJo2USEQSdLB8Lw.text: We went to celebrate a special occasion here.  My friend from work had highly recommended it for any type of special dinner, so my husband and I thought we'd try it.  I had passed this place many, many times while attending ASU and I had never one stepped foot in to it, but had always seen a great outdoor dining area always full of people that seemed to be enjoying what we now know is great cuisine!  We arrived for dinner without any reservations on a weekend and were seated within 5 or so minutes.  It was great weather, so we had ideal seating outside on the W side of the seating area.. lots of small faint lighting amongst a dark night, a perfect setting for an intimate dinner (though there were others around us not dining so intimately).    Our server was friendly, prompt, and gave us the full description of menu items, wines, etc.  I had an amazing lamb shank and my husband's game-meat was absolutely flavorful!  Every ingredient and combination seemed like it was well thought out and then executed by skilled cooks in to beautiful dishes that were both exciting and still recognizable.  There was this adorable (and I am certainly not a cat kinda gal) cat that kept brushing up against our legs.. I rubbed her belly a bit and found out she was the restaurant's pet.. kinda silly.. but sweet at the same time.  I recommend this place for great food and a nice, relaxing night atmosphere... I'm sure I will pick this place again for a future romantic affair.

i-NcLG-x5n6QT-mDNjUngA.text: Awesome food. Service is a little slow but delish !!!! The pita bread and hummus was awesome.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Appetizers. Sooooo good

lj20sw-0LxFgxtLO2gPLoQ.text: My boyfriend and I went there to celebrate an anniversary, and it was great! Definitely on the pricey side, but worth it. Our waitress Naomi was super helpful and friendly and made great recommendations for our first time there.

ajEByH8L-xw_Q9TWFnkPvA.text: Went there for my son's graduation.  Food was excellent. Seated outside, and had to liten to some construction equipment across the street, but is was a small anoiance.  Parking in the back is limited, but free. Had a great time.

7aifV1bgY2B-TwhDjAx_hw.text: We discovered House of Tricks at the gourmet food festival "Devoured". They served a zesty prawn on a bed of grits with kimchee. Sounds bizarre but it was fabulous. This inspired us to swing by Saturday night  on a hungry impulse. We could have wept when we saw the aforementioned prawn dish on the appetizer menu. It was better than we remembered. Next we had the Korean BBQ ribs. The portion was quite large and the flavors suprisingly bold and bright. We finished our meal with a house salad and duck.  I love good food. I love House of Tricks. This is a special date night, or freinds coming to town kind of place. The patio dining is romantic and I was impressed that our fellow diners were a multinational bunch. This shows the broad appeal of the delicious food. Our service was very good. This place is a winner and we will definitely return!

tsK1XKaNXV_k3Bs6XJaHlg.text: Seating indoors is a bit cramped, but we liked the food and service was great.  Ordered the short rib chile colorado, which I really enjoyed.  My wife ordered the scallops starter as her entree, which was pretty good too.  For dessert, we had the "flourless" chocolate brownie.  I now know not to order any cake-type dessert described as "flourless", as it was really dry.  Would definitely go back though.

YCpZQthgfVwqi5JIHDuZLw.text: Mussels with chorizo. Sauce is amazing. Bread is amazing (ask for extra). Just do it!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

RmtoylEfeYZdLbw4T3P8ig.text: Always amazing! Delicious, high quality food. I always opt for a fish dish, because I know it all be prepared and handled will and taste great.

Qmwhrr0dDUYnIl9LGm2xWA.text: Amazing. Our first time there and a great experience. Definitely recommend the scallops. And sea smoke 10 Pinot noir. Wow. Can't wait to go back. Only complaint is their champagne section. No Veuve!?

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

MjAxNlRxp56mCbHuz1A3Ug.text: This has always been one of my favorite restaurants.  Not sure if it is going downhill or just an off day.    4 of us were there for lunch.  Somehow my order, hamburger, got lost.  Not a big deal, it happens.  But it took forever to get it once they found out it was missing in action.  I had ordered it Med. Rare and to add onions, pickle and mustard.  When it finally got there, no mustard pickle or onion and it was extremely well done.  They went to get the stuff but again took a long time and by the time it got there, the burger was cold. In addition to being well done, cold it was totally flavorless.  I was not rude about it but did let them know.  When the check came I figured they would at least give me a discount if not charge me for the burger but  the bill included everything.  Worst of all, the girls ordered a glass of wine which ended up being $10.50 / glass.  Totally outrageous.  But, I guess shame on us for not asking.    Once I got my burger we never saw the server again.  Needed refills on tea and water and literally jumped up and down waving to get their attention to bring the check.  She may have just been too embarrassed to come by.    In addition my sister ordered the daily special, enchiladas of some kind that were also terrible.  Ugly presentation of 2 dried out enchiladas next to a dried out bowl of beans.    To top if off their system would not take my credit card which is a Coin.  I do occasionally run into very small businesses with low tech POS that can't take it but I would have thought they would be ahead of the curve on that stuff.

y38b2AIw0cog-9I4g5Rk3w.text: The restaurant is definitely a place you want to experience at least once. The patio area and inside are absolutely beautiful. The prices are a little expensive but for special occasions I really don't mind. The customer service and staff are wonderful! The appetizer (cheese, meat, olive tray), desert, and wine were fantastic. The desert was a Madagascar Vanilla bean cheesecake on a salted caramel type crust with a raspberry sauce drizzle. It was absolutely amazing. I could have eaten it for dinner.  The main menu is very eclectic (if that is the right word). If you are a picky eater, this is not your place. But if you like food that is off the beaten path or want to take out of town guests for a different experience, this is your place. I had the Mahi Mahi and it was different but good. They like to under cook the food so be careful. I had to send my fish back. My friend ordered a Medium well tenderloin and it was definitely Medium Rare, almost rare. I would've liked it, but still not cooked to medium well. My other co-workers ordered the Autumn Gnocchi (she loved it) and the Cornish game hens (she loved it). Those menu items don't sound all that eclectic but it is the preparation and other foods that accompany the main course that may leave people saying 'hmmmm, I don't know'.That is what I did. My overall experience was great! I recommend it and will return with friends.

VFTbKUlQw7wKaYYBS2QCpQ.text: This was possibly the best dinner experience my husband and I have ever had.   We went here for dinner before going to a show at Gammage Theater.  The waiter asked us if we were going to the show that night and assured us that he would have us done in plenty of time to get there on time.  The service was great the whole night.  Drinks - I ordered the Peach Basil Martini - delicious and creative.  My husband got the Salty Old Fashioned which is made with Fig and Vanilla Infused Bourbon.  They were both delicious.    Entrees - I got the Togarashi Seared Ahi Tuna.  I was in love with my food.  It was delicious.  My husband got the Burgandy Braised Short Ribs, also delicious and so tender.  Portion sizes were great - not so much food that you felt you would waste and not too little either.    Dessert - Our waiter suggested the Salted Caramel-Apple Bread Pudding with Cinnamon Whipped Cream.  A perfect ending to a perfect meal.

px0d83uFx0xefYEYYOiSPg.text: We enjoyed the dinner on Saturday evening at the House of Tricks.  We had several starters and salads.  Friendly service and the food was delicious.

puyYz1WQc4TgcuMYo6GxWg.text: Best place to get away from all the beer joints in Tempe. Outdoor seating romantic or great for business. Our waitress was knowledgeable of the wines and the menu. Still looking for that Trios wine. A blend of about 5 different reds was divine! The Caesar salad is advertised as garlicky. Yummy! The Pork Shank was juicy and full of flavor. My salmon was medium as requested but the highlight of the dish was missing.  A lemon cream dill bechemel sauce. The waitress was so disappointed she took my food off the bill. Great recovery. I will definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Scottish Salmon
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pork Shank

mpnDOn68-1p5jFEwxJiNjg.text: Was in Tempe for work. One of my coworkers and I decided to take advantage of a free night and check this place out. Can't say enough good things about this place. The atmosphere is wonderful, the food was delicious. It is such a unique environment. I loved spending time with the sweet cat, Kinko (?) who kept us company throughout our meal. Would definitely return any time I am in Tempe.

ksC3PDfuQuYoabk6KZJiyw.text: Fantastic checkin, Outstanding service, Amazing menu selection, and the best patio in Tempe.

Z-sTTi-UWCsUauS7aFlc9w.text: You get what you pay for when, and especially when it comes to House of Tricks! This is our, go-to, romantic dinner night out place! My husband and I have celebrated our anniversary here before, and they even gave us a lovely spot in the back of the garden that was secluded from the majority of guests and very quiet! It made for a very lovely evening! The wine selections were fair, although I think they could invest in carrying a different selection of pinot grigio and chardonnay. The whites were a bit lacking, and I'm not a huge reds fan. I wish I could give this place a 4.5 stars rather than 4! I think what would make it a 5 for me would be to add to the wine selection! We will most definitely be back! Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

tbZIzlRQAkYc5j6wx5WdpQ.text: Food was excellent and the staff was SO lovely. Took a client here - it was a great spot.

UJnwYtg1E3h7NQUaOsYEzg.text: Fantastic wine list, food, and ambiance.  Cool vibe.  RB is super knowledgeable about wine as well as generous.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Great wine list!  Thank you, RB!

1aRwCH4B6RCHog0fpuBC3g.text: So I dine alone on business trips and I could deduct .5 for indifference by bartender at first but it is all about the food this time. Choosing to go light I selected the shaved sprouts and roasted beets salad and it was amazing!  I picked an appetizer for dinner and I'm still salivating. Seared scallops over cauli puree in a root beer reduction. More please! With the growth of chains around the valley it's nice to find a carefully crafted menu of seasonal foods! Cheers to my friend Brad for recommending this place. Back to NC I go. But in my mind I'm goin' back to House of Tricks!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Entree
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salad

st4tKwQe8VjWGF53fJlILQ.text: Had reservations and were running a little late due to traffic from the football game - the hosts were totally understanding and helpful as far as where to park. The menu is great along with the atmosphere. I had the Boar - phenomenal! Our server seemed to have good energy at first but then seemed to become very annoyed and eager to get us out - there was no wait and he also had other tables. We asked for him to divide the check and he became very aggravated and said that he couldn't do so.

Xg5-VmP-jjO9SfNWDOmZGg.text: Visiting from San Diego for the Desert Sprints Regatta and yelped this gem.  Lovely and quite large outside seating area.  Plenty of heaters if there is a chill, but we were quite comfortable this night without them.  We came at height of dinner hour on a Saturday.  Our server was helpful but a little distracted.  She had tables all over the restaurant and was slammed.  She made up for her lack of attention with her knowledge of the menu and solid, accurate recommendations.  Menu was not overly large and full of tempting fare.  We stayed in the Starters and Soup/Salad section to maximize variety.  Wow.  Warm shaved brussel sprouts with macadamias and blue cheese (like nothing else I've had in the recent brussel sprouts menu item boom), thin sliced wild boar BBQ, a toasted garbanzo bean plate and a smoked foie gras plate - all packed with flavor and well-presented.  Desserts were a moon pie special with caramelized bananas and the best bread pudding I've had since Commanders Palace in NO.  The portions on the starters were generous without overwhelming and we had room for the fantastic desserts.  Decent selection of wines by the glass and what looked like some interesting cocktails - we stuck to the wine.  Tempe seemed like a great college town with a fun, slightly rowdy vibe.  It also appeared to have a great restaurant scene.  We'll have to stay longer next time.

QHo05eqiSxDokgjDrbaf7A.text: Love the setting for House of Tricks, and I like the food too! I've only been at lunch time and service has been quick and effective. The menu has a nice variety of vegetarian options, and their daily specials sometimes include something vegetarian too. The only dish I've had that was on the disappointing side was the black bean burger, which was just too dry.

JNVJ3rFsGdpgjTVN1X4uDw.text: This restaurant probably has the best location and layout of any restaurant in the valley.  It's a hidden gem that I think gets looked over too easily, but honestly I like it that way.  The crowd here is older, not sure why but you never seen college kids here which is strange.    Concerning the fair, the food is really good but not great however, it's better than most but in Tempe that's not saying a lot.  The menu isn't very extensive though so that really subtracts from its appeal.  Lastly the service, the service here is wonderful, the staff are just so nice and attentive.  However, it must be said that they are not very expedient, be prepared to wait not for the food to come but for you server to come.  All in all this place ties for best restaurant in Tempe with its neighbor the Chop Shop.

1MsnWv59kXVLRiMSPuKmew.text: Went to House of Tricks last night with two friends. First I gotta say Jackie, our waitress, was super helpful and extremely knowledgeable about the menu. For drinks, That Green Thing was amazing, I highly recommend it, also good was The Dirty Bird (both gin and vodka versions).   Now to the food, we got the PEI mussels, Wild Boar & Koran Ribs to start, my favorite was the Wild Boar but all were extremely favorable and prepared perfectly.   Next course was salads, the Brussel sprout salad with beets, soft egg and pancetta vingerette was the clear winner for the table, also good was the arugula salad with pine nut and Fig Champagne vingerette.  For the entrees the table spilt the Molasses Braised Pork Osso Buco with Shaved Gruyere, Snap Peas and Toasted White Beans, the pork was fork tender and packed with flavor I would highly recommended this.   My favorite was the Sumac Crusted Lamb Rack on Apple-Cauliflower Puree with Amarena Cherry-Whisky Sauce and Wilted Kale, the lamb was a beautiful medium rare and the Whisky sauce was incredible.  The salted caramel apple dessert is a staff favorite and we totally agreed!!  Wish I was in town longer so that I could go back :)

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Sumac Crusted Lamb Rack on Apple-Cauliflower Puree with Amarena Cherry-Whisky Sauce and Wilted Kale
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Shaved Brussels Sprouts and Roasted Beets with Shallots, Blue Cheese and Hazelnuts, Soft Cooked Egg

Bf_amlSzFQ5RQJ04WirCrA.text: We came here for dinner on a Friday night. Very romantic spot with lots of outdoor space covered by some trees and a pergola. We started off with some champagne and then switched to red wine. They have an extensive wine selection, and the Cabernet we ordered was absolutely delicious and smooth. We tried the heirloom tomato salad, ahi tuna, foie gras, and there was a special of duck. The duck was by far the best dish we tried, but all of them were flavorful and delectable. Though the place is a bit pricey, it was a delightful special occasion out with the girls. The service was also great.

zdHqXkGY6f2cD-iNOCsGVQ.text: This was our first time found this place on yelp and had to write Great food awesome service

PPgFmQnoJGhQdIaankflBQ.text: First of all, the outdoor dining area is beautiful and I really liked the Hippy squirrel cocktail I started with.  The bread was, frankly, sorry and the butter left a film in my mouth.  My kale salad was very nice and quite a large portion with big fresh boysenberries.  It took an extraordinarily long time to recieve my entree; pistachio encrusted diver scallops on special.  While the scallop were prepared nicely, the dish just looked like a mess and wasn't worth the price IMO for 3 smallish scallops.  Overall, my meal did not meet expectations based on other reviews.

jQny5y4qXqcSvQpY8MWrNA.text: Delicious dinner of squid ink pasta with shrimp and calamari. Excellent wine list interesting infused bourbon option. Waitress was a delightful Irish girl who was very attentive to our every whim. Soup of the day was it delicious Mexican Mexican stew.

eC0QNO9mMP0viExm5b_aFQ.text: The food here is incredible!  The staff were attentive,  polite and yet not intrusive.  We ate outside, misters kept it nice and cool. The ambiance is wonderful.  If you a looking for some place to eat for a special night this is it.  The bartender fit right in to the high standards this place has, he made my wife's drinks perfectly. We don't live here but have family that do and we will be coming back to eat here when we visit again. I have to laugh Tricks, there are no tricks here just great food and a wonderful time.

WxYyUwa30EBH-nydlNsVrg.text: Recommend the PB&J or the salmon salad. Nice wine list, good service, and great outdoor seating.

x3t1_7N1PFd-hXcxSRzyWA.text: We came for a nice family dinner with a reservation. Our waitress took 15 minutes to take our order. It took more than an hour before we had our entree. It was rare instead of medium. We didn't have time to send it back or get dessert because we had a play to go to. Would not recommend!!

vdlno5jq-BL8CpuYq3V2pQ.text: This place was so delicious from the salad to the desert. I will definitely be coming back!

U52QtTcRlUhO526A5IyXfg.text: Fantastic food! However, we were there for two and a half hours and only got two drinks from our waitress... with the cost of the food and the upscale type of restaurant it's suppose to be, I thought the service would have been better...

lNVfZUbZ3rYMyghOinTvJA.text: Should be called house of deliciousness!  I could go on and on about this item, that item, blah blah blah but I dont really waznt to. This is good food, done creatively, and in my mind presented in a casual yet sophisticated manner without any pretensiousness. The chef here creates inspirational dishes that seem to meld asian and southwestern flavors seemlessly. Ok so now I realize this are not all real words but after eating here and developing a drunken state of mind who really cares anyhow?  The lowdown is the food is good and priced fair for what you get. Our service was great and on top of everything we truly had an amazing time on a rainy Saturday evening. Next time hopefully we can enjoy the killer outdoor bar and patio seating. I cant wait to go back and eat our way through the new menu.  The custom cocktails were delightful and the wine list is pretty spot on.

3OoULmfHVR3cubV_fekWVg.text: Ok, so I think that this place would have received 4-5 stars upon my first visit just the other night, but the service sucked! So, we sat down in the bar area at one of the high top tables around 6:30 pm and there seemed to be only one guy working that whole area. He was not only serving but he was bartending as well.   I have been to great restaurants all over the world and could not understand why they had just one guy working a very busy area. There were people all around the bar ordering food and drinks and those of us who were at the high top tables as well. The other staff continued to walk by and head to their respective areas of service. We waited for a while for him to come back after giving us the drink menus. We did not eat until about 7:45 pm, which is unacceptable!!! I have a busy life and was not expecting to have to wait all night for a meal after a long day of work!!!!!  My guy friend that I was with who loves this place, reassured me that it is not always like this, but I am still annoyed.  THe food on the other hand was awesome and my bourbon infused drink left me feeling pretty nice, since, I obviously had an empty stomach!  Not sure if I would go back...

5t2iq39N9it8oh5S2p3toA.text: great atmosphere - the appetizer, salad and wifes trout were excellent. My rack of lamb which was recommended was just average.   The waitress was attentive when around but appetizer plates with empty shells sat through most of dinner, salad plates when empty left till entree arrived. For the price ot the restaurant those kind of items do make a difference. We will be back because we like the overall experience, but details need to be picked up.

PdpUJcRG9xV0N8eGEgEthw.text: Great ambience and delicious food.  Went here for a work dinner and they had lots of good selections for the vegetarian and international visitor in our group truly enjoyed.

g23swX8ytNKjqSpZ9kXeQQ.text: Had a great dinner here last month. Very interesting menu, food well prepared, good service and delightful outside ambience for seating.

EC3bNvDIur81zXj5NZPzzQ.text: This is a FANCY place in Tempe! Who knew?? I've lived in AZ for 1.5 years and had never heard of this place. It is hidden off of Mill Ave and is super cute. There are indoor and outdoor seating areas. I would recommend outdoors if the weather permits. There are orange trees and heaters and the waiters are extremely attentive.  Now let's get to the good part..the FOOD :)  We had a ton of appetizers - shrimp, chicken and veggies and all were really good. The sauce on the shrimp was a little weird, but i really liked the chicken (i think it was a peanut sauce) I especially liked their bruschetta and wine selections.

jHH5WIq2gYtTIRj6EYcs6w.text: 6/1/11  I finally made it to HoT for happy hour!  Parking is in the back- be careful parking anywhere else, as your car might get towed.  There are misters for those who like eating outside.  Since I've only been here once, and I had to eat at the bar area for happy hour, I don't know what the noise level is indoors, but it certainly seems nice in there, if not a bit cramped.  A big minus for me is that smoking is allowed outside, so I'm hoping to secure a table indoors on my next visit.  Ordered the only cocktail on the menu that uses ginger liqueur (sorry, but I forgot the name), and really liked it!  It tasted light and refreshing, but packed quite a punch, so be careful-- it went down very smoothly and very fast!  Happy hour knocked off only $1, down to $9, so I suppose it's good that the bartender had a heavy hand.  ;)  As for my entree, I had the Roasted poblano, artichoke, and spinach dip, which came w/ both crostini and water crackers.  Skip the water crackers (they felt stale when I bit into them, and they're very bland) and stick w/ the crispy, nicely-toasted, and olive oil-drizzled crostini.  I did, and I ate the entire thing!  (Well, minus the water crackers.)  The base was very creamy, yet also chunky (I love foods that layer on many textures!), and I really appreciated the heat that the roasted poblanos brought to this dish.  From the moment I took that first bite, I thought that  this dish was different from any other spinach and artichoke dips I've ever tried.  Try it if you're into s/a dips, and let me know what you think of this one!  The rest of the menu sounds great, but can get very pricey (salads and soups, $6-10; starters, $10-19; and entrees, $20-32).  Will try to return for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Roasted poblano, spinach, and artichoke dip.
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. A cocktail made w/ ginger liqueur.

q0vbgYCNbcaKy3nxqkcI9w.text: We have dined at House of Tricks several times, and we have never been disappointed. Excellent service, delicious meals, many good menu options.  We enjoy the patio, and even in cooler months are very comfortable with the patio heaters.  We highly recommend House of Tricks.

SSorLstkZpSoMzIQi6PXrg.text: Yum! Ordered the steak and a glass of red. Was waited on by Clay and asked him to plz match up my wine with my food. He did a great job! This is my second visit. The first time I had the charcuterie plate and a salad. This time, I'm a little more hungry and ordering the 6 oz filet. I'll let the photos speak for themselves. Good food and service. I want to say great yet the steak was somehow salty with no demo-glace.  Nonetheless, I'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Ambience
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Misty ambience with a little fish pond. Very nice!
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Steak and glass of wine

boqWeWzomKRiI-DnEKxMBg.text: This a really special place with such a wonderful setting under the foliage of beautiful trees, the misters, the fountain! Even in summer we do like it as it is less hot there. We were there at 6:30 p.m. when it was 104 in June! It feels like you are so far from the city and you are in fact smack in the middle of Tempe with ASU nearby, yet so quiet. Parking is not a problem but you have to pay for it, no big deal. The food is great. I particularly love their appetizers and especially the rabbit terrine/pate. Their mussels are delightful. I do order a few appetizers instead of a main dish because I enjoy trying different and smaller portions of food. They are closed in July due to the high heat of our summers but as soon as they reopen we will be getting there again for dinner.

hvisx1i6mHeprA7q1iDNlg.text: We came here for my birthday.... ordered the chicken salad, it was dark meat, chicken was like 10 days old and pita bread was stale. The most awful sandwich. Despite the fact it was my birthday, it was not acknowledged. Hubby had the turkey rueben, the turkey tasted 10 days old. Since I could not eat the awful dark meat chicken salad, I ate his potatoe salad and had a stomach ache all afternoon.  I don't understand the great reviews, the food is awful and old.

bSZFotFLECtn5YmctovPCg.text: Great outdoor patio. Food is very average, and service is slow.   Sea bass was dry and over cooked. Bread pudding cake in a large portion and looked great...but it was dry, too. Both were a bit pricey, which would be ok if the food was better. Meh!

wsQcf2Iv0ASVf8IJVQVKzQ.text: This is a fantastic restaurant! The food and the atmosphere are superb! It is close to our granddaughter's dorm at ASU and is our favorite place to take her for a special occasion. We plan on eating there frequently.

awuqCN7dIdMv0Tt346HFyw.text: Love sitting on the patio. It's nice eating salad out side and looking at the beautiful view of Tempe Arizona.  Great place for a girls lunch.

Dmrmyx5gEwAPY9tTtY7aFg.text: Crowded bc of ASU Football game. Food wasn't knock your socks off quality. But their prices were. Friendly and attentive waitress. She was great!

1M8BbVE__JaWX6O4kkCc_g.text: Had the tenderloin, it was great! Nice outdoor dining with a good wine menu. Service was good as well.

bHRBCkt1qGugFc2dH4oZkw.text: I finally got to dine at House of Tricks a few days ago for my birthday dinner (thanks, husband!). Despite being on the ASU campus, the restaurant's historic house-turned-eatery works well and the charming outdoor patio with plenty of deciduous shade made you feel like you were enjoying your meal someplace much more upscale, i.e. not ASU!   Our server was really friendly -- always a plus, but at a place as expensive as House of Tricks, that should be expected. (Disclaimer: normally, husband and I eat vegan/vegetarian, but elected to be carnivores for our dinner. At the time of this review, there was only 1 vegetarian entree on the menu.)  We started with the ahi tuna poke with avocado cream and "lime-scented" cucumbers. That was really good and gone far, far too quickly. The husband ordered the lamb shank and lemon-honey risotto (the lamb was falling off of the bone, very yummy) and I had the bison meatloaf and purple sweet potato puree (also very good). For dessert, we shared the apple bread pudding and barely finished it.   Although we waited longer than expected to place our drink orders (a good 10 minutes...maybe I'm impatient?), overall, service was good. Presentation was lovely and the intentionally mismatched china bread plates are quaint and charming.  I would definitely come here again for a special occasion!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Apple bread pudding with gelato and salted caramel
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Lamb shank and lemon-honey risotto
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bison meatloaf, purple sweet potato purée, and veggies

218C1SlvowSyMIpCdaavLg.text: Amazing romantic atmosphere as you sit under the stars, beneath the trees with your love. This is a great spot to eat outside and there's plenty of room.   We went for the Valentine's Dinner menu and it was absolutely perfect. We started off with drinks and my favorite was the toasted. It had caramel whiskey, Frangelico, banana liquor, cream and cinnamon! Such a refreshing and sweet drink to start off the night. We split most of the courses except our entrees.   The lobster bisque was amazing especially with the mix of chorizo oil. The Gnocchi had an amazing blend of flavors and the presentation was beautiful. The best thing was the Bourbon Peach glazed prime rib. Seriously, I took some home so I could enjoy it one more day. We finished off with the Dark chocolate cake that had earl grey whipped cram and berry compote. The delectable garnish on top was beautiful and helped to wrap up the whole meal.  My suggestion is to go during their special events since they have different items on the menu. I still dream about that prime rib, the best I ever had! I wish it was always on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. The cake was beautiful to look at and delicious. This was the dark chocolate cake with berry compote
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. The baramundi fish was light and deliciois
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. The peach bourbon glazed prime rib

qQgSx1jv0gE9m6Sl5dSa5A.text: What an exceptional place! The appetizer and drinks were amazing. The dinner was to die for! My friend had the special which was a pork and apple dish that was incredible. I had the meatloaf and was sad I couldn't clean the plate! My only complaint was that it took a while after we set to get service. I would come back again for sure

qT32WpZzEmzESP4yKDJrZg.text: They seemed to have lost our reservation, and once we were finally seated, it was in a dark hole. Service: poor, waiter: zero personality, 1 out of 3 entrees was delicious. We did enjoy the lemon creme brulee.

VBitP3vLtbX2UA7IPcSizg.text: It isn't as if you'd eat here weekly without an expense account or bottomless pockets but this is a great restaurant.  If you have family in town, a special occasion to celebrate, or just want to splurge on a nice meal outdoors in the wonderful Arizona evening, then this is the spot to do it.  The food is always excellent from the apps all the way through the desserts.  The service is top notch as well.   I can't find much to say about House of Tricks that isn't great.  I guess if it's raining you'd have a horrible experience since it's nearly all outdoors but that doesn't seem to be a problem here too often!

TNLmwGmwJC_oYwv_LFTzxg.text: Hole in the walk bistro style restaurant with amazing food and a great wine list as well! I got the scallops as an appetizer, and the ahi tuna for my meal and could not have been more pleased. Perfect for all food preferences... especially good seafood. Our waitress was very friendly as well and took care of our requests promptly (including my very complicated special order). If you find yourself in the greater Phoenix area, definitely check this place out!

Bu8tN83EQah5Lxv6pIlzvA.text: The harissa mussels are amazing!!!!! The drinks are also very good too! I haven't been in a while but I liked the outside seating. We also had fois gras and that was very good. The squid ink pasta is ok. Parking can be a pain in the you know what if it's a busy night.

kTPYSIh5up6aAUjAVwkmNg.text: This place does everything right. From their impeccable table service to their professional kitchen and food prep plate executions, this is a very safe bet to satisfy your hunger needs! Kate, you rock!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

ghBd4h-8Jf-It10lAdePtA.text: This is one of the best restaurants in the Phoenix Metro area.  The food is amazing and the ambiance is wonderful.  The service is always spot on.  I can't say enough about this place.  Everything we have ordered here has been simply delightful and the desserts are to die for.

GDfRp2LXXXr0k1ZKc55SMg.text: Food was absolutely delicious! Wait time between courses was too long. Waitress was not too attentave. However, in all fairness it was very busy.

zf3EIKeJF8a3Mz_DrQkbmA.text: Had a beautiful date night with my husband. Food was great and the staff was awesome. Will be returning very soon!

ufIGW5sJ_vWS-Jt8lew_Sw.text: This restaurant has possibly the best patio in the phoenix area. That is all I can say good about this restaurant.  I ate there last weekend with a group of 4.  This is possibly the worst service I have experienced at a restaurant. It took 15 minutes to even be acknowledged by the staff and subsequently 30 more minutes to get even a drink.  The waiter's answer to the bad service was simply, I am behind and just catching up.  Ok fine but no apology, no management anywhere to be seen.  Just an excuse. This restaurant is very expensive so to be treated like that was unacceptable. On to the food.  They try very hard to be different, so different that some of the dishes made no sense.  I had the rare tuna with egg noodles in a sauce that was so spicy (not flavorful spicy) that it was nearly inedible.  It was also lukewarm.   This place is definitely not worth the price and service was so lacking it was ridiculous.

r-PP6LcLQ0MXWzi6dXoHMA.text: My wife and I celebrated our 50th anniversary at the House; we have eaten there before and have decided it is our "go to" place for special occasions. Our server was attentive, friendly, and well versed in the preparation of various menu selections. Our meals (6 oz steak and Texas wild boar enchiladas) were excellent, as were the beef enchilada soup and shaved Brussels sprout and beet salad, which we shared. We passed on dessert due to being full from our meals, but several of them sounded yummy when our server described them. My only disappointment was the noise level; it was quite noisy in the small room we were in, but that was due to some large groups of diners enjoying Holiday party cheer. It's not been a problem other times we've dined there. Highly recommended for events you want to be memorable!

toiBpstoz5bGAwAxph9QOg.text: I took my wife for our 3 year anniversary. The service was great and so was the food.  I had the duck and it was prepared just right.  The waiter was nice and answered all our questions and gave advice on which dishes to order based on what we like to eat.  The food isn't cheap but if you want high end food, you have to spend money.  We will be back soon.

Y9WRUo_KNibnRU_HfKU1_w.text: Beautiful restaurant with wonderful food! It is the perfect "date night" place in Tempe with amazing service.

VNOBndCLnM-c6dti3fKbgQ.text: Exceptional first courses set the tone for our dinner. The fois gras was sublime, the goat belly vindaloo of this world, and the cheese grits redefined a dish I would have never ordered except  it was gluten free (and they had many gluten free choices for our table of many food challenges). Very diverse and affordable wine list. We had an excellent Napa sparkling wine that was festive and nicely complemented the appetizers. Our mains included squid ink pasta, which was off the small plates menu but was a very generous portion, the bison steak, the game hen, and a squash gnocchi. Everything was exceptional except for the squash gnocchi, which was disappointingly bland. It is does not pay to be vegetarian in the West. Great service, wonderful patio, and a beautiful night. We planned our meal with my son and girlfriend after the ASU game had started, and the restaurant was wonderfully calm and only about half full. It can be packed at other times so a reservation is absolutely necessary.

BSCyte4KYcdqaNcEpKoq6w.text: This is absolutely an amazing restaurant. Each time that I've come here, I've received excellent service and been served delicious food. The patio is beautiful so that's always been where I've enjoyed the meal. The servers are excellent at recommending wines. Last time I had the duck, which was phenomenal. Just come here, you won't regret it.

bUiUkXWYf2VQ1-5uWFVCRg.text: I went to House of Tricks for the first time today, and was SO impressed. For a party of three, the wait was about 30 minutes, even though we were quoted for 10. It wasn't a huge imposition, though, as the weather was great and the setting is gorgeous. We were seated on the patio, and Shannon introduced herself as our server. She was very accommodating, as we were sort of crunched for time. I took ages to finally decide on what I wanted and I decided on the Daily Burger Special, which was a green chile tuna burger with pomegranate guacamole (YES, I KNOW!). It was SO delicious. My friend ordered the chicken taco salad and her mom got the shwarma salad. We ordered the tapas plate as an appetizer, which was also delicious and light. My meal was $13, so very reasonably priced for the quality of food I got.  I'll be back again soon.

9IGEoqUda7DDEaqynpmHNg.text: Every year I go to this place with a large group. We sit outside and the dinner takes over 4 hours. The first 3 times I went and ate the beef. It was great, but the last time I had the chicken. It was severed in what I thought was a sauce until I picked up an candle and to my disbelief it was blood. The server took it back and 20 minutes later returned it. I cut into it to find more blood. We started dinner at 7:30pm I finally ate at midnight at our hotel which was a 5 minute walk. No remorse from the server nor did a manager show up. This place should be closed down.

J4ujGC2aJ0oiwDt4Xru_Gw.text: Wow! This was a great find! Thanks fellow Yelpers for pointing me in the right direction. I had the lunch special, an incredible sweet potato and goat cheese gratin with grilled chicken (phenomenal)! My husband had the grilled chicken sandwich and our lunch companion had the chicken club - both said their meals were outstanding!  Highly recommend!

Y7TTgvtaZSIP9b6bD2IxwA.text: Sit outside and enjoy some wine w/dinner. Foie Gras&Pork belly came drowning in syrupy-sweet sauce. Food doesn't stand out but the ambiance makes up for whatever my palette was missing that day.      Arcadia Farms is same concept of converting an old house into a restaurant. We ate Arcadia for brunch then House of Tricks for dinner.

FUcx1iVSvfEhFp2ewizkLA.text: I had the pleasure of dining at House of Tricks yesterday with a couple of friends.  I live in Glendale, but it was definitely worth the drive.
