Luckily for HOT, I had great company which made my overall rating higher than they might deserve.  3.7 stars total - based on the following...  AMBIANCE - 5 stars In a historic house with both indoor and outdoor seating, this is an amazing atmosphere; better than most of the strip malls that the valley is known for!  SERVICE - 4 stars The hostess went above and beyond by moving us from an inside table to an outside table by the fire when we had a change of heart and wanted some fresh air.  They also went above and beyond to help me find a parking spot as I didn't want my car to get towed from the lot next door like Patti B. yelped about previously.  Larissa was our server and she was extremely knowledgeable and friendly.  There was only one thing that was a bit disappointing when it came to service:  that she came by to take our order and I told her I needed a minute and she said she'd be right back but disappeared for around 10 or 15 minutes.  FOOD - 2.5 stars Let me explain:  I chose wrong.  Do not order the Seafood Pistou.  Larissa told me that it was a 'messy' dish, but not minding that, I ordered it anyways.  It was not messy, it was just kind of gross.  The seafood didn't taste so fresh and I think the combo of that and the creamy heavy sauce were what gave me a horrible stomach ache that evening.  However, Kristin C. chose right - she had the Ahi Tuna... it was a beautiful presentation and according to Kristin, it was fantastic!  Note to self:  order Ahi if I ever return!  Oh, and I tasted the Asian Pear Salad too - it was tasty.  So, the 2.5 star rating is an average...   COMPANY - 5 stars! I'm going to allow the fact that I had a really fun dining companion bring up the average a bit here...  BANG FOR YOUR BUCK- 2 stars We had only water and perrier to drink and our bill was still kind of high for what I thought was just an ok meal... essentially 1 salad, 2 entrees, and 1 Perrier was over $80 out the door!  I admit that this review is based on just one experience... however, because of the fact that I have no clue when I'll go back, I wanted to review it anyways!  If you go to HOT, go for the ambiance and order the tuna! :)

3AomBNQMbLheXIX4cZfXpw.text: SO many reviews already I'll try to keep it short and Sweet!  Food~ I've only been for lunch, is Always Delicious, price, quality and quantity wise. Some of my favorites include Quiche of the day served with salad and fresh fruit, The Grilled Salmon and the Chicken Shawarma Salad (see pics)  The desserts Ive had are also mouthwatering, although they cost almost as much as any of the entrees I've named above. Angel food cake with berries and creme anglaise or the White Chocolate Banana Bread Pudding were both out of this world (see pics)  Service~ seems like a chore to the college pukes who work here, be lucky if you get served at all.  Most recently I watched our waiter through the window completely ignore us the entire time while he drank wine and chatted with some slob at the bar.  I have however been waited on properly, maybe suggesting a female server might help. Bad service has always come from the male staff.  Ambiance~ Love it, inside a cute old house or outside on the Lush and maturely landscaped garden patio.  *Notes* ~Make reservations for lunch or dinner just to be safe ~Bring at least $2 in coin for the parking meters ~Dinner prices are near triple the lunch prices for the entrees ~Ask for a bread and butter basket, chances are you'll be here awhile  **parking meters have an 80min. time limit, mention this if you are having SLOW service  I  have to give 5 stars for the food

2w73XEMtBIqgZOQNwIQ5Gg.text: We were five friends for a ladies luncheon to celebrate an engagement. As usual, the service was spot on and friendly. The atmosphere is perfect for special occasions. It's too hot right now to sit on the patio, so we had a nice table inside with lots of windows. I ordered the salmon flatbread with arugula. The salmon was so delicious. The flatbread itself was a little chewy, so I would not order this dish again. Others at the table had the lox with black beans, which was artfully presented; the chicken salad with goat cheese, which looked delicious but perhaps had too much bread. We also had a chicken Shwarma salad with fruit, and a house salad with grilled chicken. Everyone loved their meals. We had a delightful time.

YMdK5M9ejsihZd27HN1Zbw.text: I really wanted to give this place five stars due to the great patio seating and the amazing rack of lamb. However, the service was unimpressive and that is really what we took away from this place. As mentioned earlier, the lamb was very good and their sole vegetarian dish of portobello tempura was good.  The desserts were hit and miss.  The PB lava cake was good but the bread pudding tasted like pancakes.  I won't bother with dessert next time.    The quality of their entrees and the atmosphere out on the patio make it a recommended place to go. I just wish the service was on par with their food and atmosphere.

-8Ay2Sq2c9_EX5DZh-yvUA.text: What a hidden gem!  So glad we made our way here during a trip to Phoenix.  Outside dining, fresh and chic without being overbearing and obnoxiously posh, extensive wine list.  We had the mussels and almost drank the broth.  Ahi was sashimi grade, seared perfectly.  Will definitely come back!

wafrXr4jBeZMnBZkhJ2pLg.text: My girlfriend and I are loyal yelp'ers and we put House of Tricks on our must-see list in Tempe after seeing all the great reviews and we definitely weren't let down.   In located in the middle of a desert, the sprawling grove of trees that surround the restaurant definitely make it stand out. The place looks like an eerie pre-civil war cotton plantation... but it's weirdly romantic and nostalgic.   The food was great! My girlfriend and I attempted to try as much as we could from the menu as our budgets and stomachs would allow. We had:   1. Perfect Peach - We started with a peach cocktail that had a gin in it. It was a very well made cocktail that definitely had the peach flavor while still reminding you that this was indeed an alcoholic drink - very refreshing in 100+ degree weather.   2. Summer Salad with Strawberries and Spinach - This salad was great. It came with spinach, cheese, fennel, strawberries, and candied walnuts. It was tied together by a subtle vinaigrette that still allowed the individual components of the salad to shine while still adding a distinct hue to the salad that would otherwise not be there.  3. Foie Gras with Cinnamon Apple Chutney - This was the first sweet foie gras I've ever had and it was amazing. The foie gras had a nice crust without losing the near liquid creaminess in the center. The chutney was sweet in a way that you could taste the ingredients, but be careful to limit the amount eaten with the foie gras because it can easily overpower the flavor of the liver.   4. Lychee Marinated Duck - As a kid, my only knowledge of duck came in the form of Peking Duck, and damn, this was the most gourmet duck I've ever tried. The sweet and creamy skin and fat of the duck complemented the savory and almost smokey meat so well. The rice was forgettable but the lychee nuts made for a nice dessert.   5. Porterhouse Lamb - My girlfriend ordered medium but the meat came out medium rare. The cut of meat was far too thick to cook well or evenly and that thick of a cut of meat is hard to enjoy. The meat, however, had great flavor and definitely had a robust lamb taste that a lot of other restaurants can't seem to achieve. The lamb literally melts in your mouth - so tender. The sides were pretty good. The eggplant was excellent - the flesh was soft while the skin provided a chewy texture to complement.   Overall, great food and it's a pretty intimate setting. The food was great and the portions were the right size and allowed for more than sufficient enjoyment of each dish without being overkill (definitely a nice break from the huge portions typical of restaurants nowadays). The service was excellent, and for a restaurant of this caliber, the food definitely met all of our expectations but didn't exceed them.   I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone in the area looking for a romantic spot to take a loved one to.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Foie Gras with Apple Cinnamon Chutney

xISv9smMVtc7YFK-i_FIWA.text: This was our first time dining at the House of Tricks. It was a great experience, Axel took excellent care of us and made our anniversary celebration special. We loved his wine suggestion. Our food was amazing. The salmon was delicious. We highly recommend this restaurant.

IR2wYEg6ZW9mq5oWcX7u1g.text: Had a group lunch there when we were doing a training class in PHX. Se were seated outside and it was so lovely! They waited on 23 of us and got the food out at the same time with not a glitch! Everyone raved about the food too!  Loved it!

cocufM2sISo9JlIAozdHsg.text: Going for restaurant week and we sat on the patio. The service was excellent!  Highlights for me: Duck Panzanella, tasty modern tacquitos, super crispy with cauliflowers, creme brulee was fantastic with thinly sliced peaches as well. Ordered a bottle of red to share with the 4 of us and the server had a cool little fact about the Sean Minor wine.  Friends enjoyed the short rib app, the pork dumpling. For dessert we had amaretto as well.   The only lowlight was the chocolate cake. My guy took a few bites and gave up. The server was very kind as to offer him the creme brulee which was so much better. It was a lovely evening and everyone enjoyed themselves. We love House of Tricks.

pVSklQgkBgAdQJpf4pNnyw.text: Definitely my favorite restaurant in Tempe and in my top 5 or so in the valley.  If creativity along with great food and service is what you are looking for you'll love this place.

LSSWN4rzAi1xloafkAnBJg.text: We visited this place last spring based on the reviews read. I thought I sent this review in not long after our visit,  but Yelp gave me a reminder to finish the review.   Pros: Quiet adult atmosphere.   Cons: We had salmon with vegetables. Since I was possibly allergic to the puree, I was suppose to get more vegetables instead, but that didnt happen. Food was small portion and not worth the cost. Order was not correct. We were seated under a large umbrella with a table candle light that would not stay lit. As the sun set we could barely see our food. Wait Staff not attentive so we could have our candle table light lit to see our food.  Also be prepare to pay for parking as its located in busy area.  Overall, this place is not worth the money spent.

KsQ5HXrkkBWw7oVPE0oygg.text: Really cool atmosphere, awesome food, decent service. I've been here on two occasions for business meals and I'm looking forward to visiting again!

StoVElgH8p54v3BiTPStwg.text: The food is unique and inventive but in an approachable way. The prices are on the higher end but the portions are good, the service is absolutely amazing (not in an overly "I want to be your best friend and sit at your table and join the conversation way" or a stuffy "I'm a waiter but I have a doctorate in steak and wine way" either...it is the perfect blend of attentiveness and candor. I will go again and again...especially if someone else is footing the bill.

g8n9_Hw5fgxlute6qytTMQ.text: Server was attentive but not overbearing.  The soup was outstanding while the Short Rib was a little too fatty for my tastes in places and the beans were simply decent.   I don't want to sound like I'm nitpicking though - the food on the whole was quite good.  The brownie desert was a rich melt in your mouth masterpiece although I did go home and eat some leftover pizza after because I was still hungry.  On the whole I had a perfectly fine dinner I just left feeling very blase about the whole experience.  There was no "wow" factor and with those prices I can't justify more than a slightly above average 3.5 star review.

FhyXhKULmsA3om5hPmc5eg.text: Absolutely amazing food. Have gone twice, once for lunch I got the smoked green chili pork sandwich, so good and the house chips were very crunchy. For dinner the beef tenderloin didn't even require a knife it just fell apart. Highly recommend

BNCroHvL9CfR79-Fc0AMeQ.text: This place has such a delicious array of food, and I can't get enough of it. Last time I was here, about a week ago, they had these scallops with a root beer reduction, they blew my mind, and a duck confit salad that was so tasty. I also ordered their market fish, which was a striped bass on potatoes at gratin, I have yet to figure out why my frozen tilapia isn't doing magic tricks in my mouth like that bass did. Just kidding, I know why, it's from Costco, and it's frozen haha. They have a huge wine selection, and a quaint little outdoor bar and parking around the area is free after 6! What's not to love about an upscale place in Tempe, where most of used to bar food.  I love coming here and siting on the patio, it makes for a ridiculously romantic evening for you and your honey! Or if you need to celebrate a graduation I saw tons of caps and gowns with their families (also some hooker heels with those gowns, which was pretty hilarious for people watching).

vup6EW-v3-pwctiBTksCfA.text: House of Tricks is a treasure in Tempe and highly recommend anybody in town to try it out!

wmjlCudz6iFqQQqTAGuqpQ.text: 4 of us went here before the football game & what a treat it was. Our waitress was fantastic! She very attentive but never in your face. Perfect! All drinks were on point & the apps were amazing. We had the Poke & baby back ribs. My oh my!!! I was a bit scared to try the poke being in the desert & all, but to my delightful surprise it was one of the best we've EVER had!!  The ribs were also yummy! 3 of us had the braised short ribs & it was great. One of us had the pork chop & it did not disappoint!

qv9MVfzlkX-nZo16rwngfA.text: The patio is lovely, with heaters in the winter. Even though it was busy it wasn't too noisy.  The food was phenomenal. We had the mussels in this delicious cream Sauce that we wanted to lick from the bowel. The ahi tuna was delicious and a lighter options for an entree. The mahi mahi was delicious, the sauce is superb and made the dish. The bread pudding was huge and delicious. We also had the cheesecake with lavendar in the crust-- superb. The wine list is different with wines from Austria and Slovenia as well as France and Italy. Our server was superb. No complaints! A must go! Perfect before a show at the Gammage.

B8Ke4PKxiv62yfqDJX8fGw.text: We spent Valentines Day here and it was so romantic. The outdoor patio was overwhelmingly beautiful. I can't even describe how delicious and perfect our meals were. I got the Cornish hen and he got the bison meatloaf. Just perfect. And from the Valentine's Day special menu we got the chocolate cake and I'm so glad we did. Everything was just perfect. Service was wonderful. I would highly recommend House of Tricks for any romantic dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. A perfect Valentines Day

kGnmYdSIFwZvXrVz2JDT9w.text: Sooo the food was amazing! ! It was a work event with about 20 people. I had beef tenderloin and my friend had sea bass both were unbelievable. We were sitting outside and it started to sprinkle (shocking for Tempe in May). The waitress quickly raised an extra umbrella and kept us nice and comfortable. I highly recommend House of Tricks!

hb69HtmAZ5C73oyC8LMRUw.text: Amazing food and service in a really fun environment. We had the sears foie gras, ahi and tenderloin. All cooked to perfection. Only negative was that patio sprinklers were making everything wet forcing us to select an inside table over the beautiful outdoor patio.

Py9L0keEH4elTqWfGutABw.text: This was a nice outdoor dining experience. The servers were helpful and the dishes had very unique tastes. I'm usually not into foie grais but the sweet, tangy sauce complimented the flavor well. We tried the grilled sea bass special which contained a myriad of tastes.  Also tried the rack of lamb and osso buco which were good. Dessert was bread pudding and flourless chocolate cake. Entrees were the main draw of the night. Well done first impression!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bread pudding with assorted berries and cream topping

RW3F2lDkjPRUVc5eqGwfNw.text: Plenty of shade for lunch and heaters for eves. Six of us were pleased with preferences ranging from gluten free to vegan to vegetarian and omnivores. Don't hesitate to visit for a great valley experience near PHX!

juyTZvZJT8X463ZyjSYjaA.text: What a wonderful surprise! Very quaint, but nice downtown Tempe city vibe without the rowdy students! We shared foi gras appetizer and it was delicious. I had the blueberry salad with house smoked salmon appetizer. I would defiantly take guests here again.

MuKGx9wXtklcSDq8HdAYlw.text: I really wanted to just love this place, I mean, I just wanted to love it so bad.   We went on a Tuesday night for dinner service. The ambiance was great, and it was a cute little restaurant. The service was terrible....I mean terrible. We waited for every single thing, from order taking to food arrival. Our main dishes arrived 40 mins after we ordered. There was never an apology, or even a, "hey sorry we are running a little behind." They simply just allowed us to wait.   The bread they brought out was ok, but it was cold. The butter is what made the bread good, but the bread would be so much better if it was warm.   The food was good, luke warm, but very good. I ordered the short rib, and I loved the flavor and sauce.   I would give it another shot.

lN4zS_5SKwLW3ifkHoe72A.text: Very delicious dinner with great service! The restaurant is super cozy and cute with a great outdoor patio. We started with the upside down mushroom and leek focaccia and it was outstanding! Loved the garlicky bite of the sundried tomatoes..I could have eaten just this for dinner. We also had the beet salad but added goat cheese instead of pecorino, I thought it was great. If I had a suggestion it would be for them to add more beets, and bigger pieces.  For dinner I had the salmon, cooked perfectly and I loved the flavor of the lemon curd. The black rice was very tasty. I didn't get the ricotta blob on the side. I also got to taste the pork chop and it was delicious, very juicy and I loved the Dijon mustard-based sauce on the top.   Home run, House of Tricks!

macXSptXDs3AwUY0h8ONqQ.text: Yessss! House of Tricks never disappoints. I used to come here for lunch, or tea/desserts and everything was always so perfect.   I finally came back for my graduation lunch (they take reservations) and everybody loved it as usual. I got the BLT made with cornbread instead of a bun. It was amazing. The menu changes (idk how often) so posting the different things we got probably won't help.   But the menu always has unique, fancy type stuff for a good price! Also the desserts are SO freaking good. One time I got a coffee creme brulee paired with hibiscus tea and omgggg.   The service is also very good and the atmosphere is beautiful! It's so pretty green... and if you like cats you'll love the abundance of furry friends in the yard :)  Hands down, fav place in Tempe.

IhvQanocW0z14-CjbwjCQA.text: Oh man, get the pork volcano shank. Holy smokes. Ambiance is phenomenal. The food is better. Love it.

OcijeKLknEF-tzzuWqcteQ.text: My took me here, great set-up and ambience. Food is so good with great wine pairing.

wxWxGvj_Dq9QDj7lmMlQXQ.text: We went here for my birthday and had a very nice time. Good drinks, good food, pretty decent service. However, as a vegetarian, there was a very limited selection for me, so this is something to be aware of if you're a vegetarian or dining with them. Dessert was very good, though!

UY_DKYpSvZcJjCt9Ptnxrw.text: I have been coming to House of Tricks for a number of years.  This is one of my favorite spots for a gourmet experience and food that is fresh and innovative.   My lunch here was celebrating a special event.  And as always, the service was impeccable, the food fabulous and I love their patio.  I enjoyed the wonderful quiche combination - with yummy pork/chickpea soup.   Others enjoyed their burgers and the cornbread BLT - everything was delicious.    What is keeping me from giving this location a full 5-stars is two points - one within their control and one they are not able to do anything about.   I was sad to see their adult version of the PB&J go away - it was so much fun to order and so wickedly good.  I hope they bring it back.    Part of the appeal of this location is their expansive patio - especially in the beautiful Arizona winter - eating "al fresco" in the thriving Tempe downtown area.  However, a high-rise building is being erected across the street, which totally blocks the winter sun from their patio.  And, although it was a moderate day (mid-60's), we had to ask for two heaters to be brought to the table.     I will continue to whole-heartedly endorse this fabulous venue, but just  be prepared for a change.  I hope the sun moves north quickly - which will help the early spring visitors.

bCYL3hcyaRb20d2xuu9fnA.text: House of Tricks never disappoints! Another fabulous dinner. Hubby had the bison meatloaf and I had the seared sea scallops and salad. Plus our server was exceptional, Naomi. She made our 25th anniversary dinner very special.This is the most perfect patio weather and they have the best patio for it.

XhJTRH9veCJYFdUBchh2DQ.text: The food is super yummy! Ambiance very welcoming and intimate. Only down side, service takes forever. We ordered dessert at 8:20p and at 8:48p still waiting on it...not sure how long it takes cheesecake to be plated, but here I am. Would come back if I didn't have any plans to do anything else with my evening.

XME572TQ2eHT0y4_LOiikQ.text: 100% absolutely one of the top restaurants in the phoenix area.  Ambience is romantic. Menu is fantastic.  A life changer.

iORTnt4U6HN9nkOReC8DOg.text: Had a reservation at 7:45. The table wasn't ready until 8. The food was very pricey and the food was decent. There was a stray cat wondering around our table and grown women would lay down by our feet and play with the cat. Overall bad experience WOULD NOT RECOMMEND

qtuJ0cl98xkk6_zXkn_DTw.text: BEWARE! The majority of seating at this restaurant is outside! We had a reservation a week ahead of time & drove an HOUR to get here in the rain only to be told they did not have room to seat us inside (and 'inside seating is never guaranteed' except for the groups they had the inside reserved for this rainy 40 degree evening!) Having to leave and find another place to eat at 5pm in Tempe was HORRIBLE! Traffic is unbelievable. We will not return to this restaurant. At minimum they owe patrons with reservations a phone call to warn them of these 'limitations'. It's worth noting, parking is bad as well.

_HFCnIPvWmF-GYEPBjSOow.text: Our waitress, Sarah, was awful. After searching online for a great place to take my parents for their anniversary, I chose House of Tricks based on great reviews from different sites. I called days in advance to make reservations and mentioned multiple times we were celebrating their anniversary. At first I thought perhaps she was new as she was slow and stares off into space as she tried to remember what the specials were for the day and finally gave up to look at her notes. Then when we said we wanted to share appetizers (the four of us) and asked about the scallops and then she brought 2, I would think she would tell us the $20 scallops only came with 2 when she saw 4 people in front of her. We asked for bread and she said she'd come right back, 10 minutes later we asked again then our entrees came before we even finished the appetizers or got our bread. The next time we saw her was when she dropped off the check and did nothing for their anniversary. So disappointing! This placed was way overpriced for the poor service we received and we enjoy dining out at higher end restaurants several times a month but will NOT return here or recommend it to others. In all fairness the other staff was nice and I did hear the other server for the table near us advise her 4 top against the scallops b/c it only came with 2 pieces and the lamb was a better option to share. It wasnt until I heard her that I decided to write a review about Sarah's bad service--obviously the rest of the staff knew how to do their jobs well.

hiIsOTpi9Ltwn8pRyjDl_A.text: Always a delightful experience whether with one other or a group of 6. Outdoor atmosphere is so delightful and the quality and service has never failed us. A favorite spot to take family and guests from out of town.

PVFZGa7_oiZMyDXafNbaIA.text: Always the best place to go whether it's for lunch or dinner. I celebrate birthdays and anniversaries here and am never disappointed. The incredible customer service and the beautiful ambiance mixes together perfectly with the delectable food. I will always recommend this place to friends and family. If you go, you will never be disappointed.

YMGA8bz7BlQw9qBLW0SDQg.text: I had a Ladies' Night dinner here last weekend and we had a fantastic time! From the ambiance (beautiful patio with fire pit), to the food/drinks (the grouper was incredible) to the wait staff (I wish I could remember her name, but she was the best waitress I have ever had), it was an awesome night. The night was not cheap but definitely a great value.

54MvxYE4aXfHkVIUHYpTmw.text: Headed to House of Tricks for their Fall Showcase week. The menu had 3 small plates and was priced at $31, celebrating their 31st anniversary.  I started of with the Duck Taquito with  Pomegranate Reduction and Avocado Mousse. The Taquito tasted like the ones we buy from the frozen section and the sauce was too sweet for the dish.  Next I had the Kale and Marinated Mushroom Salad with Creamy Burrata. This one was a winner and was quite refreshing and tasty. For the Entree, I had the Beef Mole Short Rib with Tamale Mashed Potatoes. omg. get this !!! It was amazing ! Right amount of flavor and texture was on the plate. The beef was so tender and had a good ration of fatty and lean portions. I ended the meal with the Caramel bread pudding. Now this was a True stunner ! The caramel sauce was sweet and rich and perfectly paired with the bread pudding. One might say that the pudding is a little dense and rich. But hey, its bread pudding after all !! Service was exceptional and our server Andrew had a pleasant smile throughout the service. They were even prompt in fixing an error with my friend's entree.  Overall, lovely ambiance, great service and gorgeous food !

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Short Rib Mole. so tender
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Caramel Apple Bread Pudding
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cider Brined Pork Belly

zxUGfMdxg-FbeLbEq8W4dA.text: To be perfectly honest, when I heard the name "House of Tricks," an upscale restaurant isn't the first thing that came to mind. It sounds more like the name of some low-grade dirty carnival funhouse. I fully expected to be greeted by some fat, sweaty carny with a bad comb-over and a shirt two sizes too small - with buttons on the verge of bursting from a failed attempt to contain his massive beer belly.  "Hey, hey! Step right up! Come witness the illusions, the magic, and the thrills found within the House of Tricks!"  Instead of the funhouse that I was expecting, House of Tricks, which is named after the owners, is a restaurant operating in a converted cottage house. Consider them ahead of their time. While home-converted restaurants seem standard fare in "foodie" areas of Phoenix, I doubt many people were doing this in 1987 when they first opened.   We sat outside next to a heat lamp. I'd compare the atmosphere to something similar to what you'd get at a place like Cibo. So if you're a sucker for atmosphere and base your rating on "vibes," then you'll probably be quite pleased.  We started with some bread and split the Roma lettuce wedge, which included yogurt curry vinaigrette, carrot ribbons, dates, cashews, squash chips, and cheese curds. It was decent, although I think we would have preferred it better in traditional salad form.  The artisan cheese plate seems to be a very popular starter, so that's what we decided on. Honestly, unless you're a sewer rat and love virtually all cheese, these plates are always a gamble. We didn't care for many of their choices, which steered more towards the 'bleu" family. The addition of honey and mustard, as well as some bread and candied nuts were all nice little touches, however. Nothing was particularly bad, it just didn't really cater towards our palettes.    Unfortunately, I actually think the lunch menu at House of Tricks looks far more exciting than the dinner menu. They like their seafood here, which leaves me with limited options. I ended up ordering the 6oz beef tenderloin cooked medium. I liked it. My girlfriend ordered a special, which was meat prepared in some kind of Japanese style. She wasn't really a fan. Again, not so much an issue with quality, just a matter of personal taste, I guess.  For dessert, we ordered the salted caramel apple bread pudding, which also just seemed kind of standard. We didn't end up finishing it, which is incredibly rare.  Server(s) seemed kind of disorganized, but polite about it. We asked to keep our bread, only to have it taken away by someone else, only to have it returned after our main server kept reminding them repeatedly to bring out more.  There wasn't really anything particularly bad about the food or the experience. As another reviewer pointed out, if you're a frequent diner, you just kind of feel all blase about it. Sadly, we've seen it before and we've seen it done better. And if we're going to drop over 100 bucks on a meal, this would not be my first choice.  Despite mentioning in the reservation that my girlfriend was celebrating her birthday, it was not acknowledged - so if you're going here for a celebration, don't expect any special treatment. I guess it's just not one of their specialty areas.  I felt it was worth trying at least once, just for the sole purpose of crossing it off of my bookmark list. Maybe there was a time when this place would be considered one of the premier fine-dining spots in the Valley, but with so many other places opening in recent years, I find it hard to justify any repeated visits.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salted Caramel Bread Pudding
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. 6 oz Filet

Fg3YacnAKmvRvGXpCujxwg.text: I went with 3 friends and am I glad I did.  We had the noble bread to start.  We had the pork shop, the salmon, the chicken and I had the Bison Meatloaf with pureed purple potatoes and carrots OMG.  Everyone loved their dinner.  We had a couple of glasses of wine and tea.  For desert we the the brownie and the cheesecake with lavender OMG.  Our waitress Kate was fantastic.  What a quaint restaurant.  We sat inside but they have misters and really nice outside seating. I would definitely go back.  Enjoy.

8T6EbK2vW4stkLxnaWkJ0Q.text: Went here with a girlfriend for a nice dinner and was very impressed. I thought it was all outdoor seating and turns out they had some indoor seating as well. Outside is cute with all the trees, can't wait to bring the hubby. But you would never guess it Was in Tempe.  From the pictures, I was worried I would still be hungry after because the plates seems dainty. But I was pleasantly surprised I left completely full.  I started with the raspberry ice tea. We split the sweet potato goat cheese cakes. It was one of those things where it had some random ingredients and it tasted so good. Then I had the Caesar salad. It was pretty good size and was garlicky as promised. Last I had the harissa mussels as my meal. Wow it was huge and so flavorful. I almost wish I had rice to eat the sauce with because the pieces of bread wasn't enough.  We ended with splitting the bread pudding. Very good as well.  Service was great. Everyone was friendly. Can't wait to be back.

VStbVJGSsWalu7dnAm7Ppw.text: My wife and I had reservations on Valentines day. We were sat right away, we liked the atmosphere of the restaurant very much. However, throughout the night our service was very poor. The area where we were sitting in seemed to have 2 main servers, but neither of them were ours. We saw our server very rarely and we were the only table in the area where we were sitting to be served by him and it definitely felt like that as he was at our table maybe 3 times - he did not go over the valentines day specials with us, and only became aware of them after we had ordered and overheard the table next to us get educated on them. We ordered the Korean BBQ ribs for an appetizer. The ribs came out after a good amount of time after ordering (more than 30 min) and were quite cold. We did not know if they were supposed to be cold but our waiter was nowhere to be seen to ask. The eaten ribs sat on our table for another 30 minutes with no attempt by anyone to clear it until our main courses showed up and we actually had to request that the empty plate be removed so they could fit our main dishes on our table.    I ordered the meatloaf, which was good. My wife ordered the Gnocchi. The gnocchi was not what she was expecting based on the description of the dish and she was very disappointed with it. Unfortunately, again our waiter was nowhere to be found to voice our concerns and we finally had to flag someone down in the area to find him. When we said she didn't enjoy the gnocchi, he made no attempt to offer an alternative or anything else - since she had barely touched the dish he just said 'oh, I'm sorry to hear about that' and just stared at us. At this point, we were quite put off and requested our check - the only time of the night he actually came back very quickly to our table.   This was very frustrating as we were so excited to try this place for the first time based on the other reviews we have read. Our experience was one that makes us not want to return, even though so many others seem to have had a good experience. This is not what we would have expected, either in the quality of the food or the quality of service, for a restaurant of this prestige and budget range.

C4jj00trFgRXO1adqAyr3Q.text: I came here a week or two ago for lunch and fell in love with the Grilled Chicken Breast Chipotle Pasta, and I returned last night hoping to get the dish again.   I was surprised to learn that the restaurant has a completely different kitchen and chef for lunch and for dinner so, unfortunately, I was not able to get the pasta dish which did not make me happy and I told my waitress that. She was so sweet an apologized and promised I'd love their dinner just as much. I was not convinced but we decided to stay and try out some other food.   Wow!!! I didnt think it was possible for everything I put in my mouth to be as amazing as it was. We ordered the Charcuterie Plate and the Ceasar salad to start with and I got the Ancho Spiced Six Ounce Beef Tenderloin for my entree. My friend ordered the Seared Pink Peppercorn Crusted Ahi Tuna. Both were AMAZING. I dont know what the sauce is that they use with the tenderloin but I have never tasted anything so flavorful. I am not a huge red meat lover but was definitely impressed with this dish and was actually glad the pasta was not on the menu so I was forced to try something new.   I dont think you could ever be disappointed with any of the food options here, lunch or dinner!
