pkyWYiX3CIP-orBud1nkww.text: Always fantastic! We have been here a few times and the best meal ever was the pork belly during restaurant week. Love trying new dishes here and sipping on the creative cocktails!

Gdc_utO3vCwp7-5fhokUjA.text: The service was amazing. The kindest people. The food was to die for. I took my friend as a surprise to see Wicked at ASU Gammage and the distance was perfect. We will definitely be coming back. The berry tart and the apple pudding were delicious and not too sweet. LOVED IT SO MUCH

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Half Pound Beef Tenderloin Burger
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Grilled Chicken Breast Chipotle Pasta

6eCuW6OaRoQRxlHR9aoKCA.text: As of the date I am writing this, House of Tricks has 896 reviews! 896! And almost all of them GREAT! I am not really surprised. The food is wonderful! The service is extraordinary! And the location is  . . . . well, what's the old saying?   "Location, location, location."   It couldn't be better. If you are looking for a great place to have a special dinner . . . or just want to chill in a relaxing atmosphere . . . House of Tricks is your best choice . . . .  in the University area. "Not your average diner!"

VSywHoUkm3lNp6Jo-jb8tw.text: We have been at this restaurant so many times. It's our favorite place to go for any celebration that we have. The food is always delicious and the ambiance is great!

OKktmdDy_WqyyhpPPbZL9A.text: Fabulous place!! Great atmosphere.  We had a lovely evening sitting on the patio. A hidden gem

pUQTz42OCiqiaj9wJe8xWw.text: Best place in Tempe to eat. The atmosphere is perfect for a date, birthday celebration or pregame before a show at Gammage. The food menu is always rotating with fresh ingredients and fresh ideas. We personally love the Harrisa Mussels with chorizo and extra noble bread.  Plus its great to sit in the bar area (first come first serve) so you can get in and out for a quick bite. Chris the bar manager is always very attentive so you get your drinks and food. Always a pleasure! Saludos

hgxzVvFS-5K5krQb59oY3Q.text: Stopped in for a couple appetizers and drinks after reading Yelp reviews. First of all, wonderfully quaint atmosphere. Sat at the bar which is outdoors. Plenty of misters around so it doesn't get too hot.   Had the Korean style ribs and the mushroom bruschetta. The ribs were very tender but too sweet for my taste. The bruschetta - now I might make a special trip back just for that!  Delish

dQdDcjacIpDUO_MSmThCqw.text: Great place. Comfortable relaxing atmosphere. We ate outside. Nice night. Food was amazing. Service superb. Pork shank was the best I have ever had. Don't come here without ordering this entree. Halibut was equally delicious as were the scallops appetizers and salads.  Don't come to Tempe without trying this delicious place. Oh and prices were reasonable

CzasUiy-WzTFBEgTbxLxig.text: By far hands-down this is one of the most unique an incredibly wonderful experiences in Tempe as well as Arizona. The food is so incredible and it is worth a tiny bit of extra money you will spend to sit amongst this old house and hear the trees below the service is incredible the waiters and waitresses just seem to be a little notch above all the other eateries around they should be this place is unique and exceptional

rLKD90WEHGT6SMa-18bjVw.text: This is my FAVORITE date night restaurant in Arizona! The atmosphere is amazing and you feel like you are in a little secret garden by yourselves even if there are other diners around. The food is always so good. I've never had anything that I don't like. This has been an anniversary staple in my house for over 10 years! The prices are so very reasonable for the food, atmosphere and service.

TUiDjeW4L0ecahUrOF2g4g.text: "Meh. I've experienced better" is Yelp's description of two stars and I couldn't agree more.  We had a reservation for 6 at 6:30 on a Tuesday in March (during spring break) and arrived and were sat promptly. Waters delivered, wine ordered....25 minutes later the wine was delivered and our waiter seemed surprised we were ready to order.   I got the soup of day, which was a pork tamale and the caesar salad. I ordered them both as my entree (at least, I thought that was obvious), yet the soup was delivered at least 20 minutes before my salad and everyone else's meals. That was a little awkward. The soup itself was fine. Nothing I'd order again, but not bad and a good size for $8. The salad was very overdressed and the croutons hard, but the lettuce was fresh and the size decent. I'd get it again with the dressing on the side.  The patio is very cute, but the wicker chairs hurt to sit on (in a dress) and are angled for relaxing, not eating.  Overall the service was extremely lacking and the entire meal took 2.5 hours to complete. I would not return.   As an aside- Two people in my group got the mushroom etouffee and thought it was great (sea bass and pea/cous cous salad did not receive good reviews.)

cSOrpGg-93oGny2FRAyrNQ.text: Food is very tasty, drinks were a bit weak. A little too pricy in my opinion, and service was lacking. Not a bad experience by any means, just not my ideal spot for a date night.

N9TRawbeMhD4piK3vm_B-g.text: Always have a great experience at this restaurant. Perfect location and hidden from the crowd.

U-hP1BGRqI1F7jSWWd_Ryg.text: In my opinion, this is one of the most unique restaurants in Tempe! The kitchen and inside area is what used to be an old house and the large majority of the dining area is on a huge outside patio. Even in the winter time it is comfortable with the heaters and the fireplace.   The menu is seasonal and switches out pretty frequently but their food is always amazing. Really unique and tasty dishes that are served with great customer service. I would not pass on dessert either!   Tip: you can make reservations via the yelp app! This place gets really busy, especially on holidays so be sure to claim your spot.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Roasted Tomato-Miso Risotto
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Soy-Ginger Glazed Jidori Frenched Chicken Breast

Yaj9sv2dIxuT6Puln5ygLw.text: We chose to eat outside.  Ambiance was great and the noise wasn't too loud. Food was great.  The kitchen "missed" our ticket of mussels for appetizers. Nearly an hour passed before we were attended to. Mussels came and they were great.  Had the jerk tuna, and bride had the pork shank.  Both were excellent. Had it it not been for the lengthy delay in appetizers and overall attending to us as customers, we loved it.  The waitress did remove our mussels on the ticket which was good. We would likely go back there for another try.

Nr-b03KK9TPhOMdUQ1jQUw.text: This is one of my go to places for quiet romantic celebrations. There in beautiful outside seating. The food is excellent in my opinion and the service is very good.  Pick the outside seating if the whether permits and during the cooler seasons that have heaters or you can just choose to sit inside. If your looking to have a nice night out, celebrating. Quiet birthday or wanting a little romantic dinner this is a place that should be high on your list.

jsEVbMDffM3XPkLDmyaB0w.text: Such a great spot for lunch or dinner. The prices might be high, but well worth it! The ambiance is amazing!

Sm5_X4FoxE6u_GkhncCxoA.text: Wonderful! All the reviews are legit!!   Perfect place for a date or to celebrate an anniversary, bday or any other special occasion. Or just come to simply enjoy their pretty patio and delicious food.   My husband and I came here for a day date on a Friday afternoon and arrived just in time to enjoy their lunch menu. Excellent service and the food was spectacular. Great portions too. Seemed like they just added a few new menu items but also keep some favorites for returning customers.   We will definitely be back soon!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salmon salad - tasted as fresh and delicious as it looks!!!
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Excited to devour this salmon salad!

hxnadwZfcR9O0LDKqFzahA.text: It's usually one of my favorite places to go to in Tempe but not yesterday. At first the service and appetizers were good but it was all down hill after that. Our server would only come around every 20 mins or when we called for her. Our entrees has absolutely no flavor. I asked for spice because I wasn't willing to more salt to the meal to make it even flavorful.  That took about 25 minutes to get and at that point my food was cold. When I let my server know all she said is "well now you know." So what does that mean? Don't come back? I don't think I'll be going back anytime soon.

gg-bQIgBsRPhg2siIbK0xw.text: I've wanted to eat here since my first trip to Tempe over 2 years ago.  I finally had the chance in late February with my son (who attends ASU) and parents.  Although it was a chilly evening, we chose to eat outside near a heater and it actually got quite warm and toasty.   We all loved our meals- soup, steak, lamb, etc.  We were curious about the name and our server shared that the owner's last name is Tricks- so, there you go! The ambiance was relaxing, quiet and welcoming.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. An after dinner family photo.

8yC8fsh9jzuBMOhDkdHmeQ.text: The House of Tricks is like a beautiful garden cottage with a fantastic inside and outside area.  The menu is inventive & original which is great because i like trying new things.  The arugula, date & orange salad was delicious - I think I will start adding dates to my salads at home now.  I would have given five stars but the bison meatloaf was a little heavy & purple potato puree was a little starchy but they both tested good. The staff members were fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Delicious specialty cocktail - can&#39;t recall exact name but maybe think mango margarita with chili, sugar and salt rim
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Bison meatloaf, purple sweet potato purée, brussels sprout leaves and sautéed bourbon glazed heirloom carrots.

3JhfyVj8vqoPgj2HbYX3Qg.text: Everything about this place is amazing.  We were in town for the Ironman and decided to come here for dinner one night.  It's such a sweet place, beautifully laid out and decorated, lovely ambiance.  It feels small and cozy, but it seems like they have a lot of seating areas.  We wanted to sit outside, so we grabbed a table at the outside bar area.  Service was very prompt, and everyone was super nice and friendly.  Food was absolutely incredible.  We started off with the bread and ahi tuna, then had the tenderloin and poached ono for our main courses, and finished with the salted caramel bread pudding.  So delicious.  I kind of want to go back to Tempe just to go back here for dinner.

d40IZ_Bz9HYnaxikzotI_w.text: Their customer service sucks!  I called ahead to ask if I needed a reservation for a party of 8 at around 4pm and the lady over the phone said no, that at that time it wasn't crowded.  Well, it was unusual for Phoenix to be in the low 50's that late aftrrnoon, so asked to be seated inside and they refused to accommodate us. After waiting for some of our people to arrived, they noticed that even with their heaters 4 people of my party were freezing and still would not allow us inside, when they had plenty of room.  One of my coworkers was eating with her gloves on. The next thing was the server Karen. She was so rude when we asked for separate checks.  I know that may take longer and it may be a pain in the ass to do so, but she didn't even hide it. Her facial expression said it all! So RUDE! The food was good, but again, their customer service sucks big time!  Even after we left they didn't have enough customers and more than half of the inside sitting was empty. Very disappointed at this place that I doubt any of us will be back.

p9OhqyTdfFukBbKNoMFSQA.text: Was very excited to try this place based on all the positive reviews. We went for lunch at 1:30 on a Friday. The food was very good but the service was extremely lacking. We order two cocktails,an appetizer, and three entrees. The food took over twenty minutes to arrive and when it did it was the entree. We never received the appetizer. When we mentioned it to waiter he apologized but did not offer any solution to rectify the error. He did not offer us anything, in fact, he avoided our table for the rest of the meal. I'm only giving them three stars because the service was horrible but the food was adequate. We will never return here when there are so many other exceptional restaurants in the area to choose from.

bqwhZXCbJAN8RTlgM2INsQ.text: Been here twice for lunch, ordered the salmon risotto salad both times.  Need to go back, there are countless things on their menu to try!  Great service & atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Everything looks delicious!

PMbcM3wZfFKC8aFNXcouSg.text: Every time I come to House of tricks, I am always satisfied with amazing food. I often come during lunch time and it is better to come here during the cooler months since the outside patio is a pretty place to sit with sometimes an ongoing fire.  Brought my brother here when he was in town, who is a chef, and he was very pleased with his food. He actually got some ideas from his meal.  This is definitely one of our favorites with a friendly staff. Whatever I have tried at House of Tricks is always delicious. Today I had the Salmon with risotto over a salad enhanced with mango - WOW. Also, I would recommend any of their specials, they are always well prepared and taste is always on key. Props to the chef, will come here time and time again. :)

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Special red velvet dessert
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Beautiful Rockfish

pUWo0XhatzKa_b8xEIfLUA.text: Nice ambience although I find the outdoor chairs uncomfortable.  The weather was nice and we were seated on the outdoor patio. We ordered a sirloin burger and a grilled chicken sandwich.  I found the burger was juicy but a bit bland with some flavorful cheddar cheese and onions.  The chicken sandwich was tasty with a pesto seasoning.  The chicken sandwich came with a side of fruit salad. The salad had a light amount of a salad dressing vinaigrette on it. The fruit included small bits of strawberry, blueberry, kiwi, and pineapple. The burger came with a side of house-made potato chips that were a bit overcooked. It took a while to get our order but we were in no rush.

b4KagVYwgMuavqaOWLuvBQ.text: We made a reservation for 5:45pm on Saturday 6/18 and we did not eat there!  When we got there even though we had a reservation they said there were no tables inside that we needed to eat outside on the Patio.  It was 112 degrees out and we were all dressed up to go to ASU Gammage theater that night.  I can't believe they wanted people to eat outside.  I know they had misters but really!!!!! Also the girl said people came at 4:30 and 5:00 and took all the inside tables and they would not have any for 1 1/2 hours??????? DAH don't you think you should have responded to our reservation that you didn't have inside sitting anymore and then we would not have drove for 40 minutes from Fountain Hills to Tempe to eat!!! NOT GOOD! Will Not return, bad service!!!!!

kz8Wzt9Amm1ZQlfR4qYILg.text: More like American old not American new. Old school slow service not inspiring. Took 15 min for server contact. 15 more min for water. Soup Luke warm. Tuna poke was only decent app. Not returning

Ep0UQSDNWcfvoGXErfyZtA.text: One of the best restaurants we have experienced. Great environment, special service and awesome food.  A must experience. Wish we could give more stars.

jcN64EOQdCG-hBB4e8Q9Xw.text: We went here for date night. We were sat at a table in a sweet little room in one of their houses. The decor reminded me of my great grandmothers living room with a quaint bookshelf and a few old-school portraits hanging on the walls. My 14oz free range pork chop was to die for. Perfectly cooked medium paired with red potatoes and a creamy broccolini  rapini. We finished dinner with the salted caramel bread pudding which we are still talking about! Our server was sweet and attentive. I recommend this place to friends and family all the time. Sit on the patio if the weather is permitting. The shrubbery and cascading trees with bistro string lighting provide a memorable ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. 14oz bone-in free range pork chop

5QwJErwm8MTpWaQ3oAKzog.text: Great food, great service and great atmosphere. Really nice patio and good value for food quality and location.   Quaint, rustic, welcoming and relaxing with outside fire pit and heaters. Would definitely return!

tRBOgeOuXbwgDshINIg55g.text: Great food, fun location. Would have loved to sit outside however it was a little too warm. Fun waitstaff, delicious food. Will definitely be back.

tT5nHw7yp_LsQmPJ1957qw.text: We visited Arizona and my friend suggested this place. It was so so delicious! The waiter was lovely. We could not make up our minds so he arranged to have our entrees split so we could share and try out some variety. It was busy but we only had to wait a short while for our table so we went to the bar and saw some other patrons' dinner orders. They were raving about them so we wanted to try everything!  The outdoor patio was sensational! A lovely place for a romantic dinner. I was with my pal so we had a great time but I hope to return with my boyfriend because it was just amazing. The dishes we had were Grilled Beef Tenderloin and Seared Ahi Tuna. Wonderful!  I really hope to return. Arizona was wonderful and this restaurant was part of that wonderful experience.

rnYUt6wo4fNC349UD0txMw.text: Good food. Neat atmosphere. Attentive wait staff. I wish there was a bit more variety on the menu. Must pay for parking and it's not easy to find a spot.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Menu

hvAluROlNwpPf7bmCxfmpA.text: Never disappointed at House of Tricks.  Last night a friend and I went to HOT for a nice dinner while she was in town for a short business trip.  It was a lovely experience.  We started with cocktails. I had the New Old Fashioned which was delicious.  The liquor was infused with vanilla bean and fig and topped with citrus bitters.  So good.  My friend had a margarita that has chili pepper infusion.  She liked her drink too.  We shared the cheese tray, which was excellent.  A nice variety of cheeses, toasty bread, nuts, and grapes.  More than ample portion for two.  We both decided on the short ribs on a bed of white cheese grits.  SO GOOD!  Meat was fall off the bone tender and seasoned to perfection.  Will definitely order this again.  When we arrived we were given the choice of inside or outside seating.  As much as we hated to pass up the beautiful outdoor seating area, it was really hot so we opted for inside.  Go glad we did because we were able to linger over our drinks and dinner while staying completely comfortable.  Our waiter was delighted and provided excellent service.  Love House of Tricks!

Sa1A0BvcrevJ5C4cbVuawQ.text: Food and service are great. I travel to Tempe once a year for a conference and this is the best place I've found.

jbe3w54Ot_kZbySL22Kygg.text: Fantastic service and food in a charming, cozy atmosphere. This is a unique little gem of a restaurant. My wife and I both really enjoyed our meals. I had lamb chops and she had a seafood special that day. We had only been once before and our waitress bent over backwards to help us decide what to order and to help accommodate their dishes with my wife's dairy allergy. We went for our anniversary and they genuinely made us feel special. Thank you for the unforgettable night. The only thing I can knock is the dessert selection - again my wife has a dairy allergy which pretty much limits her to nearly nothing on dessert menus when we dine out, but we ended up going to PF Chang's for their Great Wall of chocolate. That and bathroom location and size was kind of bizarre. But I really had to dig to find anything negative to say

13SC-Smxc0bD3tAQgqj5EA.text: What an awesome find! I finally got to try this place after hearing so many great things about it from other friends. The staff definitely did wonders here trying to fuel or pre-bachelorette party night fun last Saturday.   The restaurant appears to be an old historic house - possibly even two houses connected together by a long welcoming stretch of a patio. It had been a rainy evening and cold one at that, so it was nice to get into the dining area where the ambiance had cozy and refined wrapped up in a bundle!  I think our server was the resaturant manager. He did everything in his power to make our experience wonderful for our group of 10 girls.   Memorable items of the night: Old fashioned drink - very well done and potent here. My first glass was Makers Mark infused with Vanilla and I think maple as well. They ran out of it for the second round, so my second glass was with Woodford Reserve as requested.   Rack of Lamb - the special of the night. Cooked to perfection. Tender, not gamey at all!  Scallop appetizer - Appetizes only two people since there were only two scallops on the plate, but it was served with a quaint arrangement of small thin but very flavorful well seasoned vegetables. This is big coming from me, because as an outspoken meatatarian, it is usually difficult to get me to eat vegetables, yet I loved these ones.  The homemade butter was spiced and delicious in its own right when served before out appetizers with sliced baguettes.   Overall cozy, warm, inviting restaurant. I'd say it's Tempe's own hidden gem.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Rack of lamb special
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Filet mignon with onion rings on top
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Filet mignon without onion

tQ69yHaQJ4YEgHmXSyQGQw.text: My group of 5 couples went here for our dinner for prom. We made reservations inside, since it can get hot in May, and were seated in the red room.  We started off by ordering drinks and starters. My date and I ordered the Pork Butt and the couple next to is had the Bone Marrow. We were served bread and butter while we waited. The bread was soft on the inside with a nice crust outside. The butter was a sweet herb butter. My date and I loved the appetizer we got. I tried a little of the Bone Marrow and it was very good as well. Next we ordered our entrees. My date ordered the Beef Tenderloin and I ordered the Chicken. When it arrived both plates looked delicious. However, when I actually tried the chicken is was under seasoned and over cooked. Even when I tried layering it with the sides that come with the dish it was not good. Definitely was not worth almost $30 and which is disappointing since I love chicken. My date ordered his tenderloin medium rare and was happy with how it was cooked. I tried a couple bites and wish I would've ordered it instead since it was tender and delicious tasting.  We didn't order dessert since we had the dance to go to. So we requested the check. They apparently can't separate checks and gave us one with everything on it. That's fine but for five teen boys trying to figure out how much they owe, was pretty confusing. Luckily our waitress was able to split the food up by couple while still on the same bill and all was worked out. My only other qualm was that our waitress would not check in on us for extended amounts of time. Some of the boys were very thirsty and drank their water in a couple minutes and waited about 20 for a refill.  I had high hopes for this restaurant since it was a higher end restaurant and a boy in out group was the one who suggested it because he'd eaten their before. I may go back, but I'll consider other restaurants first.

r9TdEHPiyAGj7Wto4m0Bgw.text: Date night for my husband and I.  We've been here before and are never disappointed.  Love the casual, beautiful, and cozy atmosphere.  Food tastes fancy, but the environment isn't too pretentious, which is right up our alley.  The service has always been amazing.  Favorite dish was the mussels appetizer.  To. Die. For.  And, you can't beat the expansive wine menu.

k3fRbEp1QxPvKdvGZYvORA.text: Being a student, I have to be cheap. But damnit, when you can splurge, it just feels nice. I also uploaded pictures of our entrees.  Boyfriend took me here for my birthday and even though I read it wasn't good, I ordered the Seafood Pistou because it just had a ton of seafood that sounded good (salmon, mussels, clams, tuna, something else I can't remember). You know what this dish needs. SOME CHEAP PASTA. Sounds contradictory for a pricey restaurant with high quality meats, I know, but there was so much garlic pesto in the "shallow broth" that I really wanted some pasta to help soak some of that up. It was good, though.  Boyfriend wanted to "try something new" and rather than taking a small step from meat and potatoes, he ordered the seared tuna. WTF. I ended up eating the tuna because he didn't like the texture (I thought, duh), but he liked the sesame noodles it came with. He ate them while he drooled over the filet on mashed potatoes at the table next to us. NEVER AGAIN, I told him. :)  The salmon cakes were good and I enjoyed the salad they were served on.   I enjoy coming here for lunch because the portions aren't much different for the price, but isn't that the story of lunch v. dinner, anyway?

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Seared Tuna
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Seafood  Pistou
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Salmon Cakes $9 for two with a salad-like garnish

8FTcdvdcsaxVDdIaN73O0Q.text: Attended a business luncheon here.  Sat in the Courtyard outside, nice ambiance.  Had the salmon and creamy polenta.  Very good.  Portions right sized as well.  Make sure you have time as this restaurant has a brisk lunch trade and may not be a good location if you are in a hurry.  We will definitely return

9HvevK_qs5cTSt3IEYtVhg.text: I have been to House of Tricks on a few different occasions, during different times of the year, both for lunch and dinner.  All three times I have been impressed with the food.  This is a place I feel comfortable being a little more adventurous than usual as everything has been delicious.    The patio is amazing.  You completely forget that you are only steps away from drunken college students and the main drag of bars.  I swear, this patio somehow transports me to a different place until I walk out of the gate and remember where I am.  The only "eh" part about House of Tricks has been hit or miss service.  The very first time I went, our server was absolutely terrible - not even greeting our table for about 15 minutes (and no, this is not an exaggeration).  On the visits since then it has been much better (although it was very easy to improve from the low bar set the first time).  There have been a few instances in which I wish my server was a little more attentive but overall, not too shabby.  This is definitely a place I will return to again and again.  And order whatever catches my eye, because I know it will be delicious!

qhmDUeJuYLcmhFQ5zn_P6A.text: Great food but was a little on the pricey side for just good food. Atmosphere and location was great.

u0S0FiCMSopY0uEn6vN0bQ.text: Second visit here and this is a can't miss place in Phoenix. Came here for dinner with co-workers and we shared 4 entrees. Pork Belly, Pasta, Kale salad, and Ahi Tuna. All were outstanding. The servers are very attentive and friendly.   I especially like the atmosphere of this restaurant with a great patio!    If you're in Phoenix area, give this one a try!

uUN_aZx3gofivVCiqInNvg.text: Service was attentive and genuine. Food was surprising and delicious. Bone marrow is a must! Butter Fish and Lamb Chop were yummy. I think the play on the parsnip, kale and lamb chop were my fav. Recommended pairing with the big, bad napa cab was perfect. Chris was great and personable. I'll be back!

4ZpH6ddrnel6-Zgk65Jo4A.text: Muscles and the Korean ribs is a must!! I go back for the muscles and had them for the third time tonight and every time it taste better than the last time I ate them. I travel a lot for work and go to a lot of restaurants. The muscles here are one of my favorite dishes I have ever fed my face.

7R62AJo9Dm-B624VA0TqLg.text: Stopped in for lunch and I had the salmon. It was cooked to perfection! My husband had the green chile cornbread BLT and it was yummy! Great place for a romantic lunch date!

l9EEhVKgvBNjLbZTYYqp5Q.text: Tricks has made a name for itself based on quality dishes and prime date-night atmosphere. I came for my first visit during happy hour on a Thursday with a group of coworkers. We sat at a table near the outdoor bar and I positively love the patio. What a gorgeous view. It has a lovely feeling about it, and it's relaxed. For happy hour, they have a drink menu with some exquisite, albeit, pricey choices. I chose a Frisky Squirrel or something of a similar silly name and it definitely boasts a tasty, fresh ginger flavor.   We also ordered some bites from the 4-6 p.m. Monday-Saturday menu: pizza with fennel sausage (for $3 more), chicken wings, bruschetta with goat cheese, and mussels. HOLY MACKEREL, the mussels came in a scrumptious broth that we all fought after-- there was a tomato, fishy, sodium-licious broth that they came in and we dunked our extra pieces of bread in it until the bowl was dry.  The bruschetta? Perfectly acceptable. The pizza? I have some qualms. I could have made this pizza myself. There was nothing special about it-- the sausage was baked in the cheese on top of the pizza, which would make Bianco cringe, and drowned the fennel flavor in cheese and tomatoes. Meh. The chicken wings were the perfect mix of baked and flavorful goodness. I highly recommend ordering these.   I would come back for a nice date or a happy hour again and I am really excited to finally enjoy this Tempe gem.

T35YpPTplGGd3mrUTZ9HPA.text: What a wonderful find. HofT is an oasis within the downtown Tempe area. We went for lunch and it was delightful. The food was delicious, the setting perfect  (reminded me of a courtyard on the East Coast) and the prices were reasonable. Our server left a bit to be desired, as she wasn't very attentive, but we will definitely be back.

dXp2NvQHo9Mv3CETsBrlmQ.text: House of Tricks is great! Besides the cool look and feel of the place ( I have always been happily seated outside), the combination of flavors and ingredients is very different than what I normally experience. I highly recommend this place especially sitting outside inthe courtyard.

JtYx9VbMgB-V4SLcfzzPFw.text: The menu here is varied and interesting.  The appetizer selection in particular is quite good.  The drink selection is also more than adequate.  I found the service to be very good, and the ambiance of the outdoor patio is excellent.  The only item that I tried that I thought was average was the Ahi Tuna entree.  It was not bad, but was not as impressive as the rest of the meal.  Nonetheless, I enjoyed the experience and would recommend as a good place for a special occasion dinner.

tVj0cO1tJWSuAp70KyXsBg.text: Wow all I can say is Scott the chef is a gem. I never post on Yelp - but I just had to for this place. The beer is delicious, the Brussel sprout salad was insanely good and the people are just really nice and welcoming here. Not to mention the actual restaurant is gorgeous! Check this place out. You will be happy.

sYhh4rcuc3Mcqj--_kN3-A.text: I travel to Phoenix about once a month and have discovered that I absolutely adore this restaurant and have to come every time I am in town. Inside/Outside, no matter where it's absolutely divine. The wait staff is great and the changing menu never disappoints.

3WURwpRFRFni7Cq2yATd3g.text: One of my favorite spots in downtown Tempe!  Perfect for lunch, dinner, happy hour.  The best lunch dish is the salmon.  Crispy risotto cake, mixed-greens. Fabulous iced teas. Very unique taste and the patio setting is perfect, most of the time in Arizona weather.  Tricks also has an extensive wine menu which is totally worth exploring!

j80CoRAQfYDx0vm2xAiXLg.text: The menu is creative and absolutely delish. I love the service and ambiance as well.  I frequent for lunch and dinner and have never had a substandard meal.  A bit pricey but that is relative. Both Pres Obama and I love this place but don't let that keep you from dining here.  Great for schmoozing clients (...or politicians). ;-D     Just gotta try it.

G7HztZiEcor7zCBhAZYaBQ.text: The House of Tricks is aptly named. They have a box full of "tricks" to get you in the door along with many to make sure that you don't return.   Don't be fooled! This clever house of tricks keeps their way over priced, mediocre food and horrible service well hidden until you, and your wallet, have already be taken. Quite the slight of hand!!  I made the mistake of taking my family there for my wife's birthday (6 of us altogether). After sitting for 15 minutes we were greeted by Ben who immediately let us know through his inaction and disinterest that this was going to be a long night of "no service". Ben didn't need to be concerned, though-he was getting his tip no matter what he did, or didn't do for this table. Our choice should have been Burger King for the service, if nothing else. Sorry, no disrespect to those who wear the crown ;-). The bottom line-the House of Tricks has THE WORST SERVICE in Arizona!!!   Their overpriced food features barely palatable dishes and the portions are small. If you eat there don't expect any "wow" from the food. The only "wow" you will get is when you see the bill!!  In this economy Arizona has seen the doors of many restaurants shut. We don't need a magic door at the House of Tricks, but we do need it to close!!!

24Of3NATFgjKFLUQdyQiog.text: Came by for a late lunch on my way to the airport. Never been so happy my flight was delayed. The vegetarian burger was awesome! Served with a delicious side of fresh fruit. Patio bar is the place to sit. I felt like I was in the islands. Very chill. Great service. Look forward to coming back on my next visit.

3dT-Ip_1BcR1ntHjxV729A.text: Excellent dining and great service.  My short rib was fine and my wife loved the halibut.  Great , non-traditional wine list.

Wt38AW796345MWz6wEdYVw.text: This is one of the best places in the Valley.  I've been here four or five times now, and it gets better each time I visit.  The food is simply amazing.  I only have one substantive comment about the dinner I had there tonight: Wow! If you don't like this place, you don't know what good food is.

Wsf-_lzUAoc-pmovKh1geQ.text: A pricey, date-oriented eatery with fantastic ambiance.  I only ate outside, and found the vibe to be great but the food a little short of what I would expect for what they're charging.  However, I can see it being an ideal place to bring a date and go through a bottle of wine or two.

1wWPcz6hzHJqRKCzwBHR2Q.text: While throwing a small get together, we were able to have a back patio with a buffet style table set up with some pretty tasty appetizers.  The chicken sqewers were delicious and smoked salmon was also tasty but something seemed to lack.  At the end of the day it was good and I wouldn't hesitate to go back, but nothing to make me a raving fan.

slJXOBlJlioMb9xXliUo6g.text: Fabulous ambiance- great food and great service.  My favorite place I have eaten at while visiting the Phoenix area.  I highly recommend!

oGNayZqqYHdrUDyYZkWZ7g.text: Nice place to sit outside and enjoy a good meal.  the spinach salad was great, the duck breast was amazing.  The Gnocchi was very dry and a little burned on the side.  Dinner in the patio was excellent!!!

8bh4Ip--WEhF7VdUE3BN7g.text: i thought this place was crap, but my gf didnt think it was that bad. the menu was nothing special, typical phoenix restaurant choices. they ran out of the scallop dish at 7pm. we waited about 45 minutes for our food on a wednesday night. the choices were overpriced. and my mashed potatoes were cold. nuff said.  gf thinks the mussels were good though.

xLb3bUAy_VKwKX9ywa3GSA.text: I am from out of state and every spring break I must go to house of tricks. This place is one of my all time favorite restaurants. The lunch is delicious. They always have amazing lunch specials and the atmosphere is wonderful. Nothing is better than enjoying an iced tea and eating a fabulous lunch outside at House of Tricks!I love this place!!

la7Mx2Q4UI1IXrMCzCbVsA.text: Very intimate setting.  Quiet and romantic.  If the weather is permitting, I would recommend a table outside. Given the environment, you would never suspect Mill Ave is right around the corner.  They also have a pretty extensive wine list to choose from.  Enjoy!

Cpb-tOsEjYJGaw9qzqcxfQ.text: Kelly Fletcher is by far the best chef in Arizona, and every time I go there I am amazed by both the creativity and precision of his cooking. If you like Elements, T. Cooks, Kai, FnB, and Vincents then House of Tricks is an absolute must.

FwrdY6UgFlfdGoEwJxOyxg.text: I am putting 4 stars because my lunch was absolutely delicious! I went to lunch yesterday february 26th with a good family friend and I had the roasted chicken sandwich with the pasta salad and he had the Reuben, I think. Sandwich was amazing and I feel the other fellow yelpers were right this place is very tasty :)    However, our service was not up to par AT ALL. He was tall, slender with a dark beard with hints of grey in it..hmm well I was waiting for my guest and ordered a cup of coffee.. so far so good. When my guest finally arrived we waited about 15 minutes until he approached us. He asked what my guest wanted to drink and the minute he said ill just have water and was about to say we are ready to order or waiter was gone. He rushed away, dropped off water and left again! So confused... then when we finally flagged him down he un-enthusiastically recommended some entrees(since we bother have not been there) and that was about it. Not personal at all. No fun!   Great food, will come back for that but hopefully next time we will have quality service to go along with their quality food!

a04Y7NgvFtGs37KkC33EoA.text: A great place to celebrate and laugh...the patio is gorgeous with open fire places and lots of beautiful trees. The food by Chef Kelly is, well, to die for. For a certain chicken dish I might commit murder. It's called the Ballantine Chicken. Imagine if you could make chicken into an orgasmic experience. A crispy skin that oozes juices as it is pierced with your knife. The stuffing made with brioche and all presented on a puree of fresh butternut squash. OMG! The raspberry iced tea is delightful, as is their wine selection. Sometimes it's nice to find a place in the middle of the city that makes you feel as if you are on vacation. The historic houses that make up the indoor seating are adorably rustic with modern twists. Take someone you love here...

in2vqs3oj65aIz29oaCVag.text: I really like this place for lunch or dinner.  The outside bar is awesome.  I call it my special occasion spot...for anniversaries, birthday's etc.  It's different in that you'll see anywhere from corporate execs to professors to those who decided to travel from outside their north Scottsdale suburbs.  I used to live about 2 miles north and now the only thing I regret is not having gone there more frequently.  For lunch, try their iced tea...very refreshing.  Sandwiches and salads are tasty.  Any dinner entree (especially beef) is sure to please.  My out of town friends were surely impressed!

rts5KjrqSW5G8R9S3c3jVg.text: Have been here 3 times now I think.  Once for a full meal a year or two ago, drinks a couple weeks back, and a few days back for apps and drinks.  This last time was good.  The wines by the glass are good and the app selection had decent variety.  The short rib app is really good and has a nice kick.  The shrimp/fish cake was dry and marginal so he took it off the bill.  The atmosphere is nice because you can sit outside at the bar, misters, fairly quiet, cool place.  We were there somewhat late and so it seemed that all of the employees were drinking and smoking at the bar.  That was a little annoying.  I get that they are off and want a drink, that's cool.  However, it's a business so the customers should have the run of the place.  Either way, I would recommend it.

Wimwlm2lAQwL7OvgJQ4OKw.text: Wow.  ONLY thing that holds me back from giving it five stars was one of the hostesses.  I did not have a reservation, and asked if there would be any availability for a table for one.  Here is the wrong thing to say, which is exactly what she said:  "Oh, you can just sit at the bar.  Same menu and everything.  It's heated."  I tried to be kind, which is hard when I'm talking to a dismissive little blond college chick, but I explained that it was the courtyard atmosphere that I wanted - so no, I would not be sitting at the bar, and if no tables were available, I completely understood.  "We've got a lot of groups tonight... I mean, it would be a long time before a table opened... like twenty minutes."  I told her that was fine, and that she could find me at the bar when my table was ready.  I hadn't even sipped my wine before she came and got me.  So frustrating that was the start to the experience, because everything else was five-star all the way.  My server was one of the best I've ever experienced:  he was attentive but not in the way, gracious beyond measure - seriously perfect.  The courtyard was beautiful, lit by candles and surrounded by trees so as to be hidden in a patch of Eden.  The cats roaming around were quirky and lent a warmth that such an upscale experience can lack.  From the time I was seated until I left, it was perfect.

uxeakZm0Yr7cS1Xj9nrUOA.text: The duck breast on special was insanely good. Intimate athmosphere, and the servers were very knowlegable.

_b1b2FiAZ9Dc3Np40wMuOA.text: The ambiance is lovely on the patio and with excellent food, this proves to be a lovely romantic restaurant for dinner. The menu changes by seasons and I was recently disappointed that there was no quail on the menu. The service is good, could be a little better but all and all better then most upscale type restaurants. Overall dining experience is quite nice.

sMhi6ghhsKCTK58bKemdXw.text: Food was moderate and exceptionally overpriced. Service was good, venue was enjoyable.  I think price and the expectation built about this place ruined it for me, only because it winds up this is a very expensive place trying to be a LEGITIMATE expensive place.  Instead, it's just overblown.  I can see how college couples and the nouveau riche would find House of Tricks to be a cut above; after all, if you're paying a lot of money, it MUSt be a good place, right?  Warning to those who have experienced real "fine dining" and eaten domestically and abroad:  this is NOT the real deal - move along to something else.

__XIKXQUallmzqw8RQx6Gg.text: Complete disappointment.  Slow service, the food tasted like last night's leftovers.  I have no idea how anyone can give this restaurant a good review.  Have you never eaten at a good restaurant before?

9D0nN6tAy-k2p701p6cF9g.text: Went there for a lovely evening with my best friend.. The bartender suggested a wine.. that was delicious. we had enjoyed a Heirloom salad and the veggie enchiladas.. my plate was almost licked clean. atmosphere quiet and you could converse without a constant interruption. the only reason I give 4 out of 5 is that the gluten free options weren't fabulous and the server did not even ask about dessert and the prices were high..portions small..will try to go there as soon as i win the lottery.. but i saw happy hour prices were fabulous. perhaps i will try to go between 4-6pm.

Sa7i86eQIo3R3vSaOEEQ5g.text: Very good dinner. The corn blueberry salad was my favorite part, such a good blend of flavors! Steak and salmon were good. My steak (or the sauce) was very salty, a little too much for my taste but it was still good. Blackberry crumble was good, it tasted fresh and not too sweet. The ambiance outside was really nice, they have a beautiful and wild garden.

vk_8LdLxUFvc6s9wNbJkAg.text: We had a very enjoyable time at House of Tricks. The service was excellent. We had the Valentine Day special.  The food was well prepared and presented. This is a place that we will definitely come back to.

Qkk525cnLcQ54HiQTHYbtw.text: Loved our dinner at House of Tricks. It's a converted house in the heart of Tempe, and most of the seating is outside--which was ideal for a cool spring night. The food is great (highly recommend the bison meatloaf), and the service is outstanding. To top it off, Yelp reservations made things so easy!

L-xJEoUOm5Tpcxo7lWo9Eg.text: Excellent place to dine on a nice evening...huge outdoor dining area on patios under trees and lights. Bar area is also nice for a small meal or if on the road alone (such as I was).   Food all looked incredible and it took me too long to decide on what I wanted but I finally settled on the scallops and a cheese board. I can't decide which was better but they were both equally delicious. Great and unique flavors, quality ingredients and well prepared! The cheese selection was varied and they were beautifully paired with honey and mustard. The grilled bread was perfection.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Cheese board
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Scallops

qreLheGe83zBwry5T6mj4Q.text: Went in for my birthday. My fiance wanted a nice place in the heart of Tempe and this place was recommended. We made reservations and arrived 5 minutes early. We approached the hostess stand and told them about our reservation and they told us there will be a wait. After 30 minutes go by my fiance comes up and asks how much longer (now way past our reservation) and the hostess response: 'I guess we can take you now'. We didn't let it bother us because it was my birthday. Our server came in a timely manner and got our drinks, appetizer, and told us she would come back for our entrees. We were already to order then but she left. After 45 minutes goes by, we have our drinks(delivered not from our server), we have our apps (not from our server) and now finished waiting to still put in our order. The server in the mean time repeatedly went to the table right next to us (no acknowledgment)as we wait. It wasn't until I walked into the managers office and politely asked to get our bill as this wasn't the birthday I hoped. The manager took it upon himself to make things right and took over or table. He proceeded to take our order and offered another bottle of wine. He turned things around for us and that was very appreciated. The server finally stopped by after we were already eating and saw that her manager stopped by. She never apologized but instead stated that she was busy with another table and assumed everything was good. To make things more awkward her blouse came undone, she turned around and giggled.   At the end, the manager continued to take care of our table. He was extremely generous and the only reason we will be coming back.   I come from a restaurant background and currently a manager at one. This manager was exceptional and made my birthday night turn around to end on good terms. I wish I could remember his name to thank him.

rEye-_teq7uinGO-gq301A.text: This place reminds of one of the restaurants that my grandparents loved going to when I was young - the food was good, the staff are very pleasant and helpful. Would definitely come back again. And love that they have a few selections of Gluten Free food - my mom would be happy to see that.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Garlicky Spinach Artichoke
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pork Pastrami
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. French Dip

diiqpQ6US_ZmFXSsZNM5bA.text: You would never know this place was even here. Tucked away near ASU. Lovely atmosphere. Great wine list. I tried the bruschetta with goat cheese, figs, prosciutto and arugula. Deeeelish! Filling, so I didn't get to try the salmon on the menu that sounded too fabulous. Cup of soup Sweet Potato and green chile. Sweet and smoky a hint of spice and crispy bacon. Very nice. Definitely a place I will frequent when I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. House smoked salmon with capers, red onion and avocado with toasted baguette
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. &#34;The new Old Fashioned&#34;
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Pan fried fish of the day over couscous with artichoke purée

CoiH2EOmhh5Rxb4MQLKWGA.text: I love coming to HoT, they're food is delicious and the atmosphere is even better. The best part about House of Tricks is my favorite waitress, Sarah, who always gives the best wine recommendations, is really friendly and really cares about your experience. HoT goes above and beyond to make sure you have a great dining experience.

Of54rEKaZYjp8WkFv0v97Q.text: Friends of ours told us to check this place out, so we came on a Friday night, unplanned with no reservation. They got us in quick with very little wait time but it was also later at night (9ish) However, I would try to make a reservation if possible if you plan on going during busier dinner times.   The place itself is very cute and quaint, we sat outside and there is greenery all around you. White tablecloths but we wore average dress clothes (casual dress with heels and jeans with collared shirt) and fit right in.  A little Pricey but SO worth it. We didn't try any entrees because our friends told us try the muscles off the appetizer list. We are HOOKED! We got the artisan cheese plate and the Muscles off the starter list and they were both amazing!! The plates are large and we shared the cheese and muscles between the two of us and it was light and perfect and just the right amount of food. The couple next to us both got entrees and they looked pretty large and they also looked absolutely DELICIOUS. We will have to try some next time we visit.   YOU MUST TRY THIS PLACE!!! We recommend it to everyone we know!! It's SO worth it! Service was great, fast and very nice, food was delicious, and we had a great night!

OJxjVIlOqSu-vjf-htksHA.text: The ambiance and the food were excellent as always. Beautiful outdoor patio and beautiful weather. We had the buffalo mozzarella and Ahi Tuna Tartare as starters, which were both extremely fresh and delicious. The waiter was great and very knowledgeable. The food took longer than expected but not terrible... We had the beef tenderloin, short rib chile and cornish game hen. All excellent.   The only slightly negative experience was in the bar area before our reservation was ready. We ordered a round of drinks while we waited and the bartender/server seemed very impatient and short with us... Let's say, the opposite of engaging... Not a big deal but the ladies ordered Prosecco, which they did not have. Instead of telling us they don't serve Prosecco, they passed off a different cheap sparkling white wine hoping we wouldn't notice. Our server later confirmed that they do not serve Prosecco. Kinda shady.

ZaWsAVznUIA7HzWh32CO8w.text: It has been some time since my last visit to HoT.  I recall it being very good and I had even recommended it to others.  Not so much anymore.  The food quality was very average.  I had the foie gras starter.  This was so disappointing - it was not a nice piece of fg, it was drowning in an odd sauce and the bread was hard and just not good.    For main course I tried the osso buco, while not bad it was definitely nothing to write home about.  The worst part for me was the service.  The server was unfriendly, cort and seemed to want to rush us away.  At one point I snapped at him because I had enough.    I don't think I'll ever return now.  Kinda sad it was so bad.

hzfcTTMc8HjKEavki0DCgg.text: The ambience is what gives this place a 5 but I cant knock the infused bourbon and the beef tenderloin tacos. WOW!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States

03QiYBy4h7HLrYKc5Oe87Q.text: This used to be my favorite restaurant, they made the most incredible club sandwich with brown sugar bacon, a honey dijonnaise to die for, perfect bread and fresh avocado. They updated their menu recently and the club is gone. In its place is a bacon turkey wrap. The "spinach wrap" is the same thing served in the on campus cafeterias. It was a solid "meh". Their potato salad is still wonderful, the patio and restaurant are still charming, but I won't be back without that club. Bummer.

bDDgejDrkjuWGzSXJFunfw.text: Yelp has never let me down. Traveling in for a meeting we looked for a nice restaurant near our hotel. House of Tricks is the real deal. The scallops and smoked salmon appetizers were fantastic. We had the blackened tuna and the broiled duck as main entrees. Unbelievable!!!

JD5m8b2l5yGJ58tkmE5BgQ.text: Quaint.  Happy Hour selection of food...poor. Tried the pork appetizer. Overpowered by the green onion.  I think they were going for southwestern spice with it.  A total miss.  I'm not sure what it was going for. Wine was fine nothing spectacular.  This place survives because of it quaintness.  Waiter was nice and paid enough attention.

Kc64JfUBU5zZuLaNveksdQ.text: I visited with my family after having made a Yelp reservation for 7:45pm at about 7pm the same day. The restaurant was still pretty busy at that point but we were seated in a small dining room with only one other party. We had just been at the Desert Botanic Gardens and just needed a bit of a snack, so we ordered salads and a few appetizers. I ordered the romaine salad wedge that's served with a  yogurt curry vinaigrette and it was absolutely delicious. For appetizers we order the cheese plate, jalapeno goat cheese grits, and the Korean BBQ ribs. The cheese plate was fine but nothing special, same with the grits - just meh. But the ribs were absolutely awesome! Smoked perfectly then sauced just ever-so-slightly such that you weren't overwhelmed but you got the flavor without a ton of sugary bbq sauce. The only thing that wasn't great was the service. Once the other table in the room left, we were ignored and had to move empty salad plates to the table next to us so we could have some room. Then we had to flag someone down to refill our water.  Overall the food was good and the atmosphere was interesting and I would visit again but not near the end of the evening.

GysaFmtJ-0o0MlP6rHIlBg.text: Beautiful outdoor dining. Good to great service.  Seafood got rave reviews. Duck was a B+.  Would definitely return for dinner--but not lunch given the major construction site across the street.

ARNEBHcp0g7IFP17QyMqTw.text: Last night I enjoyed the Red Trout and potato soup. Tonight it was Caesar salad and Game Hen with risotto and kale. Great food and great service with high energy! Don't miss happy hour from 4 to 6 every day.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. House of Tricks in Tempe. Very green and very good!

1k3CuYC_bT8ANJ2zVgEXhA.text: The food had such a wide range of potential and I was afraid they wouldn't do anything very well. I was amazed by the rabbit and chorizo starter. One of the best things I have had with rabbit. Everyone at the table loved it. The drinks were fun and overall the plates were well proportioned and very tasty.

cpzvlxE-tX4HhX46NOW5RA.text: We came on whim since it was within walking distance from where we were. What a nice restaurant! Outside ambiance is beautiful and without pretense. It's a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere especially since we've been hanging out at ASU haunts.  We came during happy hour so we sat at the outside bar and ordered off the happy hour Tapas-like menu. We ordered the ceviche and the chiles arepas/pork dish.  Both were beautifully plated and very delicious. Cocktails were good. The mango margarita was a little disappointing. We thought it would be spicier. But the rose by the glass (the only choice by the glass) and the Gentle Ben cocktail were great. Bar staff was extremely friendly and accommodating. Delivery of dishes was very quick. When we come back to Tempe, this restaurant will most definitely be revisited.

EuOaNxpobX7J0Ye5_0uivw.text: My daughter and I had a 7 pm reservation last night. We arrived and were offered a seat at a two top right next to the door. It was very cold so I asked for a different table. The seemingly too bored to care hostess said the only other option was also by a door, despite there being MANY open tables. We sat and were ignored for about 10-12 minutes before a bus boy dropped a basket of icy cold, dry baguette slices on our table and told us the compound butter this evening was "orange poppy seed" (sweet). We waited another 10 minutes without anyone giving us a word or a glance, despite several waitstaff walking by our table several times. We got up and left without anyone saying a word. My daughter realized she left her purse and went back to get it. A waiter was standing near our table and he looked at her questioningly but still not a word. I don't know whether we were ignored because we were two women, or they have bad service generally, or it was just a bad night. We walked over to La Bocca and were welcomed beautifully and served a delicious meal (see review). When next in town, we will revisit La Bocca (a house of treats for us) but not House of Tricks.

M_WTBlkaoRURlGeGBQJQIg.text: It bums me out to say this, but we did not have a good experience here. We were seated directly next to the kitchen which was uncomfortably hot, so much so that the table next to us asked to be moved because it was so bad. I wish we had moved as well because that one tiny bathroom-sized vent was definitely not large enough to cool that size room. When we left, we discovered that with the misters on, it was actually cooler outside on one of the warmest days of the summer so far.   Service was fine, but food was pretty lackluster. We started with the tuna poke which was good, but not great. My fiance and I both had the beef tenderloin with mashed potatoes and garlic spinach. Flavor was ok, but the steaks were rare to blue when we both ordered medium rare. We let our server know (no manager stopped by), but didn't even bother asking for it to be re-fired to the temperature of our liking because it was so hot in there, that we were mostly set on getting out as soon as possible. Against our original plans, we were wooed by the desert choices so we hung around for that thinking that might save our experience, only to be let down by that as well. I ordered the tres leches cake with plum sauce on the side. The cake was boring, the whip cream had a strange menthol flavor (I think they were going for mint, but it tasted very artificial), and thank goodness I had the plum sauce on the side because that was so bizarre -- extremely medicinal tasting and completely inedible. My fiance had the flourless turtle brownie which was dry as all heck and literally had one pecan in the entire thing. It tasted like I tried to make a microwave mug brownie but cooked the crap out of it. $120 out the door for a very mediocre dinner. We will not be returning.

jPOYuUhaoEw-sYPsRV6EwA.text: Some friends from Boston were in town and we decided to have a late lunch before going to an engagement at ASU.   Everything about this place was top shelf.  We chose to eat outside in a wonderful patio and the food was fabulous.  Great service.  Great everything.  I'll be going back there again and again.  So will my friends from Boston as they were very very happy with everything about the House of Tricks.

kS1D8McB8hvFL48qAz4kEA.text: There are a lot of positives about this place as others have stated: the romantic patio outside, the excellent food, and generally very good service.  But the last two times left a bad taste in my mouth, figuratively speaking.    As a go-to place for special occasions, the last time was Valentine's Day.  With bad weather, my wife and I ate indoors for a change.  Tables were cram-packed together and I felt like my romantic interlude was with the people at the adjoining tables.  Not fun.  This time, we were joined by another couple to celebrate my wife's birthday.  I had called ahead while making the reservation to see what they might be able to do for her, as it was a major birthday.  Nothing--besides putting a candle in her dessert.  Unless I wanted to pay an arm and a leg to buy a cake.    So it was a bit extra warm that night and I asked if they could turn on the misters.  One guy went away to say they would try....later to find they couldn't do it.  So we stayed outside, a bit on the toasty side.  (We didn't want a repeat of Valentine's Day).  The food was good...I had the Salmon in Ponzu sauce, which was previously well-reviewed before.  When I checked with the waiter when it was dessert time if he was going to take care of the birthday preparations, he told me it was the first he had heard of it!   Good thing I said something!  My Key Lime Cheesecake was pretty good.  But the chocolate nougaty thing my wife ordered for dessert was like a Snickers bar that sat in the freezer--very hard and practically inedible...she practically had to chase it around the table as it kept jumping off her plate as she tried to cut into it!  Then when we got the check, it was near closing, and we never saw our waiter again.  We waited quite a while until finally the busboy came by to pick up our payments.  It was like we were deserted.  Considering this place ain't cheap, I expected better service and more attention to detail regarding the birthday preparations.  If you want a low key celebration, here's the place to go.  If you want the staff to get into it a bit more, this is NOT the place to go.  Heck, even Applebee's gives you a singing chorus for your birthday!  While the kitchen is still very good, I think the staff needs a bit more snap and caring about their customers to warrant a return.

EuqIALU0qE_Fmmz0a7eZLw.text: We came here for Restaurant Week and also for my boyfriend's birthday. We were seated inside next to the fireplace in a very awkward spot. I was sitting on one side of the table that was on the other side of a half wall/open window type thing, which was less than 12 inches from the guy at the table next to us. The kitchen was right by us as well so there were dishes being slammed around and lots of other loud things going on. We asked to be moved outside even though it was a little on the warm side. The patio is nice, although I wasn't a fan of the random cat that showed up (other than funny internet pictures, I do not see a use for cats).   We each chose a different app, entree and dessert. I wasn't excited about the salad but it turned out to be great! The entree and desserts were the highlight of the meal. We had the arugula salad, pork belly, short ribs, hoki, cinnamon roll and strawberry shortcake. All of it was pretty damn tasty!   I think the food is worth the price and the porch is great for casual wine drinking :) I'll definitely be coming back!

I7SSZwO07UhqANFXK6GdOw.text: This place is so versatile, it's great for lunch with co-workers, a meeting, happy hour with friends, or a date night on the town.    For some reason, I LOVE all of the soups that House of Tricks has to offer.  I think this place has the best soup in the valley.  Random, perhaps, but give it a try!   I like that they have a seasonal menu, and it changes with some regularity.  It's great to go back to a restaurant you enjoy and you find new and exciting food options to choose from.   Working in Tempe, I've gone here for work lunches a few times.   I definitely recommend the French Dip - melts in your mouth, so flavorful!  Or...my other go-to is the Grilled Chicken sandwich with goat cheese.  You had me at goat cheese....   On the dinner menu, I've tried several fish dishes - salmon and halibut are my favorites.   I love that this American style menu always has some unexpected twists and turns on the menu.   Definitely worth checking out.  And with the cute house vibe and great ambiance, this place will score big points for a date night too!

1KbiJotHSzGWx9X7mW8rCA.text: The food was pretty good but way overpriced for the quality.  The service was okay.  Our waitress was not very attentive. While I did enjoy my food I would not dine here again

ap1SvDNXVca-pTvZvJ0J4w.text: Setting is beautiful!  Food has been great before, but this time around it was fair.  I hold expensive places to a higher standard.  I wasn't that excited to come back this last time around.

photos.caption: Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Perfect patio weather day
Photo of House of Tricks - Tempe, AZ, United States. Perfect patio weather day

xzGPFhPLJD2ti0Z0pjFCQw.text: Oh mama, the muscles and chorizo were so good! We had to take the sauce to go! Jamie was really friendly and pretty good at recommending items off the menu. She also had some tips AND "tricks" (see what I did there?) on how to better enjoy one of her favorite appetizers. Definitely will go back!

6XHldyJM2Ni3-14UHCReaQ.text: Went for my graduation lunch. Was delicious and the staff was super friendly. Cocktails were also very yummy.

AjAQTxGi0KVz-HIVKpIUmA.text: We went there with a group of girls to have happy hour an dinner, we sat up by the bar due to the dining room being full, which was fine, great out door patio. Happy hour ended at 6pm we were there at 5 pm to enjoy in the specials. The water girl was right on it but when it came to getting drinks we had to flag the server down an then flag him down again for appetizers,  then for a 3rd an 4th time to order dinner an more drinks! The food was awsome,  I had the beef tenderloin which melted in my mouth. The "trick" is that the servers never ask how anything was or if you need anything such as silverware an you have to hunt them down!  We spent $225 for a party of 4 an I expected way better service for that!  Sorry about the low tip! I would return if I could get it as take out cause the service was horrible!

OT9kLTLE2tcxlCDkIFI8MA.text: Clearly there are a lot of good reviews about this restaurant so I'll keep mine brief.  OMG! I stopped in this evening for a nosh after picking up my BF at the airport. I've been there a few times so I knew they would have the fire going and heaters working.  The atmosphere is always so nice there.  Very romantic BTW if you are looking for that sort of thing. :-) I had the  'Apricot Glazed Tender Belly Pork Tenderloin with Caramelized Onion Risotto, Bacon Vinaigrette and Sauteed Spinach with Toasted Almond'.  My dining companion had the Beet Salad and then shared a bit of my entree.  We added a Malbec from Argentina to compliment the food and WOW!  I've been to HofT several times but tonight was the best ever.  Hurry in to try this amazingly yummy dish as they may be changing the menu soon.

VCHhPpCvzV0jDegrXQmNZw.text: Great little place to have lunch! The restaurant itself is small though and they didn't have room so we sat outside. It was a 100 degrees today but it wasn't bad. We sat at the bar where they have the mists so it kept us cool. Service, food and drinks were all fantastic. Would've given them 5 stars for my first visit except the hosts was hesitant to give us a seat inside even though we saw seatings. Probably wouldn't come during the summers if there's no seating even though they have great summer dishes but will return during the fall and winters.

791MJ4q8yeUMT9jvHX61Zg.text: I almost gave HOT three stars, and the only reason why I didn't is because I had a better dining experience last night than I had the previous few times I have eaten at HOT.  I want to be clear and say that the only reason I gave it 4 stars is that the food really is very good... and that's basically the point of eating at a restaurant, right?  And the service was amazing.  Our server was friendly, helpful, and attentive.  And I really do love the ambiance.  (Great date spot!)  My main issue with HOT is the price of the food, especially because the portions are quite small.  Here is what we ordered and how my friend and I felt about it: 1. The "Bloody Mary" Salad, which is tomatoes and a lot of other fresh goodies.  Delicious. 2. The seared scallops over cauliflower puree.  The scallops were good, but there were only 2 of them, and they weren't that large.  Also-- and this may be a personal preference-- but the cauliflower puree was very smooth, but such a viscous and thick texture that I wasn't a fan of it.  Also, I truly love cauliflower, and it tasted nothing like cauliflower. 3.  The mussels (which is one of HOT's signature dishes).  They are technically a starter, but I ordered them as my main course.  Honestly, I did not love them.  They were a little cold, which does no favors for mussels' texture.  Also, I don't like a creamy sauce for them-- I would rather something more wine or stock-based.  (Again, this is a matter of personal opinion, but I don't think mussels should be in something creamy.)  The flavor was good, but not great. 4..  The beef tenderloin with butter whipped potatoes and bacon demi-glace.  We ordered it medium-rare and it was PERFECT.  One of the best bites of meat I have ever had.  Basically, I feel that HOT is hit-or-miss... and that would be okay, if it weren't for the price.

KzzEyCfVgp1KVqVCzkdrvw.text: This is a respite from all the crowded bars and mediocre restaurants on Mill. The food is spot on, service great, and, the ambience is romantic. It is an old cottage converted into a restuant but dine in their patio for a perfect date night.  They change their menu seasonally, another brownie point for that, because it shows they don't shove soemthing from the freezer onto your plate. If you go there in Fall/Winter don't miss their mussels in broth, which is an entree sized appetizer. Dipping their freshly baked bread in the mussels broth, sitting by the fireplace, in their tree covered patio on a winter night, is one of the nicest things I have done in Tempe.   Fairy lights which stay on for most part of the year make the ambience enchanting, and, are a perfect accompaniment for sipping a glass of red wine.

evy8ScEzHCYy-eoDfxJc5Q.text: We went for our anniversary. They sat us outside by a heater as we requested. Food was awesome and fantastic service! Our server even brought us a few glasses of champagne on the house to celebrate! Very pretty and relaxing environment on the patio. We will definitely be going back.

Qv3mEGULo231X-5jmS01tQ.text: Get the filet, or the tenderloin. It doesn't get any better.  It is a very romantic restaurant. Sit out side in cool weather. It's my wife's and my favorite place to go. Worth every penny, been going their for over 8 years. Take some one worth it, because even if you were in bad company it will still be the best meal you've had.

gV353uHw_UinqL4-LyxDZw.text: Just returned from a pleasant dinner; the service was attentive but not overly so, and overall we had a good time. The Short Rib was immaculate, and the Duck Breast (get it Med Rare) was done perfectly. The one downside was the Seared Ahi - it came in a bowl just piled on top of noodles drenched in salty soy sauce (the "broth") which overwhelmed the dish.   They have a good and eclectic wine list with pretty good prices. We ate inside due to the chilly night and were taken care of, even offered dessert on the house to make up for the Ahi dish.  I look forward to our next visit!

5Nkzn_YIE5Q1OYPkidghNQ.text: their menu is always changing, but their is always something awesome to try. I had mixed emotions upon hearing of  Fletcher's departure. Cheers mates and see you soon.

KIC96CV13hQJDeWwmkNRMw.text: Excellent food and excellent service. Who knew I'd have one of the best salmon dishes I've ever experienced in Arizona... Doesn't sound right. The portions are definitely on the small side for the price and the atmosphere is excellent, but a little cramped.
